sadā pratyahaṁ niśāyāṁ atikrāntē pradōṣē guru saṁvēśayēt । katham ? tasya gurōḥ pādau prakṣālya saṁvāhya ca । saṁvāhanaṁ mardanam ॥ 1॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

anujñātaḥ saṁviśēt 2
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

2. He shall retire to rest after having received (the teacher's permission). [#2] 

[#2]:  Manu II, 194.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
anujñātaḥ saṁviśēt ॥ 2 ॥

**ṭīkā**  
[#1]guruṇā'nujñātastu svayaṁ saṁviśēt śayīta ॥2॥  

[#1]: paścādguruṇā iti kha. pu
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

na cainamabhiprasārayīta 3
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

3. And he shall not stretch out his feet towards him.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
na cainamabhiprasārayīta ॥ 3 ॥

**ṭīkā**  
ēnamācāryaṁ prati pādau na prasārayēt ॥ 3 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

na khaṭvāyāṁ satō'bhiprasāraṇamastītyēkē 4
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

4. Some say, that it is not (sinful) to stretch out the feet (towards the teacher), if he be lying on a bed. [#3] 

[#3]:  'But, in Āpastamba's opinion, it is sinful even in this case.'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
na khaṭvāyāṁ satō'bhiprasāraṇamastītyēkē ॥ 4 ॥

**ṭīkā**  
yadā tu guruḥ khaṭavāyā śētē tadā taṁ prati pādayōḥ prasāraṇaṁ na dōṣāyētyēkē manyantē, svapakṣastu tatrāpi dōṣa iti ॥ 4 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

na cāsya sakāśē saṁviṣṭō bhāṣēt 5
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

5. And he shall not address (the teacher), whilst he himself is in a reclining position. [#4] 

[#4]:  Manu II, 195.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
na cā'sya sakāśē saṁviṣṭō bhāṣēta ॥ 5 ॥

**ṭīkā**  
asyā''cāryasya sakāśē svayaṁ saṁviṣṭa. śayānō na bhāṣēta ! kāryāvēdanādāvutthāyaiva bhāṣēta ॥5॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

abhibhāṣitastvāsīnaḥ pratibrūyāt 6
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

6. But he may answer (the teacher) sitting (if the teacher himself is sitting or lying down). [#5] 

[#5]:  Manu II, 196.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
abhibhāṣitastvāsīnaḥ pratiyāt ॥ 6॥ .

**ṭīkā**  
ācāryēṇā[#2]bhibhāṣitastvāsīnaḥ pratibrūyāt । ētadācārya āsīnē śayānē vā ॥6॥

[#2]: abhibhāṣitastan iti kha. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

anūtthāya tiṣṭhantam 7
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

7. And if (the teacher) stands, (he shall answer him,) after having risen also.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
anutthāya tiṣṭhantam ॥ 7॥

**ṭīkā**  
yadā tyācāryastiṣṭhan brūtē tadā tamanūtthāya pratibrūyāt । uttarē dvē sūtrē spaṣṭārthē ॥7॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

gacchantamanugacchēt 8
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

8. He shall walk after him, if he walks.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
gacchantamanugacchēt ॥ 8 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
+++(agrē 10 sūtrē vyākhyātam।)+++
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

dhāvantamanudhāvēt 9
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

9. He shall run after him, if he runs.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
dhāvantamanudhāvēt ॥ 9॥  

**ṭīkā**  
+++(agrē 10 sūtrē vyākhyātam।)+++
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

na sōpānaḥvēṣṭitaśirā avahitapāṇirvāsīdēt 10
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

10. He shall not approach (his teacher) with shoes on his feet, or his head covered, or holding (implements) in his hand.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
na sōpānadvēṣṭitaśirā avahitapāṇirvāsīdēt ॥ 10 ॥

**ṭīkā**  
uttaratrōpānat-pratiṣēdhān 'na sōpāna'd ity anuvādaḥ 'adhvāpannas tv iti pratiprasōtum । 

ācāryaṁ na sōpānatka āsīdēt । nāpi vēṣṭitaśirāḥ । avahitapāṇi - dātrādihastaḥ 

ēvaṁbhūtō'pi nāsīdēt ॥ 8-10 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

adhvāpannas tu karma-yuktō 'vāsīdēt 11
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

11. But on a journey or occupied in work, he may approach him (with shoes on, with his head covered, or with implements in his hand),
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
adhvāpannastu karmayuktō vā''sīdēt ॥ 11 ॥

**ṭīkā**  
adhvānaṁ prāptō'dhvāpannaḥ karmaṇi dātrādisādhyē pravr̥ttaḥ karmayuktaḥ ēvaṁbhūtastu sōpānatkō'pyāsīdēt ॥ 11 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

na cēd upasīdēt 12
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

12. Provided he does not sit down quite near (to his teacher).
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
na cēdupasīdēt ॥ 12॥

**ṭīkā**  
[#1] na cēdācāryassamīpē, upasīdēt upaviśēt । yadi tūpaviśēdadhvāpannaḥ karmayuktō vā tadōpānatprabhr̥tīni vihāyōpaviśēt ॥ 12 ॥  

[#1]: na cēdācāryasamīpē upasīdēt upaviśēt iti kha, pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

dēvam ivācāryam upāsītāvikathayann avimanā vācaṁ śuśrūṣamāṇō'sya 13
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

13. He shall approach his teacher with the same reverence as a deity, without telling idle stories, attentive and listening eagerly to his words.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
dēvamivācāryamupāsītā'vikathayannavimanā
vācaṁ śuśrūṣamāṇō'sya ॥ 13 ॥

**ṭīkā**  
yō yaṁ dēvaṁ bhajatē sa tadbhāvanayā tamivā''cāryamupāsīta । avikathayan [#2]vyarthāṁ kathāmakurvan । avimanāḥ avikṣiptamanāḥ । asyā''cāryasya vācaṁ
śuśraṣamāṇaḥ ॥ 13 ॥  

[#2]: vyarthā kathā vikathā tāmakurvan iti. kha. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

anupasthakr̥taḥ 14
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

14. (He shall not sit near him). with his legs crossed.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
anupasthakr̥taḥ ॥14॥

**ṭīkā**  
[#3]upasthakaraṇaṁ prasiddham । tatkr̥tvā nōpāsīta ॥ 14॥  

[#3]: ākuñcitasya savyajānuna uparidakṣiṇaṁ pādaṁ prakṣipyōpavēśanamupasthakaraṇam ।
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

anuvāti vītaḥ 15
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

15. If (on sitting down) the wind blows from the pupil towards the master, he shall change his place. [#6] 

[#6]:  Manu II, 203.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
anuvāti[#4] vātē vītaḥ ॥15॥  

**ṭīkā**  
vātē anuvāti sati vītaḥ viparyayēṇētaḥ upāsīta । prativātaṁ tu vakṣyamāṇēna pratiṣidhyatē । manurapyāha—
[#5] prativātē'nuvātē ca nāsīta guruṇā sahēti ॥ 15 ॥   

[#4]: 'vātē' iti nāsti kha. pu.   

[#5]: manu0 smr̥0 2. 203.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

apratiṣṭabdhaḥ pāṇinā 16
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

16. (He shall sit) without supporting himself with his hands (on the ground),
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
apratiṣṭabdhaḥ pāṇinā ॥ 16 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
pāṇinā pratiṣṭabdhō na syāt pāṇitalaṁ bhūmau kr̥tvā pāṇyavalambanō nā''sīta ॥16॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

anapaśritō'nyatra 17
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

17. Without leaning against something (as a wall or the like).
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
anapāśritō'nyatra ॥17॥

**ṭīkā**  
anyatra kuḍyādyapāśritō na syāt । kuḍyādyapāśritō nāsīta ॥17॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yajñōpavītī dvivastraḥ 18
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

18. If the pupil wears two garments, he shall wear the upper one after the fashion of the sacred thread at the sacrifices. [#7] 

[#7]:  At sacrifices the sacred thread passes over the left shoulder and under the right arm. Manu II, 63, and Taitt. Ār. II, 1, 3.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yajñōpavītī dvivastraḥ॥ 18 ॥

**ṭīkā**  
yadā dvivastrastadā vāsasā'nyatarēṇa yajñōpavītī syāt । [#1] "api vā sūtramēvōpavītārtha" ityēṣa kalpastadā na bhavati ॥18॥

[#1]: āpa0 dha0 2. 4. 22.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

adhōnivītastvēkavastraḥ 19
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

19. But, if he wears a (lower) garment only, he shall wrap it around the lower part of his body.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
adhōnivītastvēkavastraḥ ॥ 19 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yadā tvēkavastrō bhavati tadā adhōnivītaḥ syāt । na tasya dīrghasyāpyēkadēśēnōttarīyaṁ kuryāt ॥ 19 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

abhimukhō'nabhimukham 20
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

20. He shall turn his face towards his teacher though the latter does not turn his towards him. [#8] 

[#8]:  Manu II, 197.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
abhimukhō'nabhimukham ॥ 20 ॥

**ṭīkā**  
svayamācāryābhimukhaḥ ātmānaṁ pratyanabhimukhamācāryamupāsīta । [#2]svayamācāryamapaśyan ācāryasya purata ārjavē nā''sīta ॥ 20 ॥  

[#2]: svayamācāryamēva paśyan iti. kha. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

anāsannō'natidūrē 21
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

21. He shall sit neither too near to, nor too far (from the teacher),
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
anāsannō'natidūrē[#3] ca ॥ 21 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
atyāsannō na syādatidūrē ca na syāt ॥ 21 ॥

[#3]: cakārō nāsti kha. pustakē
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yāvadāsīnō bāhubhyāmprāpnuyāt 22
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

22. (But) at such a distance, that (the teacher) may be able to reach him with his arms (without rising).
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yāvadāsīnō bāhubhyāṁ prāpnuyāt ॥ 22 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yāvatyantarālē āsīna ācāryaṁ bāhubhyāṁ prāptuṁ śaknuyāt tāvatyāsīta ॥22॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

aprativātam 23
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

23. (He shall not sit in such a position) that the wind blows from the teacher, towards himself. [#9] 

[#9]:  See Sūtra 15 and Manu quoted there.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
aprativātam ॥ 23 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ācāryasya [#4]prativātē nā''sīt ॥ 23 ॥  

[#4]: prativātaṁ iti kha. pu
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ēkādhyāyī dakṣiṇaṁ bāhuṁ pratyupasīdēt 24
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

24. (If there is) only one pupil, he shall sit at the right hand (of the teacher).
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ēkādhyāyī dakṣiṇaṁ bāhuṁ pratyupasīdēt ॥ 24 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yadā ēka ēvā'dhītē tadā ācāryasya dakṣiṇaṁ bāhuṁ prati dakṣiṇē pārśva upasīdēt upaviśēt ॥ 24 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yathāvakāśaṁ bahavaḥ 25
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

25. (If there are) many, (they may sit) as it may be convenient.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yathāvakāśaṁ bahavaḥ ॥ 25 ॥

**ṭīkā**  
bahavastu śiṣyā yathāvakāśamupasīdēyuḥ ॥ 25 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

tiṣṭhati ca nāsītānāsanayōgavihitē 26
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

26. If the master (is not honoured with a seat and) stands, the (pupil) shall not sit down.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
tiṣṭhati ca nā''sītā'nāsanayōgavihitē ॥ 26 ॥

**ṭīkā**  
āsanayōga āsanakalpanā। āsanayōgēna vihitassambhāvita āsanayōgavihitaḥ । āsanayōgēnā'sambhāvitē ācāryē tiṣṭhati sati svayaṁ nā''sīt ॥ 26 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

āsīnē ca na saṁviśēt 27
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

27. (If the master is not honoured with a couch) and sits, the (pupil) shall not lie down on a couch.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
āsīnē ca na saṁviśēt ॥ 27 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
[#1] 'aśayanayōgavihitē' iti pūrvānusārēṇa gamyatē । śayanayōgēnāsambhāvita ācāryē āsīnē svayaṁ na saṁviśēt na śayīta ॥ 27 ॥

[#1]: āsanayōga iti ka0 pu0
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

cēṣṭati ca cikīrṣantacchaktiviṣayē 28
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

28. And if the teacher tries (to do something), then (the pupil) shall offer to do it for him, if it is in his power.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
cēṣṭati ca cikīrṣaṁstacchaktiviṣayē ॥ 28 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
vyatyayēna parasmaipadam । ācāryē cēṣṭati sati svayamapi taccikīrṣan syāt । kimaviśēṣēṇa, ? śaktiviṣayē । yadyācāryēṇa kriyamāṇamātmanaśśaktērviṣayō bhavati । 'cikīrṣa'nniti sanprayōgādicchāmēva pradarśayēt nācchidya kuryāt । pradarśitāyāṁ tvicchāyāmācāryaścēdanujānīyāt, kuryāt । aśaktiviṣayē tu nēcchāpi pradarśayitavyā । cikīrṣēditi yuktaḥ pāṭhaḥ ॥28॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

na cāsya sakāśē'nvaksthāninamupasaṁgr̥hṇīyāt 29
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

29. And, if his teacher is near, he shall not embrace (the feet of) another Guru who is inferior (in dignity), [#10] 

[#10]:  The term Guru includes a father, maternal uncle, &c. (see above), and these are inferior to the teacher. Manu II, 205.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
na cāsya sakāśē'nvaksthānina upasaṅgrahṇīyāt ॥ 29 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ācāryavyatiriktā guravō'nvaksthānina iti smārtō vyavahāraḥ । ācāryaḥ śrēṣṭhō gurūṇām । tamapēkṣyānvakyānaṁ padamēṣāmiti kr̥tvā । ācāryasya sannidhau anvaksthāninaṁ nōpasaṁgr̥hṇīyāt ॥ 19 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

gōtrēṇa vā kīrtayēt 30
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

30. Nor shall he praise (such a person in the teacher's presence) by (pronouncing the name of) his family.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
gōtrēṇa vā kīrtayēt ॥ 30 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
na cainamanvaksthāninaṁ gōtrēṇa abhijanakulādinā vā kīrtayēt na stuvīta bhārgavō'yaṁ mahākulaprasūta iti ॥ 30 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

na cainaṁ pratyuttiṣṭhēdanūttiṣṭhēdvā 31
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

31. Nor, shall he rise to meet such an (inferior Guru) or rise after him, [#11] 

[#11]:  -32. 'The pupil is not to show the mentioned marks of respect to any of his own inferior Gurus, even if the person is the Guru, e.g. the maternal uncle, of his teacher.'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
na cainaṁ pratyuttiṣṭhēdanuttiṣṭhēvā[#2]pi cēttasya -
guruḥ syāt ॥ 31 ॥  

[#2]: api cētyādi sūtrāntaraṁ, kha, ca. pu ।  

**ṭīkā**  
pratyutthānamapyasya na kartavyamācāryasya sakāśē । yadā punarasāvācāryasakāśē tvāsitvā gamanāyōttiṣṭhati tadā'nūtthānamapi na kartavyam । yadyapyasau tasya[#21]ācāryasya mātulādiḥ guruḥ syāt । [#22] ācārya-prācāryasannipāta' iti vakṣyati। tēnaiva gyāyēna[#23]mātulādiṣvapi prasaṅgē idamuktam ॥ 31 ॥

[#21]: māṇavakasya iti ka. pu.  

[#22]: āpa0 dha0 1.8, 19 pūjāṁ vakṣyatīti kha. pu.  

[#23]: mātulādiprasaṅgē iti ka0 pu0
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

api cēttasya guruḥ syāt 32
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

32. Even if he be a Guru of his teacher.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
api cēttasya guruḥ syāt ॥ 32 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yadyapyasau tasya[#1]ācāryasya mātulādiḥ guruḥ syāt । [#2] ācārya-prācāryasannipāta' iti vakṣyati। tēnaiva gyāyēna[#3]mātulādiṣvapi prasaṅgē idamuktam ॥ 31 ॥

[#1]: māṇavakasya iti ka. pu.

[#2]: āpa0 dha0 1.8, 19 pūjāṁ vakṣyatīti kha. pu.  

[#3]: mātulādiprasaṅgē iti ka0 pu0
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

dēśāttvāsanācca saṁsarpēt 33
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

33. But he shall leave his place and his seat, (in order to show him honour.)
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
dēśātvāsanāca saṁsarpēt ॥ 33॥  

**ṭīkā**  
kiṁ tu dēśādāsanācca saṁsarpēttasya sammānārtham ॥ 33 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

nāmnā tadantēvāsinaṁ gurumapyātmana ityēkē 34
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

34. Some say, that (he may address) a pupil of his teacher by (pronouncing) his name, if he is also one of his (the pupil's) own Gurus. [#12] 

[#12]:  'But Āpastamba's own opinion is that he ought not to address by name a (maternal uncle or other) Guru (who visits his teacher).'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
nāmnā tadantēvāsinaṁ gurumapyātmana ityēkē ॥ 34 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
tasyācāryasyāntēvāsinaṁ nāmnaiva kīrtayēt 'yajñaśarmanni'ti । yadyapyasā. vātmanō gurubhavati ityēvamēkē manyantē । svapakṣastu gurōrnāmagrahaṇaṁ na kartavyamiti ॥ 34 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yasmiṁstvanācāryasaṁbandhādgauravaṁ vr̥ttistasminn anvaksthānīyē 'pyācāryasya 35
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

35. But towards such a person who is generally revered for some other reason than being the teacher (e.g. for his learning), the (student) should behave as towards his teacher, though he be inferior in dignity to the latter.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yasmiṁstvanācāryasambandhādgauravaṁ vr̥ttistasminnanvaksthānīyē 'pyācāryasya ॥ 34 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yasmiṁstu puruṣē śiṣyācāryabhāvamantarēṇāpi vidyācāritryādinā laukikānāṁ gauravaṁ tasminnanvaksthānīyē 'pyācāryē yā vr̥ttissā kartavyā। anvaksthānīyō'pyananvaksthānyēva ॥ 34 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

bhuktvācāryasya sakāśē nānūtthāyōcchiṣṭaṁ prayacchēt 36
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

36. After having eaten in his (teacher's) presence, he shall not give away the remainder of the food without rising. [#13] 

[#13]:  According to I, 1, 3, 40 seq., a student shall give what he is unable to eat to a child, or to a slave. If he has eaten in the presence of his teacher, he shall not give the food away without rising for the purpose.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
bhuktvā cāsya sakāśē nānūtthāyōcchiṣṭaṁ prayacchēt ॥ 35 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ācāryasya bhuñānasyā'bhuñjānasya vā sakāśē bhuktvā anūtthāya chāndasō dīrghaḥ। utthānamakr̥tvā ucchiṣṭaṁ na prayacchēt [#4] āryāya vā paryavadadhyāditi yadvihitam ॥ 35 ॥  

[#4]: āpa0 dha0 1.3.40
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ācāmēdvā 37
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

37. Nor shall he sip water (after having eaten in the presence of his teacher without rising).
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ācāmēdvā ।। 36 ॥

**ṭīkā**  
ācamanamapyanutthāya na kuryāt ।। 36 ।।
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

kiṁ karavāṇīty āmantrya 38
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

38. (He shall rise) addressing him (with these words), 'What shall I do?'
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
kiṁ karavāṇītyāmantrya ॥ 37॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ācamya kiṁ karavāṇīti gurumāmantrya ॥ 37॥  

isyāpastambadharmasūtrē prathamapraśnē ṣaṣṭhī kaṇḍikā ॥
</details>
</details>

### 07 brahmacaryam, snātakaḥ

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

uttiṣṭhēt tūṣṇīṁ vā 1
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

1. Or he may rise silently.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
uttiṣṭhētūṣṇīṁ vā ॥1॥  

**ṭīkā**  
uttiṣṭhēt tūṣṇīṁ vā। vikalpaḥ । āmantryēti liṅgāt [#1] utthāyāpyācāmannācāryasakāśa ēvā''cāmēt ॥ 1॥  

[#1]:  

    utthāyāpyācamanaṁ na kuryāt , ācāryasamīpa ēvācāmēt । iti. kha. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

nāpaparyāvartēta gurōḥ pradakṣiṇīkr̥tyāpēyāt 2
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

2. Nor shall he (in going away) move around his teacher with his left hand turned towards him; he shall go away after having walked around him with his right side turned towards him.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
nāpaparyāvartēta gurōḥ pradakṣiṇīkr̥tyā'pēyāt ॥ 2॥  

**ṭīkā**  
utthāya kāryavattayā gantumicchan gurōrapa apasavyaṁ na paryāvartēta । kiṁ tu pradakṣiṇīkr̥tyā'pēyāt ॥ 2॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

na prēkṣēta nagnāṁ striyam 3
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

3. He shall not look at a naked woman. [#1] 

[#1]:  7. Manu IV, 5 3: Yājñ. I, 13 5.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
na prēkṣēta nagnāṁ striyam ॥ 3॥  

**ṭīkā**    
yāṁ prēkṣamāṇasya manasō vikārō bhavati tāṁ nagnāṁ striyaṁ nēkṣēta ॥3॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ōṣadhi-vanaspatīnām ācchidya nōpajighrēt 4
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

4. He shall not cut the (leaves or flowers) of herbs or trees, in order to smell at them. [#2] 

[#2]:  Gopatha-brāhmaṇa I, 2, 2.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
[#2]ōṣadhivanaspatīnāmācchidya nōpajighrēt ॥ 4 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ōṣadhayaḥ phalapākāntāḥ । vanaspatayō yē puṣpairvinā phalanti । vīrudvr̥kṣāṇāmapyupalakṣaṇam । tēṣāṁ patrapuṣpāṇyācchidya nōpajighrēt । 'ācchidyē'tivacanā[#3]dyādr̥cchikāghrāṇē na dōṣaḥ ॥ 4 ॥  

[#2]:  

    "athaitat brahmacāriṇaḥ puṇyō gandhō ya ōṣadhivanaspatīnāṁ tāsāṁ puṇyaṁ gandhaṁ pracchidya nōpājighrēt tēna taṁ puṇyaṁ gandhamavarundhē” iti gōpathabrāhmaṇam । (gō0 brā0 1. 2.2)  

[#3]:

    yādr̥cchikē gandhagrahaṇē na dōṣaḥ iti kha. pu0
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

upānahau chatraṁ yānam iti ca varjayēt 5
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

5. He shall avoid (the use of) shoes, of an umbrella a chariot, and the like (luxuries). [#3] 

[#3]:  Manu II, 178.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
upānahau chatraṁ yānamiti varjayēt ॥ 5 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yānaṁ śakaṭādi । itiśabda ēvaṁprakārāṇāmupalakṣaṇārthaḥ । tatra gautamaḥ— [#4]varjayēnmadhumāṁsagandhamālyadivāsvapnāñjanābhyañjanayānōpānacchatrakāma-krōdhalōbhamōhavādavādanasnānadantadhāvanaharṣanr̥ttagītaparivādabhayānīti ॥ 5 ॥  

[#4]: gau0dha0 2.13.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

na smayēta 6
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

6. He shall not smile.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
na smayēta ॥6॥  

**ṭīkā**  
smitaṁ na kuryāt ॥ 6॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yadi smayētāpigr̥hya smayētēti hi brāhmaṇam 7
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

7. If he smiles, he shall smile covering (the mouth with his hand); thus says a Brāhmaṇa.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yadi smayētā'pigr̥hya smayētēti hi brāhmaṇam ॥7॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yadi harṣātirēkaṁ dhārayituṁ na śakyatē apigr̥hya hastēna mukhaṁ pidhāya smayēta iti brāhmaṇaṁ 'na smayētē'tyārabhya ॥ 7 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

nōpajighrēt striyaṁ mukhēna 8
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

8. He shall not touch a woman with his face, in order to inhale the fragrance of her body.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
[#1]nōpajitaghrēt striyaṁ mukhēna ॥ 8॥

**ṭīkā**  
snātā[#2]manuliptāṁ vā striyaṁ bālāmapi mukhēna nōpajighrēt । 'mukhēnē'ti vacanādyādr̥cchikē gandhāghrāṇē na dōṣaḥ ॥ 8॥  

-  1. pañca ha vā ētē brahmacāriṇyagnayō dhīyantē dvau pr̥thagghastayōrmukhē hr̥dayē upastha ēva pañcamaḥ । sa yaddakṣiṇēna pāṇinā striyaṁ na spr̥śati tēnāharaharyājināṁ lōkamavarundhē, yatsavyēna tēna pravrājinām , yanmukhēna, tēnāgnipraskandināṁ, yaddhr̥dayēna tēna śūrāṇāṁ, yadupasthēna tēna gr̥hamēdhināṁ, taiścēt striyaṁ parāharatyanagniriva śiṣyatē ॥ iti gō0 brā0 1.2. 4.  

[#2]: anuliptāṅgī iti kha. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

na hr̥dayēna prārthayēt 9
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

9. Nor shall he desire her in his heart.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
na hr̥dayēna prārthayēt ॥ 9 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
hr̥dayēna manasā striyaṁ na prārthayēt—apīyaṁ mama syāditi ॥ 9 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

nākāraṇād upaspr̥śēt 10
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

10. Nor shall he touch (a woman at all) without a particular reason. [#4] 

[#4]:  Manu II, 179.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
nākāraṇādupaspr̥śēt ॥ 10 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
kāraṇēna vinā striyaṁ nōpaspr̥śēt । kāraṇaṁ yōktrasannahanavimōcanaviṣama-patanadhāraṇādi ॥10॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

rajasvalō raktadan satyavādī syād iti hi brāhmaṇam 11
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

11. A Brāhmaṇa declares, 'He shall be dusty, be shall have dirty teeth, and speak the truth.' [#5] 

[#5]:  Though both (these first two precepts) have been given in Sūtra I, 1, 2, 27, still they are repeated, in order to show that a Śrauta penance for the breach of them, is enjoined by a revealed text.'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
rajasvalō raktadansatyavādī syāditi hi brāhmaṇam ॥11॥  

**ṭīkā**  
rajasvalō malinagātraḥ । raktā dantā yasya sa rakadan । chāndasō dannādēśaḥ । paṅkiladanta ityarthaḥ । ētadubhaya'mutsannaślāgha'(1-1-27) ityanēna gatamapi punarucyatē[#3]śrautaprāyaścittaprāptyartham । anr̥taṁ vōktvē(2-1-27)ti prāyaścittaṁ vakṣyati । satyavādī syāditi brāhmaṇam ॥ 11 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yāṁ vidyāṁ kurutē gurau tē'pyasyācāryā yē tasyāṁ gurōrvaṁśyāḥ 12
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

12. Those teachers, who instructed his teacher in that science which he (the pupil) studies with him, (are to be considered as) spiritual teachers (by the pupil). [#6] 

[#6]:  The term vaṃsya, 'ancestor,' for the teacher's teacher is explained by the circumstance, that Hindus consider a 'school,' consisting of a succession of teachers and pupils, as a spiritual family, and call it a vidyāvaṃsa, vidyāparamparā. Manu II, 205.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yāṁ vidyāṁ kurutē gurau tē'pyasyā''cāryā yē tasyāṁ
gurōrvaṁśyāḥ ॥ 12 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ātmīyē gurau yāṁ vidyāṁ kurutē adhītē tasyāṁ vidyāyāṁ gurōrvaṁśyā ācāryāstē'pyasya māṇavakasyācāryāḥ । yadyapi sākṣāttēbhyō na gr̥hyatē vidyā tathāpi ācāryavadupacaritavyāḥ। 'tasyā'miti vacanādvidyāntarē yē vaṁśyāstēṣu nāyaṁ vidhiḥ ॥ 12 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yānanyānpaśyatō'syōpasaṁgr̥hṇīyāt tadā tvēta upasaṁgrāhyāḥ 13
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

13. But if (a teacher), before the eyes of his (pupil), embraces the feet of any other persons, then he (the pupil also) must embrace their feet, (as long as he remains) in that (state of studentship). [#7] 

[#7]:  'Another (commentator) says, "He, the pupil, must embrace their feet (at every meeting) from that time (when he first saw his teacher do it)." Because the word "but" is used in the Sūtra, he must do so even after he has returned home (on completion of his studies).'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yānanyān paśyatō'syōpasaṅgrahīyāttadātvē ta upasaṅgrāhyāḥ ॥ 13 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
asya māṇavakasya paśyata asmin māṇavakē paśyati yānanyānācārya upasaṅgr̥hīyāttē māṇavakasyā'pyupasaṅgrāhyāḥ । kiṁ sadā ? nētyāha-tadātvē tasyāṁ daśāyām । apara āha—tadā prabhr̥ti ta upasaṅgrāhyāḥ । tuśabdāt samāvr̥ttēnāpi ॥ 13 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

gurusamavāyē bhikṣayāmutpannāyāṁ yamanubaddhastadadhīnā bhikṣā 14
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

14. If (a pupil) has more than one teacher, the alms (collected by him) are at the disposal of him to whom he is (just then) bound. [#8] 

[#8]:  'More than one teacher,' i.e. several, who have taught him the several Vedas. Each Brahman generally knowing one Veda only.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
gurusamavāyē bhikṣāyāmutpannāyāṁ yamanubaddhastadadhīnā bhikṣā ॥ 14 ॥   

**ṭīkā**  
yadā dvitīyaṁ tr̥tīyaṁ vā vēdamadhīyānasya māṇavakasya gurusamavāyō bhavati guravaḥ samavētā bhavanti, tadā bhikṣāyāmutpannāyāṁ ya gurumidānīmanubaddhō māṇavakaḥ yatō'dhītē tadaghīnā bhikṣā, yacca yāvañca labdhaṁ tattasmai nivēdanīyam । [#1]taduktaśca viniyōgaḥ ॥ 14 ॥

[#1]: tataśca viniyōgaḥ iti, ka. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

samāvr̥ttō mātrē dadyāt 15
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

15. When (a student) has returned home (from his teacher), he shall give (whatever he may obtain by begging or otherwise) to his mother.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
samāvr̥ttō mātrē dadyāt ॥ 15 ॥   

**ṭīkā**  
kr̥tasamāvartanō vivāhātprāgarjitaṁ mātrē dadyāt ॥ 15 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

mātā bhartāraṁ gamayēt 16
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

16. The mother shall give it to her husband;
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
mātā bhartāraṁ gamayēt ॥ 16 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
mātā patiṁ prāpayēt ॥ 16 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

bhartā gurum 17
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

17. (And) the husband to the (student's) teacher.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
matō gurum ॥ 17॥

**ṭīkā**  
[#2] prāpayēt । māṇavakasya gurum , māṇavakārjitaṁ dravyaṁ tadgāmi yuktam ॥ 17॥  

[#2]: sō'pi guruṁ prāpayēnmāṇavakasya iti kha. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

dharmakr̥tyēṣu vōpayōjayēt 18
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

18. Or he may use it for religious ceremonies. [#9] 

[#9]:  'Religious, ceremonies, i.e. the wedding and the like. For them he may use it optionally. He, i.e. on failure of the teacher; the father, on failure of the father; the mother, on failure of all (the pupil) himself.'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
dharmakr̥tyēṣu vōpayōjayēt ॥ 18 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
dharmakr̥tyāni vivāhādīni । tēṣu vōpayōjayēt । gurōrabhāvē bhartā, tadabhāvē mātā, sarvēṣāmabhāvē samāvr̥ttassvayamēva vā ॥ 18 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

kr̥tvā vidyāṁ yāvatīṁ śaknuyādvēdadakṣiṇāmāharēddharmatō yathāśakti 19
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

19. After having studied as many (branches of) sacred learning as he can, he shall procure in a righteous manner the fee for (the teaching of) the Veda (to be given to his teacher), according to his power. [#10] 

[#10]:  Manu II, 245 and 246; Yājñ. I, 51; Weber, Ind. Stud, X, 125.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
kr̥tvā vidyāṁ yāvatīṁ śaknuyāt vēdadakṣiṇāmāharēddharmatō
yathāśakti ॥ 19 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yāvatīṁ vidyāṁ kartuṁ śaknuyāt vēdaṁ vēdau vēdānvā tāvatīṁ kr̥tvā adhītya guravē dakṣiṇāmāharēt dadyāt । yathāśakti dharmata upalabdhāṁ nyāyārjitām ॥19॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

viṣamagatē tvācārya ugrataḥ śūdra tō vāharēt 20
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

20. But, if the teacher has fallen into distress, he may take (the fee) from an Ugra or from a Śūdra. [#11] 

[#11]:  'The word Ugra denotes either the offspring of a Vaiśya, and of a Śūdra woman, or a twice-born man, who perpetrates dreadful deeds.'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
viṣamagatē tvācārya ugrataḥ śudratō vā''harēt ॥20॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
dharmata ityasyāpavādaḥ-

**ṭīkā**  
yadā tvācāryō viṣamagataḥ āpadgataḥ tadā ugrataḥ śūdratō vā'pi pratigr̥hya dakṣiṇāmāharēt । vaiśyācchūdrāyāṁ jāta ugraḥ, ugrakarmā vā dvijātiḥ ॥20॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

sarvadā śūdrata ugratō vācāryārthasyāharaṇaṁ dhārmyamityēkē 21
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

21. But some declare, that it is lawful at any time to take the money for the teacher from an Ugra or from a Śūdra.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
sarvadā śūdrata ugratō vā''cāryārthasyāharaṇaṁ dharmyamityēkē ॥21॥  

**ṭīkā**  
sarvadā āpadyanāpadi ca, ācāryārthasyācāryāya yō dēyō'rthaḥ tasya, ugrataḥ śūdratō vā''haraṇaṁ dharmyaṁ dharmādanapētamityēkē manyantē । 'dhārmya'miti pāṭhē svārthē ṣyañ ॥21॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

datvā ca nānukathayēt 22
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

22. And having paid (the fee), he shall not boast of having done so.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
datvā ca nā'nukathayēt ॥ 22 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ācāryāya ēvamāhr̥tya datvā na kīrtayēt,-ētanmayā dattamiti ॥ 22 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

kr̥tvā ca nānusmarēt 23
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

23. And he shall not remember what he may have done (for his teacher).
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
kr̥tvā ca nā'nusmarēt ॥23॥  

**ṭīkā**  
guravē prāṇasaṁśayādau mahāntamapyupakāraṁ kr̥tvā nānusmarēt nā'nucintayēt- ahō mayaitatkr̥tamiti ॥ 23 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ātmapraśaṁsāṁ paragarhāmiti ca varjayēt 24
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

24. He shall avoid self-praise, blaming others, and the like. [#12] 

[#12]:  Manu II, 119.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ātmapraśaṁsā paragarhāmiti ca varjayēt ॥ 24 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
itikaraṇādēvaṁprakārāṇāmātmanindādīnāmapi pratiṣēdhaḥ ॥ 24 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

prēṣitastadēva pratipadyēta 25
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

25. If he is ordered (by his teacher to do something), he shall do just that.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
prēṣita[#1]stadaiva pratipadyēta ॥ 25 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
idaṁ kurvityācāryēṇa prēṣitastadaiva pratipadyēta kuryāt kriyamāṇamapi karma vihāya, yadyapi [#2]tadācāryasya bhavati ॥ 25 ॥  

[#1]: tadēva iti kha pu.

[#2]: tadācāryāya iti kha pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

śāstuścānāgamādvr̥ttiranyatra 26
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

26. On account of the incompetence of his teacher, (he may go) to another (and) study (there). [#13] 

[#13]:  See above, I, 1, 1, 13, and note. Here also Haradatta states that the permission to. leave the teacher is to be restricted to those who have not solemnly bound themselves to their teacher by allowing him to perform the ceremony of initiation.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
śāstuścā'nāgamādvr̥ttiranyatra ॥ 26 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
tasmiṁśca 'vidyākarmānta'mityasyāpavādaḥ । yadyadhigantumiṣṭā vidyā śāstuḥ śāśiturācāryasya samyaṅnā'gacchati tadā tasyānāgamāt anyatra puruṣāntarē vr̥ttirbhavatyēva yasya samyagāgacchati । [#3]yēṣāmācāryavidhiprayuktamadhyayanaṁ tēṣāmētannōpapadyata' ityavōcāma ॥ 26॥  

[#3]: rōṣāmityādyavōcāmatyēntaḥ pāṭhō nāsti kha. pustakē
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

anyatrōpasaṁgrahaṇāducchiṣṭāśanāccācāryavadācāryadārē vr̥ttiḥ 27
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

27. He shall behave towards his teacher's wife as towards the teacher himself, but he shall not embrace her feet, nor eat the residue of her food. [#14] 

[#14]:  Manu II, 208-212.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
anyatrōpasaṅgrahaṇāducchiṣṭāśanāccā''cāryavadācāryadārē vr̥ttiḥ ॥27॥  

**ṭīkā**  
anyatrētyubhayōśśēṣaḥ । ācāryavadācāryadārē vr̥ttiḥ kartavyā । kimaviśēṇa ? anyatrōpasaṅgrahaṇāducchiṣṭāśanācca, pādōpasaṅgrahaṇamucchiṣṭāśanaṁ ca ityētadubhayaṁ varjayitvā । atra manuḥ—
[#1]'guruvadgurupatnīṣu yuvatīrnābhivādayēt ।' iti । gautamastu, [#2] 'tadbhāryāputrēṣu caivaṁ nōcchiṣṭāśanasnāpanaprasādhanapādaprakṣālanōnmardanōpasaṅgrahaṇāni' iti । 'dāra' ityēkavacanaṁ chāndasam ॥27॥

[#1]:

    manu0 smr̥0 2. 212. gurupatnī tu yuvatirnābhivādyēha pādayōḥ । iti mudritamanusmr̥tipāṭhaḥ।  

[#2]: gau0 dha0 2. 31. 32
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

tathā samādiṣṭē'dhyāpayati 28
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

28. So also (shall he behave) towards him who teaches him at (the teacher's) command, [#15] 

[#15]:  'The use of the present "adhyāpayati," shows that this rule holds good only for the time during which he is taught by such a man.'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
tathā samādiṣṭē'dhyāpayati ।। 28 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ya ācāryēṇa samādiṣṭō niyuktō'dhyāpayati tasminnācāryadāravadvr̥ttiḥ । 'adhyāpayatīti vartamānanirdēśā[#3]dyāvadadhyāpanamēvāyamatidēśaḥ ॥ 28 ॥  

[#3]: yāvadadhyāpanaṁ tāvadēvātidēśaḥ iti. kha. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

vr̥ddhatarē ca sabrahmacāriṇi 29
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

29. And also to a fellow-student who is superior (in learning and years). [#16] 

[#16]:  'Because (an older fellow-student) is of use to him, according to the verse: One-fourth (of his learning) a pupil receives from his teacher, one-fourth he acquires by his own intelligence, one-fourth from his fellow students, one-fourth he is taught by time.'-- Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
vr̥ddhatarē ca sabrahmacāriṇi ॥ 29 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
adhyāpayatīti nā'nuvartatē । taranirdēśāt jñānavayōbhyāmubhābhyāṁ vr̥ddhō gr̥hyatē । sabrahmacārī sahādhyāyī, samānē brahmaṇi vrata caratīti । tasminnapyācāryadāravadvr̥ttiḥ।  
'ācāryātpādamādattē pādaṁ śiṣyaḥ svamēdhayā।  
pādaṁ sabrahmacāribhyaḥ pādaḥ kālēna pacyatē ॥'   ityadhyayanē upayōgasambhavāt ॥ 29॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ucchiṣṭāśanavarjamācāryavadācāryaputrē vr̥ttiḥ 30
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

30. He shall behave to his teacher's son (who is superior to himself in learning or years) as to his teacher, but not eat the residue of his food. [#17] 

[#17]:  Manu II, 2, 207-209.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ucchiṣṭāśanavarjamācāryavadācāryaputrē vr̥ttiḥ ॥ 30 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
'ucchiṣṭāśanavarjamiti vacanādupasaṅgrahaṇaṁ bhavati । ētacca jñānavayōbhyāmubhābhyāṁ vr̥ddhē । tadarthaṁ vr̥ddhatara ityanuvartatē । gautamīyastūpasaṅgrahaṇapratiṣēdhō vr̥ddhatarādanyaviṣayaḥ ॥ 30 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

samāvr̥ttasyāpyētadēva sāmayācārikamētēṣu 31
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

31. Though he may have returned home, the behaviour towards his (teacher and the rest) which is prescribed by the rule of conduct settled by the agreement (of those who know the law, must be observed by him to the end),
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
samāvr̥ttasyāpyētadēva sāmayācārikamētēṣu ॥ 31॥  

**ṭīkā**  
kr̥tasamāvartanasyāpyētadēvānantarōktam । ētēṣvācāryādiṣu putrāntēṣu sāmayācārikaṁ samayācāraprāptaṁ vr̥ttamāntāt । samādiṣṭē tvadhyāpayītēti[#2] viśēṣa uktaḥ ॥ 31॥  

॥ ityāpastambīyadharmasūtravr̥ttāvujvalāyāṁ saptamī kaṇḍikā ॥
</details>
</details>

### 08 anadhyāyāntam

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yathā brahmacāriṇō vr̥ttam 1
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

1. Just as by a student (actually living with his teacher). [#1] 

[#1]:  8. Haradatta does not connect this Sūtra with the preceding one. He explains it by itself: '(We will now declare) how a student (who has left his teacher, but is not married) ought to behave.'
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yathā brahmacāriṇō vr̥ttam ॥ 1 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
samāvr̥ttasyēti[#1] vartatē । samāvr̥ttasya [#2]brahmacāriṇō'kr̥tavivāhasya yathā vr̥ttaṁ vartanam tathā vakṣyāmaḥ ॥ 1 ॥  

[#1]: anuvartata iti kha. pu.  

[#2]: kr̥tavivāhasya' iti ka. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

mālyāliptamukha upaliptakēśaśmaśruraktō'bhyaktō vēṣṭityupavēṣṭitī kāñcukyupānahī pādukī 2
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

2. He may wear garlands, anoint his face (with sandal), oil his hair and moustaches, smear his eyelids (with collyrium), and (his body) with oil, wear a turban, a cloth round his loins, a coat, sandals, and wooden shoes.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
mālyālipsamukha upaliptakēśaśmaśruraktō'bhyaktō vēṣṭityupavēṣṭitī kāñcukyupānahī pādukī ॥2॥  

**ṭīkā**  
mālī mālāvān । āliptamukhaścandanādinā । mukhagrahaṇamupalakṣaṇam । [#3]mukhamagrē brāhmaṇō'nulimpēdi'tyāśvalāyanavacanāt । sugandhibhirāmala kādibhirdravyairupaliptāni saṁskr̥tāni kēśaśmaśrūṇī yasya saḥ upaliptakēśaśmaśruḥ । akta añjanēnā'kṣṇōḥ। abhyaktaḥ tailēna । vēṣṭitā vēṣṭitaśirāḥ । kaṭipradēśō dvitīyēna vāsasā vēṣṭitō yasya saḥ upavēṣṭitī । kañcukañcōpānacca kañcukōpānaham । [#4]dvandvāccudapahāntādityac samāsāntaḥ । tadasyāstīti kañcukōpānahī। dvandvōpatāmarhyātprāṇisthādinipratyayaḥ। prasiddhē pāṭhē kañcukamēva kāñcukaṁ tadvān kāñcukī। upānadvānupānahī । brīhyādisvādiniḥ। pādukē dārumayē pādarakṣaṇē tadvān pādukī ॥2॥  

[#3]: āśva0 pr̥0 3. 7 10.  

[#4]: pā0 sū0 5.4, 106. cavargāntāt vahāntācca dvandvāṭṭac syāt samāhārē iti
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

udācārēṣu cāsyaitāni na kuryātkārayēdvā 3
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

3. Within the sight of his (teacher or teacher's relations) he shall do none of those (actions, as putting on a garland), nor cause them to be done.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
udācārēṣu cāsyaitāni na kuryātkārayēdvā ॥ 3 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
asyā''cāryādēḥ putrāntasya udācārēṣu dr̥ṣṭigōcarēṣu dēśēṣu ētāni mālyādīni na kuryātkārayēdvā ॥ 3 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

svairikarmasu ca 4
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

4. Nor (shall he wear garlands &c. whilst performing) acts for his pleasure,
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
svairikarmasu ca ॥ 4 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ētāni na kuryāt kārayēdvā॥4॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yathā dantaprakṣālanōtsādanāvalēkhanānīti 5
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

5. As, for instance, cleaning his teeth, shampooing, combing the hair, and the like.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yathā dantaprakṣālanōtsādanāvalēkhanānīti ॥5॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
tatrōdāharaṇam

**ṭīkā**  
dantaprakṣālanaṁ dantadhāvanam । utsādanamudvartanam । avalēkhanaṁ kaṅkatādinā kēśānāṁ vibhāgēnā'vasthāpanam । itiśabdaḥ pradarśanārthaḥ । tēna snānabhōjanamūtrōcārādiṣvapi pratiṣēdhaḥ ॥ 5 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

taddravyāṇāṁ ca na kathayēdātmasaṁyōgēnācāryaḥ 6
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

6. And the teacher shall not speak of the goods of the (pupil) with the intention to obtain them. [#2] 

[#2]:  'If the teacher comes to the house of his (former) pupil (who has become a householder), he shall, for instance, not say, "Oh, what a beautiful dish!" in such a manner, that his desire to obtain it becomes apparent.'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
tadravyāṇāṁ ca na kathayēdātmasaṁyōgēnā''cāryaḥ ॥ 6॥

**ṭīkā**  
tasya śiṣyasya gr̥hasthabhūtasya yāni dravyāṇyupasthāpitāni tēṣāṁ madhyē ēkēnāpi dravyēṇa yathā''tmā saṁyujyatē tathā na kathayēt । ācāryaḥ śiṣyagr̥ha[#1]mētya ahō darśanīyaṁ bhōjanapātramityādi[#2] lipsā yathā
gamyatē tathā na kathayēditi ॥ 6 ॥  

[#1]: pratyāgata iti kha. pu.

[#2]: īpsā iti. kha. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

snātastu kālē yathāvidhyabhihr̥tamāhūtō 'bhyētō vā na pratisaṁharē ityēkē 7
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

7. But some declare, that, if a pupil who has bathed (after completing his studies) is called by his teacher or has gone to see him, he shall not take off [#3]  that (garland or other ornaments) which he wears according to the law at the time (of that ceremony).

[#3]:  This opinion is contrary to Āpastamba's view given in Sūtras 2 and 3 above.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
snātastu kālē yathāvidhyabhihr̥tamāhūtō'bhyētō vā
na pratisaṁharēdityēkē ॥ 7 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
[#3] vēdamadhītya snāsya'nnityanēna vidhinā snātaḥ tasminkālē yathāvidhyabhihr̥tamābaddhaṁ sragādi ācāryēṇāhūtaḥ svayamēva vā tatsamīpamabhyētō na pratisaṁharēt na vimuñcēdityēkē manyatē । svapakṣastu tadāpi muñcēditi । 'kālē yathāvidhyabhihr̥ta'miti vacanādaparēdyurārabhya pratisaṁharēdēva ॥ 7 ॥

[#3]: āpa0 gr̥0 12. 1.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

uccaistarāṁ nāsīta 8
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

8. He shall not sit on a seat higher (than that of his teacher),
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
uccaistarāṁ nā''sīta ॥ 8॥  

**ṭīkā**  
svārthē tarap । ācāryāsanāduccāsanē nā''sīta ॥ 8॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

tathā bahupādē 9
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

9. Nor on a seat that has more legs (than that of his teacher),
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
tathā bahupādē ॥ 9 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
nīcē'pyāsanē bahupādē nā''sīta ॥9॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

sarvataḥ pratiṣṭhitē 10
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

10. Nor on a seat that stands more firmly fixed (on the ground than that of his teacher), [#4] 

[#4]:  'When he gives to his teacher a wooden seat (with legs), he shall not sit on a cane-seat (without legs), for the latter touches the ground on all sides.'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
sarvataḥ pratiṣṭhitē ॥ 10 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
āsanē āsīta । ācārya pīṭhādāvupavēśya svayaṁ vētrāsanādāvāsīta । taddhi bhūmau sarvataḥ pratiṣṭhitam ॥ 10 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

śayyāsanē cācaritē nāviśēt 11
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

11. Nor shall he sit or lie on a couch or seat which is used (by his teacher). [#5] 

[#5]:  Manu II, 119.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
śayyāsanē cā''caritē nāviśēt ॥ 11 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ācāryēṇācarita upabhuktē śayyāsanē nā''viśēt । śayanē na śayīta āsanē nāsīta । pitrādiṣvapi guruṣu samānamidam । tathā ca manuraviśēṣēṇāha-[#4]śayyāsanē cādhyuṣitē śrēyasā na samācarēt।' iti ॥ 11 ॥  

[#4]:

    manu. 2. 119 śayyāsanē'dhyācaritē' iti mēdhātisammataḥ pāṭhaḥ । śayyā cāsanaṁ cēti dvandvaikavadbhāvaḥ ।
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yānamuktō'dhvanyanvārōhēt 12
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

12. If he is ordered (by his teacher), he shall on journey ascend a carriage after him. [#6] 

[#6]:  This rule is an exception to I, 2, 7, 5. Manu II, 204.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yānamuktō'dhvanyanvārōhēt ॥ 12 ॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
gataṁ samāvr̥ttasya vaiśēṣikam । atha brahmacaryavidhērēva śēṣaḥ—

**ṭīkā**  
yānaṁ śakaṭādi । ārōhētyuktō guruṇā paścādārōhēt । adhvani mārgē 'chatraṁ yānamiti varjayē'diti pūrvōktasya pratiṣēdhasyāpavādaḥ। yānaṁ ca gurvārūḍhamanyadvā ॥ 12 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

sabhānikaṣakaṭasvastarāṁśca 13
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

13. (At his teacher's command) he shall also enter an assembly, ascend a roller (which his teacher drags along), sit on a mat of fragrant grass or a couch of straw (together with his teacher). [#7] 

[#7]:  'The roller is an implement used by husbandmen, with which the ploughed land is made even. If one person ascends it and another drags it along, the ground becomes even. If that is dragged by the teacher, the pupil shall ascend it at his command. He shall not disobey from fear of the unseemliness of the action.'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
sabhānikaṣakaṭasvastarāṁśca ॥ 13 ॥

**ṭīkā**  
uktō'dhvanyanvārōhēdityēva । 'sabhāsamājāścē'tyasyāpavādārthaṁ sabhāgrahaṇam । nikaṣō nāma kr̥ṣīvalānāmupakaraṇaṁ, kr̥ṣṭaṁ kṣētraṁ yēna samīkriyatē, yacca kasmiṁścidārūḍhē[#1] kēnacidākr̥ṣyatē । tatra guruṇā ākr̥ṣyamāṇē'pi tēnōktassannārāhēt । na tvanaucityabhayānnārōhēditi । kaṭō vīraṇanirmitā śayyā। tatra guruṇōktassan sahā''sīta । utsavādāvēṣa ācāraḥ । svastarō nāma palālaśayyā[#2] navasvastarē saṁviśantī'ti darśanāt । tatrāpi guruṇōktassan sahāsanādi kuryāt ॥ 13 ॥  

[#1]: kēnacidākr̥ṣyamāṇē kṣētraṁ samaṁ bhavati, iti. gha. pu.  

[#2]: āpa0 gr̥0 19.9
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

nānabhibhāṣitō gurumabhibhāṣēta priyādanyat 14
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

14. If not addressed by a Guru, he shall not speak to him, except (in order to announce) good news.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
nānabhibhāṣitō gurumabhibhāṣēta priyādanyat ॥14॥  

**ṭīkā**  
guruṇā'nabhibhāṣitō guruṁ prati na kiñcit brūyāt priyādanyat । priyaṁ tu brūyāt yathā tē putrōjāta iti ॥ 14 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

vyupatōdavyupajāvavyabhihāsōdāmantraṇanāmadhēyagrahaṇaprēṣaṇānīti gurōrvarjayēt 15
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

15. He shall avoid to touch a Guru (with his finger), to whisper (into his ear), to laugh (into his face), to call out to him, to pronounce his name or to give him orders and the like (acts) [#8] 

[#8]:  Manu II, 199; regarding the term Guru, see above, I, 2, 6, 29.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
vyupatōdavyupajāpavyabhihāsōdāmantraṇanāmadhēyagrahaṇa-prēṣaṇānīti gurōrvarjayēt ॥ 15 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
vyupatōdaḥ [#3] aṅgulyādighaṭṭanaṁ yadābhimukhyārthaṁ kriyatē । vyupajāpaḥ śrōtrayōrmuhurmuhurjalpanam । vakāraśchāndasō'papāṭhō vā । vyabhihāsaḥ ābhimukhyēna hasanam । udāmantraṇamuccaissambōdhanam , yathā badhiraṁ prati । nāmadhēyagrahaṇaṁ daśamyāṁ pitr̥vihitasya nāmnō grahaṇam। na pūjyanāmnō bhagavadādēḥ । prēṣaṇamājñāpanam । ētāni guruviṣayē na kartavyāni । itikaraṇādēvaṁprakārāṇāmanyēṣāmapi pratiṣēdhaḥ । yathā''ha manuḥ—

[#4] nōdāharēttasya nāma parōkṣamapi kēvalam ।  
na caivāsyānukurvīta gatibhāṣitacēṣṭitam ॥ iti ॥ 15॥  

[#3]: aṅgulyādinā saṁghaṭṭanam iti. gha. pu.

[#4]: manu, 2.199
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

āpadyarthaṁ jñāpayēt 16
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

16. In time of need he may attract attention (by any of these acts).
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
āpadyartha jñāpayēt ॥ 16 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
āpadi vyupatōdādimirapyarthamabhiprētaṁ jñāpayēt । asati puruṣāntarē [#5]vacanēnāpi bōdhayēt, na sākṣātprēṣayēt , yathā-śūlatōdō mē bhavati, sa cā'gninā śāmyati, na cātra kaścitsannihitaḥ, kiṁ karōmi mandabhāgya iti ॥ 16 ॥

[#5]: vacanēnaiva iti ka. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

saha vasansāyaṁ prātaranāhūtō guruṁ darśanārthō gacchēt 17
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

17. If (a pupil) resides (in the same village) with (his teacher after the completion of his studies), he shall go to see him every morning and evening, without being called. [#9] 

[#9]:  This and the following Sūtras refer to a person who has finished his studentship, while the preceding ones, from Sūtra 8, apply to the time of studentship also.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
sahavasansāyaṁ prātaranāhūtō guruṁ darśanārthōṁ gacchēt ॥17॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
uttarē sūtrē samāvr̥ttaviṣayē—  

**ṭīkā**  
saha ēkasmin grāmē vasan sāyaṁ prātaranāhūtō'pi guruṁṁ darśanārthō nānyaprayōjanō gacchēt ॥ 17॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

viprōṣya ca tadaharēva paśyēt 18
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

18. And if he returns from a journey, he shall (go to) see him on the same day.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
viprōṣya ca tadaharēva paśyēt ॥ 18 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yadā grāāmāntaraṁ gataḥ pratyāgacchati tadā tadaharēvā''cāryaṁ paśyēt ॥18॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ācāryaprācāryasannipātē prācāryāyaōpasaṅgr̥hyōpasañjighr̥kṣēdācāryam 19
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

19. If his teacher and his teacher's teacher meet, he shall embrace the feet of his teacher's teacher, and then show his desire to do the same to his teacher.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ācāryaprācāryasannipātē prācāryāyōpasaṁgr̥hyōpasañjighr̥kṣēdācāryam ॥ 19 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ācāryasyā''cāryaḥ prācārya prapitāmahavat । yadā ācāryasya prācāryasya ca kāryavaśāt sannipātō mēlanaṁ bhavati, tadā prācāryāya dvitīyārthē caturthī । prācāryaṁ pūrvamupasaṁgr̥hya paścātsvācāryamupasaṅgr̥hītumicchēt । na kēvalaṁ manasā kintu yathā'cāryōṁ jānāti māmayamupasañjighr̥kṣatīti tathā cēṣṭēta । anyathā adr̥ṣṭārthamupadiṣṭaṁ syāt ॥ 19॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

pratiṣēdhēditaraḥ 20
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

20. The other (the teacher) shall (then) forbid it.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
pratiṣēdhēditaraḥ ॥ 20 ॥

**ṭīkā**  
itara ācāryaḥ pratiṣēdhēt 'vatsa mā mōpasaṅgrahīriti ॥ 20॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

lupyatē pūjā cāsya sakāśē 21
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

21. And (other marks of) respect (due to the teacher) are omitted in the presence of the (teacher's teacher).
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
lupyatē pūjā cā'sya sakāśē ॥ 21 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
asya prācāryasya sakāśē sannidhau ācāryasya pūjā lupyatē na kāryā । na kēvalamupasaṅgrahaṇamēva । uttarasūtraṁ samāvr̥ttaviṣayam ॥ 21 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

muhūṁścācāryakulaṁ darśanārthō gacchēdyathāśaktyadhihastyamādāyāpi dantaprakṣālanānīti 22
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

22. And (if he does not live in the same village), he shall go frequently to his teacher's residence, in order to see him, and bring him some (present) with his own hand, be it even only a stick for cleaning the teeth. Thus (the duties of a student have been explained).
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
muhūṁścā''cāryakulaṁ darśanārthō gacchēdyathāśaktyadhihastyamādāyā'pi dantaprakṣālanānīti ॥ 22 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
muhūm̐ścētyanusvāradīrghau chāndasau। vīpsālōpaścātra draṣṭavyaḥ । muhurmuhuriti vivakṣitam । grāmāntarē vasannapi muhurmuhurācāryakulaṁ darśanārthamāgacchēt । yathāśakti gōrasāpūpādi adhihastyaṁ hastē bhavamādāya svayamēva gr̥hītvētyarthaḥ । apiśabdō'bhāvē vidhiṁ dyōtayati-gōrasādyabhāvē dantakāṣṭhānyapīti । itiśabdaḥ antavāsidharmāṇāṁ samāptidyōtanārthaḥ ॥ 22 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

mātaraṁ pitaram ācaryam agnīṁś ca gr̥hāṇi ca rikta-pāṇir nōpagachhēd, rājānaṁ cēn na śrutam iti 23
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

[MISSING]
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
[#1]mātaraṁ pitaramācāryamagnīṁśca gr̥hāṇi ca riktapāṇirnōpagacchēdrājānaṁ cēnna śrutamiti ॥ 23 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  

[#1]: idaṁ sūtraṁ ka. pustaka ēva dr̥śyatē । nānyatra।
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

tasmingurōrvr̥ttiḥ 23
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

23. (Now) the conduct of a teacher towards his pupil (will be explained).
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
tasmingurōrvr̥ttiḥ ॥ 24 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
tasminn antēvāsini gurōr vr̥ttiḥ । vr̥ttaḥ prakārō vakṣyatē ॥ 23 ॥ 24 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

putramivainamanukāṅkṣansarvadharmēṣvanapacchādayamānaḥ suyuktō vidyāṁ grāhayēt 24
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

24. Loving him like his own son, and full of attention, he shall teach him the sacred science, without hiding anything in the whole law. [#10] 

[#10]:  Weber, Ind. Stud. X, 126.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
putramivainamanukāṅkṣan sarvadharmēṣvanapacchādayamānaḥ suyuktō vidyāṁ grāhayēt ॥ 25 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ēnaṁ śiṣyaṁ putramiva[#2] asyā'bhyudayaḥ syāditi anukāṅkṣan sarvēṣu dharmēṣu kiñcidapyanapacchādayamānaḥ agūhan suyuktaḥ suṣṭhvavahitaḥ tatparō bhūtvā vidyāṁ grāhayēt ॥ 25 ॥

[#2]: abhyāsādiṣu iti u. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

na cainamadhyayanavighnēnātmārthēṣūparundhyādanāpatsu 25
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

25. And he shall not use. him for his own purposes to the detriment of his studies except in times of distress.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
na cainamadhyayanavighnēnātmārthēṣūparundhyādanāpatsu ॥ 26 ॥

**ṭīkā**  
na cainaṁ śiṣyamadhyayanavighnēnā''tmaprayōjanēṣvanāpatsūparunyāt । [#3]uparōdhaḥ asvatantrīkaraṇam । 'anāpatsvi'tivacanādāpadyadhyayanavighātēnā'pyuparōdhē na dōṣaḥ ॥ 26 ॥  

[#3]: uparōdhaḥ svatantrīkaraṇam. iti. ḍa. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

antēvāsyanantēvāsī bhavati vinihitātmā gurāvanaipuṇamāpadyamānaḥ 26
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

26. That pupil who, attending to two (teachers), accuses his (principal and first) teacher of ignorance, remains no (longer) a pupil.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
antēvāsyanantēvāsī bhavati vinihitātmā gurāvanaipuṇamāpadyamānaḥ ॥ 27 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
'āpadyamāna' ityantarbhāvitaṇyarthaḥ । yō'ntēvāsī vinihitātmā dvayōrācāryayōḥ[#4]vividhaṁ nihitātmā gurāvanaipuṇamāpādayati-nā'nēnā'yaṁ pradēśaḥ samyagukta iti, sō'ntēvāsī na bhavati । sa tyājya ityarthaḥ[#5]।  
apara āha- yō'ntēvāsī vāṅmanaḥkarmabhiranaipuṇamāpadyamānō gurau visadr̥śaṁ nihitātmā bhavati anurūpaṁ na śuśrūṣatē sō'ntēvāsī na bhavatīti ॥ 27 ॥  

[#4]: vidhivat iti. kha. pu.।  

[#5]:  

    “atra manuḥ-dharmārthau yatra na syātāṁ śuśrūṣā vāpi tadvidhā । tatra vidyā na vaptavyā śubhaṁ bījamivōṣarē iti-"ityadhikaḥ pāṭhō dr̥śyatē kha. pustakē
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ācāryō'pyanācāryō bhavati śrutātpariharamāṇaḥ 27
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

27. A teacher also, who neglects the instruction (of his pupil), does no (longer) remain a teacher. [#11] 

[#11]:  'Another commentator says, "That pupil who offends his teacher in word, thought, or deed, and directs his mind improperly, i.e. does not properly obey, does not (any longer) remain a pupil."'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ācāryō'pyanācāryō bhavati śrutātpariharamāṇaḥ ॥ 28 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ācāryō'pyanācāryō bhavatīti, tyājya ityarthaḥ । kiṁ kurvan ? śrutātpariharamāṇaḥ tēna tēna vyājēna vidyāpradānamakurvan ॥ 28॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

aparādhēṣu cainaṁ satatamupālabhēta 28
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

28. If the (pupil) commits faults, (the teacher) shall always reprove him.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
aparādhēṣu cainaṁ satatamupālabhēta ॥ 29 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
aparādhēṣu kr̥tēṣvēnaṁ śiṣyaṁ satatamupālabhēta-idamayuktaṁ tvayā kr̥tamiti ॥ 29 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

abhitrāsa upavāsa udakōpasparśanamadarśanamiti daṇḍā yathāmātramā nivr̥ttēḥ 29
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

29. Frightening, fasting, bathing in (cold) water, and banishment from the teacher's presence are the punishments (which are to be employed), according to the greatness (of the fault), until (the pupil) leaves off (sinning). [#12] 

[#12]:  But see also Manu. VIII, 299, where corporal punishment is permitted.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
abhitrāsa upavāsa udakōpasparśanamadarśanamiti daṇḍā yathāmātramānivr̥ttēḥ ॥ 30 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  

abhitrāsō [#1]bhayōtpādanam । upavāsō bhōjanalōpaḥ। udakōpasparśanaṁ śītōdakēna snāpanam । adarśanaṁ yathā''tmānaṁ na paśyati tathā karaṇam। gr̥hapravēśaniṣēdhaḥ। sarvatra ṇyantāt pratyayaḥ । ityētē daṇḍāḥ śiṣyasya yathāmātraṁ yāvatyaparādhamātrā tadanurūpaṁ vyastāḥ samastāśca । ānivr̥ttēḥ yāvadasau na tatō'parādhānnivartatē tāvadētē daṇḍāḥ ॥ 30 ॥  

[#1]: rajjunēṇvādinā bhayōtpādanam iti, kha.pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

nivr̥ttaṁ caritabrahmacaryamanyēbhyō dharmēbhyō'nantarō bhavētyatisr̥jēt 30
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

30. He shall dismiss (the pupil), after he has performed the ceremony of the Samāvartana and has finished his studentship, with these words, 'Apply thyself henceforth to other duties.'
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
nivr̥ttaṁ caritabrahmacaryamanyēbhyō dharmēbhyō'nantarō bhavētyatisr̥jēt ॥ 31 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ēvaṁ caritabrahmacaryaṁ nivr̥ttaṁ gurukulāt kr̥tasamāvartanamityarthaḥ। ēvaṁbhūtamanyēbhyō dharmēbhyō yamasāvāśramaṁ pratipitsatē tatra tēbhyō'nantarō bhava yathā tvamantaritō na bhavasi tathā bhavētyuktvā'tisr̥jēt । taṁ tamāśramaṁ pratipattumutsr̥jēt ॥ 31 ॥  

ityāpastambasūtravr̥ttāvujvalāyāmaṣṭamī kaṇḍikā ॥  
iti cāpastambadharmasūtravr̥ttau haradattaviracitāyāmujjvalāyāṁ prathamapraśnē dvitīyaḥ paṭalaḥ ॥ 2 ॥
</details>
</details>

  

iti dvitīyaḥ paṭalaḥ

## +03

### 09 naimittikānadhyāyaḥ

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

śrāvaṇyāṁ paurṇamāsyāmadhyāyamupākr̥tya māsaṁ {anūktam ananūktañca} pradōṣē nādhīyīta 1
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

1. After having performed the Upākarma for studying the Veda on the full moon of the month' Srāvaṇa (July-August), he shall for one month not study in the evening. [#1] 

[#1]:  9. The Upākarma is the ceremony which is performed every year at the beginning of the course of study. It is in fact the solemn opening of the Brahmanic term. 'Because Āpastamba uses the word evening (i.e. first part of the night) it is not sinful to study later in the night.'--Haradatta. Manu IV, 95; Yājñ. I, 142, 143; Weber, Ind. Stud. X. 130 and 134.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
śrāvaṇyāṁ paurṇamāsyāmadhyāyamupākr̥tya māsaṁ pradōṣaṁ nā'dhāyīta ॥ 1 ॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
ēvamadhyēturadhyāpayituśca dharmā uktāḥ। atha dēśakālakr̥tā adhyayanadharmā ucyantē—  

**ṭīkā**  
mēṣādisthē savitari yō yō darśaḥ pravartatē। cāndramāsāstattadantāścaitrādyā dvādaśa smr̥tāḥ। tēṣu yā yā paurṇamāsī sāsācacyādikā smr̥tā।
kādācitkana yōgēna nakṣatrasyati nirṇayaḥ ।। tadēvaṁ siṁhasthē savitariyā'māvāsyā tadantē cāndramalē māsē yā madhyavartinī paurṇamālī sā śrāvaṇī । śravaṇayōgastu bhavatu vā mā vā । tasyāṁ śrāvaṇyā paurṇamāsyāmadhyāyamupākr̥tya gr̥hyōktēna vidhinōpākarma ka. svā svādhyāyamadhīyīta । adhīyānaśca māsamēka pradōṣē prathamē rātribhāgē nā dhīyīta grahaṇādhyayanaṁ dhāraṇādhyayana ca na kuryāt । pradōṣagrahaṇādātrā vapyūrva na dōṣaḥ ॥ 1॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

taiṣyāṁ paurṇamāsyāṁ rōhiṇyāṁ vā viramēt 2
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

2. On the full moon of the month of Pauṣa (December-January), or under the constellation Rohini, he shall leave off reading the Veda. [#2] 

[#2]:  The term lasts therefore for five months; (i.e. latter half of, Srāvaṇa, Bhārapada, Āśvina, Kārttika, Mārgasīrṣa, and the first half of Pauṣa.) The Rohinī-day of Pauṣa is meant.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
taiṣyāṁ paurṇamāsyāṁ rōhiṇyāṁ vā viramēt ॥2॥  

**ṭīkā**  
tiṣyaḥ puṣyaḥ, tēna yuktā paurṇamāsī taiṣī śrāvaṇīvat। tasyāṁ viramēt । utsarjanaṁ kuryāt । tasyāpi prayōgō[#1]gr̥hya ēvōktaḥ। rōhiṇyāṁ vā,[#2] tēṣamāsi tiṣyātpūrvā yā rōhiṇī tasyāṁ vā viramēt । anayōḥ pakṣayōḥ pañca māsānadhīyīta ॥2॥  

[#1]:  

    āpastambagr̥hyasūtrāntargatōpākarmōtsarjana-paṭalavyākhyānē 'nākulāyāmityartha । (āpa. gr̥. sū. pr̥. 154 ) ētadvacanabalādēva haradattēnōpākarmōtsarjanākhyaḥ paṭalaḥ āpastambagr̥hyāntargatō vyākhyāta ityavagamyatē iti nyarūpayāma gr̥hyaṭippaṇyām ।  

[#2]:

    'tiṣyē māsi bhavā yā 'rōhiṇī' iti ḍa. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ardhapañcamāṁścaturō māsānityēkē 3
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

3. Some declare, (that he shall study) for four months and a half. [#3] 

[#3]:  'According to this latter opinion the Upākarma should be performed on the full moon of Bhādrapada, as has been taught in another work (Manu IV, 95); the (time of the) Utsargana, (the solemn closing of the term) should be advanced; and after the Utsargana has been performed, one may study the Veda during the light nights of each month until the full moon of Srāvaṇa, in order to fix in one's mind the part learned already; and in the dark fortnight of each month one may study the Vedāṅgas, i.e. grammar and the rest (Manu IV, 98). On the full moon of Srāvaṇa the Upākarma should be performed once more, and that part of the Veda should be studied which has not yet been learned.'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ardhapañcamāṁścaturō māsānityēkē ॥ 3 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ardhaḥ pañcamō yēṣāṁ tē ardhapañcamāḥ । adhikāṁścaturō māsān adhīyītētyapēkṣyata [#3]ityēkē manyantē । asminpakṣē prōṣṭhapadyāmupākaraṇaṁ śāstrāntaradarśanāt । utsarjanasya vā pratikarṣaḥ। utsarjanē ca kr̥tē śrāvaṇyāḥ prāk śuklapakṣēṣu dhāraṇādhyayanaṁ vēdasya, kr̥ṣṇapakṣēṣu vyākaraṇādyaṅgādhyayanam । punaḥ śrāvaṇyāmupākr̥tyāgr̥hītabhāgasya grahaṇādhyayanamiti । prapañcitamētat[#4]gr̥hyē ॥ 3 ॥

[#3]: atra manuḥ 4, 95. draṣṭavyaḥ ।  

[#4]: āpa0 gr̥0 7.1. pr̥. 110 ।
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

nigamēṣvadhyayanaṁ varjayēt 4
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

4. He shall avoid to Study the Veda on a high-road. [#4] 

[#4]:  Nigarnāh, 'high-roads,' are squares and the like.--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
nigamēśvadhyayanaṁ varjayēt ॥ 4॥  

**ṭīkā**  
nigamāścatvarāḥ । grāmanirgamanāmargā vā niyamēna gamyatē tēṣviti । tēṣu sarvaprakāramadhyayanaṁ varjayēt ॥ 4॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ānaḍuhēna vā śakr̥tpiṇḍēnōpaliptē'dhīyīta 5
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

5. Or he may study it (on a high-road), after having smeared (a space) with cowdung.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ānaḍuhēna vā śakr̥tpiṇḍēnōpaliptē'dhīyīta ॥5॥  

**ṭīkā**  
anaḍutsambandhinā vā śakatpiṇḍēnōpalipya nigamēṣvapyadhīyīta ॥5॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

śmaśānē sarvataḥ śamyāprāsāt 6
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

6. He shall never study in a burial-ground nor anywhere near it within the throw of a Samyā. [#5] 

[#5]:  The Samyā is either the pin in the bullock's yoke or the round stick, about a foot and a half in length, which is used for the preparation of the Vedi. Manu IV, 116; Yājñ. I, 148.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
śmaśānē sarvataḥ śamyāprāsāt ॥ 6 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
śmaśānē cādhyayanaṁ varjayēt । sarvataḥ sarvāsu dikṣu । śamyā kṣiptā yāvati dēśē patati tatō'rvāgiti pañcamīnirdēśādgamyatē ॥ 6 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

grāmēṇādhyavasitē kṣētrēṇa vā nānadhyāyaḥ 7
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

7. If a village has been built over (a burial ground) or its surface has been cultivated as a field, the recitation of the Veda (in such a place) is not prohibited.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
grāmēṇā'dhyavasitē kṣētrēṇa vā nā'nadhyāyaḥ ॥ 7 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yadā śmaśānaṁ grāmatayā kṣētratayā vā adhyavasitaṁ svīkr̥taṁ bhavati tadā adhyētavyamēva ॥ 7 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

jñāyamānē tu tasminn ēva dēśē nādhīyīta 8
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

8. But if that place is known to have been a burial-ground he shall not study (there). [#6] 

[#6]:  'Nor anywhere near it within the throw of a Samyi.' This must be understood from. Sūtra 6.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
jñāyamānē tu tasminnēva dēśē nā'dhāyīta ॥ 8॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yadā tu tadadhyavasitamapi śmaśānaṁ jñāyatē-ayaṁ sa pradēśa iti, tadā tāvatyēva pradēśē nā'dhīyīta । na śamyāprāsāt ॥ 8 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

śmaśānavacchūdra patitau 9
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

9. A Śūdra and an outcast are (included by the term) burial-ground, (and the rule given, Sūtra 6, applies to them). [#7] 

[#7]:  Yājñ. I, 148.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
[#1] śmaśānavacchūdrapatitau ॥ 9 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
śūdrāpatitasakāśē'pi śamyāprāsānnā'dhyēyam ॥9॥  

[#1]: yājñavalkyō'tra 1. 148. draṣṭavyaḥ ।
</details>

<details><summary>viśvāsa-ṭippanī</summary>

śmaśānavacchūdrapatitau ॥ 9 ॥
samānāgāra ityēkē ॥ 10 ॥

So, safe to say that deliberate (literal) shrAvaNa to v4s was to be avoided; but tolerated if accidental.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

samānāgāra ityēkē 10
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

10. Some declare, that (one ought to avoid only, to study) in the same house (where they dwell).
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
samānāgāra ityēkē ॥ 10 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ēkē manyantē samānāgārē śūdrapatitau varjyau, na śamyāprāsāditi ॥10॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

śūdrā yāṁ tu prēkṣaṇapratiprēkṣaṇayōrēvānadhyāyaḥ 11
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

11. But if (a student and) a Śūdra woman merely look at each other, the recitation of the Veda must be interrupted,
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
śūdrāyāṁ tu prēkṣaṇapratiprēkṣaṇayōrēvā'nadhyāyaḥ ॥ 11 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
śūdrāyāṁ tu yadā parasparaṁ prēkṣaṇaṁ bhavati tadaivā'nadhyāyaḥ । na samānāgārē, nāpi śamyāprāsāditi ॥ 11 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

tathānyasyāṁ striyāṁ varṇavyatikrāntāyāṁ maithunē 12
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

12. Likewise, if (a student and) a woman, who has had connexion with a man of a lower caste, (look at each other).
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
tathā'nyasyāṁ striyāṁ varṇavyatikrāntāyāṁ maithunē ॥12॥  

**ṭīkā**  
śūdrāvyatiriktā'pi yā strī maithunē varṇavyatikrāntā nīcagāminī tasyāmapi prēkṣaṇapratiprēkṣaṇayōranadhyāyaḥ ॥ 12 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

brahmādhyēṣyamāṇō malavadvāsasēcchansaṁbhāṣituṁ brāhmaṇēna saṁbhāṣya tayā saṁbhāṣēta saṁbhāṣya tu brāhmaṇēnaiva saṁbhāṣyādhīyīta । ēvaṁ tasyāḥ prajāniḥśrēyasam 13
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

13. If he, who is about to study the Veda, wishes to talk to a woman during her courses, he shall first speak to a Brāhmaṇa and then to her, then again speak to a Brāhmaṇa, and afterwards study. Thereby the children (of that woman) will be blessed. [#8] 

[#8]:  The last part of the Sūtra may also be interpreted: 'Thus she will be blessed with children.'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
brahmādhyēṣyamāṇō malavadvāsasēcchan sambhāṣituṁ brāhmaṇēna sambhādhya tathā sambhāṣēta । sambhāṣya tubrāhmaṇēnaiva sambhāṣyā'dhīyīta । ēvaṁ tasyāḥ prajāniḥśrēyasam ॥13॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yō vēdamadhyēṣyamāṇō malavadvāsasā rajasvalayā saha sambhāṣitumicchati sa pūrvaṁ brāhmaṇēna sambhāṣya paścāttayā sambhāṣēta । sambhāṣya ca punarapi brāhmaṇēnaiva sambhāṣyā'dhīyīta । kimēvaṁ sati bhavati ? ēvaṁ tasyā malavadvāsasa āgāminī yā prajā tasyā niḥśrēyasamabhyudayō bhavati । prajārūpaṁ vā niḥśrēyasaṁ tasyā bhavati । 'prajāniḥśrēyasamiti vacanāt vidhavādibhiḥ saha sambhāṣaṇē naitatkartavyam ॥ 13 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

antaḥśavam 14
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

14. (He shall not study in a village) in which a corpse lies; [#9] 

[#9]:  Manu IV, 108; Yājñ. I, 148.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
[#1] antaśśavam ॥ 14 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
antaśśavō yatra grāmē tatra nādhyēyam । ētēnā'ntaścāṇḍāla'miti vyākhyātam ॥ 14॥  

[#1]: manu, 4. 108 tatra draṣṭavyaḥ ।
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

antaścāṇḍālam 15
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

15. Nor in such a one where Kāndālas live.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
antaścāṇḍālam ॥ 15 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
caṇḍāla ēva cāṇḍālaḥ । ubhayatra prathamā saptamyarthē । avyayībhāvō vā vibhakttyarthē draṣṭavyaḥ ॥15॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>
