abhinirhr̥tānāṁ tu sīmnyanadhyāyaḥ 16
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

16. He shall not study whilst corpses are being carried to the boundary of the village,
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
[#2]abhinissr̥tānāṁ tu sīmnyanadhyāyaḥ ॥ 16 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yadā śavāḥ sīmni abhinissr̥tā bhavanti tadā tatrā'nadhyāyaḥ ॥ 16 ॥  

[#2]: ābhinirhr̥tānāṁ iti. kha. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

saṁdarśanē cāraṇyē 17
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

17. Nor in a forest, if (a corpse or Cāṇḍāla) is within sight.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
sandarśanē cā'raṇyē ॥ 17 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
araṇyē ca yāvati pradēśē śavaścaṇḍālō vā sandr̥śyatē tāvatyanadhyāyaḥ ॥ 17॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

tadaharāgatēṣu ca grāmaṁ bāhyēṣu 18
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

18. And if outcasts have entered the village, he shall not study on that day, [#10] 

[#10]:  Haradatta explains Bāhya, 'outcasts,' by 'robbers, such as Ugras and Niṣādas.' But, I think, it means simply such outcasts as live in the forest or outside the village in the Vādī, like the Dhers, Mahārs, Māngs of the present day. Most of these tribes however, are or were given to thieving. See Kullūka on Manu X, 2 9, and the Petersburg Dict. s. v.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
tadaharāgatēṣu ca grāmaṁ bāhyēṣu ॥ 18 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
bāhyāḥ upaniṣādādayaḥ paripanthinaḥ tēṣu ca grāmamāgatēṣu tadaharanadhyāyaḥ tasminnahani nā'dhyētavyam ॥ 18॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

api satsu 19
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

19. Nor if good men (have come). [#11] 

[#11]:  Yājñ. I, 150.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**   
api satsu ॥ 19 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yē vidyācaritrādibhirmahāntaḥ santaḥ tēṣvapi grāmamāgatēṣu tadaharanadhyāyaḥ ॥ 19 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

saṁdhāvanustanitē rātrim 20
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

20. If it thunders in the evening, (he shall not study) during the night. [#12] 

[#12]:  Manu IV, 106; Yājñ. I, 145. This rule refers to the rainy season. (For thunder) at other (seasons) he orders below a longer (cessation).'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
sandhāvanustanitē rātrim ॥ 20 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
sandhiḥ sandhyā tasmin sandhau । anustanitē mēghagarjitē sati rātriṁ [#1]sarvāṁ rātriṁ nā'dhīyīta। varṣatāvidam । anyasminnadhikaṁ vakṣyati ॥20॥  

[#1]: asya sūtratvēna parigaṇanaṁ kr̥taṁ ka pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

svapnaparyāntaṁ vidyuti 21
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

21. If lightning is seen (in the evening, he shall not study during that night), until he has slept.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
svapnaparyāntaṁ vidyuti ॥ 21 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
antyō dīrgha upāntyō hrasvaḥ । viparyāsaśchāndasō'papāṭhō vā । sandhau vidyuti satyāṁ svapnaparyantāṁ rātrimanadhyāyaḥ na sarvām । svapnaparyantā rātriḥ praharāvaśiṣṭā ॥ 21 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

upavyuṣaṁ  
yāvatā vā kr̥ṣṇāṁ rōhiṇīm iti,  
śamyā-prāsād vijānīyād  
- ētasmin kālē vidyōta-mānē sapradōṣam aharanadhyāyaḥ 22
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

22. If lightning is seen about the break of dawn, or at the time when he may distinguish at the distance of a Samyā-throw, whether (a cow) is black or red, be shall not study during that day, nor in the following evening.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
upavyuṣaṁ yāvatā vā kr̥ṣṇāṁ rōhiṇīmiti śamyāprāsādvijānīyādētasminkālē vidyōtamānē sapradōṣamaharanadhyāyaḥ ॥ 22 ॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
ēvaṁ sāyaṁ sandhyāyāmuktaṁ, prātassandhyāyāmāha —

**ṭīkā**  
upavyuṣaṁ uṣassamīpē tatra vidyōtamānē vidyuti satyāmaparēdyussapradōṣamaharanadhyāyaḥ । pradōṣādūrdhvaṁ rātrāvadhyayanam । yāvatā vā kālēna śamyāprāsādarvāgavasthitāṁ gāṁ kr̥ṣṇāmiti vā rōhiṇīmiti vā vijānīyāt । ētasminkālē upavyuṣaṁ vidyōtamāna ityanvayaḥ । rōhiṇī gauravarṇā । itiśabdaprayōgē dvitāyā prayujyatē । tatrā'nvayaprakāraścintyaḥ ॥ 22॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

dahrē+++(=apararātrē tr̥tīyō bhāgaḥ)+++ 'pararātrē+++(=rātrēs tr̥tīyō bhāgaḥ)+++ stanayitnunā 23
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

24. If it thunders in the second part of the third watch of the night, (he shall not study during the following day or evening).
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
dahrē'pararātrē stanayitnunā ॥ 23 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
rātrēs tr̥tīyō bhāgaḥ sarvō 'pararātraḥ। tasya trēdhā vibhaktasyādyōṁ'śō mahārātraḥ। antyō dahraḥ । tasmin dahrē'pararātrē stanayitnunā nimittēna sapradōṣamaharanadhyāyaḥ ॥ 23 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ūrdhvamardharātrādityēkē 24
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

24. Some (declare, that this rule holds good, if it thunders), after the first half of the night has passed.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ūrdhvamardharātrādityēkē ॥ 24 ॥  

**ṭīkā**

### 10 anadhyāyāḥ

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

cāturmāsīṣu ca 1

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

1. (Nor shall he study) on the days of the full moons of those months in which the Kāturmasya-sacrifice may be performed (nor on the days preceding them). [#1] 

[#1]:  10. The three full-moon days are Phālgunī (February-March), Āṣādhī (June-July), Kārttikī (October-November).
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
cāturmāsīṣu ca ॥ 1 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
caturṣu māsēṣu bhavāścāturmāsya । saṁjñaiṣā tisr̥ṇāṁ paurṇamāsīnāṁ yāsu cāturmāsyāni kriyantē । kāḥ punastāḥ? phālgunyāṣāḍhīkārtikyaḥ। cāturmāsyō yaśaḥ। tatra bhava'iti vartamānē 'saṁjñāyāmaṇi'tyaṇpratyayaḥ । tāsu cāturmāsīṣu pūrvavadvāvahōrātrāvanadhyāyaḥ । gautamastu svaśabdēnāha[#2] 'kārtikē phālgunyāṣāḍhī paurṇamāsī'ti । [#3]paurṇamāsyanantarapratipatsu ca śāstrāntaravaśādanadhyāyaḥ । yathā hōśanāḥ-'parvaṇītihāsarjitānāṁ vidyānāmanadhyāya' iti । 'pratipatsu na cintayē'diti ca । ēvaṁ caturdaśīmātrasya varjanē śāstrāntaraṁ[#4] mūlaṁ mr̥gyam । tatra yājñavalkyaḥ —  
[#5] 'pañcadaśyāṁ caturdaśyāmaṣṭamyāṁ rāhusūtakē।' iti ॥1॥  

[#2]: gau0 dha0 16. 32.  

[#3]: paurṇamāsyantarē pratipattsu ca iti, kha. pu.  

[#4]: mūlam' iti. nāsti ka. pustakē । mr̥gyamiti nāsti kha. pustakē   

[#5]: yā0 smr̥0 1.146. r̥tusandhiṣu bhuktvā ca śrāddhikaṁ pratigr̥hya ca ityadhikaḥ pāṭhaḥ kha. pustakē ।
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

vairamaṇē+++(=utsarjanē)+++ +++(mr̥tēṣu)+++ guruṣv aṣṭākya aupākaraṇa iti tryahāḥ 2
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

2. At the time of the Vedotsarga, on the death of Gurus, at the Ashlakā-Śrāddha, and at the time of the Upākarma, (he shall not study) for three days; [#2] 

[#2]:  The construction is very irregular, the first noun standing in the nominative and the rest in the locative. A similar irregularity occurs below, I, 3, 11, 3 1. The Vedotsarga is the ceremony. which is performed at the end of the Brahmanic term, in January. 'In the case of the death of a Guru, the vacation begins with the day on which the death occurs. On the other occasions mentioned he shall not study on the day preceding (the ceremony), on the day (of the ceremony), nor on the day following it.'--Haradatta. Manu IV, 119; Yājñ. I, 144. 'The Gurus' intended here, are fathers-in-law, uncles, &c.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
vairamaṇē guruṣvaṣṭākya aupākaraṇa iti tryahāḥ ॥ 2 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
viramaṇamutsarjanaṁ tadēva vairamaṇam । tasmin vairamaṇē । prathamāntapāṭhē saptamyarthē prathamā । guruṣu śvaśurādiṣu । saṁsthitēṣviti prakaraṇādgamyatē। aṣṭakaivā'ṣṭākyaṁ svārthikaḥ ṣyañ । ādau prāptā vr̥ddhirmadhyē kr̥tā । upākaraṇamēvaupākaraṇam । ētēṣu nimittēṣu tryahā adhyayanarahitāḥ । tatra guruṣu maraṇadinamārabhya tryahāḥ । itarēṣu pūrvēdyurapēdyustasmiṁśca dinē nādhīyīta। atra gautamaḥ-[#1]tisrō'ṣṭakāstrirātramantyāmēkē'bhitō vārṣika'miti । upākaraṇādūrdhvaṁ prāgutsarjanāt yadadhyayanaṁ tadvārṣikam । tadabhitastasyādāvantē ca yatkarma kriyatē tatrāpi trirātramityarthaḥ। auśanasē ca vyaktamuktama[#2] 'upākarmaṇi cōtsargē tryahamanadhyāya' iti । mānavē ca vyaktam[#3] upākarmaṇi cōtsargē trirātra kṣapaṇaṁ smr̥tam ।' iti ॥2 ॥  

[#1]: gau0 16. 38-40.  

[#2]: nēdaṁ vacanamidānīmupalabhyamānāyāṁ padyātmikāmauśanasasmr̥tau dr̥śyatē ।  

[#3]: manu0 4, 119.
</details>
</details>

tathā saṁbandhēṣu jñātiṣu +++(mr̥tēṣu tryaham anadhyāya iti brahmacāriniyamaḥ। itarēṣām āśaucavatāṁ tu yāvad āśaucamanadhyāyaḥ)+++3
</details>

iti । [#4]**ubhayatra** jananē maraṇē ca ॥3॥

apara āha- anubhāvina udakārhāḥ । tēṣāṁ maraṇē parivāpanamiti ॥6॥

gurusannidhau "cādhīhi bhō" ityuktvā'dhīyīta ॥ 15 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
dhāraṇādhyayanaṁ pārāyaṇādhyayanaṁ vā kurvan gurau sannihinē sati 'adhīhi bhō' ityuktvā'dhīyīta ॥ 15॥*
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

adhyāpayēd vā 16
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

(See previous sUtra.)
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
adhyāpayēdvā ॥ 16 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
adhyāpayannapi tatsannidhāvēvamēvōktvā'dhyāpayēt ॥ 16 ॥*
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ubhayata upasaṁgrahaṇam adhijigāṁsamānasyādhītya ca 17+++(5)+++
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

17. When a student desires to study or has finished his lesson, he shall at both occasions embrace the feet of his teacher. [#11] 

[#11]:  Manu II, 73.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ubhayata upasaṁgrahaṇamadhijigāṁsamānasyādhītya ca ॥17॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ubhayataḥ adhyayanasyā''dāvantē ca upasaṁgrahaṇa kartavyaṁ yathākrama[#1]madhyē tu kāmasyā''dāvadhītyāntē ॥ 17 ॥*  

[#1]: adhyētukāmasyētyādi ḍa pustaka ēvāsti ।  

*manau. 2. 73 ślōkō draṣṭavyaḥ ।
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

adhīyānēṣu vā yatrānyō vyavēyād +++(=madhyē gacchēt)+++, ētam ēva śabdam +++(=adhīhi bhōḥ)+++ utsr̥jyādhīyīta 18
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

18. Or if, whilst they study, another person comes in, he shall continue his recitation, after those words, ('Ho, study!') have been pronounced (by the newcomer). [#12] 

[#12]:  Haradatta states rightly, that the plural ('they study') is useless. According to him, the use of the verb in the singular may be excused thereby, that the advice is addressed to each of the persons engaged in study. Manu IV, 122.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
adhīyānēṣu vā yatrā'nyō vyavēyādētamēva śabdamutsr̥jyā'dhīyīta ॥ 18 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
bahuvacanamatantram । adhīyānēṣu ca yatrā'nyō vyavēyādantarā gacchēt, tatrā'pyadhīhi bhō' ityētamēva śabdamutsr̥jya uccāryā'dhīyīta । pratyēkamupadēśādēkavacanam । arthāyīran ॥ 18 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

+++(bahu-)+++śva-gardabha-nādāḥ salāvr̥ky-ēkasr̥ka+++(=śr̥gāla)++++ulūka-śabdāḥ  
sarvē vāditra-śabdā  
rōdana-gīta-sāmaśabdāś ca 19
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

19. The barking of (many) dogs, the braying of (many) asses, the cry of a wolf or of a solitary jackal or of an owl, all sounds of musical instruments, of weeping, and of the Sāman melodies (are reasons for discontinuing the study of the Veda). [#13] 

[#13]:  The ekasṛka, 'solitary jackal,' is now called Bālu or Pheough, and is considered to be the constant companion of a tiger or panther. Its unharmonious cry is, in the present day also, considered to be an evil omen. Yājñ. I, 148; Manu IV, 108, 115 and 123.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
śvagardabhanādāssalāvr̥kyēkasr̥kōlūkaśabdāssarvē vāditaśabdā rōdanagītasāmaśabdāśca ॥19॥  

**ṭīkā**  
**śunāṁ gardabhānāṁ** ca bahūnāṁ nādaḥ । bahuvacananirdēśāt ।  

**salāvr̥kī** vr̥kajātāv avāntarabhēdaḥ । krōṣṭrītyanyē । liṅgasyāvivakṣitatvāt puṁsō'pi grahaṇam । [#1] 'indrō yatīn sālāvr̥kēbhya' ityādau darśanāt । sarvatrādisvarō dīrghaḥ । sa ēvāyaṁ vikr̥taḥ prayuktaḥ । 

**ēkasr̥kaḥ** ēkacaraḥ sr̥gālaḥ । ulūkō divābhītaḥ। ētēṣāṁ ca śabdāḥ । vāditāni vāditrāṇi vīṇāvēṇu mr̥daṅgādīni । tēṣāṁ ca sarvē śabdāḥ । rōdanaśabdādayaśca । ētē śrūyamāṇā [#2]anadhyāyasya hētavaḥ ॥ 19 ॥

[#1]: tai0 saṁ0 6. 2. 7.   

[#2]: yā0 smr̥tau 1. 148-151. ślōkāḥ draṣṭavyāḥ ।
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

śākhāntarē +++(śrūyamāṇē)+++ ca sāmnām anadhyāyaḥ 20
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

20. If another branch of the Veda (is being recited in the neighbourhood), the Sāman melodies shall not be studied.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
śākhāntarē ca sāmnāmanadhyāyaḥ ॥ 20 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
vēdāntarasakāśē[#3] sāmnāmanadhyayanam । gītiṣu sāmākhyā, tadyōgādvēdavacana ityanyē ॥20॥   

[#3]: sāma nā'dhyēyam । iti. kha. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

sarvēṣu ca śabdakarmasu +++(=ākrōśa-parivādādiṣu)+++ yatra +++(+adhyayana-śabdēna)+++ saṁsr̥jyēran 21
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

21. And whilst other noises (are being heard, the recitation of the Veda shall be discontinued), if they mix (with the voice of the person studying). [#14] 

[#14]:  Manu IV, 121.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
sarvēṣu ca śabdakarmasu yatra saṁsr̥jyēran ॥ 21 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ākrōśa[#4]parivādādiṣu sarvēṣu śabdakarmasu anadhyāyaḥ। yatrādhyayanaśabdēna tē sasr̥jyēran ॥ 21॥  

[#4]: parihāsādiṣu. iti. ka. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

chardayitvā +++(=vamitvā)+++ svapnāntam +++(nādhīyīta)+++। 22
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

22. After having vomited (he shall not study) until he has slept. [#15] 

[#15]:  Manu IV, 121.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
chardayitvā svapnāntam ॥ 22 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
chardanaṁ vamanam । tatkr̥tvā svapnāntaṁ yāvannā'dhīyīta ॥ 22 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

sarpirvā prāśya +++(adhīyīta)+++। 23
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

23. Or (he may study) having eaten clarified butter (after the attack of vomiting).
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
sarpirvā prāśya ॥ 23 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
atha vā sarpiḥ prāśyā'dhīyīta ॥ 23 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

pūtīgandhaḥ 24
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

24. A foul smell (is a reason for the discontinuance of study). [#16] 

[#16]:  Manu IV, 107; Yājñ. I, 150.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
pūtigandhaḥ ॥ 24 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
durgandha upalabhyamānō'nadhyāyahētuḥ ॥ 24 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

śuktaṁ +++(=pakvaṁ kālapākēnāmlaṁ jāta)+++ cātmasaṁyuktam +++(=udarastham)+++ 25
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

25. Food turned sour (by fermentation), which he has in his stomach, (is a reason for the discontinuance of the recitation, until the sour rising ceases). [#17] 

[#17]:  Manu IV, 121.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
śuktañcā''tmasaṁyuktam ॥ 25 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yatpakvaṁ kālapākēnā'mlaṁ jātaṁ tacchuktam । tadyāvadātmasaṁyuktaṁ svōdarasthamajīrṇaṁ, yāvattadanuguṇa udgārastāvadanadhyāyahētuḥ ॥ 25 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

pradōṣē ca bhuktvā 26
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

26. (Nor shall he study) after having eaten in the evening, [#18] 

[#18]:  'Therefore he shall sup, after having finished his study.'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
pradōṣē ca bhuktvā nā'dhīyīta ॥ 26 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
tēnā'dhītyaiva bhuñjīta ॥ 26 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

prōdakayōśca +++(= bhuktvārdrayōḥ)+++ pāṇyōḥ 27
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

27. Nor as long as his hands are wet. [#19] 

[#19]:  Manu IV, 121; Yājñ. I, 149.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
prōdakayōśca pāṇyōḥ ॥ 27 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
bhuktvētyēva । bhuktvā yāvatprōdakau pāṇī ādrau tāvannā'dhīyīta । kēcit bhuktvēti nānuvartayanti ॥ 27 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

prētasaṁkl̥ptaṁ cānnaṁ bhuktvā sapradōṣamaharanadhyāyaḥ 28
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

28. (And he shall discontinue studying) for, a day and an evening, after having eaten food prepared in honour of a dead person (for whom the Sapiṇḍī-karaṇa has not yet been performed), [#20] 

[#20]:  Manu IV, 112; Yājñ. I, 146.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
prētasaṁkl̥ptaṁ cānnaṁ bhuktvā sapradōṣamaharanadhyāyaḥ ॥ 28 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yō mr̥tō'sapiṇḍīkr̥tassa prētaḥ । taduddēśēna dattamannaṁ bhuktvā sapradōṣamaharnā'dhīyīta । pradōṣādūrdhvaṁ na dōṣaḥ । atra manuḥ —  
[#1]yāvadēkānudiṣṭasya gandhō lēpaśca tiṣṭhati ।   viprasya viduṣō dēhē tāvadbrahma na kīrtayēt ॥' iti ॥ 28 ॥  

[#1]: manu0smr̥0 4. 111.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ā ca vipākāt 29
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

29. Or until the food (eaten on that occasion) is digested. [#21] 

[#21]:  If that food has not been digested by the end of that time (i.e. in the evening), he shall not study until it has been digested.'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ā ca vipākāt ॥ 29 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yadi tāvatā kālēna tadannaṁ pakkaṁ jīrṇa na bhavati, tata āvipākāt tasya nā'dhīyīta ॥ 29 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

aśrāddhēna tu paryavadadhyāt 30
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

30. But he shall (always) eat in addition (to the meal given in honour of a dead person), food which has not been given at a sacrifice to the Manes. [#22] 

[#22]:  'Because in this Sūtra the expression "food not given at a Śrāddha" occurs, some think that the preceding Sūtra refers to "food eaten at a Śrāddha."'--Haradatta. This explanation is not at all improbable.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
aśrāddhēna tu paryavadadhyāt ॥ 30 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
jīrṇē ajīrṇē ca tasmin aśrāddhēnā'nnēna paryavadadhyāt tasyōparyaśrāddhamannaṁ bhuñjītētyuktaṁ bhavati । kēcit atra 'aśrāddhēnē'ti vacanāt pūrvatrāpi prētānnamiti śrāddhamātraṁ vivakṣitaṁ manyantē ॥ 30 ॥  

॥ ityāpastambadharmasūtrē tadvr̥ttāvujvalāyā ca daśamī kaṇḍikā ॥
</details>
</details>

### 11 anadhyāyāḥ

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

{anadhyayanam} kāṇḍōpākaraṇē cāmātr̥kasya 1
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

1. (The recitation of the Veda shall be interrupted for a day and evening if he has eaten), on beginning a fresh Kāṇḍa (of his Veda), food given by a motherless person, [#1] 

[#1]:  11. The Black Yajur-veda, to which Āpastamba belongs, is divided throughout into books called Kāṇḍas.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
kāṇḍōpākaraṇē cā''mātr̥kasya ॥1॥  

**ṭīkā**  
kāṇḍōpākaraṇaṁ kāṇḍavratādēśanam । tasminnahani amātr̥kasyānnaṁ bhuktvā sapradōṣamaharanadhyāyaḥ। apara āha-bhuktvēti nā'nuvartatē । yathācōttaratra bhuktvā grahaṇam । kāṇḍōpākaraṇē amātr̥kasya māṇavakasya sapradōṣamaharanadhyāyaḥ। ētēnōttaraṁ vyākhyātam ॥ 1॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

kāṇḍasamāpanē cāpitr̥kasya 2
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

2. And also if he has eaten, on the day of the completion of a Kāṇḍa, food given by a fatherless person.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
kāṇḍasamāpanē cā'pitr̥katya ॥2॥  

**ṭīkā**  
kāṇḍasamāpanaṁ vratavisargaḥ ॥2॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

manuṣyaprakr̥tīnāṁ ca dēvānāṁ yajñē bhuktvētyēkē 3
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

3. Some declare, that (the recitation shall be interrupted for the same space of time), if he has eaten at a sacrifice offered in honour of gods who were formerly men. [#2] 

[#2]:  Haradatta names as such gods, Nandīsvara and Kubera. Other commentators, however, explain Manuṣyaprakriti by Manuṣyamukha, 'possessing human faces.' A similar rule occurs Gautama XVI, 34, Where a Manuṣyayagña is mentioned as a cause for discontinuing the recitation of the Veda. In his Commentary on Gautama, also, Haradatta is in doubt. He first refers the term to the sacraments like the Sīmantonnayana, and then adds, that some explain it to mean 'a sacrifice to gods who formerly were men.'
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
manuṣyaprakr̥tīnāṁ ca dēvānāṁ yajñē bhuktvatyēkē ॥3॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yē manuṣyā bhūtvā prakr̥ṣṭēna tapasā dēvāssampannāstē manuṣyaprakr̥tayō [#2]nandikubērādayaḥ । tēṣāṁ yajñaḥ tatprītyarthaṁ brāhmaṇabhōjanam, tatra bhuktvā sapradōṣamaharanadhyāya ityēkē manyantē । manubhyamukhēna dēvēṣvijyamānēṣvityanyē ॥3॥  

[#2]: 'nandīśvaraśarakumārādayaḥ' iti pāṭhāntaram ।
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

paryuṣitaistaṇḍulairāmamāṁsēna ca nānadhyāyāḥ 4
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

4. Nor is the recitation interrupted, if he has eaten rice received the day before, or raw meat (though these things may have been offered in honour of the dead), [#3] 

[#3]:  This Sūtra is an exception to I, 3, 10, 28.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
paryuṣitaistaṇḍulairāmamāṁsēna ca nā'nadhyāyaḥ ॥ 4 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
'prētasaṁklr̥ptaṁ cā'nna'(10.28)mityasyāpavādaḥ। paryuṣitā rātryantaritāḥ hyaḥ pratigr̥hītāḥ, tēṣu taṇḍulēṣvadya paktvā bhujyamānēṣu nānadhyāyaḥ। tathā āmamāṁsēna tadaharbhakṣitēnāpi nānadhyāyaḥ। paryuṣitēnētyēkē । 'paryuṣitai'riti vacanāttadaharbhakṣitaiḥ sapradōṣamaharanadhyāyaḥ ॥ 4॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

tathauṣadhivanaspatimūlaphalaiḥ 5
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

5. Nor (if he has eaten at a funeral dinner) roots or fruits of herbs and trees.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
tathauṣadhivanaspatimūlaphalaiḥ॥5॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ōṣadhigrahaṇēna vīrudhō'pi gr̥hyantē । vanaspatigrahaṇēna vr̥kṣamātram । tēṣāṁ mūlaiḥ sūraṇakandādibhiḥ phalaiścā'mrādibhiḥ pakvairapakvaiśca tadahakṣitairapi nā'nadhyāyaḥ॥5॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yatkāṇḍamupākurvīta yasya cānuvākyaṁ kurvīta na tattadaharadhīyīta 6
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

6. When he performs the ceremony for beginning of a Kāṇḍa, or when he studies the index of the Anuvākas [#4]  of a (Kāṇḍa), he shall not study that (Kāṇḍa) on that day (nor in that night).

[#4]:  Haradatta's commentary on this Sūtra is very meagre, and he leaves the word anuvākyam unexplained. I am not certain that my explanation is correct. But it is countenanced by the statements of the Gṛhya-sutras regarding the order of studying. Weber, Ind. Stud. X, 132.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yatkāṇḍamupākurvīta yasya cānuvākyaṁ kurvīta na tattadaharadhīyīta ॥6॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yasminnahani yatkāṇḍamupākr̥taṁ na tattadaharadhīyīta ।  
tathā śrāvaṇyāṁ paurṇamāsyām upākr̥tya  
praśastē 'har-antarē yasya kāṇḍasyānuvākyam adhyētum ārambhaṁ kurvīta  
na tat-tad-ahar adhīyīta ।  
ahar ity ahōrātrōpalakṣaṇam ॥6॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

upākaraṇasamāpanayōśca pārāyaṇasya tāṁ vidyām 7
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

7. And if he performs the ceremonies prescribed on beginning or ending the recitation of one entire Veda, he shall not study that Veda (during that day). [#5] 

[#5]:  Yājñ. I, 145. This Sūtra is a Jñāpaka or 'such a one which indicates the existence of a rule not expressly mentioned! Above (I, 3, 9, 1) the yearly -performance of the Upākarma and Utsarga ceremonies for the beginning and end of the Brahmanic term has been prescribed. In this Sūtra the performance of the Upakarma and Utsarga at the beginning and completion of the Pārāyana or the vow to go through a whole Veda is incidentally mentioned. Thence it may be inferred that these ceremonies must. be likewise performed on the latter occasions, though no absolute rule to this effect has been given. Such Jñāpakas are of frequent occurrence in all Sūtras, and constitute one of the chief difficulties of their interpretation.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
upākaraṇasamāpanayōśca pārāyaṇasya tāṁ vidyām ॥ 7॥  

**ṭīkā**  
anēkavēdādhyāyī yadyēkasya vēdasya pārāyaṇaṁ kurutē tadā tasya pārāyaṇasya [#1]yē upākaraṇōtsarjanē, tayōḥ kr̥tayōstāṁ vidyāṁ tadahar nā'dhīyīta । ētadēva jñāpakaṁ pārāyaṇasyā'pyupākaraṇōtsarjanē bhavata iti । 'tāṁ vidyāmi'ti vacanādvidyāntarādhyayanē na dōṣaḥ ॥ 7॥  

[#1]: upākaraṇōtsarjanayōḥ kr̥tayōḥ, iti ḍa. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

vāyurghōṣavānbhūmau vā tr̥ṇa saṁvāhō varṣati vā yatra dhārāḥ pravahēt 8
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

8. If the wind roars, or if it whirls up the grass on the ground, or if it drives the rain-drops forward during a rain-shower, (then the recitation shall be interrupted for so long a time as the storm lasts). [#6] 

[#6]:  Yājñ. I, 149; Manu IV, 102, 122.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
vāyurghōṣavān bhūmau tr̥ṇasaṁvāhō varṣati vā yatra dhārāḥ pravahēt ॥ 8॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ghōṣavān karṇaśravaḥ । bhūmāvavasthitāni tr̥ṇāni saṁvāhayati utkṣipya gamayatīti tr̥ṇasaṁvāhaḥ । varṣati vā [#2]mēghē dhārāḥ pravahēt vikṣipēt । yatra dēśē ēvaṁvidhō vāyustatra tāvantaṁ kālaṁ nā'dhīyīta । atra manuḥ —  
[#3]"karṇaśravē'nilē rātrau divā pāṁsusamūhanē" ॥ iti ॥ 8॥   

[#2]: dēvēḥ iti ka. pu. 3. ma0 smr̥0 2. 102  

[#3]: ma0smr̥0 2.102.
</details>
</details>

[#1]: idaṁ 11śaṁ ca sūtraṁ tridhā vicchinnaṁ ḍa. pu.

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

avihitamanuvākādhyayanamāṣāḍhavāsantikayōḥ +++(=vasantōtsavaḥ)+++ 20
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

20. During the spring festival and the festival (of Indra), in the month of Āṣāḍha (June-July), the study of an Anuvāka is forbidden. [#10] 

[#10]:  According to Haradatta, Āpastamba uses the word Anuvāka in order to indicate that smaller portions of the Veda may be studied. Others think, that by Anuvāka, the Saṃhitā and the Brāhmaṇa are meant, and that the study of the Aṅgas is permitted. The Vasantotsava, or spring festival, which, according to the Dramas, was, in olden times, kept all over India, falls, according to Haradatta, on the thirteenth of the first half of Caitra, about the beginning of April.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
avihitamanuvākādhyayanamāṣāḍhavāsantikayōḥ ॥16॥  

**ṭīkā**  
vāsantikō vasantōtsavaḥ । sa ca caitramāsi śuklatrayōdaśyāṁ bhavati । āṣāḍhaśabdēnāpi tasminmāsē kriyamāṇastādr̥śaḥ kaścidindrōtsavādirvivakṣitaḥ। tayōstadaharanuvākādhyayanamavihitam । anuvākagrahaṇānnyūnē na dōṣaḥ।  
apara āha- anuvākagrahaṇānmantrabrāhmaṇayōrēva pratiṣēdhaḥ, nāṅgānāmiti ॥ 16 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

nityapraśnasya cāvidhinā 21
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

21. (The recitation) of the daily portion of the Veda (at the Brahmayajña is likewise forbidden if done) in a manner differing from the rule (of the Veda). [#11] 

[#11]:  'Hence, if one has forgotten it and eaten one's breakfast, a penance, not the Brahmayajña, must be performed'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
nityapraśnasya cā'vidhinā ॥ 17 ॥

**ṭīkā**  
nityaṁ praśnādhyayanaṁ yatra sa nityapraśnō brahmayajñaḥ। tasya cāvidhinā vakṣyamāṇēna prakārēṇa vinā'nuvākādhyayanamavihitam । yadyapi nityaṁ brahma yajñādhyayanaṁ tathāpi kēnacidapyaṅgēna vinā na kartavyam । tēna vismr̥tya prātarāśē kr̥tē prāyaścittamēva na brahmayajñaḥ। manuḥ—   
'snātakavratalōpē ca prāyaścittamabhōjanam । iti ॥ 17 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

tasya vidhiḥ 22
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

22. (Now follows) the rule (for the daily recitation) of that (Brahmayajña).
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
tasya vidhiḥ ॥ 18॥  

**ṭīkā**  
tasya nityapraśnasya vidhirvakṣyatē ॥ 18 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

akr̥taprātarāśa udakāntaṁ gatvā prayataḥ śucau dēśē'dhīyīta yathādhyāyam utsr̥jan vācā 23
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

23. Before taking his morning-meal, he shall go to the water-side, and having purified himself, he shall recite aloud (a portion of the Veda) in a pure [#12]  place, leaving out according to (the order of the) texts (what he has read the day before).

[#12]:  See Taittirīya Āraṇyaka II, 11, 1 and 11; Āśv. Gṛ. Sū. III, 2, 1-2. In our days this rule is usually not observed. Brāhmaṇas mostly recite at the daily Brahmayajña, 'Veda-offering,' one particular formula, which symbolically comprises the whole Veda. A few learned Brāhmaṇa friends, however, have assured me, that they still recite the whole of their Śākhā every year according to this rule of Āpastamba.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
akr̥taprātarāśa udakāntaṁ gatvā prayataḥ śucau dēśē'dhīyīta yathādhyāyamutsr̥janvācā ॥ 29 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
akr̥tadivābhōjana udakasamīpaṁ gatvā prayataḥ snānamārjanādiśuddhaḥ śucau dēśē prācyāmudīcyāṁ vā diśyacchadirdarśē'dhīyīta । yathādhyāyaṁ yathā pāmanuṣaṅgarahitamutsr̥jan ādita ārabhya prathamādiṣvahassu[#1] adhīyīta dvitīyādiṣūtsr̥jya tataḥ paramadhīyīta । vācā uccairityarthaḥ ॥ 19 ॥  

[#1]: adhītaṁ yat tat iti ḍa. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

manasā cānadhyāyē 24
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

24. If a stoppage of study is enjoined (for the day, he shall recite the daily portion) mentally.
</details>

**sūtram**

**ṭīkā**

</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

vidyuti cābhyagrāyāṁ stanayitnāv aprāyatyē prētānnē nīhārē ca mānasaṁ paricakṣatē 25
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

25. If lightning flashes without interruption, or, thunder rolls continually, if a man has neglected to purify himself, if he has partaken of a meal in honour of a dead person, or if hoarfrost lies on the ground, (in these cases) they forbid the mental recitation (of the daily portion of the Veda). [#13] 

[#13]:  Yājñ. I, 149; Manu IV, 106, 120, 127; Taitt. Ār. II, 15, 1.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**

**ṭīkā**  
vidyuti abhyagrāyāmaviratāyām । stanayitnau cā'bhyagrē । aprāyatyē ātmanō'śucibhāvē । prētānnē ca bhuktē । nīhārē ca nīhārō himānī tasmiṁśca vartamānē । mānasamanantarōktamadhyayanaṁ paricakṣatē varjayanti ॥ 21 ॥
</details>
</details>

śrāddhabhōjana ēvaikē 26
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

26. Some forbid it only in case one has eaten a funeral dinner. [#14] 

[#14]:  Manu IV, 109, 116.

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
śrāddhabhōjana ēvaikē ॥ 22 ॥

</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

vidyutstanayitnurvr̥ṣṭiścāpartau yatra saṁnipatēyustastryahamanadhyāyaḥ 27
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

27. Where lightning, thunder, and rain happen together out of season, the recitation shall be interrupted for three days. [#15] 

[#15]:  Manu IV, 103 and 104.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
vidyutstanayitnurvr̥ṣṭiścāpartau[#2] yatra sannipatēyustryahamanadhyāyaḥ ॥ 23 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
apartau yasmin dēśē yō varṣākālaḥ tatō'nyastatrāpartuḥ । tatra yadi vidyudādayassannipatēyuḥ samuditāssyuḥ tadā tryahamanadhyāyaḥ ॥ 23 ॥  

[#2]: “yatra" iti nāsti ka. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yāvadbhūmirvyudakētyēkē 28
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

28. Some (declare, that the recitation shall stop) until the ground is dry.

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yāvadbhūmirvyudakētyēkē ॥ 24 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yāvatā kālēna bhūmiḥ vigatōdakā bhavati tāvantaṁ kālamanadhyāya ityēkē manyantē ॥24॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ēkēna dvābhyāṁ vaitēṣāmākālam 29
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

29. If one or two (of the phenomena mentioned in Sūtra 27 appear, the recitation shall be interrupted) from that hour until the same hour next day.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ēkēna dvābhyāṁ vaitēṣāmākālam ॥ 25 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ētēṣāṁ vidyudādīnāṁ madhyē ēkēna dvābhyāṁ vā yōgē ākālamanadhyāyaḥ । aparēdyurā tasya kālasya prāptarityarthaḥ ॥ 25 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

sūryācandramasōrgrahaṇē bhūmicalē'pasvāna ulkāyāmagnyutpātē ca sarvāsāṁ vidyānāṁ sārvakālikamākālam 30
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

30. In the case of an eclipse of the sun or of the moon, of an earthquake, of a whirlwind, of the fall of a meteor, or of a fire (in the village), at whatever time these events happen, the recitation of all the sacred sciences (Vedas and Aṅgas) must be interrupted from that hour until the same hour next day. [#16] 

[#16]:  Yājñ. I, 145; Manu IV, 105, 118.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
sūryācandramasōrgrahaṇē bhūmicalē'pasvāna ulkāyāmagnyutpātē ca sarvāsāṁ vidyānāṁ sārvakālikamākālam ॥26॥  

**ṭīkā**  
'suryācandramasō'riti vacanaṁ br̥haspatyādinivr̥ttyartham । bhūmicalē bhūkampē । apasvānē nirghātē । ulkāyāmulkāpātē । agnyutpātē[#1] grāmādidāhē । ētēṣu nimittēṣu[#2] sarvēṣu sarvāsāṁ vidyānām—  
[#3]aṅgāni vēdāścatvārō mīmāṁsā nyāyavistaraḥ।  
purāṇaṁ dharmaśāstraṁ ca vidyā hyētāścaturdaśa ॥   ityuktānām ।  

sārvakālikamr̥tau cāpartau cā''kālamanadhyāyaḥ। atra 'sarvāsāmi'ti vacanādanyatra vēdānāmēva pratiṣēdhaḥ । aṅgānāmapītyanyē ॥ 26 ॥  

[#1]: gr̥hādidāhē iti ga. pu.  

[#2]: sarvēṣu iti nāsti.kha. ga. pu.  

[#3]:

    viṣṇu pu. aṅgāni śikṣāvyākaraṇachandōniruktajyautiṣaśrautrasūtrāṇi, catvārō vēdāḥ, r̥gādayaḥ prasiddhāḥ, mīmāṁsā pūrvamīmāṁsā, uttaramīmāṁsā ca, nyāyavistaraḥ gautama "praṇītamānvīkṣikyākhyaṁ nyāyaśāstram, vaiśēṣikaśāstraṁ ca, purāṇaṁ matsyādipurāṇāni, manvādipraṇītāni dharmaśāstrāṇi ca vidyāpadavācyānītyarthaḥ ।
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

abhraṁ cāpartau sūryācandra masōḥ parivēṣa indra dhanuḥ pratisūryamatsyaśca vātē pūtīgandhē nīhārē ca sarvēṣvētēṣu tāvantaṁ kālam 31
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

31. If a cloud appears out of season, if the sun or the moon is surrounded by a halo, if a rainbow, a parhelion or a comet appears, if a (high) wind (blows), [#17]  a foul smell (is observed), or hoarfrost (lies on the ground, at all these occasions (the recitation of all the sacred sciences must be interrupted) during the duration (of these phenomena).

[#17]:  Manu IV, 104, and see above.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
abhraṁ cāpartau sūryācandramasōḥ parivēṣa indradhanuḥ pratisūryamatsyaśca vātē pūtigandhē nīhārē ca sarvaṣvētēṣu tāvatkālam ॥27॥  

**ṭīkā**  
apartāvabhraṁ dr̥śyamānaṁ yāvat dr̥śyatē tāvatkālamanadhyāyaḥ । ēvaṁ parivēṣādivapi yōjyam । br̥haspatyādiparivaṣē na dōṣaḥ । indradhanuḥ prasiddham । sūryasamīpē tadākr̥tiḥ pratisūryaḥ । matsyaḥ pucchavannavām ।
samāhāradvandvē chāndasō liṅgavyatyayaḥ । sarvēṣvētēṣu vātādiṣu ca triṣu tāvatkālamanadhyāyaḥ । vātē ghōṣavati । pūtigandhē durgandhē । nīhārē himānyām । vātādigrahaṇaṁ pūrvōktānāṁ śvagardabhādīnāmupalakṣaṇārtham । punariha vacanaṁ tāvatkālamiti vidhātum । atraiva śvagardabhādigrahaṇē kartavyē pūrvatra pāṭhasya cintyaṁ prayōjanam ॥ 27 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

muhūrtaṁ viratē vātē 32
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

32. After the wind has ceased, (the interruption of the recitation continues) for one muhūrta. [#18] 

[#18]:  One muhūrta = 48 minutes.
</details>

salāvr̥kyāmēkasr̥ka iti svapnaparyāntam 33

salāvr̥kyāmēkasr̥ka iti svapnaparyantam ॥ 29 ॥

ananūktaṁ cāpartau chandasō nādhīyīta 35
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

35. Out of term he shall not study any part of the Veda which he has not learnt before.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ananūktaṁ cā'parttau chandasō nādhīyīta ॥ 31 ॥  
**ṭīkā**    
utsarjanādūrdhvamupākaraṇādarvāgapartuḥ । tatra chandasō'nanūktamaṁśamapūrvaṁ nā'dhīyīta । grahaṇādhyayanamapatauṁ na kartavyam । yadyapi[#2]taiṣyāṁ paurṇamāsyāṁ rōhiṇyāṁ vā viramē'dityuktama, tathāpi kiyantaṁ kālaṁ tadviraramaṇam ? kasmādvā'dhyayanam ? ityapēkṣāyāmidamucyatē-ētāvantaṁ kālaṁ grahaṇādhyayanaṁ na kartavyamiti । dhāraṇādhyayanē na dōṣaḥ। tathā 'chandasa' iti vacanādaṅgānāṁ grahaṇādhyayanē na dōṣaḥ ॥ 31॥  

[#2]: āpa0 dha0 1.9.2.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

{ananūktaṁ} pradōṣē ca 36
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

36. Nor (shall he study during term some new part of the Veda) in the evening. [#19] 

[#19]:  Other commentators interpret the Sūtra in a different sense. They take it to mean: 'And (luring the night (from the twelfth to the thirteenth of each half of the month, he shall not study at all, be it in or out of term).'
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
pradōṣē ca ॥32॥  
**ṭīkā**    
pradōṣē cā'nanūktamr̥tāmapi nādhīyīta । [#3] māsaṁ pradōṣē nādhīyītē'tyētattu dhāraṇādhyayanasyāpi pratiṣēdhārtham । apara āha-yasyāṁ rātrau dvādaśī trayōdaśī ca miśrībhavataḥ, tasyāṁ pradōṣē nādhīyātānūktamanūktaṁ ca, r̥tāvapartau ca । ēṣa ācāra iti ॥ 32 ॥  

[#3]: āpa0 dha0 1.9.1.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

sārvakālikamāmnātam +++(=adhītam)+++ {adhyētavyam} 37
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

37. That which has been studied before, must never be studied (during the vacation or in the evening). [#20] 

[#20]:  'What has been studied before, must not be studied (again) at any time in the vacation nor in the evening.'-- Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
sārvakālikamāmnātam ॥ 33 ॥  
**ṭīkā**    
āmnātamadhītaṁ tatsārvakālikamapau pradōṣē ca sarvasminkālē'dhyētavyam ॥ 33 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yathōktamanyadataḥ pariṣatsu 38
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

38. Further particulars (regarding the interruption [#21]  of the Veda-study may be learnt) from the (teaching and works of other) Vedic schools.

[#21]:  Haradatta thinks that by 'Pariṣad,' Manu's and other Dharma-śāstras are meant. This explanation is, however, not exact. Pariṣad, 'assemblage,' means, in the language of the Śāstras, either a Pañc, an assemblage of learned Brahmans called together to decide some knotty point of law, or a Brahminical school, which studies a particular redaction of the Veda (see the Petersburg Dict. s. v.) The latter meaning is that applicable to this Sūtra. By 'Pariṣadaḥ' are here intended the Vedic schools, and their writings and teaching. Gautama also says, XVI, 40. Prātividyaṃ yān smarantismaranti, '(he shall observe the stoppages of the Veda-study) which they teach in (the writings belonging to) each of the Vedas.'
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yathōktamanyadataḥ pariṣatsu ॥ 34 ॥

ata ētasmādanadhyāyaprakaraṇōktādanyadanadhyāyanimittam । pariṣatsu mānavādidharmaśāstrēṣu yathōktaṁ [#1]tathā draṣṭavyam । tatra vāsēṣṭhaḥ [#2] digdāhaparvataprapātēṣūpalarudhirapāṁsuvarṣēṣvākālika'miti ।
yamaḥ —
[#3] ślēṣmātakasya śalmalyā madhūkasya tathāpyadhaḥ ।  
kadācidapi nādhyēyaṁ kōvidārakapitthayōḥ॥   saṅgrāmōdyānadēvatāsamīpēṣu nādhīyītēti ॥ 34 ॥

   va. smr̥. 13 8. dignādaparvatanādakampaprapātēṣu, iti mudritapustakapāṭhaḥ । nimittaprādurbhāvādārabhyā'nyēdyuryāvat sa ēva kālaḥ sa ākālaḥ । tatra bhavamākālikam ।  

[#3]: mudritayamasmr̥tau br̥hadyamasmr̥tau vā nēdaṁ vacanamupalabhyatē ।  

॥ ityāpastambadharmasūtravr̥ttāvujvalāyāmēkādaśī kaṇḍikā ॥

iti cāpastambadharmasūtravr̥ttau haradattaviracitāyāmujjvalāyāṁ
prathamapraśnē tr̥tīyaḥ paṭalaḥ ॥ 3 ॥

## +04

### 12 pañca-mahā-yajñāḥ

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

tapaḥ svādhyāya iti brāhmaṇam 1
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

1. A Brāhmaṇa declares, 'The daily recitation (of the Veda) is austerity.' [#1] 

[#1]:  12. 'It procures as much reward as penance.'--Haradatta. Manu II, 166; Weber, Ind. Stud. X, 113. The phrase occurs frequently in the Brāhmaṇas, e.g. Taitt. Ār. II, 14, 3.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
tapaḥ svādhyāya iti brāhmaṇam ॥1॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yō'yaṁ nityasvādhyāyastattapaḥ kr̥cchrātikr̥cchracāndrāyaṇādilakṣaṇaṁ tapō yāvatphalaṁ sādhayati tāvatsādhayatītyarthaḥ ॥ 1॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

tatra śrūyatē । sa yadi tiṣṭhann āsīnaḥ śayānō vā svādhyāyamadhītē tapa ēva tattapyatē tapō hi svādhyāya iti 2
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

2. In the same (sacred text) it is also declared, Whether he recites the daily portion of the Veda standing, or sitting, or lying down, he performs austerity thereby; for the daily recitation is austerity.' [#2] 

[#2]:  Regarding the proper position at the 'Veda-offering,' or daily recitation, see above, I, 3, 11, 2 3, and Taitt. Ār. II, 11, 3. Passages similar to the first part of the sentence quoted in this Sūtra occur Taitt. Ār II, 12, 3, and 15, 3. It ought to be observed that the Taitt. Ār. in both places has the word 'vrajan,' which is also read in the P. and P. U. MSS. The second part is taken apparently from the same work, II, 14, 2.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
tatra śrūyatē[#1]sa yadi tiṣṭhannāsīnaḥ śayānō vā svādhyāyamadhītē tapa ēva tattapyatē tapō hi svādhyāya iti ॥2॥  

**ṭīkā**  
tatraiva brāhmaṇē "sa yadi tiṣṭhannāsīna' ityāpatkalpaḥ śrūyatē । tatra [#2] 'darbhāṇāṁ mahadupastīryōpasthaṁ kr̥tvā prāṅāsīnaḥ svādhyāya'mityādirmukhyaḥ kalpō[#3] brāhmaṇa ēvōktaḥ । iha punarāsīnavacanaṁ yathākathañcidāsanārtham । sarvathā'pyadhīyānastapa ēva tattapyata iti brāhmaṇārthaḥ। manurapyāha—  
[#4]āhaiva sa nakhāgrēbhyaḥ paramaṁ tapyatē tapaḥ।  
yassragvyapi dvijō'dhītē svādhyāyaṁ śaktitō'nvaham ॥' iti ।  
sragvīti svairaṁ darśayati ॥2॥  

[#1]: tai0 ā0 2.12.atra sūtrē brāhmaṇavākyānupūrvī yōpāttā sā kvacit brāhmaṇē nōpalabhyatē । kintu ēvamanumīyatē-taittirīyāraṇyakadvitīyaprapāṭhakadvādaśānuvākagataṁ "uta tiṣṭhannuta vrajannutāsīna uta śayānō'dhītaiva svādhyāyam" ityaṁśaṁ 'tapa ēva tat tapyatē tapō hi svādhyāyaḥ' iti tatraiva trayōdaśānuvākagatamaṁśaṁ cā''dāyaikīkr̥tya sūtrē'nūditavān sūtrakāra iti ।  

[#2]: tai0 ā0 2. 11 ।  

[#3]: taittirīyāraṇyakē svādhyāyabrāhmaṇa ityarthaḥ ।  

[#4]:

    manu0 2. 167. “ yadi ha vā apyasyaktō'laṁkr̥tassuhitassukhē śayanē śayānaḥ svādhyāyamadhīta āhēva sa nakhāgrēbhyastapyatē ya ēvaṁ vidvān svādhyāyamadhītē, tasmāt svādhyāyō'dhyētavya." ( mā śata0 brā0 11. 5. 3.) iti mādhyandinaśatapathabrāhmaṇavākyamūlēyaṁ mānavī smr̥tiriti bhāti।
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

athāpi vājasanēyibrāhmaṇam । brahmayajñō ha vā ēṣa yatsvādhyāyastasyaitē vaṣaṭkārā yatstanayati yadvidyōtatē yadavasphūrjati yadvātō vāyati । tasmātstanayati vidyōtamānē'vasphūrjati vātē vā vāyatyadhīyītaiva vaṣaṭkārāṇāmacchambaṭkārāyēti 3
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

3. Now the Vājasaneyi-brāhmaṇa declares also, 'The daily recitation is a sacrifice at which the Veda is offered. When it thunders, when lightning flashes or thunderbolts fall, and when the wind blows violently, these sounds take the place of the exclamations Vaṣaṭ (Vauṣaṭ and Svāhā). Therefore he shall recite the Veda whilst it thunders, whilst lightning flashes and thunderbolts fall, and whilst the wind blows violently, lest the Vaṣaṭ (should be heard) in vain. [#3] 

[#3]:  See Śatapatha-brāhmaṇa XI, 5, 6, 8, where a passage very similar to that quoted by Āpastamba occurs. Vaṣaṭ and the other exclamations, which are pronounced by the Hotṛ-priest, serve as signals for the Adhvaryu to throw the oblations into the fire.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
athāpi vājasanēyibrāhmaṇam[#5]brahmayajñō ha vā ēṣa yatsvādhyāyastasyaitē vaṣaṭkārā yatstanayati yadvidyōtatē yadavasphūrjati yadvātō vāyati । tasmāt stanayati vidyōtamānē'vasphūrjati vātē vā vāyatyadhīyītaiva vaṣaṭkārāṇāmacchambaṭkārāyēti ॥ 3॥  

[#5]:  

    idānīmupalabhyamānamādhyandinaśatapathabrāhmaṇa-paṅktistviyam- "tasya vā ētasya brahmayajñasya catvārō vaṣaṭkārāḥ yadvātō vāti yadvidyōtatē, yat stanayati yadavasphūrjati tasmādēvavidvātē vāti vidyōtamānē stanayatyavasphūrjatyadhīyītaiva vaṣaṭkārāṇāmachambaṭkārāya" iti ।  

**prastāvaḥ**  
ēvaṁ karturniyamō nā''padyatīvā''daraṇīya ityuktvā kālē'pyāha—  

**ṭīkā**  
athāpi api ca svādhyāyō nāma ya ēṣa brahmayajña brahmavēdaḥ tatsādhanō yāgaḥ। yathā darśapūrṇamāsādayaḥ purōḍāśādisādhanāḥ। havaiśabdau prasiddhiṁ dyōtayataḥ। tasya yajñasyaitē vakṣyamāṇāḥ stanayitnvādayō vaṣaṭkārāḥ vaṣaṭakārasthānīyāḥ । bahuvacanarnirdēśāt[#1] vaṣaṭkārānuvaṣaṭkārasvāhākārāssarvē pradānārthā gr̥hyantē । [#2]stanitaṁ mēghaśabdaḥ। vidyōtanaṁ vidyudvyāpāraḥ। avasphūrjanam śanipātaḥ । tatra avasphūrjathurliṅgamiti darśanāt । 'vāyatī'ti ōvai śōṣaṇa' ityasya rūpam । yathā ārdrapradēśaśśuṣkō bhavati tathā[#3] vātītyarthaḥ । yasmādētē vaṣaṭkārāḥ tasmāt stananādiṣvanadhyāyanimittēṣu satsvapyadhīyītaiva । na punaranadhyāya iti nādhīyīta । kimartham ? vaṣaṭkārāṇāmētēṣāmacchambaṭkārāya avyarthatvāya । anyathā ētē vaṣaṭakārā vyarthāssyuḥ । tataśca[#4] yathā hōtrā vaṣaṭkr̥tē adhvaryurna juhuyāt tādr̥gēva tatsyāt ॥3॥  

[#1]:  

     vaṣaṭkāraḥ sarvatra yāgādau havi prakṣēpāt pūrvaṁ haviprakṣēpārthamēva paṭhyamānayājyāyāḥ antē paṭhyamānaḥ “vauṣaṭ" iti śabdaḥ । sōmayāgē tattadūgrahahōmānantaraṁ "sōmasyāgnē vīhi3 vauṣaṭ" iti dvitīyavāraṁ paṭhyamānō'nuvaṣaṭkāraḥ । svāhākārastu prasiddhaḥ ।  

[#2]: stananaṁ iti. kha. ga. pu.  

[#3]: vāyatītyarthaḥ, iti ka. pu.  

[#4]:

    darśapūrṇamāsādiyāgēṣu sarvatra haviḥpradānasamayē "amuṣmā anubrūhi" iti praiṣānantara purōnuvākyāmanūcyā''śrāvya pratyāśravya yājyāmuktvā vaṣaṭkr̥tē juhōti" iti vacanāt vaṣaṭkārānantara hōmō vihitaḥ । tatra vaṣaṭkārānantara hōmākaraṇē yādr̥śō dōṣastādr̥śassyādityarthaḥ।
</details>
</details>

tasya śākhāntarē vākyasamāptiḥ 4

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

4. The conclusion of the passage from that (Vājasaneyi-brāhmaṇa is found) in another Śākhā (of the Veda).

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
tasya śākhāntarē vākyasamāptiḥ॥ 4 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
tasya vājasanēyibrāhmaṇasya । śākhāntarē vākyasamāptirbhavati, na [#5]tāvati paryavasānam ॥ 4॥  

[#5]: 'tāvatīti. nāsti kha. pu.

</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

atha yadi vātō vā vāyāt stanayēd vā vidyōtēta vāvasphūrjēd vaikāṁ varcamēkaṁ vā yajurēkaṁ vā sāmābhivyāharēdbhūrbhuvaḥ suvaḥ satyaṁ tapaḥ śraddhāyāṁ juhōmīti vaitat । tēnō haivāsyaitadahaḥ svādhyāya upāttō bhavati 5
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

5. 'Now, if the wind blows, or if it thunders, or if lightning flashes, or thunderbolts fall, then he shall recite one Ṛk-verse (in case he studies the Rig-Veda), or one Yajus (in case he studies the Yajur-veda), or one Sāman (in case he studies the Sāma-veda), or (without having a regard to his particular Veda, the following Yajus), "Bhūḥ Bhuvaḥ, Suvaḥ, in faith I offer true devotion." Then, indeed, his daily recitation is accomplished thereby for that day.' [#4] 

[#4]:  'Some suppose that the words Bhūḥ Bhuvaḥ and Suvaḥ &c. (are to be used only) if one studies the Brāhmaṇa portion of the Veda, not every where.'-- Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
atha yadi vā vātō vāyātstanayēdvā vidyōtēta vā'vasphūrjēdvaikāṁ varcamēkaṁ vā yajurēkaṁ vā sāmābhivyāharēdbhūrbhuvassuvassatyaṁ tapaḥ śraddhāyāṁ juhōmīti vaitat । tēnōhaivā'syaitadahassvādhyāya upāttō bhavati ॥ 6 ॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
tadēva [#1]śākhāntaraṁ paṭhati—

**ṭīkā**  
antē itiśabdō'dhyāhāryaḥ । vātādiṣu satsu ēkāmr̥camadhīyīta । prāptē pradēśē। yaju[#2]rvēdādhyayana ēkaṁ yajuḥ । sāma[#3]vēdādhyayana ēkaṁ sāma । sarvēṣu vā vēdēṣu 'bhūrbhuvaḥ suva'rityādikaṁ yajurabhivyāharēt , na punaryathāpūrvaṁ praśnamātram । tēnaiva tāvataivāsyā'dhyētuḥ tadahaḥ tasminnahani svādhyāya upāttō bhavati[#4] adhītō bhavatīti yāvat । kēcitu 'bhūrbhuvaḥ suva'rityādikaṁ brāhmaṇabhāgādhyayanaviṣayaṁ manyantē, na sārvatrikam ॥5॥  

[#1]:

    kimidaṁ śākhāntaramiti na jñāyatē।  

[#2]:, 3. vēdādhyāyī iti ka. pu.  

[#4]:

    svīkr̥tō bhavati adhītō bhavatītyartha , iti. kha. pu
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ēvaṁ satyāryasamayēnāvipratiṣiddham 6
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

6. If that is done, (if the passage of the Vājasaneyi-brāhmaṇa is combined with that quoted in Sūtra 5, the former stands) not in contradiction with the decision of the Āryas. [#5] 

[#5]:  Haradatta explains Āryas by viśiṣṭāḥ, 'excellent ones,' i.e. persons who know the law, and he gives Manu as an instance.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ēvaṁ satyāryasamayēnā'vipratiṣiddham ॥ 6 ॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
kasmāt punarvājasanēyibrāhmaṇasyōdāhr̥tē śākhāntarē vākyasamāptirāśrīyatē na punaryathāśrutamātraṁ gr̥hyatē ? tatrāha—  

**ṭīkā**  
ēvaṁ sati vākyaparisamāptāvāśrīyamāṇāyāmāryasamayēna āryāḥ śiṣṭā manvādayaḥ tēṣāṁ samayō vyavasthā, tēna avipratiṣiddhaṁ bhavati । itarathā vipratiṣiddhaṁ syāt ॥ 6 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

adhyāyānadhyāyaṁ hyupadiśanti । tadanarthakaṁ syādvājasanēyibrāhmaṇaṁ cēdavēkṣēta 7
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

7. For they (who know the law) teach both the continuance and the interruption (of the daily recitation of the Veda). That would be meaningless, if one paid attention to the (passage of the) Vājasaneyi-brāhmaṇa (alone).
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
adhyāyānadhyāyaṁ hyupadiśanti । tadanarthakaṁ syādvājasanēyibrāhmaṇaṁ cēdavēkṣēta ॥ 7 ॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
katham?  

**ṭīkā**  
āryā hi adhyāyamanadhyāyaṁ cōpadiśanti । tadupadēśanamanarthakaṁ syāt yadi vājasanēyibrāhmaṇaṁ yathāśrutamavēkṣatā'dhyētā ॥7॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

āryasamayō hyagr̥hyamānakāraṇaḥ 8
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

8. For no (worldly) motive for the decision of those Āryas is perceptible; (and hence it must have a religious motive and be founded on a passage of the Veda). [#6] 

[#6]:  See above, I, 1, 4, 9 and 10. and notes.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
āryasamayō hyagr̥hyamānakāraṇaḥ ॥ 8॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
nanu-anarthakamēvēdamastu, śrutivirōdhāt । tatrāha—  

**ṭīkā**  
yō'yamadhyāyānadhyāyaviṣaya āryasamayaḥ na tatra kiñcitkāraṇaṁ gr̥hyatē । yathā[#5] vaisarjanahīmōyaṁ vāsō'dhvaryavē dadātī'tyatrāgr̥hyamāṇakāraṇaścāryasamayaḥ śrutyanumānadvārēṇa pramāṇam । atō vākyaparisamāptirēva yuktā । ēvaṁ hi vājasanēyibrāhmaṇasyāpi nātyantabādhaḥ । anadhyāyōpadēśasyāpi prabhūtādhyayanaviṣayatayā'rthavatvamiti । sūtrē 'agr̥hyamāna kāraṇa' iti ṇatvābhāvaśchāndasaḥ ॥ 8 ॥  

[#5]:  

    sōmayāgē agnīṣōmīyapaśvanuṣṭhānakālē tadarthaṁ śālāmukhīyādagnē kacidaśamuddhatya tasya uttaravēdisthāhavanīyakuṇḍē sthāpanārthaṁ adhvaryau gacchati taṁ yajamānastatpatnīputrādayō'nugacchēyuḥ । gacchatastānahatēna dīrghatamēna vastrēṇōparyācchādya sarvēṣvāhavanīyadēśaṁ prāptēṣu tatra tamagniṁ pratiṣṭhāpya, ācchādanavastrāntaṁ sr̥gdaṇḍē badhvā''nyēna juhōti । tē vaisarjanahōmā ucyantē । tacca vāsaḥ adhvaryavē dadyāt iti prakr̥tavākyārthaḥ । smr̥tērasyāḥ lōbhādimūlakatvamāpādyāta ēvāprāmāṇyamuktaṁ śabarasvāminā । kumārasvāminā tu ēvaṁ sati sarvatrā'nāśvāsaprasaṅgamāpādya manvādismr̥tivat prāmāṇyamēvāṅgīkr̥tam ।
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

vidyāṁ pratyanadhyāyaḥ śrūyatē na karmayōgē mantrāṇām 9
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

9. (The proper interpretation therefore is, that) the prohibition to study (given above and by the

Āryas generally) refers only to the repetition of the sacred texts in order to learn them, not to their application at sacrifices.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
vidyāṁ pratyanadhyāyaḥ śrūyatē na karmayōgē mantrāṇām ॥ 9 ॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
kā punarasau smr̥tiḥ ? yā brahmayajñē'pyanadhyāyamupadiśati । mānavē tāvadviparyayaḥ śrūyatē—  
[#1] 'naityakē nāstyanadhyāyō brahmasatraṁ hi tatsmr̥tam ।' iti ।  
sāmānyēnānadhyāyōpadēśastu brahmayajñādanyatra caritārthaḥ। tasmāttādr̥śī smr̥tirmr̥gyā । ēvaṁ tarhyagnihōtrādiṣvapi mantrāṇāmanadhyāya prāpnōti । nētyāha—  

**ṭīkā**  
vidyā vēdādhyayanam । tāṁ pratyanadhyāyaḥ śrūyatē । na punarmantrāṇāṁ karmayōgē । hētuḥ paribhāṣāyāmuktō[#2]rthāntaratvāditi । arthāntaraṁ hi karmaṇi prayōgō mantrāṇām [#3]na punargrahaṇādhyayanam । pārāyaṇādhyayanamadhyē'nadhyāyāgamō bhavati vā na vēti cintyam । ēvaṁ śrīrudrādijapē'pi ॥9॥  

[#1]:  

    ma0 smr̥0 2. 106. brahmasatraṁ satatapravr̥ttaṁ satram , yathā sahasrasaṁvatsarādikaṁ satraṁ na kadācicchidyatē tadvadidaṁ nityādhyayanamityarthaḥ।  

[#2]: āpa0 pa0 1.40.  

[#3]:

    anuṣṭhēyārthaprakāśakatayā ityadhikaṁ kha, ga, pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

brāhmaṇōktā vidhayastēṣāmutsannāḥ pāṭhāḥ prayōgādanumīyantē 10
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

10. (But if you ask, why the decision of the Āryas presupposes the existence of a Vedic passage, then I answer): All precepts were (originally) taught in the Brāhmaṇas, (but) these texts have been lost. Their (former existence) may, however, be inferred from usage. [#7] 

[#7]:  How then is their existence known? 'They are inferred from usage.' '"Usage" means the teaching of the law-books and the practice. From that it is inferred that Manu and other (authors of law-books) knew such texts of the Brāhmaṇas. For how could otherwise (Ṛṣis like Manu) teach in their works or practise (such customs) for which no authority is now found? And certainly they were intimately connected with the revealed texts (i.e. saw them).'-- Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
brāhmaṇōktā vidhayastēṣāmutsannāḥ pāṭhāḥ prayōgādanumīyantē ॥ 10 ॥   

**prastāvaḥ**  
kathaṁ punarāryasamayaḥ pramāṇam ? yāvatā na tēṣāmatīndriyē'rthē jñānaṁ sambhavati । tatrāha—  

**ṭīkā**  
vidhīyanta iti vidhayaḥ karmāṇi । tē sarvē smārtā api brāhmaṇēṣvēvōktāḥ। nanvidānīṁ brāhmaṇāni nōpalabhyantē। satyam; tēṣāmutsannāḥ pāṭhāḥ, adhyētr̥daurbalyāt । kathaṁ tarhi tēṣāmastitvam ? prayōgādatumīyantē । prayōgaḥ smr̥tinibandhanamanuṣṭhānaṁ ca । tasmādbrāhmaṇānyanumīyantē manvādibhirupalabdhānīti । [#1] kathamanyathā smarēyuranutiṣṭhēyurvā । sambhavati ca tēṣāṁ vēdasaṁyōgaḥ ॥10॥  

[#1]:

    kathamaparathā iti kha. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yatra tu prītyupalabdhitaḥ pravr̥ttirna tatra śāstramasti 11
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

11. But it is not (permissible to infer the former existence of) a (Vedic) passage in cases where pleasure is obtained (by following a rule of the Smṛti or a custom). [#8] 

[#8]:  Compare above, I, 1, 4, 8-10.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yatra tu prītyupalabdhitaḥ pravr̥ttirna tatra śāstramasti ॥11॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
atha prasaṅgādapasmr̥tirucyatē—  

**ṭīkā**  
yatra[#2]pitr̥ṣvasr̥sutāmātulasutāpariṇayanādau । prītyupalabdhitaḥ pravr̥ttirna tatrōtsannapāṭhaṁ śāstramanumīyatē, prītērēva pravr̥ttihētōḥ sambhavāt ॥ 11 ॥

[#2]:

    'pitr̥ṣvasr̥sutā' iti nāsti kha. ga. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

tadanuvartamānō narakāya rādhyati 12
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

12. He who follows such (usages) becomes fit for hell.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
tadanuvartamānō narakāya rādhyati ॥ 12 ॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
tataśca—  

**ṭīkā**  
tadvidhānamanutiṣṭhannarakāyaiva rādhyati kalpatē ॥ 12 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

atha brāhmaṇōktā vidhayaḥ 13
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

13. Now follow (some rites and) rules that have been declared in the Brāhmaṇas. [#9] 

[#9]:  The consequence of the introduction of these rules into a Smṛti work is, that their omission must be expiated by a Smārta penance and not by a Śrauta one.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
atha brāhmaṇōktā vidhayaḥ ॥ 13 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ēvaṁ smr̥tyācāraprāptānāṁ śrutimūlatvamuktam। [#3] atha pratyakṣabrāhmaṇōktā ēva kēcidvidhayō vyākhyāyantē tēṣāmapi smārtēṣvanupravēśārtham । tēna tadā tikramē smārtātikramanimittamēva prāyaścittaṁ bhavati ॥ 13॥  

[#3]: athēdānīṁ iti kha. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

tēṣāṁ mahāyajñā mahāsattrāṇīti saṁstutiḥ 14
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

14. By way of laudation they are called 'great sacrifices ' or 'great sacrificial sessions.' [#10] 

[#10]:  The commentator observes, that, as these rites are called 'great sacrifices,' by way of laudation only, the particular laws binding on performers of real Soma-sacrifices cannot be transferred to the performers of these ceremonies. Regarding the p. 48 term 'great sacrifices,' see also Taitt. Ār. II, 11, 10, 1 seq., and Śatapatha-brāhmaṇa XI, 59 6, 1.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
tēṣāṁ [#4]mahāyajñā mahāsatrāṇīti ca saṁstutiḥ ॥14॥  

**ṭīkā**  
tēṣāṁ vakṣyamāṇānāṁ mahāyajñā iti saṁstutiḥ svādhyāyabrāhmaṇē । mahāsatrāṇīti ca saṁstutirbhavati br̥hadāraṇyakādau । saṁstutigrahaṇēna saṁstutimātramidaṁ na nāmadhēyaṁ[#5] dharmātidēśārthamiti darśayati । tēna mahāyajñēṣu sōmayāgēṣu yē dharmāḥ 'na jyēṣṭhaṁ bhrātaramatītya sōmēna yaṣṭavya'mityādayaḥ, yē ca mahāsatrasya gavāmayanasya dharmā[#1] iṣṭaprathamayajñānāmadhikāra' ityādayaḥ ubhayē'pi tē vakṣyamāṇēṣu pañcamahāyajñēṣu na bhavanti ॥ 14 ॥  

[#4]:

    pañcaiva mahāyajñāḥ tānyēva mahāsatrāṇi (śa0 brā0 11. 5.6.1 ) iti śatapathē।  

[#5]:

    kuṇḍapāyināmayanākhyē saṁvatsarasādhyē satraviśēṣē "māsamagnihōtraṁ juhōtīti" śrutō'gnihōtra śabdastatratyasya karmaviśēṣasya gauṇyā vr̥tyā nāmadhēya san prasiddhāgnihōtrāt dharmātidēśaka ityuktaṁ pūrvamīmāṁsāyāṁ saptamatr̥tīyē । ēvaṁ ca kvacit nāmatvēnābhidhāvr̥tyā prayujyamānasya śabdasya prakaraṇāntarē'nyatra karmanāmatayā yadi śravaṇaṁ, tadā na tatra karmāntarē'pi tasya śaktiraṅgīkriyatē'nēkārthatādōṣabhiyā । kintu prasiddhatādr̥śakarmaniṣṭaguṇasamānaguṇavatvarūpāṁ gauṇī vr̥ttimāśritya tadbalāt tadīyadharmātidēśaka iti sthitam । prakr̥tē tu na tathā । kintu stutimātramiti ।  

[#1]:

    iṣṭaprathamayajñairyaṣṭavyam iti. kha, pu. "āhitāgnaya iṣṭaprathamayajñā gr̥hapatisaptadaśāssatramāsīran" iti satrē'dhikāriniyamaḥ। prathamayajñaśabdēna sōmayāga ucyatē'gni ṣṭōmasaṁsthākaḥ । pūrvaṁ kr̥tādhānāḥ anuṣṭhitāgniṣṭōmasaṁsthākasōmayāgāḥ dvādaśāhādiṣu satrākhyēṣu jyōtiṣṭōmavikr̥tibhūtēṣu sōmayāgēṣvadhikāriṇaḥ iti vākyārthaḥ । tādr̥śānāṁ niyamānāṁ tatrāpēkṣā । adhītavēdasya sarvasyā'pyatrādhikāra iti bhāvaḥ ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

aharaharbhūtabalirmanuṣyēbhyō yathāśakti dānam 15
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

15. (These rites include): The daily Bali-offering to the (seven classes of) beings; the (daily) gift of (food) to men according to one's power;
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
[#2]aharaharbhūtabalirmanuṣyēbhyō yathāśakti dānam ॥ 15 ॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
kē punastē? tānāha—

**ṭīkā**  
vaiśvadēvē vakṣyamāṇēna baliharaṇaprakārēṇa bhūtēbhyō'haraharbhūtabalirdēyaḥ, ēṣa bhūtayajñaḥ । manuṣyēbhyaśca yathāśakti dānaṁ kartavyam । ēṣa manuṣyayaśaḥ ॥ 15 ॥  

[#2]:

    "sūtrāṇīmāni-śatapathabrāhmaṇasya kāñcana pratirūpatāmanubhavanti" iyaṁ hi śātapathī paṁktiḥ-bhūtayajñō manuṣyayajñaḥ pitr̥yajñō dēvayajñō brahmayajñaḥ iti। aharahabhūtēbhyō baliṁ harēt । tathaitaṁ bhūtayajñaṁ samāpnōti, aharahardadyādōdapātrāt tathaitaṁ manuṣyayajñaṁ samāpnōti, aharahassvadhā kuryādōdapātrāt tathaitaṁ pitr̥yajñaṁ samāpnōti, aharahassvāhā kuryādākāṣṭhāttathainaṁ dēvayajñaṁ samāpnōti । atha brahmayajñaḥ । svādhyāyō vai brahmayajñaḥ iti ।  

॥ ityāpastambadharmasūtravr̥ttau dvādaśī kaṇḍikā ॥
</details>
</details>

### 13 pañca-mahā-yajñāḥ, ōṁ

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

dēvēbhyaḥ svāhākāra ā kāṣṭhāt, pitr̥bhyaḥ svadhākāra ōdapātrāt, svādhyāya iti 1
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

1. The oblation to the gods accompanied by the exclamation Svāhā, which may consist even of a piece of wood only; the offering to the Manes accompanied by the exclamation Svadhā, which may consist even of a vessel with water only; the daily recitation. [#1] 

[#1]:  13. Taitt. Ār. II, 10, 2 and 3, and Śatapatha-br. loc. cit. 2. Haradatta observes, that some consider the Devayajña, mentioned in the Sūtra, to be different from the Vaiśvadeva, but that he holds it to be the same. Further he mentions, that some prescribe this Vaiśvadeva to be performed even if one has nothing to eat.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
dēvēbhyaḥ svāhākāra ā kāṣṭhāt pitr̥bhyaḥ svadhākāra ōdapātrāt svādhyāya iti ॥1॥  

**ṭīkā**  
dēvēbhyaḥ svāhākārēṇa pradānam ākāṣṭhāt aśanīyābhāvē kāṣṭhamapi tāvaddēyam । vaiśvadēvōktaprakārēṇaivaiṣa dēvayajñaḥ । kēcidvaiśvadēvāhutībhyaḥ pr̥thagbhūtāmimāmāhutiṁ manyantē । 'dēvēbhyaḥ svāhē'ti ca mantramicchanti । 'dēvayajñēna yakṣya' iti saṅkalpamicchanti । vayaṁ tu na tathēti[#3] gr̥hya ēvā'vōcāma । kēcidāhuḥ—'ākāṣṭhā'diti vacanādaśanīyābhāvēna bhōjanalōpē'pi yathākañcit vaiśvadēvaṁ kartavyam, puruṣasaṁskāratvāditi ।  

[#3]:

    āpastambagr̥hyasūtrasyānākulātātparyadarśanasahitasya caukhambāmudraṇālayamudritasya pustakasya 104 pr̥ṣṭhē draṣṭavyam।

aparē tu-aśanīyasaṁskāra iti vadantō bhōjanalōpē vaiśvadēvaṁ na kartavyamiti sthitāḥ।  
pitr̥bhyaḥ svadhākārēṇa pradānam ārapātrāt annādyabhāvē udapātramapi svadhākārēṇa tāvaddēyam । pātragrahaṇāt saha pātrēṇa dēyam । ēṣa pitr̥yajñaḥ । svādhyāya [#1] 'tasya vidhirityārabhyōktō nityasvādhyāyaḥ । sa tu brahmayajñaḥ। itiḥ samāptau । ityētē mahāyajñā iti । na cāyamupadēśakramō'nuṣṭhāna upayujyatē । anuṣṭhānaṁ tu—[#2]brahmayajñō, dēvayajñaḥ, pitr̥yajñō, bhūtayajñō, manuṣyayajña iti ॥ 1॥  

[#1]: ā0 dha0 11 22,  

[#2]:

    śiṣṭācārō'pi brahmayajñō dēvayajñaḥ, pitr̥yajñō. bhūtayajñō, manuṣyayajña, ityēvam । na tu brāhmaṇōktēnaiva kramēṇānuṣṭhānam। ca. pustakē dēvayajñō, bhūtayajñaḥ, iti pāṭhakramaḥ ।
</details>
</details>

pūjā varṇajyāyasāṁ kāryā ॥ 2 ॥

varṇatō[#3] yē jyāyāṁsaḥ praśastatarā bhavanti tēṣāmavarēṇa varṇēna kāryā pūjā adhvanyanugamanādikā utsavādiṣu ca gandhalēpādikā ॥2॥

    ma0 smr̥0 2. 137. daśamīṁ gataḥ navatyadhikāṁ avasthāṁ gata ityarthaḥ । varṣāṇāṁ śatasya daśadhā vibhāgē daśamyavasthā navatyadhikā bhavati ।

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

hr̥ṣṭō darpati dr̥ptō dharmamatikrāmati dharmātikramē khalu punarnarakaḥ 4

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

4. A man elated (with success) becomes proud, a proud man transgresses the law, but through the transgression of the law hell indeed (becomes his portion).

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
hr̥ṣṭō darpati dr̥ptō dharmamatikrāmati dharmātikramē khalu punarnarakaḥ ॥ 4॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
pūjā kāryētyuktam । tadvirōdhī harṣō varjya ityāha—  

**ṭīkā**  
abhimatalābhādinimittaścittavikārō harṣaḥ । tadyuktō hr̥ṣṭaḥ । sa darpati dr̥pyati। darpō garvō'bhimānaḥ। dr̥ptō dharmamatikrāmati, pūjyapūjanādikaṁ prati stabdhatvāt । khalupunaśśabdō vākyālaṅkārē । dharmātikramē khalu punarnarakō bhavati niraya pratipadyatē । tasmāddharmātikramamūlabhūtō harṣō na kartavyaḥ । yadyapi bhūtadāhīyēṣu [#1]dōṣēṣu varjanīyēṣu harṣō'pi, [#2]vakṣyatē । tathāpīha viśēṣēṇa harṣasya varjanārthō'yamārambhaḥ ! yōgāṅgātvādvakṣyamāṇasya ॥ 4॥  

[#1]:

    dōṣaṣu varjanīyaṣu iti nāsti kha. pu.   

[#2]: āpa0 dha0 1. 23. 6.

na samāvr̥ttē samādēśō vidyatē 5

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

5. It has not been declared, that orders (may be addressed by the teacher) to a pupil who has returned home. [#3] 

[#3]:  Haradatta gives as an example the order to fetch water, and adds that a voluntary act on a former pupil's part ought not to be forbidden.

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
na samāvr̥ttē samādēśō vidyatē ॥ 5॥  

**ṭīkā**  
samāvr̥ttaṁ śiṣyaṁ prati ācāryēṇa samādēśō na dēyaḥ-idaṁ tvayā kartavyamiti । yathā asamāvr̥ttadaśāyāmājñā dīyatē-udakumbhamāharētyādi, naivamidānīm। svēcchayā karaṇē na pratiṣēdhyam ॥ 5॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ōṁkāraḥ svargadvāraṁ tasmādbrahmādhyēṣyamāṇa ētadādi pratipadyēta 6
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

6. The syllable 'Om' is the door of heaven. [#4]  Therefore he who is about to study the Veda, shall begin (his lesson) by (pronouncing) it.

[#4]:  Compare also Taitt. Ār. I, 2, 4, and Manu II, 74.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ōṅkārassvargadvāraṁ tasmādbrahmā'dhyēṣyamāṇa ētadādi pratipadyēta ॥ 6॥   

**ṭīkā**  
ōṅkāraḥ praṇavaḥ svargasya dvāramiva । yathā dvārēṇa gr̥hābhyantaraṁ prāpyatē tathā'nēna svargaḥ ! tammāt brahma vēdaṁ svargasādhanamadhyēṣyamāṇa ētadādi anāmnātamapyōṅkāramādau kr̥tvā pratipadyēta upakramētā'dhyētum ॥ 6 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

vikathāṁ cānyāṁ kr̥tvaivaṁ laukikyā vācā vyāvartatē brahma 7
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

7. If he has spoken anything else (than what refers to the lesson, he shall resume his reading by repeating the word 'Om'). Thus the Veda is separated from profane speech.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
vikathāṁ cānyāṁ kr̥tvaivaṁ laukikyā vācā vyāvartatē brahma ॥ 7॥  

**ṭīkā**  
adhyayanē 'nupayuktā kathā vikathā ।  
tāṁ cānyāṁ kr̥tvā ētadādi pratipadyēta । ēvaṁ sati brahma vēdaḥ laukikyā vācā vyāvartatē tayā miśritaṁ na bhavati ॥7॥
</details>
</details>

yajñēṣu caitadādayaḥ prasavāḥ 8

<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

8. And at sacrifices the orders (given to the priests) are headed by this word.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yajñēṣu caitadādayaḥ prasavāḥ॥8॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
punarapyōṅkāramēva stauti—

[#3]:

    sōmayāgē udgātr̥prastōtr̥pratihartākhyān chandōgān prati guṇiniṣṭhaguṇābhidhānarūpastōtrārambhārthadhvaryuṇā'nujñādānamidam ।
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

lōkē ca bhūtikarmasvētadādīnyēva vākyāni syuryathā puṇyāhaṁ svastyr̥ddhimiti 9
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

9. And in common life, at the occasion of ceremonies performed for the sake of welfare, the sentences shall be headed by this word, as, for instance, '(Om) an auspicious day,' '(Om) welfare,' '(Om) prosperity.' [#5] 

[#5]:  The example given in the Sūtra is that of the Puṇyāhavācana, which precedes every Gṛhya ceremony, and at which the sacrificer requests a number of invited Brāhmaṇas to wish him success. The complete sentences are, The sacrificer: Oṃ karmaṇaḥ puṇyāham bhavanto bruvantviti, 'Om, wish that the day may be auspicious for the performance of the ceremony.' The Brāhmaṇas: Om puṇyāhaṃ karmaṇa itī, 'Om, may the day be auspicious for the ceremony.' In the same manner the Brāhmaṇas afterwards wish 'welfare,' svasti, 'prosperity,' vṛddhi, to the sacrificer.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
lōkē ca bhūtikarmasvētadādīnyēva vākyāni syuryathā puṇyāhaṁ svastyr̥ddhimiti ॥9॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yathā yajñēṣvōṅkārādayaḥ prasavāḥ, lōkē ca bhūtikarmasu pāṇigrahaṇādiṣu ētadādīnyēva vākyāni syuḥ । tānyudāharati— yathēti । puṇyāhavācanē ōṁ karmaṇaḥ puṇyāhaṁ bhavantō bruvanvi'ti vācayitā vadati । [#1] 'ōṁ puṇyāhaṁ karmaṇō'stu' iti prativaktāraḥ । [#2] ōṁ karmaṇē svasti bhavantō avantu' iti vācayitā। 'ōṁ karmaṇē svasti' itītarē। [#3] ōṁ karmaṇa r̥ddhi bhavantō bruvantu" iti vācayitā । 'ōṁ karmarghyatāmitītarē । tasmādēvaṁ praśasta ōṁkāra iti ॥ 9॥  

[#1]:

    ōṁ puṇyāhaṁ iti ka.pu.  

[#2]:

    ōṁ karmaṇē svasti iti vācayitā iti ka. pu.  

[#3]:

    ōṁ karmaṇa r̥ddhiṁ iti ka. pu
</details>
</details>

samayaḥ śuśrūṣā, tēna vinā kr̥cchraṁ duḥkhaṁ duravadhāraṇaṁ apūrvaṁ granthaṁ na kurvīta । kriyāsāmānyavacanaḥ karōtiradhyayanē'dhyāpanē ca vartatē । samayēna vinā śiṣyō'pi kr̥cchraṁ granthaṁ nā'dhīyīta । āvāryō'pi nādhyāpayēt । tathā ca manuḥ—  
[#4] dharmārthau yatra na syātāṁ śuśrūṣā vāpi tadvidhā ।  
na tatra vidyā vaptavyā śubhaṁ bījamivōṣarē' ॥ iti ।   kimaviśēṣēṇa ? nētyāha-triḥśrāvaṇamātrē trissahavacanamiti parihāpya varjayitvā । triḥśrāvaṇamātrē trissahavacanamātrē cānyatarāpēkṣayā kriyamāṇē
śuśrūṣā nā'pēkṣyā । tatō'dhikē sarvatrāpēkṣyati ॥10॥

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

11. Hārita declares, that the (whole) Veda must be studied under a vow of obedience until there is no doubt (regarding it in the mind of the pupil). [#7] 

[#7]:  The meaning of Hārita is, that the vow of obedience is required for the Triḥsrāvaṇa and Tr.ihsahavacana, which Āpastamba exempted in the preceding Sūtra. It follows from this rule that the Aṅgas or works explanatory of the Veda need not be studied under a vow of obedience.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

avicikitsā yāvadbrahma nigantavyamiti hārītaḥ ॥ 11 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
vicikitsā saṁśayaḥ। tadabhāvō'vicikitsā sā yāvadutpadyatē tāvadbrahma nigantavyaṁ niyamapūrvamadhigantavyamiti hārītaḥ ācāryō manyatē । atra pakṣē triḥśrāvaṇatrissahavacanayōrapi śuśrūṣitavyam । brahmagrahaṇādaṅgēṣu nāyaṁ vidhiḥ ॥ 11 ॥
</details>
</details>

18. (For) the (wise) say, 'The Veda-knowledge (of either of them) grows.'
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
brahma vardhata ityupadiśanti ॥ 18 ॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
atra hētuṁ svayamēvāha—

**ṭīkā**  
dvayōrapi brahma vardhatē । saiva brahmavr̥ddhi' śuśrūṣētyupadiśantyācāryāḥ ॥18॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

nivēśē vr̥ttē saṁvatsarē saṁvatsarē dvau dvau māsau samāhita ācāryakulē vasēdbhūyaḥ śrutamicchann iti śvētakētuḥ 19
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

19. Śvetaketu declares, 'He who desires to study more, after having settled (as a householder), shall dwell two months every year, with collected mind, in the house of his teacher,'
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
nivēśē vr̥ttē saṁvatsarēsaṁvatsarē dvaudvau māsau samāhita ācāryakulē vasēdbhūyaḥśrutimicchanniti śvētakētuḥ॥ 19॥  

**ṭīkā**  
bhūyaḥśravaṇamicchan puruṣō nivēśē dārakarmaṇi vr̥ttē'pi pratisaṁvatsaraṁ dvaudvau māsau samāhitō bhūtvā'cāryakulē vasēditi śvētakēturācāryō manyatē ॥ 19 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ētēna hyahaṁ yōgēna bhūyaḥ pūrvasmātkālācchrutamakurvīti 20

<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

20. (And he adds), 'For by this means I studied a larger part of the Veda than before, (during my studentship.)'
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ētēna hyahaṁ yōgēna bhūyaḥ pūrvasmātkālācchrutamakurvīti ॥ 20 ॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
atra hētutvēna śvētakētōrēva śiṣyānprati vacanam —  

**ṭīkā**  
ētēnānantarōktēna yōgēnōpāyēna ahaṁ pūrvasmāt brahmacaryakālāt bhūyaḥ [#1]bahutaraṁ śrutamakurvīti kr̥tavānasmi । atō yūyamapi tathā kurudhvamiti ॥  

[#1]: adhikatara iti kha. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

tacchāstrairvipratiṣiddham 21
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

21. That is forbidden by the Śāstras.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
tacchāstrairvipratiṣiddham ॥ 21 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
tadidaṁ śvētakētōrvacanaṁ śrutyādibhiḥ śāstrairviruddham ॥ 21 ॥

nivēśē hi vr̥ttē naiyamikāni śrūyantē 22

</details>

nivēśē hi vr̥ttē naiyamikāni śrūyantē ॥ 22 ॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
kathamityata āha —  

**ṭīkā**  
hiśabdō hētau । yasmāt nivēśē vr̥ttē naiyamikāni niyamēna kartavyāni nityāni karmāṇi śrūyantē ॥ 22 ॥  

॥ iti trayōdaśī kaṇḍikā ॥

agnihōtramatithayaḥ 1

[#1]:  14. The Agnihotra, i.e. certain daily oblations of clarified butter.

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
[#2]agnihōtramatithayō yaccānyadēvaṁ yuktam ॥ 1 ॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
kāni pustakāni ?

**ṭīkā**  
agnihōtram, atithayaḥ atithipūjā ।  
[#3] yathā mātaramāśritya sarva jīvanti jantavaḥ ।  
ēvaṁ gr̥hasthamāśritya sarvē jīvanti bhikṣavaḥ ॥ iti ।   yaccānyadēva yuktaṁ ēvaṁvidhaṁ śrāddhasandhyōpāsanādi । ēvamētaiḥ karmabhi raharaharākrāntasya na [#4]śarīrakaṇḍūyanēṣvapyavasarō bhavati । sa kathaṁ dvaudvau māsau gurukulē vasēditi ॥ 1 ॥

[#2]:

    agnihōtramatithayaḥ । yaccānyadēvaṁ yuktam । iti sūtradvayatvēna parigaṇita kha. ca. pustakayōḥ ।  

[#3]:

    vasi0 smr̥0 8. 16. vacanamida smr̥timuktāphalē 'dakṣaḥ' —ityārabhya paṭhitēṣu vacanēṣu madhyē paṭhitam । idānīmupalabhyamānamudritadakṣasmr̥tipustakē tu nōpalabhyatē । vasiṣṭha smr̥tāvēvōpalabhyatē ।  

[#4]: śiraḥkaṇḍuyanē iti kha. pu.

yaccānyadēvaṁ yuktam 2

2. And what else of this kind (is ordained).

yaccānyadēvaṁ yuktam 2

+++(pūrvasūtrē vīkṣatām ।)+++

adhyayanārthēna yaṁ cōdayēnna cainaṁ pratyācakṣīta 3

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
adhyayanārthēna yaṁ cōdayēnna cainaṁ pratyācakṣīta ॥ 2 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yamācāryaṁ māṇavakō'dhyayanaṁ prayōjanamuddiśya cōdayēt-'śiṣyastē'haṁ śādhi māṁ tvāṁ prapanna'miti, sa ēnaṁ māṇavakaṁ naiva pratyācakṣīta । caśabdō'vadhāraṇē ॥2॥

4. Provided he does not see in him a fault, (which disqualifies him from being taught).

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

na cāsmin dōṣaṁ paśyēt ॥ 3 ॥

kimaviśēṣēṇa ? nētyāha—  

**ṭīkā**  
caṇiti nipātō'sti-[#1]'nipātairyadyadihantakuvinēccēścaṇakañcidyatrayukta'miti । sa cēdarthē vartatē। [#2] 'indraśca mr̥ḍayāti na' ityādau darśanāt । tasyāyaṁ prayōgaḥ- na cēdasmin māṇavakē dōṣamanadhyāpyatāhētuṁ paśyēt ॥ 3॥

[#2]: r̥0 saṁ0 2.41.11.

yadr̥cchāyāmasaṁvr̥ttau gatirēva tasmin 5
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

5. If by chance (through the pupil's stupidity the teaching) is not completed, obedience towards the (teacher is the pupil's only refuge). [#3] 

[#3]:  Manu II, 218.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yadr̥cchāyāmasaṁvr̥ttau gatirēva tasmin ॥ 4॥  

**ṭīkā**  
samānamadhīyānēṣu māṇavakēṣu yadi kasyacidyadr̥cchayā dr̥ṣṭahētumantarēṇa buddhimāndyādinā'dhyayanasyā [#3]saṁvr̥ttissyāt adhītō bhāgō māṇavakāntaravannāgacchēt tadā tasyāṁ yahacchāyāmasaṁvr̥ttau tasminnācāryē gatirēva śuśrūṣaiva māṇavakasya śaraṇam । tathā ca manuḥ—  
[#4] yathā khanan khanitrēṇa narō vāryadhigacchati ।  
tathā gurugatāṁ vidyāṁ śuśrūdhuradhigacchati ॥ iti ।  
adhikaṁ śuśrūṣitō hi gurussarvātmanā taṁ śikṣayēditi ॥ 4 ॥  

[#3]: samāvr̥ttiḥ iti ka.pu.  

[#4]: ma0 smr̥0 2. 218
</details>
</details>

mātari pitaryācāryavacchuśrūṣā 6
