sarpaśīrṣī mr̥duraḥ kravyādō yē cānyē vikr̥tā yathā manuṣyaśirasaḥ 39
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

39. Nor the snake-headed fish, nor the alligator, nor those which live on flesh only, nor those which are misshaped (like) mermen. [#26] 

[#26]:  Haradatta closes this chapter on flesh-eating by quoting Manu V, 56, which declares flesh-eating, drinking spirituous liquor, and promiscuous intercourse to be allowable, but the abstinence therefrom of greater merit. He states that the whole chapter must be understood in this sense.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
sarpaśīrṣī mr̥duraḥ kravyādō yē cā'nyē vikr̥tā yathā manuṣyaśirasaḥ ॥ 39 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
sarpasyēva śirō yasya sō'pi matsyō na bhakṣyaḥ । mr̥durō makaraḥ yē ca kravyamēvā'danti śiṁśumārādayaḥ tē'pyabhakṣyāḥ। yē ca uktēbhyō'nyē matsyā vikr̥tākārāḥ । tatrōdāharaṇam-yathā manuṣyāśērasaḥ jalamanuṣyākhyā jalahastyādayaśca । tē'pi sarvē na bhakṣyāḥ । atra manuḥ—  
[#1] anumantā viśasitā nihantā krayavikrayī।  
saṁskartā cōpahartā ca khādakaścēti ghātakāḥ ॥  
[#2]māṁsabhakṣayitā'mutra yasya māṁsamihādmyaham ।  
ētanmāsasya māṁsatvaṁ pravadanti manīṣiṇaḥ ॥  
na māṁsabhakṣaṇē dōṣō na madhē na ca maithunē ।  
pravr̥ttirēṣā bhūtānāṁ nivr̥ttistu mahāphalā ॥' iti ।  
[#3]apratiṣiddhēṣvapi bhakṣaṇānnivr̥ttirēva jyāyasītyarthaḥ ॥ 39 ॥  

[#1]: ma0 smr̥0 5. 51.  

[#2]: ślōkō'yaṁ nāsti ka. pu.  

[#3]:

    “atrāpratiṣiddhēṣvapi nivr̥ttirēva jyāyasī bhakṣaṇapānamaithunādibhya ityarthaḥ' iti ga pu.।  

ityāpastambadharmasūtrē saptadaśī kaṇḍikā ॥   
iti cāpastambadharmasūtravr̥ttau haradattamiśraviracitāyāmujjvalāyāṁ prathamapraśnē pañcamaḥ paṭalaḥ ॥ 5 ॥
</details>
</details>

  

iti pañcamaḥ paṭalaḥ

## +06

### 18 abhōjyādi

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

madhvāmaṁ mārgaṁ māṁsaṁ bhūmir mūlaphalāni rakṣā-gavyūtir-nivēśanaṁ yugyaghāsaś cōgrataḥ pratigr̥hyāṇi 1
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

1. Honey, uncooked (grain), venison, land, roots, fruits, (a promise of) safety, a pasture for cattle, a house, and fodder for a draught-ox may be accepted (even) from an Ugra. [#1] 

[#1]:  18. Manu IV, 247. 'Ugra denotes either a bad twice-born man. or the offspring of a Vaiśya and of a Śūdra-woman. Other persons of a similar character must be understood to be included by the term.'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
madhvāmaṁ mārgaṁ māṁsaṁ bhūmir mūlaphalāni rakṣā-gavyūtir-nivēśanaṁ yugyaghāsaś cōgrataḥ pratigr̥hyāṇi ॥ 1 ॥

**prastāvaḥ**  
ēvaṁ tāvannimittaduṣṭaṁ jātiduṣṭaṁ kāladuṣṭaṁ cā'bhōjyamuktam । tatra nimittaduṣṭaṁ yasya kulē mriyētē(pr̥. 92.)tyādi । jātiduṣṭaṁ kalañjādi । kāladuṣṭaṁ paryuṣitādi । idānīṁ pratigrahāśucīni kānicidanujñāya kānicit pratiṣēdhati—  

**ṭīkā**  
madhu pakvamapakvaṁ vā । āmaṁ taṇḍulādi । mr̥gasya vikārō mārgaṁ māṁsam । bhūmiḥ śālēyādikṣētram । viśramasthānamityanyē । mūlaphalāni[#1] mūlakāmrādīni । rakṣā abhayadānam । gavyūtirgōmārgaḥ । nivēśanaṁ gr̥ham । yugaṁ vahatīti yugyō balīvardaḥ । tasya ghāsō bhakṣyaṁ palālādi। ētānyugratō'pi pratigr̥hyāṇi pratigrāhyāṇi adurbhikṣē'pi । ugrapāpakarmā dvijātiḥ, vaiśyādvā śudrāyāṁ jātaḥ । ugragrahaṇaṁ tādr̥śānāmupalakṣaṇam ॥ 1 ॥   

[#1]: mūlakandādīni iti ka. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ētānyapi nānantēvāsyāhr̥tānīti hārītaḥ 2
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

2. Hārita declares, that even these (presents) are to be accepted only if they have been obtained by a pupil.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ētānyapi nā'nantēvāsyāhr̥tānīti hārītaḥ ॥ 2 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ētāni madhvādīnyapi antēvāsyāhr̥tānyēva pratigrāhyāṇi, na svayamugrata iti hārīta ācāryō manyatē ॥2॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

āmaṁ vā gr̥hṇīran 3
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

3. Or they (Brāhmaṇa householders) may accept (from an Ugra) uncooked or (a little) unflavoured boiled food.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
āmaṁ vā gr̥hṇīran ॥ 3 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
pūrvōktēṣvāmaṁ svayamēva vā gr̥hṇīran dvijā iti[#2] hārītasyaiva pakṣaḥ ॥ 3 ॥  

[#2]:

    hārītācāryasya, iti cha. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

kr̥tānnasya vā virasasya 4
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

4. (Of such food) they shall not take a great quantity (but only so much as suffices to support life). [#2] 

[#2]:  Also this rule seems to belong to Hārita, on account of its close connection with the preceding two.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
kr̥tānnasya vā virasasya ॥ 4 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
āmasyā'lābhē kr̥tānnasyā'pi virasasya lavaṇādirasāsaṁyuktasya । ṣaṣṭhī nirdēśāta stōkam । svayamantēvāsyāhr̥taṁ vā gr̥hṇīran ॥ 4 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

na subhikṣāḥ syuḥ 5
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

5. If (in times of distress) he is unable to keep himself, he may eat (food obtained from anybody),
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
na subhikṣāḥ syuḥ ॥ 5 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
anantarōktavidhānadvayē yadgr̥hītamannaṁ tēna subhikṣāḥ suhitā na bhavēyurēva । yāvatā prāṇayātrā bhavati tāvadēva gr̥hṇīran , na yāvatā sauhityaṁ tāvaditi ॥5॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

svayamapyavr̥ttau suvarṇaṁ dattvā paśuṁ vā bhuñjīta 6
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

6. After having touched it (once) with gold,
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
svayamapyavr̥ttau suvarṇaṁ datvā paśuṁ vā bhuñjīta ॥ 6 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yadi tu durbhikṣatayā ātmanō'pi vr̥ttirna labhyatē prāgēva pōṣyavargasya, tadā svayamapyavr̥ttau yatraiva labhyatē tatraiva kr̥tānnamapi bhuñjīta । tatra guṇavidhiḥ- suvarṇaṁ datvā sakr̥dēvōpaklr̥ptamupariṣṭātsuvarṇēna spr̥ṣṭvā । ētēna paśuṁ vā datvētyapi vyākhyātam । 'paśuragniḥ, [#1]agniḥ paśurāsīditi mantraliṅgāt[#2] gōsūktēnā'gnērupasthānadarśanācca ॥ 6 ॥  

[#1]: tai0 saṁ0 5. 7. 26.  

[#2]: r̥0 saṁ0 6. 28. 1
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

nātyantamanvavasyēt 7
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

7. Or (having touched it with) fire.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
nā'tyantamanvavasyēt ॥ 7 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
na punaratyantamanvavasīdēt ॥ 7 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

vr̥ttiṁ prāpya viramēt 8
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

8. He shall not be too eager after (such a way of living). He shall leave it when he has obtained a (lawful) livelihood. [#3] 

[#3]:  Haradatta quotes, in support of the last Sūtras, a passage of the Chāndogya Upaniṣad, I, 10, 1, and one from the .Ṛj-veda, IV, 18, 13, according to which it would be lawful to eat even impure food, as a dog's entrails, under such circumstances. Other commentators explain this and the preceding three Sūtras differently. According to them the translation would run thus: 'If he himself does not find any livelihood (in times of distress, he may dwell even with low-caste people who give him something to eat, and) he may eat (food given by them) paying for it with (some small gift in) gold or with animals.' This second explanation is perhaps preferable.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
vr̥ttiṁ prāpya viramēt ॥ 8 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yadā vihitā vr̥ttilabhyatē tadā niṣiddhāyā viramēt । na punas"sakr̥tpravr̥ttāyā kimavakuṇṭhanēnē"ti nyāyēna tatraiva ramēta । atra chāndōgyōpaniṣat-[#3]'maṭacīhatēṣu kuruṣvāṭikyā saha jāyayōṣastirha cākrāyaṇa ibhyagrāmē pradrāṇaka uvāsa। sa hēbhyaṁ kulmāṣān khādantaṁ bibhikṣē' ityādi । mantravarṇaśca bhavati[#4] 'avarttyā śuna antrāṇi pēca' iti । avarttyā vr̥tyabhāvēna । apara āha- durbhikṣē svayamapyavr̥ttau ā tannivr̥ttēryatra kutracinnīcē'pi dātari bhuñjānō vasēt yāṁ ca yāvatīṁ ca svarṇamātrā vā kañcana paśuṁ vā tasmai datvā । na punaratyantamanvavasyēt vr̥ttiṁ prāpya viramēditi ॥ 8॥  

[#3]:

    chā0 u0 1. 10. “maṭacīhatēṣu maṭacyaḥ aśanayaḥ tābhirhatēṣu nāśitēṣu kuruṣu sasyēṣvityarthaḥ । tatō durbhikṣē jātē āṭikyā anupajātapayōdharādistrivyañjanayā jāyayā upastirha nāmataḥ cakrasyāpatyaṁ cākrāyaṇaḥ ibhaḥ hastī tamarhatītībhyaḥ īśvaraḥ' hastyārōhō vā । tasya grāmaḥ ibhyagrāmaḥ tasmin pradrāṇakaḥ annālābhāt । drā kutsāyāṁ gatau। kutsitā gatiṁ gataḥ । antyāvasthāṁ prāpta ityarthaḥ । uvāsa uṣitavān kasyacidgr̥hamāśritya। sō'nnārthamaṭannibhyaṁ kulmāṣān kutsitānmāṣān khādantaṁ bhakṣayantaṁ yadr̥cchayōpalabhya vibhikṣē" iti śāṅkarabhāṣyam।  

[#4]: r̥0saṁ0 4. 18, 13.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

trayāṇāṁ varṇānāṁ kṣatriyaprabhr̥tīnāṁ samāvr̥ttēna na bhōktavyam 9
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

9. (A student of the Brahmanic caste) who has returned home shall not eat (in the house) of people belonging to the three tribes, beginning with the Kṣatriya (i. e. of Kṣatriyas, Vaiśyas, and Śūdras). [#4] 

[#4]:  Manu IV, 219, and 223.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
trayāṇāṁ varṇānāṁ kṣatriyaprabhr̥tīnāṁ samāvr̥ttēna na bhōktavyam ॥ 9 ॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
ēvamāpadi vr̥ttimuktvā subhikṣē'nāpadi vr̥ttimāha—  

**ṭīkā**  
samāvr̥ttō dvijātiḥ kṣatriyādīnāṁ trayāṇāṁ varṇānāṁ gr̥hē na bhuñjīta ॥9॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

prakatyā brāhmaṇasya bhōktavyaṁ kāraṇādabhōjyam 10
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

10. He may (usually) eat (the food) of a Brāhmaṇa on account of (the giver's) character (as a Brāhmaṇa). It must be avoided for particular reasons only.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
prakr̥tyā brāhmaṇasya bhōktavyamakāraṇādabhōjyam ॥10॥

**ṭīkā**  
brāhmaṇasyānnaṁ prakr̥tyā svabhāvēnaiva bhōktavyam । kāraṇādēva svabhōjyam ॥10॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yatrāprāyaścittaṁ karmāsēvatē prāyaścittavati 11
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

11. He shall not eat in a house where (the host) performs a rite which is not a rite of penance, whilst he ought to perform a penance. [#5] 

[#5]:  If a Brāhmaṇa who has been ordered to perform a penance, performs a Vaiśvadeva or other rite without heeding the order of his spiritual teacher, then a student who has returned home ought not to eat in his house, until the enjoined penance has been performed.'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yatrā'prāyaścittaṁ karmā''sēvatē prāyaścittavati ॥ 11 ॥

**prastāvaḥ**  
kāraṇamāha —  

**ṭīkā**  
[#1] yatra yadā vaiśvadēvāgnihōtrādīni nityamābhyudayikaṁ vā'prāyaścittaṁ karmā''sēvatē tātparyēṇa karōti prāyaścittavatyātmani cōditaṁ prāyaścittaṁ  [#2]prāṇāyāmōpavāsavidhikr̥cchrādi na karōti tadā ētasmāt kāraṇāta brāhmaṇasyā'nnamabhōjyamiti ॥ 11 ॥  

[#1]:

    yatra yadā agnihōtravaiśvadēvādyakaraṇē prāyaścitaṁ muktvā tadanurūpaṁ, nityamābhyudayikaṁ vā karmāsēvatē tātparyēṇa karōti na prāyaścittavatyātmani cōditē prāyaścittaṁ, tadaitasmātkāraṇādabhōjyamiti iti • ka pu.  

[#2]: prāṇāyāmapathikr̥dādi iti. kha.pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

caritanirvēṣasya bhōktavyam 12
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

12. But when the penance has been performed, he may eat (in that house). [#6] 

[#6]:  'The use of the part. perf. pass. "performed" indicates that he must not eat there, whilst the penance is being performed.'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
caritanirvēṣasya bhōktavyam ॥ 12 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
caritō nirvēṣaḥ prāyaścittaṁ yēna tasyā'nnaṁ bhōktavyam । tadbhōjanē na dōṣaḥ । niṣṭhayā bhūtakālasyā'bhidhānāccaryamāṇē'pi nirvēṣē na bhōktavyam । kiṁ tarhi ? caritē ॥ 12 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

sarvavarṇānāṁ svadharmē vartamānānāṁ bhōktavyaṁ, śūdra-varjamityēkē 13
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

13. According to some (food offered by people) of any caste, who follow the laws prescribed for them, except that of Śūdras, may be eaten.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
sarvavarṇānāṁ svadharmē vartamānānāṁ bhōktavyaṁ śudravarjamityēkē ॥ 13 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
śūdravarjitānāṁ svadharmē vartamānānāṁ trayāṇāṁ varṇānāmannaṁ bhōjyam । na brāhmaṇasyaivētyēka manyantē ॥ 13 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

+++(śūdrasya)+++ tasyāpi dharmōpanatasya +++(= dharmārtham āśritasya)+++ 14
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

14. (In times of distress) even the food of a Śūdra, who lives under one's protection for the sake of spiritual merit, (may be eaten). [#7] 

[#7]:  Yājñ. 1, 166.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
+++(śūdrasya)+++ tasyāpi dharmōpanatasya +++(= dharmārtham āśritasya)+++ ॥ 14॥  

**ṭīkā**  
tasyā'pi śūdrasyā'nnaṁ bhōjyam , yadyasō dharmārthamupanataḥ āśritō bhavati । dharmagrahaṇādarthārthamupanatasyā'bhōjyam । āpatkalpaścā'yam ॥ 14 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

suvarṇaṁ datvā paśuṁ vā bhuñjīta nātyantamanvavasyēdvr̥ttiṁ prāpya viramēt 15
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

15. He may eat it, after having touched it (once) with gold or with fire. He shall not be too eager after (such a way of living). He shall leave it when he obtains a (lawful) livelihood. [#8] 

[#8]:  Manu IV, 223
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
suvarṇaṁ datvā paśuṁ vā bhuñjīta nā'tyantamanvavasyēdvr̥ttiṁ prāpya viramēt ॥ 15 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
gatam ॥ 15 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

saṅghānnamabhōjyam 16
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

16. Food received from a multitude of givers must not be eaten, [#9] 

[#9]:  Manu IV, 209.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
saṅghānnamabhōjyam ॥ 16 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
saṅghō gaṇaḥ tasya yat svamannaṁ na tvēkasya । tadabhōjyaṁ yadyapi tē sarvē dadyuḥ ॥ 16 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

parikruṣṭaṁ +++(=sarvān bhōjanārtham āhvānti yē)+++ ca 17
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

17. Nor food offered by a general invitation (to all comers). [#10] 

[#10]:  Manu IV, 209; Yājñ. I, 168.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
parikruṣṭaṁ +++(=sarvān bhōjanārtham āhvānti yē)+++ ca ॥ 17 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
'bhōktukāmā āgacchata' ityēvaṁ parikruśya sarvata āhūya yaddīyatē tatparikruṣṭaṁ tadabhōjyam ॥ 17 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

sarvēṣāṁ ca śilpājīvānām 18
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

18. Food offered by an artisan must not be eaten, [#11] 

[#11]:  Manu IV, 2 10, 215; Yājñ. I, 162-164.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
sarvēṣāṁ ca śilpājīvānām ॥ 18 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
citranirmāṇādikaṁ śilpa yē ājīvanti[#1] tēṣāṁ sarvēṣāmapi brāhmaṇādīnāmannamabhōjyam ॥ 18 ॥  

[#1]:

    ājīvanti ityantataraṁ 'ājīvanti tēna yē jīvanti' ityadhikaṁ ka. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yē ca śastramājīvanti 19
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

19. Nor (that of men) who live by the use of arms (with the exception of Kṣatriyas), [#12] 

[#12]:  Yājñ. I, 164.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yē ca śastramājīvanti ॥ 19 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yē ca śastrēṇa jīvanti tēṣāmapyannamabhōjyam । kṣatriyavarjama,[#2]tasya vihitatvāt ॥ 19 ॥  

[#2]:

    tasya vihitatvāt , iti nāsti ka. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yē cādhim +++(bhāṭakagrāhakāḥ)+++ 20
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

20. Nor (that of men) who live by letting lodgings or land.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yē cā''dhim ॥20॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ājīvantītyapēkṣatē । svagr̥hē parān vāsayitvā tēbhyō bhr̥tigrahaṇamādhiḥ, yaḥ stōma iti prasiddhaḥ ॥  
parabhūmau kuṭiṁ kr̥tvā stōmaṁ datvā vasēttu yaḥ'। iti ।  
taṁ cā''dhiṁ yē ājīvanti tēṣāmapyannamabhōjyam । yē tu prasiddhamādhimājīvanti tēṣāṁ vārdhuṣikatvādēva[#3] siddhō niṣēdhaḥ ॥ 20 ॥  

[#3]:

    abhōjyānnatvaṁ siddham, iti kha. ga.pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

bhiṣak 21
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

21. A (professional) physician is a person whose food must not be eaten, [#13] 

[#13]:  Manu IV, 212; Yājñ. I, 162.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
bhiṣak ॥ 21॥  

**ṭīkā**  
abhōjyānna iti prakaraṇādgamyatē । bhiṣak bhaiṣajyavr̥tiḥ। dharmārthaṁ tu yē sarpadaṣṭādīṁścikitsanti tē bhōjyānnā ēva ॥ 21 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

vārdhuṣikaḥ +++(vr̥ddhyupajīvinaḥ)+++ 22
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

22. (Also) a usurer, [#14] 

[#14]:  Manu IV, 210; Yājñ. I, 161.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
vārdhuṣikaḥ ॥ 22 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
vr̥ddhyājavī । sō'pyabhōjyānaḥ ॥ 22 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

dīkṣitō'krītarājakaḥ 23
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

23. (Also) a Brāhmaṇa who has performed the Dīkṣaṇīyeṣṭi (or initiatory ceremony of the Soma-sacrifice) before he has bought the king (Soma). [#15] 

[#15]:  'That is to say, one who has begun, but not finished a Soma-sacrifice.'--Haradatta. Manu IV, 210, and Gopatha-brāhmaṇa III, 19.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

###### mantra
dīkṣitō'krītarājakaḥ ॥ 23 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
dīkṣitō [#4] dīkṣaṇīyēṣṭayā saṁskr̥taḥ sō'pi yāvat krītarājakō na bhavati sōmakrayaṁ na karōti tāvadabhōjyānnaḥ ॥ 23 ॥

[#4]:

    jyōtiṣṭōmē—'āgnāvaiṣṇavamēkādaśakapālaṁ nirvapēt dīkṣiṣyamāṇa', ityanēna dakṣiṇīyēṣṭirnāma kācidiṣṭirvihitā । sā ca yajamānasaṁskārārthā, iti nirṇītaṁ pūrvamīmāṁsāyāṁ pañcamādhyāyē। tayā saṁskr̥tō yajamānō yāvat yāgārthadravyaṁ sōmalatāṁ na krīṇāti tāvatparyantamityarthaḥ । prathamadinē 'aparāhṇē dīkṣayēt' iti aparāhvē dīkṣā vihitā । tataḥ pūrva dīkṣaṇīyēṣṭi । tatsamanantaradanē sōmakrayaṇaṁ vihitam । tataśca prathamadinē'parāhṇādanantaraṁ dvitīyadinamadhyāhnāt pūrvaṁ dīkṣitānnaṁ na bhōktavyamitti phalitam । idaṁ caikadīkṣā pakṣē । anēkadīkṣāpakṣē tu tadanurōdhēna dinasaṁkhyāvr̥ddhiḥ pratyētavyā ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

agnīṣōmīyasaṁsthāyāmēva 24
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

24. (The food given by a person who has performed the Dīkṣaṇīyeṣṭi may be eaten), when the victim sacred to Agni and Soma has been slain.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
agnīṣōmīya saṁsthāyāmēva ॥ 24 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
bhōktavyamiti vakṣyamāṇamapēkṣatē । agnīṣōmīyē paśau saṁsthitē samāpta ēva bhōktavyam । na prāgiti ॥ 24 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

hutāyāṁ vā vapāyāṁ dīkṣitasya bhōktavyam 25
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

25. Or after that the omentum of the victim (sacred to Agni and Soma) has been offered. [#16] 

[#16]:  Aitareya-brāhmaṇa II, 1, 9.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
hutāyāṁ vapāyāṁ dīkṣitasya bhōktavyam ॥ 25 ॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
pakṣāntaramāha—

**ṭīkā**  
agnīṣōmīyasya vapāyāṁ hutāyāṁ vā dīkṣitasyānnaṁ bhōktavyam । tathā ca bahvr̥cabrāhmaṇam-'aśitavyaṁ vapāyāṁ hutāyām' iti ॥ 25 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yajñārthē vā nirdiṣṭē śēṣādbhuñjīrann iti hi brāhmaṇam 26
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

26. For a Brāhmaṇa declares, 'Or they may eat of the remainder of the animal, after having set apart a portion for the offering.'
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
[#1]yajñārthaṁ vā nirdiṣṭē śēṣādbhuñjīranniti hi brāhmaṇam ॥ 16 ॥

**prastāvaḥ**  
pakṣāntaramāha —

**ṭīkā**  
idaṁ yajñārthamiti vyādēśē kr̥tē śēṣādbhuñjīranniti brāhmaṇaṁ bhavati । brāhmaṇagrahaṇaṁ prītyupalabdhitaḥ pravr̥ttērapasmr̥titā mā bhūditi pratyakṣamēvā'tra brāhmaṇamiti ॥ 26 ॥  

[#1]:

    Cf. āpa0 śrau0 10 15 16.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

klībaḥ 27
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

27. A eunuch (is a person whose food must not be eaten), [#17] 

[#17]:  Manu I V, 211; Yājñ. I, 161.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
klībaḥ ॥ 27 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
paṇḍakaḥ । sō'pyabhōjyānnaḥ ॥27॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

rājñāṁ praiṣakaraḥ 28
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

28. (Likewise) the (professional) messenger employed by a king (or others), [#18] 

[#18]:  The village or town messengers are always men of the lowest castes, such as the Mahārs of Mahārāṣṭhra.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
rājñāṁ praiṣakaraḥ ॥28॥  

**ṭīkā**  
rājñāmiti bahuvacanāt grāmādēryaḥ praiṣakaraḥ tasyā'pi pratiṣēdhaḥ ॥ 28 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ahaviryājī 29
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

29. (Likewise a Brāhmaṇa) who offers substances that are not fit for a sacrifice, [#19] 

[#19]:  'For example, he who offers human blood in a magic rite.'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ahaviryājī ॥ 29 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yaścā'haviṣā nararudhirādinā yajatē'bhicārādau yathā 'yamabhicarēttasya lōhitamavadānaṁ kr̥tvē'ti sō'pyabhājyānnaḥ ॥ 29 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

cārī 30
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

30. (Likewise) a spy, [#20] 

[#20]:  Haradatta explains cārī, translated by 'spy,' to mean 'a p. 69 secret adherent of the Śākta sect' (gūḍhacārī, śāktaḥ). The existence of this sect in early times has not hitherto been proved.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
cārī ॥ 30॥  

**ṭīkā**  
cārō gūḍhacaraḥ spaśaḥ । sō'pyabhōjyānaḥ ॥ 30 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

avidhinā ca pravrajitaḥ 31
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

31. (Also) a person who has become an ascetic without (being authorized thereto by) the rules (of the law), [#21] 

[#21]:  Haradatta gives the Śākyas or Bauddhas as an instance. But it is doubtful, whether Āpastamba meant to refer to them, though it seems probable that heretics are intended.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
avidhinā ca pravrajitaḥ ॥ 31 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yaścā'vidhinā pravrajitaḥ śākyādissō'pyabhōjyānnaḥ ॥ 31 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yaścāgnīnapāsyati 32
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

32. (Also) he who forsakes the sacred fires without performing the sacrifice necessary on that occasion), [#22] 

[#22]:  Yājñ. I, 160.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yaścā'gnīnapāsyati ॥ 32 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
[#1](yō'nāpadyagniṁ tyaktvā prāyaścittaṁ na karōti sō'pyabhōjyānnaḥ । api ca) avidhinētyēva । yaścā'vidhinā utsargēṣṭayā vinā'nagnīnapāsyati sō'pyabhōjyānnaḥ ॥ 32 ॥  

[#1]:

    kuṇḍalāntargatō'dhikaḥ ka pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yaśca sarvānvarjayatē, sarvānnī ca śrōtriyō +++('pi)+++, nirākr̥tir +++(=asvādhyāyaḥ)+++ vr̥ṣalīpatiḥ 33
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

33. Likewise a learned Brāhmaṇa who avoids everybody, or eats the food of anybody, or neglects the (daily) recitation of the Veda, (and) he whose (only living) wife is of the Śūdra caste. [#23] 

[#23]:  'Who avoids everybody, i.e. who neither invites nor dines with anybody.'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yaśca sarvānvarjayatē, sarvānnī ca śrōtriyō +++('pi)+++, nirākr̥tir +++(=asvādhyāyaḥ)+++ vr̥ṣalīpatiḥ ॥ 33 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yaśca sarvān varjayatē bhōjanē na kvacidbhuṅktē na kaścidbhōjayati sa sarvavarjī। yaśca sarvānnī sarvēṣāmannaṁ bhuṅktē tāvubhāvapyabhōjyānnau । śrōtriya ityubhayōśśēṣaḥ । śrōtriyō'pi sannabhōjyānna ēvēti । nirākr̥tiḥ niḥsvādhyāyaḥ । nirvrata ityanyē । sō'pyabhōjyānna । br̥ṣalīpatiḥ kramavivāhē yasya vr̥ṣalī patnī jīvati itarā mr̥tāḥ sa vr̥ṣalīpatiḥ । sa śrōtriyō'pyabhōjyānna iti ॥ 33 ॥  

ityāpastambadharmasūtravr̥ttāvaṣṭādaśī kaṇḍikā ॥ 18 ॥
</details>
</details>

### 19 bhōjyānnāḥ

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

matta unmattō baddhō 'ṇikaḥ+++(=putrāc chrutagrāhī)+++ pratyupaviṣṭō+++(?)+++ yaśca pratyupavēśayatē tāvantaṁ kālam 1 …

</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

1. A drunkard, a madman, a prisoner, he who learns the Veda from his son, a creditor who sits with his debtor (hindering the fulfilment of his duties), a debtor who thus sits (with his creditor, are persons whose food must not be eaten) as long as they are thus engaged or in that state. [#1] 

[#1]:  19. Manu IV, 207; Yājñ. I, 161, 162. Another commentator explains aṇika, translated above 'he who learns the Veda from his son,' by 'a money-lender,' and combines pratyupaviṣṭaḥ with this word, i.e. 'a money-lender who sits with his debtor hindering him from fulfilling his duties.' This manner of forcing a debtor to pay, which is also called Ācarita (see Manu VIII, 49), is, though illegal, resorted to sometimes even now.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
matta unmattō baddhō'ṇikaḥ pratyupaviṣṭō yaśca pratyupavēśayatē tāvantaṁ kālam ॥ 1 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
madakaradravyasēvayā [#2]vikr̥tiṁ gatō mattaḥ । unmattō māntaḥ । baddhō nigalitaḥ। aṇikaḥ putrāt śrutagrāhī, putrācārya iti śāstrēṣu ninditaḥ। pratyupaviṣṭaḥ r̥ṇādinā kāraṇēnā'dhamarṇādikaṁ nirudhya tatpārśva upaviṣṭaḥ । pratyupēvaśayitā tvitaraḥ, tasya parihāramakurvaṁstēna saha kāmaṁ suciramāsyatāmityāsīnaḥ । tā ētē mattādayastāvantaṁ kālamabhōjyānnāḥ, yāvanmadādyanuvr̥ttiḥ । apara āha- aṇikaḥ r̥ṇasya dātā pratyupavēṣṭuridaṁ viśēṣaṇamiti ॥ 1॥  

[#2]: aprakr̥tiṁ iti. kha. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ka aśyānnaḥ 2  
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

2. Who (then) are those whose food may be eaten? [#2] 

[#2]:  'The object of this Sūtra is to introduce the great variety of opinions quoted below.'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ka āśyānnaḥ ॥ 2॥

**ṭīkā**  
yadyētē abhājyānnōḥ kastahi āśyānnaḥ ? kasya tarhyannamaśanīyamiti । yadyapyētē abhōjyānnā ityuktē pariśiṣṭā bhōjyānnā iti gamyatē । tathāpyanēkamatōpanyāsārthaṁ praśnapūrvaka ārambhaḥ ॥ 2 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ya īpsēd+++(=prārthyatē [bhōktavyamiti, tasyānna])+++ iti kaṇvaḥ 3
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

3. Kaṇva declares, that it is he who wishes to give.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ya īpsēditi kaṇvaḥ ॥ 3 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ya ēva prārthayatē sa ēvā''śyānna iti kaṇvar̥ṣirmanyatē [#1]pratiṣiddhavarjam ॥ 3 ॥  

[#1]:

    pratiṣiddhavarjam , iti nāsti ka. pustakē ।
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

puṇya +++(anna)+++ iti kautsaḥ 4
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

4. Kautsa declares, that it is he who is holy. [#3] 

[#3]:  'Holy' means not only 'following his lawful occupations,' but particularly 'practising austerities, reciting prayers, and offering burnt-oblations.'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
puṇya iti kautsaḥ ॥ 4 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
sarvavarṇānāṁ svadharmē vartamānānā'(18.13.)mityuktatvāt bhōjyānnāssarvē puṇyā ēva । iha punaḥ puṇyagrahaṇamatiśayārtham । tapōhōmajapyaiḥ kṣvadharmēṇa ca yuktaḥ puṇyaḥ । sa svayamaprārthayamānō'pi bhōjyānna iti kautsasya pakṣaḥ ॥ 4 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yaḥ kaścid dadyāditi vārṣyāyaṇiḥ +++(āpastambēnāyam pakṣō nirākariṣyatē 'grē)+++5  

</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

5. Vārshyāyaṇi declares, that it is every giver (of food).
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yaḥ kaściddadyāditi vārṣyāyaṇiḥ ॥ 5 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yaḥ kaścitpuṇyō'puṇyō vā satataṁ dānaśīlaḥ । sa bhōjyānna iti vārṣyāyaṇirāha।  
tathā ca manuḥ—  
[#2]śraddhāpūtaṁ vadānyasya hatamaśraddhayētarat ।' iti ॥ 5 ॥   

[#2]: ma0 smr̥0 4. 228
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yadi ha rajaḥ +++(=pāpam)+++ sthāvaraṁ - puruṣē bhōktavyam, atha cēc calaṁ - dānēna nirdōṣō bhavati 6
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

6. For if guilt remains fixed on the man (who committed a crime, then food given by a sinner) may be eaten (because the guilt cannot leave the sinner). But if guilt can leave (the sinner at any time, then food given by the sinner may be eaten because) he becomes pure by the gift (which he makes).
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yadi hi rajaḥ sthāvaraṁ puruṣē bhōktavyamatha cēccalaṁ dānēna nirdōṣō bhavati ॥ 6॥

**prastāvaḥ**  
atrōpapattiḥ —

**ṭīkā**  
rajaḥ pāpam । tadyadi puruṣē kartari sthāvaraṁ sthiraṁ nōpabhōgamantarēṇa kṣīyatē tadā tataḥ pratigrahē'pi bhōktari saṁkramābhāvāt bhōktavyam । atha cēccalamupabhōgamantarēṇā'pi kṣīyatē tadā satatadānaśīlē na muhūrtamapi pāpamavatiṣṭhata iti kutō bhōkturdōṣa iti ॥ 6॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

śuddhā bhikṣā bhōktavyā +++(iti)+++ ēkakuṇikau kāṇvakutsau tathā puṣkarasādiḥ 7
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

7. Offered food, which is pure, may be eaten, according to Eka, Kuṇika, Kāṇva, Kutsa, and Pushkarasādi.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
śuddhā bhikṣā bhōktavyaikakuṇikau kāṇvakutsau tathā puṣkarasādiḥ ॥ 7 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
dhārmikēṇōdyatā āhr̥tā bhikṣā śuddhā । sā bhōjyētyēkādīnāṁ pañcānāṁ pakṣaḥ । puṣkarasādiḥ[#3] pauṣkarasādiḥ । ādivr̥ddhyabhāvaśchāndasaḥ ॥7॥  

[#3]:

    'ācāryaḥ' ityadhika ka. pustakē,
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

sarvatōpētaṁ +++(=aprārthya labdham bhōjyamiti)+++ vārṣyāyaṇīyam  +++(matam - āpastambō nirākariṣyatyagrē)+++8   

</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

8. Vārshyāyaṇi's opinion is, that (food) given unasked (may be accepted) from anybody.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
sarvatōpētaṁ vārṣyāyaṇīyam ॥ 8॥  

**ṭīkā**  
sarvata upētaṁ sarvatōpētam । chāndasō guṇaḥ । upētamayācitōṣapannam । tatsarvatō'pi bhōjyamiti vārṣyāyaṇīyaṁ matam ॥ 8॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

puṇyasyēpsatō +++('nnasya)+++ bhōktavyam +++(ityāpastambaniścayaḥ)+++ 9
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

9. (Food offered) willingly by a holy man may be eaten.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
puṇyasyēpsatō bhōktavyam ॥ 9 ॥

**prastāvaḥ**  
idānīṁ svamatamāha—

**ṭīkā**  
kaṇvakutsayōḥ pakṣau samuccitāvācāryasya pakṣaḥ[#1] ॥9॥

[#1]: 'ācāryasya pakṣēṇa' iti ka, pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

puṇyasyāpy +++(dātum)+++ anīpsatō na bhōktavyam 10
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

10. Food given unwillingly by a holy man ought not to be eaten. [#4] 

[#4]:  Another commentator explains this Sūtra thus: 'He need not eat the food offered by a righteous man, if he himself does not wish to do so.'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
puṇyasyā'pyanīpsatō na bhōktavyam ॥ 10 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yaḥ prārthitō'pi nētyasakaduktvā kathaṁcidāpāditēpsa[#2] sō'nīpsannityucyatē, tasya puṇyasyā'pyabhōjyamiti । apara āha-anīpsata iti kartari ṣaṣṭhī । puṇyasyāpyannaṁ na bhōjyaṁ, yadi bhikṣamāṇaḥ pūrvavairādinā svayamīpsanna bhavatīti ॥10॥  

[#2]:

    sō'lpēpsussannanīpsannityucyatē' iti ka pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yataḥ kutaścābhyudyataṁ bhōktavyam 11
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

11. Food offered unasked by any person whatsoever may be eaten,
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yataḥ kutaścā'bhyudyataṁ bhōktavyam ॥ 11 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
'sarvatōpēta'(198.)mityuktamēva punarucyatē viśēṣavivakṣayā ॥11॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

nānaniyōgapūrvamiti hārītaḥ 12
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

12. 'But not if it be given after an express previous announcement;' thus says Hārita.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
nā'naniyōgapūrvamiti hārītaḥ ॥ 12 ॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
tamāha—

**ṭīkā**  
'adya tubhyāmidamāhariṣyāmi tadatrabhavatā grāhya'miti nivēdanaṁ niyōgaḥ । tadabhāvaḥ aniyōgaḥ । punarnañsamāsaḥ । dvau nañau prakr̥tamarthaṁ gamayataḥ । ananiyōgō niyōgaḥ tatpūrvaṁ cēdabhyudyataṁ na bhōjyamiti ॥ 12 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

atha purāṇē ślōkāvudāharanti । udyatāmāhr̥tāṁ bhikṣāṁ purastādapravēditām । bhōjyāṁ mēnē prajāpatirapi duṣkr̥takāriṇaḥ । na tasya pitarō'śnanti daśa varṣāṇi pañca ca । na ca havyaṁ vahatyagniryastāmabhyadhimanyata iti 13
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

13. Now they quote also in a Purāṇa the following two verses: [#5] 

[#5]:  See Manu IV, 248 and 249, where these identical verses occur.

'The Lord of creatures has declared, that food offered unasked and brought by the giver himself, may be eaten, though (the giver be) a sinner, provided the gift has not been announced beforehand. The Manes of the ancestors of that man who spurns such food, do not eat (his oblations) for fifteen years, nor does the fire carry his offerings (to the gods).'
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**prastāvaḥ**  
atha purāṇē ślōkāvudāharanti—  

**sūtram**  
[#3]udyatāmāhr̥tāṁ bhikṣā purastādapravēditām ।  
bhōjyāṁ mēnē prajāpatirapi duṣkr̥takāriṇaḥ ॥   
na tasya pitarō'śnanti daśa varṣāṇi pañca ca ।  
na ca havyaṁ vahatyagniryastāmabhyadhimanyatē ॥ iti ॥ 13 ॥  

[#3]:

   nādyatanabhaviṣyatpurāṇīyamidaṁ vacanam । Cf manu 4. 251, 252.  

atha api ca purāṇē—  
[#1]sargaśca pratisargaśca vaṁśamanvantarāṇi ca ।  
vaṁśānucaritaṁ caiva purāṇaṁ pañcalakṣaṇam ॥'  
ityēvalakṣaṇē bhaviṣyadādau । udyatāṁ hastābhyāmudyamya dhāritām । āhr̥tāṁ svayamānītām । pūrvamanivēditāṁ bhikṣām । duṣkr̥takāriṇō'pi sakāśāt bhōjyā mēnē prajāpatirmanuḥ, manuḥ prajāpatirasmīti[#2]darśanāt । yastu tāmabhyadhimanyatē pratyācaṣṭē tasya pitaraḥ kavya nāśnanti । kiyantaṁ kālam ? daśa varṣāṇi pañca ca । agniśca havyaṁ na vahati । tāvantamēva kālamiti pratyākhyāturnindārthavādaḥ ॥ 13 ॥  

[#1]: amarakō0 1. vā 5.  

[#2]:

   manu prajāpatiryasminniti dakṣē darśanāt, iti ka. pu. prajāpatiryasminniti mānavē darśanāt' iti kha. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

cikitsakasya mr̥gayōḥ śalyakr̥ntasya pāśinaḥ । kulaṭāyāḥ ṣaṇḍhakasya ca tēṣāmannamanādyam 14
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

14. (Another verse from a Purāṇa declares): 'The food given by a physician, a hunter, a surgeon, a fowler, an unfaithful wife, or a eunuch must not be eaten.' [#6] 

[#6]:  Manu IV, 211, 212.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
[#3]cikitsakasya mr̥gayōśśalyakr̥ntasya pāśinaḥ ।  
kulaṭāyāṣṣaṇḍakasya ca tēṣāmannamanāyam ॥14॥  

**ṭīkā**  
cikitsakō bhiṣak । mr̥gayurmr̥gaghātī lubdhakaḥ । śalyakr̥ntaḥ śastrēṇa granthyādīnāṁ chēttā ambaṣṭhaḥ । pāśī pāśavān pāśajālēna mr̥gādīnāṁ grāhakaḥ। kulātkulamaṭatīti kulaṭā vyabhicāriṇī। ṣaṇḍakaḥ tr̥tīyāprakr̥tiḥ। ētēṣāṁ cikitsakādīnāmannamanādyam । cikitsakaṣaṇḍakayōḥ punarvacanamudyatasyā'pi pratiṣēdhārtham । [#4] pūrvatra tarhi grahaṇaṁ śakyamakartum । ēvaṁ tarhi sūtrakārasya sa pratiṣēdhaḥ । ayaṁ tu purāṇaślōkē pratiṣēdha ityapaunaruktyam ॥ 14 ॥  

[#3]: Cf manu0 4. 211. 212  

[#4]: pūrvatra tarhi grahaṇasya vaiyarthyam ।
</details>
</details>

athāpyudāharanti । annādē bhrūṇahā mārṣṭi anēnā abhiśaṁsati । stēnaḥ pramuktō rājani yācannanr̥tasaṅkara iti 15
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

15. Now (in confirmation of this) they quote (the following verse): 'The murderer of a Brāhmaṇa learned in the Veda heaps his guilt on his guest, an innocent man on his calumniator, a thief set at liberty on the king, and the petitioner on him who makes false promises.' [#7] 

[#7]:  Regarding the liberation of the thief, see Āpastamba I, 9, 25, 4. A similar verse occurs Manu VIII, 317, which has caused the confusion observable in many MSS., as has been stated in the critical notes to the text.

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
annādē bhrūṇahā mārṣṭi anēnā abhiśaṁsati ।  
stēnaḥ pramuktō rājani yācannanr̥tasaṅkarē ॥ iti ॥15॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
athā'pyudāharanti—  

**ṭīkā**  
ṣaḍaṅgasya vēdasyā'dhyētā bhrūṇaḥ । taṁ yō hatavān sa bhrūṇahā । sō'nnādē mārṣṭi limpati । kim ? prakaraṇādēna iti gamyatē । bhrūṇaghnō yō'nnamatti tasmiṁstadēna' saṁkrāmati । tasmāttasyōdyatamapyabhōjyamiti prakaraṇasaṅgataḥ pādaḥ । itarat purāṇaślōkē paṭhyamānē paṭhitam । anēnasaṁ yō'bhiśaṁsati mithyaiva brūtē- idaṁ tvayā kr̥tamiti । sa tasminnabhiśaṁsati tadēnō mārṣṭi। manustu—  
[#1]patitaṁ patitētyuktvā cōraṁ cōrēti vā punaḥ।  
vacanāttulyadōṣassyānmithyā dvirdōṣabhāgbhavēt ॥  
iti dvaiguṇyamāha । tadabhyāsē draṣṭavyam । stēnaḥ prakīrṇakēśa' (254.) iti vakṣyati । sa ēva tr̥tīyasya pādasyā'rthaḥ । kartr̥bhēdādapaunaruktyam । saṅkaraḥ pratijñā pratiśravaḥ । satyasaṅgara iti yathā । yaḥ pratiśrutya na dadāti sō'nr̥tasaṅkara iti । kakārastu chāndasaḥ । tasmin yācakaḥ svayamēnō mārṣṭi। tasmātpratiśrutaṁ dēyamiti ॥ 15 ॥   

[#1]:

    ma0 smr̥0 ślōkō'yamidānīṁ mudritakōśēṣu nōpalabhyatē ।  

॥ ityāpastambasūtravr̥ttāvēkōnaviṁśī kaṇḍikā ॥ 19 ॥  

iti cāpastambadharmasūtravr̥ttau haradattamiśraviracitāyāmujjvalāyāṁ prathamapraśnē ṣaṣṭhaḥ paṭalaḥ ॥ 6 ॥

tad yathā ''mrē phalārthē nirmitē

kimatrēdānīṁ dr̥ṣṭaṁ phalaṁ tyājyamēva ? nētyāha—

taditi vākyōpanyāsē । phalārthaṁ hyāmravr̥kṣō nirmīyatē ārōpyatē । tasmin phalārthē[#4]nimittē chāyā gandhaścā'nūtpadyētē। ēvaṁ dharmaṁ caryamāṇamarthāḥ khyātyādayō'nūtpadyantē anuniṣpadyantē । tathaiva svīkāryā-[#5]। na cōddēśyatayā।
tathā cāha—  
'yathēkṣuhētōḥ salilaṁ prasēcayaṁstr̥ṇāni vallīrapi ca prasiñcati ।  
tathā narō dharmapathēna vartayan yaśaśca kāmāṁśca vasūni cā'śnutē ॥ iti ॥3॥

**sūtram**  
anasūyurduṣpralambhaḥ syātkuhakaśaṭhanāstikabālavādēṣu ॥5॥

ēkāntē yathēṣṭacārī ।

**nāstikaḥ** [#1]prētyabhāvāpavādī ।

ētēṣāṁ vādēṣu **anasūyuḥ** syāt ।  
asūyayā dvēṣō lakṣyatē ।  
dvēṣṭā na syāt ।  
tān viṣayīkr̥tya  
dvēṣam api na kuryāt ।  

tathā **duṣpralambhaśca** syāt ।  
**pralambhanaṁ** vilavādanaṁ mithyā-phalākhyānam । [#2]  
gr̥dhivañcyōḥ pralambhana iti darśanāt । **duṣpralambhō** visaṁvādayituṁ  
mithyāphalākhyānēna pravartayitum aśakyaḥ । kuhakādivādēṣu vañcitō na syāt । tadaśō na syādityarthaḥ ॥ 5॥

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
na dharmādharmau carata'āvaṁ sva' iti, na dēvagandharvā na pitara ityācakṣatē''yaṁ dharmō'yamadharma, iti ॥ 6 ॥

vañcanasya sambhavamāha—

**ṭīkā**  
āvamiti chāndasaṁ rūpam । bhāṣāyāṁ tu[#3] prathamāyāśca dvivacanē bhāṣāyā'mityātvaṁ prāpnōti । yadi hi dharmādharmau vigrahavantau gōvyāghravaccarētāmāvāṁ sva iti vāṇī, yadi vā dēvādayaḥ prakr̥ṣṭajñānā brūyurimau dharmādharmāviti tataḥ kuhakādivādēṣu na syādvyañcanā । tadabhāvāttu vañcanāsambhava iti । idaṁ cātra draṣṭavyam-pratyakṣādērna gōcarau dharmādharmau। kiṁtu nityanirdōṣavēdagamyau । tadabhāvē tanmūladharmaśāstragamyāviti ॥ 6 ॥

7. But that is virtue, the practice of which wise men of the three twice-born castes praise; what they blame, is sin. [#1] 

[#1]:  20. The Sūtra is intended to show how the law should be ascertained in difficult cases. Haradatta quotes here the passage of Yājñ. I, 9, on Pariṣads, and states that the plural āryāḥ shows that three or four must be employed to arrive at a decision. See also Manu XII, 108 seq.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**ṭīkā**  
samyagvinītāḥ । ācāryādhīnaḥ syā'(2.19)dityādinā vinayanasampannāḥ । vr̥ddhāḥ pariṇatavayasaḥ। yauvanē viṣayavaśyatā'pi syāditīdamuktam । ātmavantō jitēndriyāḥ। alōlupā akr̥paṇāḥ । adāmbhikā adharmadhvajā, ēkāntaprakāśayōrēkavr̥ttāḥ । ēvaṁbhūtānāmāryāṇāṁ sarvajanapadēṣu yadēkāntēnā'vyabhicārēṇa samāhitamanumataṁ vr̥ttamanuṣṭhānam , na mātulasutāpariṇayanavatkatipayaviṣayam, tadvr̥ttasādr̥śyaṁ bhajēta । tadanurūpaṁ cēṣṭēta । na tēṣāmanuṣṭhānaṁ nirmūlam । sambhavati ca vaidikānāmutsannapāṭhabrāhmaṇānubhava iti ॥ 8 ॥

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**ṭīkā**  
brāhmaṇavr̥ttērabhāva āpat । tasyāṁ satyām । paṇyānām । [#2]vyavahr̥paṇō samarthayō'riti karmaṇi ṣaṣṭhī । vyavaharēta । krayaśca vikrayaśca vyavahāraḥ, paṇyāni krīṇīyāt vikrīṇīta cētyarthaḥ । apaṇyāni vakṣyamāṇāni vyudasyan varjayan । kr̥tsnāyā vaiśyavr̥ttērupalakṣaṇamidam । kṣatriyavr̥ttiśca [#3]daṇḍāpūpikayā siddhā । tathā ca gautamaḥ-[#4] tadalābhē kṣatriyavr̥ttistadalābhē vaiśyavr̥tti'riti ॥ 11॥

<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

12. (Particularly) men, condiments and liquids, colours, perfumes, food, skins, heifers, substances [#4]  used for glueing (such as lac), water, young cornstalks, substances from which spirituous liquor may be extracted, red and black pepper, corn, flesh, arms, and the hope of rewards for meritorious deeds.

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
manuṣyān rasān rāgān gandhānannaṁ carma gavāṁ vaśāṁ ślēmōdakē tōkmakiṇvē pippalīmarīcē dhānyaṁ māṁsamāyudhaṁ sukr̥tāśāṁ ca ॥12॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
apaṇyānyāha—  

**ṭīkā**  
manuṣyā dāradāsādayaḥ । rasā guḍalavaṇādayaḥ, kṣīrādayō vā । rāgāḥ kusumbhādayaḥ rajyantē'nēnēti । rajyanta iti vā rāgā vastrādayaḥ। gandhāścandanādayaḥ। **gavāṁ** madhyē **vaśā** vandhyā gauḥ । ślēṣma jatuvajrādiḥ, yēna viśliṣṭaṁ carmādi sandhīyatē। 'yathā[#1] ślēṣmaṇā carmaṇyaṁ vā'nyadvā viśliṣṭaṁ saślēṣayē'diti bahavr̥cabrāhmaṇē darśanāt । udakaṁ kumbhajalam । **tōkmaṁ** īṣadaṅkuritāni vrīhyādīni । **kiṇvaṁ** surāprakr̥tidravyam । sukr̥ta puṇyaṁ tasya phalaṁ sukr̥tāśā । śiṣṭāni prasiddhāni । [#2]

ētānyapaṇyāni varjayitvā anyēṣāṁ paṇyānāṁ vyavaharēta । manuṣyādīnvarjayitvētyēva siddhē 'apaṇyānīti vacanamanyēṣāmapyapaṇyānāṁ vyudāsārtham । tatra manuḥ—  
[#3]sarvān rasānapōhēta kr̥tānnaṁ ca tilaissaha ।  
aśmanō lavaṇaṁ caiva paśavō yē ca mānuṣāḥ ॥  
sarvaṁ ca tāntavaṁ raktaṁ śāṇajhaumāvikāni ca।  
api cētsyuraraktāni phalamūlē tathauṣadhīḥ ॥  
apaḥ śastraṁ viṣaṁ māṁsaṁ sōma gandhāṁśca sarvaśaḥ।  
kṣīraṁ kṣaudraṁ dadhi ghr̥taṁ tailaṁ madhuṁ guḍaṁ kuśān ॥   āraṇyāṁśca paśūna sarvān daṁṣṭriṇaśca vayāṁsi ca ।  
madyaṁ nīlīṁ ca lākṣāṁ ca sarvāścaikaśaphāna paśun ।' iti ॥ 12 ॥

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

'kāmamutpādya kr̥ṣyāṁ tu svayamēva kr̥ṣīvalaḥ। vikrīṇīta tilācchuddhān dharmārthamacirasthitān ॥ iti ॥13॥

avihitaś caitēṣāṁ mithō vinimayaḥ 14

annēna cānnasya,  
manuṣyāṇāṁ ca manuṣyaiḥ,  
rasānāṁ ca rasair,  
gandhānāṁ ca gandhair,  
vidyayā ca vidyānām 15
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

15. But food (may be exchanged) for food, and slaves for slaves, and condiments for condiments, and perfumes for perfumes, and learning for learning. [#6] 

[#6]:  From the permission to exchange learning for learning, it may be known that it is not lawful to sell it.'--Haradatta. Manu X, 94.

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
anēna cā'nnasya manuṣyāṇāṁ ca manuṣyaiḥ rasānāṁ ca rasairgandhānāṁ ca gandhairvidyayā ca vidyānām ॥15॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
tēṣvēva kēṣāṁcidvinimayō'nujñāyatē—  

**ṭīkā**  
annādīnāṁ vidyāntānāṁ vinimayō bhavatyēvētyarthaḥ । tathā ca vasiṣṭhaḥ[#1]-rasā rasaissamatō hīnatō vā ... ..tilataṇḍulapakvānnaṁ vidyāmanuṣyāśca vihitāḥ parivartanēna' iti । mānavē tu viśēṣaḥ—  
[#2]rasā rasairnirmātavyā na tvēva lavaṇaṁ rasaiḥ।  
kr̥tānnaṁ cā'kr̥tānnēna tilā dhānyēna tatsamāḥ ॥ iti ।  

gautamīyē tu-[#3]vinimayastu । rasānāṁ rasaiḥ । paśūnāṁ ca । na lavaṇaṁ kr̥tānnayōḥ । tilānāṁ ca । samēnā''mēna tu pakvasya sampratyartha' iti । tasmādatra pratiṣēdhānuvr̥ttirna śaṅkanīyā । pūrvatra cōktaṁ 'brahmaṇi mithō viniyōgē na gatirvidyata' (13.17) iti । [#4]vinimayābhyanujñānādēva vidyādīnāṁ vikrayō'pi pratiṣiddhō vēditavyaḥ ॥ 15 ॥

[#6] jīvitātyayamāpannō yō'nnamatti yatastataḥ ।  
ākāśamiva paṅkēna na sa dōṣēṇa lipyatē ॥ iti ॥3॥

stēyam, ābhiśastyaṁ +++(←brahmahatyādibhir vakṣyamāṇaiḥ)+++,

8. (These are) stealing (gold), crimes whereby one becomes an Abhiśasta, homicide, neglect of the Vedas, causing abortion, incestuous connection with relations born from the same womb as one's mother or father, and with the offspring of such persons, drinking spirituous liquor, and intercourse with persons the intercourse with whom is forbidden. [#5] 

[#5]:  The crimes by which a person becomes Abhiśasta are enumerated below, I, 9, 24, 6 seq., where an explanation of the term will be given.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
stēyamābhiśastyaṁ puruṣavadhō brahmōjjhaṁ garbhaśātanaṁ mātuḥ pituriti yōnisambandhē sahāpatyē strīgamanaṁ surāpānamasaṁyōgasaṁyōgaḥ ॥ 8॥  

**ṭīkā**  
stēyaṁ suvarṇacauryam । ābhiśastyaṁ brahmahatyā। 'brāhmaṇamātraṁ ca hatvābhiśasta' (247.) iti vakṣyamāṇatvāt । puruṣavadhō manuṣyajātivadhaḥ । tēna strīvadhō'pi gr̥hyatē । brahmōjjhaṁ ujjha utsargē। bhāvē ghañ। chāndasō liṅgavyatyayaḥ । brahma vēdaḥ tasyā'dhītasya nāśanaṁ brahmōjjham । auṣadhādiprayōgēṇa garbhasya vadhō garbhaśātanam । māturyōnisambandhē mātr̥ṣvasrādau । pituryōnisambandhē pitr̥ṣvasrādau sahāpatyē apatyēna sahitē strīgamanaṁ mātr̥ṣvasr̥gamanaṁ tatsutāgamanaṁ mātulasutāgamanaṁ cētyarthaḥ ।  
[#2] gauḍī paiṣṭī ca mādhvī ca viśēyā trividhā surā।  
yathaivaikā na pātavyā tathā sarvā dvijōttamaiḥ ॥  
iti mānavē niṣiddhāyāḥ surāyāḥ, pānaṁ surāpānam । asaṁyōgāḥ, saṁyōgānarhāḥ pratilōmādayaḥ । taiḥ saṁyōga ēkagr̥havāsādiḥ asaṁyōgasaṁyōgaḥ । ētāni patanīyāni ॥8॥  

[#2]: ma0 smr̥0 11 94.
</details>
</details>

uktavyatiriktāni dōṣavanti karmāṇi duṣpratigrahahiṁsādīni tānyaśucikarāṇi bhavanti ॥ 19 ॥

patitasya dōṣaṁ parairaviditaṁ buddhvā parasya samākhyānē pūrvō na syāt । parairaviditaṁ svayaṁ vidvānapi na parēbhyaḥ pūrvamācakṣīta । kiṁ tu svayaṁ dharmakr̥tyēṣvēnaṁ varjayēt , yathā parē na jānanti । anyathā dōṣavān syāt ॥20॥

## +08

### 22 adhyātmam

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

adhyātmikān yōgān anutiṣṭhēn nyāya-saṁhitān anaiścārikān 1
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

1. He shall employ the means which tend to the acquisition of (the knowledge of) the Ātman, which are attended by the consequent (destruction of the passions, and) which prevent the wandering (of the mind from its object, and fix it on the contemplation of the Ātman). [#1] 

[#1]:  22. The knowledge of the Vedānta and the means which prepare men for the knowledge of the Ātman, the 'Self, the universal soul,' are placed in this Paṭala at the head of the penances, because they are most efficacious for the removal of all sin. The means are absence of anger &c., which are enumerated I, 8, 23, 6.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
adhyātmikān yōgānanutiṣṭhēnnyāyasaṁhitānanaiścārikān ॥ 1 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
uktāni patanīyānyaśucikarāṇi ca karmāṇi । tēṣāṁ prāyaścittāni vakṣyannādita ātmajñānaṁ tadupayōginaśca yōgānadhikurutē । tasyāpi sarvapāpaharatvēna mukhyaprāyaścittatvāt । śrūyatē hi—  
[#2]bhidyatē hr̥dayagranthiśchidyantē sarvasaṁśayāḥ।
kṣīyantē cāsya karmāṇi tasmin dr̥ṣṭē parāvarē ॥ iti ।  
[#3] 'tadyathēṣīkātūlamagnau prōtaṁ pradūyētēvaṁ hā'sya sarvē pāpmānaḥ pradūyanta' iti ca । yājñavalkyō'pyāha —  
[#4]ijyācāradamāhiṁsādānasvādhyāyakarmaṇām ।  
ayaṁ tu paramō dharmō yadyōganā''tmadarśanam ॥ iti ॥  

[#2]: muṇḍakōpa0 2.2. 8  

[#3]: chā0 u0 5. 24, 3  

[#4]: yā0 sma0. 1.8.

adhyātmani bhavānadhyātmikān । chāndasō vr̥ddhyabhāvaḥ । ātmanō lambhayitr̥̄n । yōgān cittasamādhānahētūn vakṣyamāṇānakrōdhādīnupāyān । anutiṣṭhēt sēvēta nyāyasaṁhitān upapattisamanvitān , upapadyantē hi tē nyāyataḥ krōdhādīnāṁ dōṣāṇāṁ nirghātē । anaiścārikān niścāraścittasya bahirvikṣēpaḥ, tasmai yē prabhavanti krōdhādayō vakṣyamāṇāḥtē naiścārikāḥ tatpratipakṣabhūtān । akrōdhādiṣu satsu cittamaniścaraṇaśīlamātmālambanaṁ niścalaṁ tiṣṭhati tasmāttānanutiṣṭhēt । ātmānaṁ labdhumakrōdhādilakṣaṇaṁ cittasamādhānaṁ kuryāditi ॥1॥
</details>

<details><summary>śaṅkarācārya-vivaraṇam</summary>

**sūtram**  
adhyātmikān yōgānanutiṣṭhēnnyāyasaṁhitānanaiścārikān ॥ 1 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
śrīmacchaṅkarabhagavatpādapraṇītaṁ vivaraṇam ॥  

atha 'adhyātmikān yōgān'—

ity-ādy-adhyātma-paṭalasya saṁkṣēpatō vivaraṇaṁ prastūyatē— kim iha prāyaścitta-prakaraṇē samāmnānasya prayōjanam iti?

ucyatē— karma-kṣaya-hētutva-sāmānyāt।  
aniṣṭa-karma-kṣaya-hētūni hi prāyaścittāni bhavanti।  
sarvaṁ ca karma varṇāśrama-vihitam aniṣṭam ēva vivēkinaḥ, dēha-grahaṇa-hētutvāt।+++(4)+++  
tat-kṣaya-kāraṇaṁ ca ātma-jñānaṁ, pravr̥tti-hētu-dōṣa-nivartakatvāt।  
dōṣāṇāṁ ca nirghātē ātma-jñānavataḥ paṇḍitasya  
dharmādharma-kṣayē kṣēma-prāptir iha vivakṣitā  
ity ātma-jñānārtham adhyātma-paṭalam ārabhyatē—

> karma-kṣaya-hētutva-sāmānyāt॥ 1॥

(1. atra paṭalaśabdō napusakaliṅgaḥ prayuktaḥ । 'samūhē paṭalaṁ na nā' ( amarakō. 3. 3. 200) ityamarakōśāttu samūhavācinaḥ paṭalaśabdasyaiva klībatvam । 'tilakē ca paricchēdē paṭalaḥ' iti śēṣakōśāt paricchēdavācakasya paṭalaśabdasya tu puṁlliāgataivētyavagamyatē । ata ēva ca sarvē granthakārāḥ 'iti prathamaḥ paṭalaḥ, ityēva likhanti । atō'trāpi puliṁṅgēnaiva bhāvyaṁ yadyapi paṭalaśabdēna tathāpi bhēdāvivakṣayā prayōgaḥ kr̥ta iti bhāti ॥)  

nanu varṇāśramavihitānāṁ karmaṇāmaphalahētunvāt tatkṣayō nēṣṭa iti, na, "sarvavarṇānāṁ svadharmānuṣṭhānē paramaparimitaṁ sukham” ( 2. 2. 2.)
ityādiśravaṇāt । aparimitavacanāt kṣēmaprāptirēvēti cēnna, 'tatparivr̥ttau karmaphalaśēṣēṇa' (2.2.3.) ityādiśravaṇāt । gautamaśca—  
(2) varṇāḥ āśramāśca svakarmaniṣṭhāḥ prētya karmaphalamanubhaya" ityādi nā saṁsāragamanamēva darśayati karmaṇāṁ phalam । sarvāśramāṇāṁ hi dōṣanirghātalakṣaṇāni samayapadāni vidhinā'nutiṣṭhan sārvagāmī bhavati, na tu svadharmānuṣṭhānāt । vakṣyati ca—  
'vidhūya kaviḥ' ( 22. 5) "satyānr̥tē sukhaduḥkhē vēdānimaṁ lōkamamuṁ ca parityajyā'tmānamanvicchēd' ( 2. 21. 13) ityādi ।  
"tēṣu sarvēṣu yathōpadēśamavyagrō vartamānaḥ kṣēmaṁ gacchati"(2. 21. 2)

- 2. gau.dha. 11. 21

iti vacanāt kṣēmaśabdasya cā'pavargārthatvāt sarvāśramakarmaṇāṁ jñānarahitānāmēva phalārthatvaṁ jñānasaṁyuktāni tu kṣēmaprāpakāṇi, yathā viṣadadhyādīni mantraśarkarādisaṁyuktāni kāryāntarārambhakāṇi, tadvaditi cēt- na; anārabhyatvāt kṣēmaprāptēḥ। yadi hi kṣēmaprāptiḥ kāryā syāt tata idaṁ cintyam- kiṁ kēvalaiḥ karmabhirārabhyā? jñānasahitairvā? jñānakarmabhyāṁ vā? kēvalēna jñānēna karmāsaṁyuktēna vēti । na tvārabhyā kēnacidapi; kṣēmaprāptēḥ nityatvāt । atō'sadidam-jhānasaṁyuktāni karmāṇi kṣēmaprāptimārabhantē iti । jñānasaṁyuktānāṁ jñānavadēva kṣēmaprāptipratibandhāpanayakartr̥tvamiti cēt- na, sakāryakāraṇānāmēva karmaṇāṁ kṣēmaprāptipratibandhakatvāt । avidyādōṣahētūni hi sarvakarmāṇi sahaphalaiḥ kāryabhūtaiḥ kṣēmaprāptipratibandhakāni । tadabhāvamātramēva hi kṣēmaprāptiḥ। na ca tadabhāva ātmajñānādanyataḥ kutaścidupalabhyatē । tathāhyuktam—
"nihatya bhūtadāhān kṣēmaṁ gacchati paṇḍitaḥ" (22. 11.) iti । pāṇḍityaṁ cēhātmajñānaṁ, prakr̥tatvāt । śrutēśca (1)"ānandaṁ brahmaṇō vidvān na bibhēti kutaścanēti" iti । abhayaṁ hi kṣēmaprāptiḥ । (2) abhayaṁ vai janaka ! prāptō'si' iti śrutyantarāt ।   
"tēṣu sarvēṣu yathōpadēśamavyagrō vartamānaḥ kṣēmaṁ gacchati' (2.21.2.) ityācāryavacanamanyārtham । katham ? yathōpadiṣṭēṣvāśramadharmēṣvavyagrō niṣkāmassan pravartamānō jñānē'dhikr̥tō bhavati, na yathēṣṭaṁ(3) cēṣṭana kāmakāmī jāyāputravittādikāmāpahr̥tavyapracētāḥ। jñānī ca san sarvasanyāsakramēṇa kṣēmaṁ gacchatītyēṣō'rthaḥ । nahi dōṣanirghātaḥ kadācidapi karmabhya upapadyatē । samithyājñānānāṁ hi dōṣāṇāṁ pravr̥ttau satyāṁ prābalyāmihōpalabhyatē । 'saṅkalpamūlaḥ kāmaḥ' iti ca smr̥tēḥ । pravr̥ttimāndyē ca dōṣatanutvadarśanāt । na cā'nirhr̥tya samithyājñānān dōṣān kṣēmaṁ prāpnōti kaścit । na ca janmāntarasañcitānāṁ śubhakarmaṇāṁ vihitakarmabhyō nivr̥ttirupapadyatē, śuddhisāmānyē virōdhābhāvāt । satsu ca tēṣu tatphalōpabhōgāya śarīragrahaṇaṁ, tatō dharmādharmapravr̥ttarāgadvēṣau, punaḥ śarīragrahaṇaṁ cēti saṁsāraḥ kēna vāryatē ? tasmānna karmabhyaḥ kṣēmaprāptistatpratibandhanivr̥ttirvā ।  
karmasahitājjñānādavidyānivr̥ttiriti cēt ! yadyapi jñānakarmaṇō bhinnakāryatvād virōdhaḥ tathāpi tailavarttyagnīnāmiva saṁhr̥tya karmaṇā jhānamavidyādi saṁsārakāraṇaṁ nivartayatīti cēnna । kriyākārakaphalānupamardēnā''tmalābhābhāvāt jñānasya karmabhiḥ saṁhatatvānupapattēḥ । tailavarttyagnīnāṁ tu sahabhāvitvōpapattēritarētarōpakāryōpakārakatvōpapattēśca saṁhatatvaṁ syāt । na tu jñānakarmaṇōstadubhayānupapattēḥ saṁhatatvaṁ kadācidapi sambhavati । kēvalajñānapakṣē śāstrapratiṣēdhavacanādayuktamiti cēnna । jñāna kāryānivartakatvācchāstrapratiṣēdhavacanasya ॥  

- 1. taitti, u. 2, 9.
- 2. br̥. u., 4. 2.4.
- 3. 'cēṣṭan' iti śatrantaḥ prayōgassādhuriti na pratīmaḥ।

yō'yaṁ karmavidhiparaiḥ kēvalajñānapakṣasya sarvasannyāsasya vipratiṣēdhō virōdhaḥ, sa naiva jñānakāryamavidyādōṣakṣayaṁ vārayati (1)'bhidyatē hr̥dayagranthiḥ' (2) 'tasya tāvadēva ciram' (3) 'mr̥tyumukhāt pramucyatē' ityēvamādiśrutismr̥tiśatasiddham, karmavidhiparatvāt pravr̥ttiśāstrasya । na ca (tat) jñānasvarūpaṁ brahmātmaikatvaviṣayaṁ vārayati, sarvōpaniṣadāmaprāmāṇyānarthakyaprasaṅgāta, 'pūḥ prāṇinaḥ'(22 4.) 'ātmā vai dēvatā' ityādismr̥tīnāṁ ca । tasmādyadyapi bahubhiḥ pravr̥ttiśāstrairvipratiṣiddhaṁ kēvalajñānaśāstramātmaikatvaviṣayamalpaṁ, tathāpi sakāryasya jñānasya balavattaratvānna kēnacidvārayituṁ śakyam।

- 1. mu.u. 2. 2. 8.
- 2. chā. u. 6.14. ..
- 3. kaṭhō. 2, 3 15,

jīvatō duḥkhānivatarkatvājñānasyā'naikāntikaṁ kṣēmaprāpakatvamiti cēt, na, 'bhidyatē hr̥dayagranthiḥ' 'brahmavidāpnōti param', 'nicāyya taṁ mr̥tyumukhāt pramucyatē' (4) brahma vēda brahmaiva bhavati' ityādiśrutismr̥tinyāyēbhyaḥ । bahubhirvipratiṣiddhatvāt sarvatyāgaśāstrasya lōkavat tyājyatvamiti cēnna, tulyapramāṇatvāt । mānasāntāni sarvāṇi karmāṇyuktvā । (5)"tāni vā ētānyavarāṇi tapāṁsi nyāsa ēvātyarēcayat" iti tapaḥśabdavācyānāṁ karmaṇāmavaratvēna saṁsārāviṣayatvamuktvā nyāsaśabdavācyasya jñānasya kēvalasya nyāsa ēvātyarēcayat' (6) tyāgēnaikē amr̥tatvamānaśuḥ' ityamr̥tatvaphalaṁ darśayati śāstram ।  
(7)"tasyaiva viduṣō yajñasyā''tmā yajamānaḥ" ityādinā ca viduṣaḥ sarvaka(rma?rmā) bhāvaṁ darśayati;
"dvau panthānāvanuniṣkrāntatarau karmapathaścaiva purastāt sanyāsaśca, tayōḥ sannyāsa ēvātirēcayati"
iti ca । vipratiṣēdhavacanasya nindāparatvādayuktamiti cēnna।

- 4. muṇḍa. u.3.2 9.

- 6. nārā.u.3.

avidvadviṣayasya karmaṇaḥ stutyarthatvōpapattēḥ । mandabuddhayō hi lōkē'dr̥ṣṭaprayōjanāḥ prarōcanēna pravartayitavyāḥ karmasu । na dr̥ṣṭaprayōjanā vidvāṁsaḥ। paranindā hi parastutiriti kēvalajñānanindayā karmastutiparamācāryavacanam ।  
yattu "buddhē cēt kṣēmaprāpaṇam , ihaiva na duḥkhamupalabhēta” (2.21.16) iti jñānasya sādhanatvānaikāntikavacanaṁ, tad (1) 'brahmavidāpnōti param' ityādivākyēbhyaḥ pratyuktam, ācāryāntaravacanācca 'tyaja dharmamadharmaṁ ca' 'na tatra kramatē buddhiḥ' 'naiṣkarmyamācarēt' 'tasmāt
karma na kurvanti' ityādēḥ । tasmāt kēvalādēva jñānāt kṣēmaprāptiḥ॥  

- 1. tai.u. 2. 1.

adhyātmikān yōgāniti । adhyātmaṁ bhavantītyadhyātmikāḥ । chāndasaṁ svatvam । kē tē adhyātmikā yōgāḥ ? vakṣyamāṇā akrōdhādayaḥ । tē hi cittalamādhānahētutvād yōgāḥ । bāhyanimittanirapēkṣatvāccādhyātmikāḥ । tānadhyātmikān yōgān । nyāyasahitān upapattisamanvitān । tē hi krōdhādiṣu dōṣanirghātaṁ prati samarthā upapadyantē nyāyataḥ । anaiścārikān niścārayanti manō'ntaḥsthaṁ bahirviṣayēbhya iti naiścārikāḥ krōdhādayō dōṣāḥ, tatpratipakṣabhūtā hyētē 'naiścārikāḥ । akrōdhādiṣu hi satsu cittamaniścaraṇasvarūpaṁ prasannamātmāvalambanaṁ tiṣṭhati । atastānanutiṣṭhēt sēvēta । akrōdhādilakṣaṇaṁ cittasamādhānaṁ kuryādityarthaḥ। tathā hi paraḥ sva ātmā labhyatē । krōdhādidōṣāpahr̥tacētastayā hi svō'pi para ātmā'vijñātō'labdha iva sarvasya yataḥ, atastallābhāya yōgānuṣṭhānaṁ kuryāt ॥ 1 ॥
</details>
