<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ātma-lābhān na paraṁ vidyatē 2
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

2. There is no higher (object) than the attainment of (the knowledge of the) Ātman. [#2] 

[#2]:  Haradatta gives in his commentary a lengthy discussion on the Ātman, which corresponds nearly to Śaṅkara's Introduction to and Commentary on the first Sūtra of Bādarāyaṇa.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ātmalābhānna paraṁ vidyatē ॥2॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
kipunarātmā prayatnēna labdhavyaḥ ? ōmityāha—  

**ṭīkā**  
ātmalābhātparamutkr̥ṣṭaṁ lābhāntaraṁ nāsti । tasmāttasya lābhāya yatna āsthēya iti । kā punarasāvātmā ? pratyagātmā । nanvasau nityalabdhaḥ। na hi svayamēva svasyā'labdhō bhavati । satyam, prakr̥timēlanāttadharmatāmupagatō vinaṣṭasvarūpa iva bhavati । prakr̥tyā hi nityasambaddhaḥ puruṣaḥ । tathāvidhaśca sambandhō yathā parasparaṁ vivēkō na jñāyatē । anyōnyadharmaścānyō'nyatrā'dhyasyantē । yathā kṣīrōdakē sampr̥ktē na jñāyatē vivēkaḥ-iyat kṣīramiyadudakamiti, amuṣminnavakāśē kṣīramamuśminnavakāśa udakamiti । yathā vā agnyayōgōlakayōrabhisambaddhayōryē agnidharmā uṣṇatvabhāsvaratvādayaḥ tē ayōgōlakē'dhyasyantē। yē vā ayōgōlakadharmāḥ kāṭhinyādairghyādayaḥ tē 'gnāvadhyasyantē । ēvaṁ hi tatra 'pratipattiḥ ēkaṁ vastu uṣṇaṁ dīrghaṁ bhāsvaraṁ kaṭhinamiti । tadvadihāpi puruṣadharmāścaita nyādayaḥ prakr̥tāvadhyasyantē । prakr̥tidharmāśca sukhaduḥkhamōhapariṇāmādayaḥ puruṣē । tataśca ēkaṁ vastu cētanaṁ sukhādikalila pariṇāmīti vyavahāraḥ।
vastatastu tasmin saṅghātē acētanāṁśaḥ pariṇāmī । cētanāṁśastu tamanudhāvati । yēna yēna rūpēṇa pariṇamati tēna tēnā'bhēdādhyāsamāpadyatē।

yathā kṣīrāvasthāgataṁ ghr̥taṁ kṣīrē dadhyātmanā pariṇamati tāmapyavasthāmanupraviśati tadvadihāpi । tadidamucyatē-[#1] tatsr̥ṣṭvā tadēvānuprāviśa'diti । sargē'pyātmanaḥ kartr̥tvamidamēva-yaduta bhōktr̥tayā nimittatvam । tadēvaṁ svabhāvataḥ svacchō'pyātmā prakr̥tyā sahābhēdamāpannaḥ taddharmā bhavati। ēvaṁ tadvikārēṇa mahatā tadvikārēṇā'haṅkārēṇa, ityāśarīrāddraṣṭavyam । sthūlō'haṁ kr̥śō'haṁ dēvō'haṁ manuṣyō'haṁ tiryagahamiti । tasyaivaṁgatasyāpēkṣitavyassvarūpalābhaḥ nīcairiva vardhitasya rājaputrasya । tadyathā śabarādibhirbālyātprabhr̥ti svasutaissaha saṁvardhitō rājaputrastajjātīyamātmānamavagamayanmātrā svarūpē kathitē labdhasvarūpa iva bhavati । tathā prakr̥tyā[#2]vēśyayēva svarūpāntaraṁ nīta ātmā mātr̥sthānīyayā[#3] "tattvamasī'ti śrutyā svabhāva nīyatē-yadēvaṁvidhaṁ pariśuddhaṁ vastu tadēva tvamasi, yathā manyasē 'manuṣyō'haṁ duḥkhyaha'mityādi na tathēti । yathā ya ēvaṁbhūtō rājā sa tvamasīti rājaputraḥ ।  

[#1]: tai. u. 2. 6.  

[#2]: vaśyayā. iti. kha. pu   

[#3]: chā. u, 6. 9. 3   

nanu tattvamasīti brahmaṇā tādātmyamucyatē। kō brūtē ? nēti । brahmā'pi nānyadātmanaḥ । kiṁ punarayamātmā ēka ? āhō svinnānā? kimanēna jñānēna ? tvaṁ tāvadēvaṁvidhaścidēkarasō nityanirmalaḥ saṁsargātkaluṣatāmiva gataḥ। tadviyōgaśca tē mōkṣaḥ । tvayi muktē yadyanyē santi tē saṁsariṣyanti । kā tē kṣatiḥ ? atha na santi tathāpi kastē lābha ityalamiyatā । mahatyēṣā kathā । tadapyētē ślōkā bhavanti —  

nīcānāṁ vasatau tadīyatanayaiḥ sārdhaṁ ciraṁ vardhita  
stajjātīyamavaiti rājatanayaḥ svātmānamapyañjasā।  
saṁghātē mahadādibhissahavasaṁstadvatparaḥ pūruṣaḥ  
svātmānaṁ sukhaduḥkhamōhakalilaṁ mithyaiva dhiṅmanyatē ॥1॥   
dātā bhōgaparaḥ samagravibhavō yaḥ śāsitā duṣkr̥tāṁ  
rājā sa tvamasīti mātr̥mukhataḥ śrutvā yathāvatsa tu ।  
rājībhya[#4] jayārthamēva yatatē tadvatpumān bōdhitaḥ  
śrutyā tattvamasītyapāsya duritaṁ brahmaiva sampadyatē ॥2॥  
ityēvaṁ bahavō'pi rājatanayāḥ prāptā daśāmīdr̥śīṁ  
naivānyōnyabhidāmapasya sahasā sarvē bhajantyēkatām ।  
kiṁ tu svē paramē padē pr̥thagamī tiṣṭhanti bhinnāstathā   
kṣētrajñā iti tattvamādivacasaḥ kā bhēdavādē kṣatiḥ ॥3॥  
tēṣvēkō yadi jātu mātr̥vacanāt prāptō nijaṁ vaibhavaṁ  
nānyēna kṣatirasya yatkila parē satyanyathā ca sthitā ॥  
yadvānyē na bhavēyurēvamapi kō lābhō'sya tadvadgatiḥ   puṁsāmityābhidāṁ bhidāṁ ca na vayaṁ nirbaddhya niścinmahē॥4॥  iti॥   

[#4]: yathārthamēva ka. pu.
</details>

<details><summary>śaṅkarācārya-vivaraṇam</summary>

**sūtram**  
ātmalābhānna paraṁ vidyatē ॥2॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
putravittādilābhō hi parō dr̥ṣṭō lōkē । kimātmalābhēna ? ityata āha—  

**ṭīkā**  
ātmalābhād ātmanaḥ parasya svarūpapratipattēḥ na paraṁ lābhāntaraṁ vidyatē । tathā vicāritaṁ vr̥hadāraṇyakē(1) tadētat prēyaḥ putrād' ityādinā ॥2॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

tatrātmalābhīyāñ ślōkān udāhariṣyāmaḥ 3
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

3. We shall quote the verses (from the Veda) [#3]  which refer to the attainment of (the knowledge of) the Ātman.

[#3]:  According to Haradatta, the following verses are taken from an Upaniṣad.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
tatrā''tmalābhīyāñcchlōkānudāhariṣyāmaḥ ॥ 3 ॥

**ṭīkā**  
tadihāpēkṣitamātmajñānamupadiśyatē । tacca trividham- śrutaṁ mananaṁ nididhyāsanamiti । [#2]śrōtavyō mantavyō nididhyāsitavya' iti śravaṇāt । tatra śrutamupaniṣadādiśabdajanyaṁ jñānam । mananamupapattibhirnirūpaṇam । ēvaṁ śrutē matē cātmani sākṣātkārahēturavikṣiptēna cētasā nirantaraṁ bhāvanā[#3]nididhyāsanam। tatrā''tmasiddhayē śrōtaṁ jñānaṁ tāvadāha—  
tatrēti vākyōpanyāsē । ātmalābhīyānātmalābhaprayōjanān । anupravacanādiṣu darśanācchapratyayaḥ । ślōkān pādabaddhānōpaniṣadān mantrān । udāhariṣyāmaḥ uddhr̥tyāhariṣyāmaḥ granthē nivēśayiṣyāmaḥ ॥3॥  

[#2]: br̥0u0 2. 4.5  

[#3]: dhyānamiti. kha. ca. pu.
</details>

<details><summary>śaṅkarācārya-vivaraṇam</summary>

**sūtram**  
tatrā''tmalābhīyāñcchlōkānudāhariṣyāmaḥ ॥ 3 ॥

**ṭīkā**  
satya krōdhādayō dōṣā ātmalābhapratibandhabhūtā akrōdhādibhirnirha(nya?ṇya)ntē; tathāpi na mulōdvartanēna nivr̥ttiḥ krōdhādīnām, sarvadōṣabījabhūtamajñānaṁ na nivr̥ttamiti tasya cānivr̥ttau bījasyā'nivartitatvāt sakr̥nnivr̥ttā api krōdhādayō dōṣāḥ punarudbhaviṣyantīti saṁsārasyā''tyantikōcchēdō na syāt । taddōṣabījabhūtasyā'jñānasya matān , jñānādanyatō na nivr̥ttirityātmasvarūpaprakāśanāyātmajñānāya matān śākhāntarōpaniṣadbhayaḥ, tatra tasmin ātmalābhaprayōjanē nimittē । ātmānaṁ karatalanyastamiva la(mbhi ? bhayi)tuṁ samarthān ātmalābhīyān ślōkānudāhariṣyāmaḥ uddhr̥tyā''hariṣyāmaḥ । granthīkr̥tya darśayiṣyāma ityarthaḥ ॥ 3॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

pūḥ prāṇinaḥ sarva ēva guhāśayasya । ahanyamānasya vikalmaṣasya ।  
acalaṁ calanikētaṁ yē'nutiṣṭhanti tē'mr̥tāḥ 4
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

4. All living creatures are the dwelling of him who lies enveloped in matter, who is immortal and who is spotless. Those become immortal who worship him who is immovable and lives in a movable dwelling. [#4] 

[#4]:  The spotless one &c. is the Paramātman. The spots are merit and demerit which, residing in the Manas, the internal organ of perception, are only falsely attributed to the Ātman, 'the soul.' To become immortal means 'to obtain final liberation.'
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
pūḥ prāṇinaḥ sarva ēva guhāśayasyā'hanyamānasya vikalmaṣasyā'calaṁ calanikētaṁ yē'nutiṣṭhanti tē'mr̥tāḥ॥ 4 ॥

**ṭīkā**  
guhēti prakr̥tināma।  
'yattasmr̥taṁ kāraṇamapramēyaṁ brahma pradhāna prakr̥tiprasūtiḥ।  
ātmā guhā yōni[#6]ranādyananta kṣētraṁ tathaivāmr̥tamakṣaraṁ ca ॥iti  
purāṇē darśanāt । tasyāṁ śētē tayā sahā''vibhāgamāpannāstiṣṭhatīti guhāśaya ātmā ।  

[#6]:  

    anādyananta iti. kha. pustakē  

[#1] ajāmēkāṁ lōhitaśuklakr̥ṣṇāṁ bahvīṁ prajāṁ janayantīṁ sarūpām ।  
ajō hyēkō juṣamāṇō'nuśētē jahātyēnāṁ bhuktabhōgāmajō'nyaḥ, iti ca mantrāntaram । ahanyamānasya na hyasau śarīrē hanyamānē'pi hanyatē [#2]tathā cōktaṁ bhagavatā-[#3] na hanyatē hanyamānē śarīra' iti । vikalmaṣasya nirlēpasya। sarva ēva hi dharmādharmādirantaḥkaraṇasya dharmaḥ, ātmani tvadhyastaḥ। ēvaṁbhūtasyātmanaḥ sarva ēva prāṇinaḥ brahmādyāstiryagantāḥ prāṇādimantaḥ saṁghātā pūḥ puraṁ upabhōgasthānam । yathā rājā puramadhivasan sacivairānītān bhōgānupabhuṅktē, tathā'yaṁ dēvādiśarīramadhivasan karaṇaiḥ rupasthāpitān bhōgānupabhuṅktē । tamēva bhūtamacalaṁ sarvagatatvēna niścalam । calanikētaṁ nikētaṁ svasthāna śarīraṁ tadyasya calaṁ taṁ yē'nutiṣṭhanti upāsatē ēvaṁbhūtō'hamiti pratipadyantē, tē'mr̥tāḥ muktā bhavantīti ।' 4॥  

[#1]:

    tai0ā0 ( nārāyaṇōpaniṣadi)10. 1.  

[#2]:

    'tathā cōktaṁ bhagavatā na hanyatē hanyamānē śarīrē । iti nāsti ka. pustakē.

[#3]: bhagavadgī0 2. 20.
</details>

<details><summary>śaṅkarācārya-vivaraṇam</summary>

**sūtram**  
pūḥ prāṇinaḥ sarva ēva guhāśayasyā'hanyamānasya vikalmaṣasyā'calaṁ calanikētaṁ yē'nutiṣṭhanti tē'mr̥tāḥ ॥ 4 ॥

**ṭīkā**  
pūḥ puraṁ śarīram । prāṇinaḥ prāṇavantaḥ। sarva ēva brahmādīni stambaparyantāni prāṇinaḥ । puraṁ puramiva rājñaḥ upalabdhyādhiṣṭhānam । kasya puram ? guhāśayasyā''tmanaḥ । yathā svakīyapurē rājā sacivādiparivr̥ta upalabhyatē, ēvaṁ dēhēṣvātmā budhādikaraṇasaṁyukta upalabhyatē । upalabhatē ca buddhyādikaraṇōpasaṁhr̥tān bhōgān । atō'vidyāvaraṇātmabhūtāyāṁ buddhiguhāyāṁ śēta iti guhāśayaḥ । tasya puram । tasyāṁ buddhāvavidyādidōṣamalāpanayē vidvadbhistyaktaiṣaṇairupalabhyatē । idamaparaṁ viśēṣaṇaṁ guhāśayasyā'hanyamānasya, chēdanabhēdanajarārōgādibhirhanyamānē dēhē na hanyatē । (1) na vadhēnā'sya hanyatē' iticchāndōgyē । tasya vikalmaṣasya, kalmaṣaṁ pāpaṁ tadasya nāstīti vikalmaṣaḥ । sarvaṁ hyavidyādōṣasahitaṁ dharmādharmākhyaṁ karma kalmaṣaṁ bhavati, vikalmaṣasyēti viśēṣaṇēna tat pratiṣidhyatē tatkāryaṁ jarārōgādiduḥkharūpamahanyamānasyēti । ēvaṁ hētuphalasambandharahitasyā'saṁsāriṇa upalabdhyadhiṣṭhānaṁ pūḥ sarvē prāṇinaḥ । atō na saṁsāryanyō 'sti । (2) ēkō dēvaḥ sarvabhūtēṣu 'gūḍha' iti śvētāśvatarē। (3)"ēṣa sarvēṣu bhūtēṣu guḍhō''tmā na prakāśatē" iti ca kāṭhakē । (4) nānyadatō'sti draṣṭā' ityādi vājasanēyakē । (1) 'sa
ātmā tattvamasī'ti ca chāndōgyē । pūrvārdhēna brahmaṇō yāthātmyamuktvōttarārdhēna tadvijñānavatastadvijñānaphalamāha-yasya sarvē prāṇinaḥ purā ahanyamānasya vikalmaṣasya, tasya sarvaprāṇisambandhādarthasiddhamākāśavat sarvagatatvam, 'ākāśavat sarvagataśca nitya' iti ca śrutēḥ। sarvagatasya cā'calatvamarthasiddhamēva । tamacalaṁ calanikētaṁ calāyāṁ hi prāṇiguhāyāṁ svayaṁ śētē tamacalaṁ calanikētam । yē'nutiṣṭhanti mamātmēti sākṣāt pratipadyantē, tē'mr̥tāḥ amaraṇadharmāṇō bhavanti ॥ 4॥  

- 1. chā. u. 8 10 4.
- 2. śvētā. u. 6. 11.
- 3. kaṭhō. 1. 3, 12.  
- 5, chā. 6. 8. 9.
- 4. br̥. u. 3.8.11
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yadidamidihēdiha lōkē viṣayamucyatē । vidhūya kavirētadanutiṣṭhēdguhāśayam 5
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

5. Despising all that which in this world is called an object (of the senses) a wise man shall strive after the (knowledge of the) Ātman. [#5] 

[#5]:  It seems to me that Haradatta's explanation of the words 'idam idi ha idi ha' is wrong. They ought to be divided thus, 'idamid, iha id, iha loke.' The general sense remains the same, and there is no necessity to assume very curious and otherwise unknown Vedic forms.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yadidamidihēdiha lōkē viṣayamucyatē।  
vidhūya kavirētadanutiṣṭhēdguhāśayam ॥ 5 ॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
viṣayasaṅgaparityāgēnā'yamupāsya ityāha —  

**ṭīkā**  
yadidaṁ, viṣayaṁ, mētaditi sarvatra liṅgavyatyayaśchāndasaḥ। ēvamitiśabdē takārasya dakāraḥ । itiśabdaḥ prasiddhau । haśabda āścaryē । itiśabdēnāvr̥ttēna śabdādiṣu viṣayēṣvavāntaraprakārabhēdaḥ pratipādyatē। viṣayāpahr̥tacētasō hi vadanti- 'iti ha tasyā gītam , iti ha tasyāḥ sukhasparśaḥ, iti ha tasyā rūpaṁ niṣṭaptamiva kanakam, iti ha tasyāḥ svādiṣṭhō'dharamaṇiḥ, iti ha tasyā gandhō ghrāṇatarpaṇa' iti । ēvaṁ divyamānuṣabhēdō'pi draṣṭavyaḥ। atrā'nantaramapara itiśabdō'dhyāhāryaḥ । iti ha iti hēti yō 'yaṁ lōkē viṣaya ucyatē, sāmānyāpēkṣamēkavacanam , ētadvidhūya guhāśayamanutiṣṭhēt । kavirmēdhāvī ॥5॥
</details>

<details><summary>śaṅkarācārya-vivaraṇam</summary>

**sūtram**  
yadidamidihēdiha lōkē viṣayamucyatē।  
vidhūya kavirētadanutiṣṭhēdguhāśayam ॥ 5 ॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
kathaṁ tadanuṣṭhānamiti ? ucyatē —  

**ṭīkā**  
yadidaṁ pratyakṣatō'vagamyamānaṁ stryannapānādisaṁbhōgalakṣaṇam । iditi kiñcidarthē । yatkiñcididaṁ pratyakṣam । ihā'smin lōkē। viṣayam । idaṁśabdasāmānādhikaraṇyānnapuṁsakaliṅgaprayōgō viṣayamiti । ubhayāliṅgō vā viṣayaśabdaḥ । dvitīya icchabda ihaśabdaśca । tayōḥ kvacinniyōgaḥ । icchabdaścārthē । ihaśabdō'muṣminnarthē । lōkaśabdaḥ kākākṣivadubhayatra sambadhyatē । iha lōkē iha ca lōkē'muṣmiṁśca yadidaṁ viṣayamucyatē, svargādilōkē pārśvasthamadhyasthō vyapadiśati iha lōkē iti ca lōkē ita tatsarvaṁ vidhūya parityajya । kaviḥ krāntadarśī, mēdhāvītyarthaḥ । phalaṁ sādhanaṁ ca tadvidhūya ēṣaṇātrayād vyutthāyētyarthaḥ । anutiṣṭhēd guhāśayaṁ yathōktalakṣaṇamātmatatvam ॥5॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ātmann ēvāhamalabdhvaitaddhitaṁ sēvasva nāhitam । athānyēṣu pratīcchāmi sādhuṣṭhānamanapēkṣayā । mahāntaṁ tējasaskāyaṁ sarvatra nihitaṁ prabhum 6
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

6. O pupil, I, who had not recognised in my own self the great self-luminous, universal, (absolutely) free Ātman, which must be obtained without the mediation of anything else, desired (to find) it in others (the senses). (But now as I have obtained the pure knowledge, I do so no more.) Therefore follow thou also this good road that leads to welfare (salvation), and not the one that leads into misfortune (new births). [#6] 

[#6]:  The verse is addressed by a teacher to his pupil. My translation strictly follows Haradatta's gloss. But his interpretation is open to many doubts. However, I am unable to suggest anything better.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ātmannēvā'hamalabdhvaitaddhitaṁ sēvasva nā'hitam ।  
athā'nyēṣu pratīcchāmi sādhuṣṭhānamanapēkṣayā ।  
mahāntaṁ tējasaskāyaṁ sarvatra nihitaṁ prabhum ॥ 6 ॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
viṣayatyāgē hētumāha—  

**ṭīkā**  
śiṣyaṁ pratyācāryasya vacanamētat। dvau cātra hētū viṣayāṇāṁ tyāgē-parādhīnatvamāhitatvaṁ ca । mahānta guṇataḥ। tējasaskāyaṁ tējasaśśarīraṁ tējōrāśiṁ svayaṁprakāśam । [#1] 'ātmajyōtiḥ samrāḍiti hōvācē'ti br̥hadāraṇyakam। sarvatra nihitaṁ sarvagatam । prabhuṁ svatantram । ēvaṁbhūtaṁ guhāśayaṁ ētāvantaṁ kālaṁ ahamātman , saptamyēkavacanasya luk, ātmani । asmin madīyē saṅghātē anyānapēkṣayaiva labdhuṁ yōgyamalabdhvā athā'nyēṣu indriyādiṣu taṁ taṁ viṣayaṁ pratīcchāmi laṅathai laṭ, pratyaiccham । idānīṁ tu taṁ labdhvā na tathāvidhō'smi । tvamapyētadēva hitaṁ sādhuṣṭhānaṁ sādhumārgaṁ sēvasva nāhitaṁ viṣayānudhāvanamiti ॥ 6॥   

[#1]: br̥ha0 u0 4. 3. 6. atra pāṭhabhēdō dr̥śyatē।
</details>

<details><summary>śaṅkarācārya-vivaraṇam</summary>

**sūtram**  
ātmannēvā'hamalabdhvaitaddhitaṁ sēvasva nā'hitam ।  
athā'nyēṣu pratīcchāmi sādhuṣṭhānamanapēkṣayā ।  
mahāntaṁ tējasaskāyaṁ sarvatra nihitaṁ prabhum ॥ 6 ॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
tat kvā'nuṣṭhātavyamiti । ucyatē—

**ṭīkā**  
ātmannēva ātmanyēva । pratyagātmā hi paramātmā। sarvaṁ hyatrānuṣṭhēyam । yadi dēhādanyatrā'nuṣṭhīyēta, sō'nātmā kalpitaḥ syāt । tasmād dēhādisaṅghāta ātmanyēva vidhūya bāhyāsaṅgaṁ guhāśayamātmatatvamanuṣṭhēyam । kimanyēṣvananuṣṭhēyamiti bhagavatō matam ? bāḍham, prathamamēva nānyēṣvanuṣṭhēyamātmatattvam । kathaṁ tarhi ? sarvaprayatnēnā'pi svadēhādisaṅghātē yathōktamātmatattvaṁ na labhēta, athā'hamanyēṣvādityādiṣu pratīcchāmi abhivāñchāmi । sādhuṣṭhānaṁ sādhōḥ paramātmanaḥ upalabdhisthānaṁ, yatra guhāśāyaṁ brahmatatvamanuṣṭhēyam । anapēkṣayā'nyat putravittalōkādisukhaṁ chitvā niḥspr̥hatayā । na hyātmānuṣṭhānaṁ bāhyārthākāṅkṣā ca saha sambhavataḥ । kasmāt punaranēkānyanyāni hitaprakārāṇyanapēkṣyā'tmānuṣṭhānamēva yatnata āsthīyata ityata āhā''cāryaḥ- yathānyānyahitāni hitabudhyā parigr̥hītāni, na tathaivamātmasēvanam । kiṁ tarhi ? (ē)taddhitamēva । tasmāt sēvasvēti । kiṁviśiṣṭaścā''tmā sēvitavya ityāha- mahāntam amitāntam ananta(ra)tvādabāhyatvācca mahānātmā, taṁ mahāntam । guṇairvōpādhisahacāribhirmahāntaṁ, br̥ṁhaṇamiti yadvat । tējasaskāyaṁ tējaḥśarīramityarthaḥ । caitanyātmajyōtiḥsvarūpam । taddhi tējasāṁ tējaḥ । (1) 'yēna sūryastapati tējasēddhaḥ' (2) 'tasya bhāsā sarvamidaṁ vibhāti' iti śrutēḥ। sarvatra sarvadēhēṣu brahmādistambaparyantēṣu । nihitaṁ sthitama, upalabdhirūpēṇābhivyaktamityarthaḥ । na hi brahmaṇō'bhivyaktinimittatvavyatirēkēṇa kasyacidādhāratvasambhavaḥ । nirādhāraṁ hi brahma, sarvagatatvōpapattēḥ । prabhuṁ prabhavati sarvānīśvarān prati, acintyaśaktitvāt । ēvamādyanantaguṇaviśiṣṭamātmānaṁ sēvasvēti ॥ 6॥

- 1. tai. brā. 13. 9. 7.
- 2. muṇḍa, 2. 2. 10.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

sarvabhūtēṣu yō nityō vipaścidamr̥tō dhruvaḥ । anaṅgō 'śabdō'śarīrō'sparśaśca mahāñśuciḥ । sa sarvaṁ paramā kāṣṭhā sa vaiṣuvataṁ sa vai vaibhājanaṁ puram 7
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

7. It is he who is the eternal part in all creatures, whose essence is wisdom, who is immortal, unchangeable, destitute of limbs, of voice, of the (subtle) body, [#7]  (even) of touch, exceedingly pure; he is the universe, he is the highest goal; (he dwells in the middle of the body as) the Vishuvat day is (the middle of a Sattra-sacrifice); he, indeed, is (accessible to all) like a town intersected by many streets.

[#7]:  The Sutra contains a further description of the Paramātman.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
sarvabhūtēṣu yō nityō vipaścidamr̥tō dhruvaḥ ।  
anaṅgō'śabdō'śarīrō'sparśaśca mahāñcchuciḥ।  
sa sarvāṁ paramā kāṣṭhā sa vaiṣuvataṁ sa vai vaibhājanaṁ puram ॥7॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
punarapyasau kīdr̥śa ityāha—

**ṭīkā**  
sarvabhūtēṣu manuṣyādiṣu saṅghātēṣu yō nityaḥ vinaśyatsvapi na vinaśyati vipaścit mēdhāvī citsvarūpaḥ। amr̥taḥ nityatvādēvā'maraṇadharmā । ataḥ dhruvaḥ ēkarūpaḥ, vikārarahitaḥ । na pradhānavādvikāriṇassatō dhārmarūpēṇā'sya nityatvamityarthaḥ । anaṅgaḥ karacaraṇādyaṅgarahitaḥ । aśabdō'sparśa iti bhūtaguṇānāmupalakṣaṇam । śabdādiguṇarahitaḥ aśarīraḥ sūkṣmaśarīrēṇā'pi varjitaḥ। mahāñcchuciḥ mahattvaṁ śaucasya viśēṣaṇam । paramārthatō'tyantaśuddhaḥ। sa sarvaṁ prakr̥tyabhēdadvārēṇa । sa ēva paramā kāṣṭhā, tataḥ paraṁ gantavyābhāvāda । sa vaiṣuvataṁ viṣuvānnāma gavāmayanasya madhyē bhavamahaḥ । 'ēkaviṁśamētadaharupayanti viṣuvantaṁ madhyē samvatsarasyē'ti darśanāt । viṣuvānēva vaiṣuvatam ।  
tadyathā samvatsarasya madhyē bhavati ēvamaṅgānāmēṣa madhyē । [#1] madhyaṁ hyēṣāmaṅgānāmātmēti bahvr̥cabrāhmaṇam । sa ēva ca vaibhājanaṁ puraṁ vividhairmārgairbhajanīyaṁ vibhajanam । tadēva vaibhājanaṁ prajñādiranuśatikādiśca । yathā samr̥ddhaṁ puraṁ sarvairarthibhiḥ prāpyamēvamayamapīti ॥7॥  

[#1]: ai0 brā0 6. pa. 8. kha.
</details>

<details><summary>śaṅkarācārya-vivaraṇam</summary>

**sūtram**  
sarvabhūtēṣu yō nityō vipaścidamr̥tō dhruvaḥ ।  
anaṅgō'śabdō'śarīrō'sparśaśca mahāñcchuciḥ।  
sa sarvāṁ paramā kāṣṭhā sa vaiṣuvataṁ sa vai vaibhājanaṁ puram ॥7॥  

**ṭīkā**  
viśiṣṭamātmānaṁ sēvasvēti kriyāpadamanuvartatē । kiṁ ca sarvabhūtēṣu brahmādiṣvanityēṣu yō nityō'vināśī । vipaścinmēdhāvī, sarvajña ityarthaḥ । amr̥tō'ta ēva । yō hyanityō'sarvajñaḥ sa martyō dr̥ṣṭaḥ, ayaṁ tu tadviparītatvādamr̥taḥ। dhruva avicalaḥ । niṣkampasvabhāva ityarthaḥ । anaṅgaḥ sthūlaśarīrarahita ityarthaḥ । sthūlē hi śarīrē śiraādyaṅgāni sambhavanti । aśarīra iti liṅgaśarīravarjita ityētat । aśabdaḥ nā'sya śabdaguṇaḥ sambhavati । śabdaviddhi san anyathā śabdātmakaḥ śabdātmakamēva vijānīyāt । na caitadasti । atō'śabdaḥ । tathā asparśaḥ ākāśavāyubhūtadvayaguṇapratiṣēdhēna śabdādayō gandhāvasānāḥ sarvabhūtaguṇāḥ pratiṣiddhā vēditavyāḥ। tata idaṁ siddhamākāśādapi sūkṣmatvam । śabdādiguṇabāhulyādvāyvādiṣu sthaulyatāratamyamupalabhyatē। śabdādiguṇābhāvānniratiśayasūkṣmatvaṁ sarvagatatvādi cā''pratibandhēna dharmajātaṁ tarkēṇā'pi śakyaṁ sthāpayitum ।  

- 1. br̥ha.u. 4. 3 6. atra pāṭhabhēdō dr̥śyatē.  

mahān, ata ēva śucirnirañjanaḥ। athavā śuciḥ pāvana ityarthaḥ । śuci hi vastu pāvanaṁ dr̥ṣṭam , yathā lōkē vāyvagnyādi । kiñca ya ātmā prakr̥taḥ, sa sarvam । (1)'idaṁ sarvaṁ yadayamātmē'ti hi vājasanēyakē । na hyātmavyatirēkēṇa kiñcinnirūpyamāṇamupapadyatē । ata ēva paramā prakr̥ṣṭā । kāṣṭhā avasānam । (2) 'sā kāṣṭhā sā parā gati'riti kāṭhakē । saṁsāragatīnāṁ avasānaṁ niṣṭhā samāptirityarthaḥ । sa vaiṣuvataṁ madhyaṁ sarvasya, sarvāntaraśrutēḥ। viṣuvatsu vā(3) divākīrtyēṣu mantrēṣu nityaṁ prakāśyaṁ bhavatīti vaiṣuvataḥ । sa paramātmā ।  
nanu sa sarvaṁ paramā kāṣṭhā sā vaiṣuvata'mityuktam । kasmāt punastadātmatattvaṁ vibhaktamupalabhyata iti । ucyatē- sa paramātmā vaibhājanaṁ, vibhākarvibhajanaṁ vivēkaḥ ātmanō yasmin dēhē kriyatē, tat । vibhājanamēva vaibhājanam । ātmanō vivēkōpalabdhyadhiṣṭhānaṁ hi śarīram । taccā'nēkadhā vibhaktam । tadupādhyanuvartitvād vaibhājanam sarvathā śuddhamēva sarvairnōpalabhyatē । kiṁ tarhi ? vibhaktō viparītaścōpalabhyatē ॥ 7॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

taṁ yō'nutiṣṭhētsarvatra prādhvaṁ cāsya sadācarēt । durdarśaṁ nipuṇaṁ yuktō yaḥ paśyētsa mōdēta viṣṭapē 8
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

8. He who meditates on him, and everywhere and always lives according to his (commandments), and who, full of devotion, sees him who is difficult to be seen and subtle, will rejoice in (his) heaven. [#8] 

[#8]:  Haradatta explains the word viṣṭap, 'heaven,' by 'pain-freed greatness,' apparently misled by a bad etymology. The heaven of the Ātman is, of course, liberation, that state where the individual soul becomes merged in the Brahman or Paramātman, which is pure essence, intelligence and joy.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
taṁ yō'nutiṣṭhētsarvatra prādhvaṁ cā'sya sadā''carēt ।  
durdarśaṁ nipuṇaṁ yuktō yaḥ paśyētsa mōdēta viṣṭapē ॥8॥  

**ṭīkā**  
tamēvaṁbhūtamātmānaṁ yō'nutiṣṭhēdupāsīta yaścā'sya sarvatra sarvāsvavasthāsu sadā prādhvamānukūlyamācarēt । ānukūlya pratiṣiddhavarjanaṁ nityanaimittikakarmānuṣṭhānaṁ ca। yaśca durdaśaṁ nipuṇaṁ[#2] sūkṣmataḥ yuktaḥ samāhitō bhūtvā paśyēt sākṣātkuryāt । saḥ viṣṭapē vigatatāpē svē mahimni sthitō mōdēta sarvaduḥkhavarjitō bhavati । saṁsāradaśāyāṁ vā tirōhitaṁ niratiśayaṁ svamānandamanubhavatīti ॥8॥  

[#2]: sūkṣmamētat iti ka. kha. pu.  

॥ ityāpastambasutravr̥ttāvujjalāyāṁ dvāviṁśī kaṇḍikā ॥ 22 ॥
</details>

<details><summary>śaṅkarācārya-vivaraṇam</summary>

**sūtram**  
taṁ yō'nutiṣṭhētsarvatra prādhvaṁ cā'sya sadā''carēt ।  
durdarśaṁ nipuṇaṁ yuktō yaḥ paśyētsa mōdēta viṣṭapē ॥8॥  

**ṭīkā**  
atastadupādhyanuvartisvabhāvadarśanamavidyākhyaṁ hitvā vidyayā śāstrajanitadarśanēna taṁ yathōktalakṣaṇamātmānamanutiṣṭhēt । sarvatra sarvasmin kālē। kiñca na kēvalamanuṣṭhānamātramasya । prādhvaṁ bandhanam ātmaikatvarasaprajñatāṁ sthirāṁ bāhyaiṣaṇāvyāvr̥ttarūpāṁ sarvasanyāsalakṣaṇam । taddhi bandhanaṁ viduṣō brahmaṇi । ēvaṁ hi baddhō brahmaṇi saṁsārābhimukhō nā''vartatē । tasmād bandhanaṁ cā'sya sadā''carēt । tadanuṣṭhānabandhanē sadācarataḥ kiṁ syāditi ? ucyatē- durdarśa duḥkhēna hyēṣaṇātyāgādinā sa dr̥śyata iti durdarśam । nipuṇaṁ yasmāddhi durdarśaṁ tasmānnipuṇam । atyantakauśalēna samāhitacētasā yuktō yaḥ paśyēt sākṣādupalabhēt-ahamātmēti, sa mōdēt । ēvaṁ dr̥ṣṭā harṣamānandalakṣaṇaṁ prāpnuyāt । viṣṭapē vigatasantāpalakṣaṇē'smin brahmaṇītyarthaḥ ॥ 8 ॥
</details>
</details>

### 23 adhyātmam

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ātman paśyan sarvabhūtāni na muhyēccintayankaviḥ । ātmānaṁ caiva sarvatra yaḥ paśyētsa vai brahmā nākapr̥ṣṭhē virājati 1
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

1. That Brāhmaṇa, who is wise and recognises all creatures to be in the Ātman, who pondering (thereon) does not become bewildered, and who recognises the Ātman in every (created) thing, shines, indeed, in heaven.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ātman paśyan sarvabhūtāni na muhyēccintayankaviḥ।  
ātmānaṁ caiva sarvatra yaḥ paśyatsa vai brahmā nākapr̥ṣṭhē virājati ॥ 9 ॥ 1 ॥

**ṭīkā**  
sarvāṇi bhūtāni ātman ātmani śēṣatvēna sthitāni paśyan upaniṣadādibhirjānan । paścāccintayan yuktibhirnirūpayan, yō na muhyēt madhyē mōhaṁ na gacchēt । kavirmēdhāvī । paścācca sarvatraiva śēṣatvēna sthitamātmanaṁ paśyēt sākṣātkuryāt । sa vai brahmā brāhmaṇaḥ nākapr̥ṣṭhē tatsadr̥śē svē mahimni sthitō virājati svayaṁ prakāśatē ॥1॥
</details>

<details><summary>śaṅkarācārya-vivaraṇam</summary>

ātman paśyan sarvabhūtāni na muhyēccintayankaviḥ । ātmānaṁ caiva sarvatra yaḥ paśyētsa vai brahmā nākapr̥ṣṭhē virājati 1

vivaraṇam । kiñca ātman paśyan ātmani paśyan upalabhamānaḥ । sarvabhūtāni sarvāṇi (bhūtāni)। sarvēṣāṁ bhūtānāmātmasvarūpatāmēva paśyannityarthaḥ । savatrā''tmānaṁ ca param । na muhyēta mōha na gacchēt । na hyātmaikatvadarśinō mōhāvatāraḥ; (1) tatra kō mōha' iti ca mantraliṅgāt। kīḍagviśiṣṭamā smadarśanaṁ mōhanibarhaṇamityāha--cintayan upasaṁhr̥takaraṇaḥ kaviḥ mēdhā vī san dhyāyamānaḥ । na śabdajanitadarśanamātrēṇa mōhāpagamaḥ । sarvabhūtē. catupraviṣṭamakaṁ saṁvyavahārakālē yō hi yuktaḥ paśyēt , sa vai brahmā brāhmaṇaḥ । nākapr̥ṣṭhē sukarāgau(1) brahmaṇi । virājati vividhaṁ dīpyatē ॥9॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

nipuṇō'ṇīyānbisōrṇāyā yaḥ sarvamāvr̥tya tiṣṭhati । varṣīyāṁśca pr̥thivyā dhruvaḥ sarvamārabhya tiṣṭhati । sa indriyairjagatō'sya jñānādanyō'nanyasya jñēyātparamēṣṭhī vibhājaḥ । tasmātkāyāḥ prabhavanti sarvē sa mūlaṁ śāśvatikaḥ sa nityaḥ 2
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

2. He, who is intelligence itself and subtler than the thread of the lotus-fibre, pervades the universe, and who, unchangeable and larger than the earth, contains the universe; he, who is different from the knowledge of this world, obtained by the senses and identical with its objects, possesses the highest (form consisting of absolute knowledge). From him, who divides himself, spring all (created) bodies. He is the primary cause, he is eternal, he is unchangeable. [#1] 

[#1]:  23. This Sūtra again contains a description of the Paramātman. The translation strictly follows the commentary, though the explanation, given in the latter, is open to objections.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
nipuṇō'ṇīyān bisōrṇāyā yassarvamāvr̥tya tiṣṭhati ।   varṣīyāṁśca pr̥thivyā dhruvaḥ sarvamārabhya tiṣṭhati ।
sa indriyairjagatō'sya jñānādanyō' nanyasya jñēyātparamēṣṭhī vibhājaḥ।  
tasmātkāyāḥprabhavanti sarvē samūlaṁ śāśvatikaḥ sa nityaḥ ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
nipuṇō mēdhāvī citsvarūpaḥ । bisōrṇāyā bisatantōrapyaṇīyān sūkṣmaḥ। ya sarvamāvr̥tya vyāpya tiṣṭhati । yaśca pr̥thivyā api varṣīyān pravr̥ddhataraḥ sarvagatatvādēva sarvamārabhya viṣṭabhya śēṣitvēnā'dhiṣṭhāya tiṣṭhati । dhruvaḥ ēkarūpaḥ। asya jagatō yadindriyairjñānaṁ indriyajanyaṁ jñānaṁ tasmāt । kīdr̥śāta ? ananyasya jñēyāt , pañcamyarthē ṣaṣṭhī, jñēyāt nīlapītādyākārādananyabhūtaṁ nīlapītādyākāraṁ, tasmādviṣajñānādanya ityarthaḥ । śrūyatē ca [#2] tasmādvā ētasmādvijñānamayāt । anyō'ntara ātmā''nandamaya' iti ।  
[#3] jñānasvarūpamatyantanirmalaṁ paramārthataḥ ।  
tamēvārthasvarūpēṇa bhrāntidarśanatassthitam ॥ iti purāṇam ।  svabhāvataḥ svacchasya cidrūpasya''tmanō nīlapītādyākārakāluṣyaṁ tadrūpāyā buddhēranurāgakr̥taṁ bhrāntamityarthaḥ। vaiṣayikajñānādanya iti viśēṣaṇēna jñānātmaka ityapi siddham। [#4] 'satyaṁ jñānamanantaṁ brahmē'ti ca śrutiḥ। ēvaṁbhūtasyā''mā paramēṣṭhī paramē svarūpē tiṣṭhatīti । vibhāja ityasya parēṇa sambandhaḥ । vibhajatyātmānaṁ dēvamanuṣyādirūpēṇa nānāśarīrānupravēśēnēti vibhāk । tasmādvibhājō nimittabhūtāt sarvē kāyā dēvamanuṣyaśarīrāṇi prabhavanti utpadyantē । sa mūlaṁ prapañcasr̥ṣṭērbhōktr̥tayā mūlakāraṇam । sa nityaḥ avināśī । śāśvatika ēkarūpaḥ avikāraḥ ॥2॥

3. But the eradication of the faults is brought about in this life by the means (called Yoga). A wise man who has eradicated the (faults) which destroy the creatures, obtains salvation.

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
dōṣāṇāṁ tu nirghātō yōgamūla iha jīvitē ।  
nirhr̥tya bhūta dāhīyān kṣēmaṁ gacchati paṇḍitaḥ ॥ 11 ॥ 3 ॥

**ṭīkā**  
dōṣāṇāṁ vakṣyamāṇānāṁ krōdhādīnāṁ nirghātaḥ nirmūlanam । iha jīvitē yōgamūlaḥ yōgāḥ vakṣyamāṇā akrōdhādayaḥ tanmūlakaḥ । ataśca tān bhūtadāhīyān bhūtāni dahataḥ krōdhādīndōṣān nirhr̥tya kṣēmaṁ gacchati ātmatrāṇadvārēṇa । paṇḍitō [#3]labdhajñānaḥ ātmasākṣātkārī । kṣēmaṁ abhayaṁ mōkṣam [#4]abhayaṁ vai janaka prāptō'sīti br̥hadāraṇyakam ॥ samāptāḥ ślōkāḥ ॥ 3 ॥

[#3]:

    labdhajñānaḥ ātmasākṣātkārī iti ka.kha.pu.

vivaraṇam । ēvaṁ yathōktamātmāna viditavata ādhyātmikā yōgā nyāyasahitā apratibandhēna bhaviṣyanti । mithyāpratyayapūrvakā hi dōṣāḥ। dōṣanimiḥ saśca dharmādharmajanitaḥ sasāraḥ dōṣanivr̥ttāvatyantaṁ vinivartatē ityētama. thai darśayiṣyannāha--

dōṣāṇāṁ tu nirghātō yōgamūla iha jīvitē । nihatya
bhūta dāhīyān kṣēmaṁ gacchati paṇḍitaḥ ॥ 11 ॥ 3 ॥ ___ dōṣāṇāṁ tu krōdhādīnāṁ nirghāta vināśaḥ। yōgā akrōdhādayaḥ, ta. nmūlaḥ tanimittamityētat । akrōdhādiṣu hi satsu pratidvandvinō dōṣā durbalatvānihanyantē । iha javita iti dōṣaprabhavakamīnīmattatvājjīvita tasya dēhadhāraṇāvasānō dōṣavyāpāra ityētad darśayati । tatpratipakṣēśva krōdhādiṣu kathaṁ nu nāma mumukṣavaḥ prayatnātiśaya kuyuriti yōgadōṣayō ritarētaravirōdhitvē sati sthitigativad yōgēbhyō dōṣāṇāmēva nirdhātaḥ, na tu viparyaya ityētat । kathāmiti cēt ? ucyatē-samyagdarśanasaciva. tvād balavantō yōgāḥ । mithyāpratyayasacivaktvāta durbalatvānihanyantē । nihantītyētadapyuktam । buddhibalavadbhayastaddhīnānāṁ lōkē nirdhātō dr̥ṣṭaḥ । 'akrōdhanaḥ' (1. 1. 23) 'krōdhādīṁśca---' (1. 11. 25) iti li nāt । nirhatya apahr̥tya । bhūtadāhān dōṣēṣu(na?) hyadbhutēṣu bhūtāni da. hanta iva agninā paritapyantē । atō bhūtadāhā dōṣā ucyantē । tān nihatya । kṣēmaṁ nirbhaya mōkṣaṁ gacchati। ___"ānandaṁ brahmaṇō vidvān na bibhēti kutaścana"abhayaṁ vai janaka prāptō ali' na bhavati vidaṣāṁ tatō bhayama' ityādiśratismatibhya. । na dōṣapraśamamātrēṇā'brahmavidaḥ kṣēmaprāptirityāha-paṇḍita iti । brahmavidi hyatra paṇḍitaśabdaḥ prayuktō, na śāstravidi । (1)"tasmād brāhmaṇaḥ pā ṇḍitya nirvidya" iti śrutēḥ । ihā''tmavidyādhikārāta ।
yadi tarhi dōṣaniharaṇaṁ paṇḍitō'pyapakṣēta, taṁ prati na hi brahmavi dyā kṣēmaprāptinimittam । yadi brahmavidyaiva kṣēmaprāptinimittaṁ, brahmavidyā nantaramēva na duḥkhamupalabhēta । naiṣa dōṣaḥ । uktō hyatra parihāraḥ--samyaga jñānabalāvaṣṭambhād balinō yōgā durvalān dōṣān mithyāpratyayabhavān nihantumalamiti । tasmād brahmavidyayaiva kṣēmaprāptiḥ । anyathā dōṣaniha raṇakarmakṣayayōrasambhavāt ।

āpastambadharmasūtrē (pa.8)ka.23 vidyayā cēd dōṣaniharaṇakarmakṣayāvaśyaṁ bhavataḥ, tata idamayanakā. yatvād dōṣaniharaṇasya nityānuvāda rūpamanarthakam, nihatyēti, na, pravr̥ttakarmākṣiptatvād dōṣāṇām। dvividhāni banēkajanmāntarakr̥tāni karmāṇi-phaladānāya pravr̥ttānyapravr̥ttāni ca । yattu pravr̥tta karma, tēnākṣi nā dōṣāḥ kartuḥ sukhaduḥkhādiphaladānāya, dōṣābhāvē phalārambhakatvā. nupapattēḥ । na hi rāgadvēṣādiśūnyē sukhaduḥkha pravr̥ttilabdhiḥ kadācit kasyacidiha dr̥śyatē । tasmāt phaladānāya pravr̥ttēna karmaṇākṣiptā dōṣāḥ prasaṅgēna prāptabalā yatnatō nihartavyā । pravr̥tyādhikyahētutvaprasaṅgāt । ata ēvēdamuktam-dōṣāṇāṁ tu nirghātō yōgamūlē iha jīvita iti। manda. madhyamōttamāpēkṣatvācca । brahmavidāmapi na sarvēṣāṁ samā bahmapratipattiḥ, vivēkātiśayadarśanāta kasyācata । 'ēṣa brahmavidāṁ variṣṭa' iti ca śrutaḥ samyagdarśanasampanna' iti ca smr̥taḥ। mandamadhyamabrahmavidapēkṣayā tyāga. vairāgyēndriyajayāvidhērarthavattvam : uttama brahmavidāṁ tvarthaprāptamētat savami. tyanuvādamātram । (1) rasō'pyasya paraṁ dr̥ṣṭvā nivartatē, iti vacanāt guṇā tīttalakṣaṇavacanēbhyaśca । pravr̥ttakāṁkṣiptadōṣāt tajānatacēṣṭābhyaśca bha. vati viduṣō'pi dēhāntarōtpattiriti cēda-muktaṣuvat pravr̥ttakākṣipta tvād vidvahōṣacēṣṭānāṁ pravr̥tta karmavibhāganavōpakṣīṇaśaktitvāta prayōjanā ntārābhāvācca na janmāntarārambhakatvamupapadyatē । yadyapravr̥ttaṁ kama, tata
satyavāvasthamēva brahmavidyāhutāśanadagdhabījaśaktitvācāla janmāntarāra. mbhāya, 'kṣīyantē cā'sya kamāṇi'(2) 'jñānāgniḥ sarvakamāṇi'ityādiśru. tismr̥tibhyaḥ । ataḥ siddhā paṇḍitasya dōṣaniharaṇāta kṣamaprāptiḥ ॥ 11॥

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

4. Now we will enumerate the faults which tend to destroy the creatures.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
atha bhūtadāhīyāndōṣānudāhariṣyāmaḥ ॥ 12 ॥ 4॥  

**ṭīkā**  
bhūtānāṁ dāhō bhūtadāhaḥ tasmai hitāḥ bhr̥tadāhīyāḥ tasmai hitamiti chaḥ।
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

krōdhō harṣō rōṣō lōbhō mōhō dambhō drōhō mr̥ṣōdyamatyāśaparīvādāvasūyā kāmamanyū anātmyamayōgastēṣāṁ yōgamūlō nirghātaḥ ॥ 13 ॥ 5 ॥  

</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

5. (These are) anger, exultation, grumbling, covetousness, perplexity, doing injury, hypocrisy, lying, gluttony, calumny, envy, lust, secret hatred, neglect to keep the senses in subjection, neglect to concentrate the mind. The eradication of these (faults) takes place through the means of (salvation called) Yoga.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
krōdhō harṣō rōṣō lōbhō mōhō dambhō drōhō mr̥ṣōdyamatyāśaparīvādāvasūyā kāmamanyū anātmyamayōgastēṣāṁ yōgamūlō nirghātaḥ ॥ 13 ॥ 5 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
[#1]tāḍanākrōśādihētukō'ntaḥkaraṇavikṣōbhaḥ svēdakampādiliṅgaḥ krōdhaḥ । harṣaḥ iṣṭalābhāccētasa udrēkō rōmāñcādiliṅgaḥ । rōṣaḥ krōdhasyaiva kiyānapi bhēdō mitrādiṣu pratikūlēṣu manasō vailōmyamātrakāryakaraḥ। lōbhō dravyasaṅgaḥ, yō dharmavyayamapi ruṇaddhi । mōhaḥ kāryākāryayōravivēkaḥ। sa ca prāyēṇa krōdhādijanyō'pi pr̥thagupadiśyatē kadācittadabhāvē'pi sambhavatīti । dambhō dhārmikatva[#2]prakāśanēna lōkavañcanam । drōhō'pakāraḥ। mr̥ṣōdyamanr̥tavādaḥ । atyāśō'tyaśanam । parīvādaḥ paradōṣābhidhānam । asūyā paraguṇē[#3]ṣvakṣamā । kāmaḥ strīsaṁsargaḥ । manyuḥ gūḍhō dvēṣaḥ । anātmya ajitēndriyatvaṁ jihvācāpalādi । ayōgō vikṣiptacittatā । ētē bhūtadāhīyā dōṣāḥ । tēṣāṁ yōgamūlō nirghātaḥ ॥5॥  

[#1]: ākrōśādi iti kha. pu.  

[#2]: pradarśanēna iti ka. pu.  

[#3]: akṣamatā iti ka. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

akrōdhō'harṣō'rōṣō'lōbhō'mōhō'dambhō'drōhaḥ satyavacanamanatyāśō'paiśunamanasūyā saṁvibhāgastyāga ārjavaṁ mārdavaṁ śamō damaḥ sarvabhūtairavirōdhō yōga āryamānr̥śaṁsaṁ tuṣṭiriti sarvāśramāṇāṁ samayapadāni tānyanutiṣṭhanvidhinā sārvagāmī bhavati 6
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

6. Freedom from anger, from exultation, from grumbling, from covetousness, from perplexity, from hypocrisy (and) hurtfulness; truthfulness, moderation in eating, silencing a slander, freedom from envy, self-denying liberality, avoiding to accept gifts, uprightness, affability, extinction of the passions, subjection of the senses, peace with all created beings, concentration (of the mind on the contemplation of the Ātman), regulation of one's conduct according to that of the Āryas, peacefulness and contentedness;--these (good qualities) have been settled by the agreement (of the wise) for all (the four) orders; he who, according to the precepts of the sacred law, practises these, enters the universal soul.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
akrōdhō'harṣō'rōṣō'lōbhō'mōhō'dambhō'drōhaḥ satyavacanamanatyāśō'paiśunamanasūyā saṁvibhāgastyāga ārjavaṁ mārdavaṁ śamō damaḥ sarvabhūtairavirōdhō yōga āryamānr̥śaṁsaṁ tuṣṭiriti sarvāśramāṇāṁ samayapadāni tānyanutiṣṭhan vidhinā [#1]sārvagāmī bhavati ॥ 14 ॥ 6॥  

[#1]:

    sārvagāmī iti vivaraṇānumataḥ pāṭhaḥ।

**prastāvaḥ**  
kē punastē yōgā iti, ucyatē —  

**ṭīkā**  
kē punastē yōgāḥ ? tānāha—  
ētē cā'krōdhādayō'pi bhāvarūpāḥ na krōdhādyabhāvamātram , krōdhādinirghātahētutayōpadēśāt । kē punastē ? akrōdhaḥ, krōdhādiṣu prasaktēṣvapi mā kārṣamiti saṅkalpaḥ। aharṣaḥ, iṣṭalābhālābhēṣu cētasa aikarūpyam । arōṣaḥ mitrādiṣu pratikūlēṣvapi manōvikārābhāvaḥ । alōbhaḥ santōṣō'lambuddhiḥ। amōhō'vadhānam । adambhō dharmānuṣṭhānam । adrōhaḥ parēṣvapakāriṣvapyanapakāraḥ । anasūyā paraguṇēṣvabhimōdanam । satyavacanaṁ yathādr̥ṣṭārthavāditvam । samvibhāgaḥ ātmāna[#1]muparudhyā'pyagrādidānam । tyāgō'pariprahaḥ । ārjavaṁ manōvākkāyānāmēkarūpatvam । mārdavaṁ sūpagamyatā। śamaḥ manyuparityāgaḥ । damaḥ[#2]indriyajayaḥ । ētābhyāmēva gatatvāt pūrvasvasmin kramē akāmaḥ, amanyuḥ, ātmavatvamiti nōpadiṣṭam । sarvabhūtairavirōdhaḥ । sarvagrahaṇaṁ kṣudrairavirōdhārtham । yōgaḥ aikāpyam । āryāṇāṁ bhāvaḥ āryaṁ śiṣṭācārānupālanam । ānr̥śaṁsaṁ ānr̥śaṁsyaṁ vyavahāravacanādau prasaktanaiṣṭhuryasya varjanam । tuṣṭiranirvēdaḥ । samayō byavasthā । sā ca prakaraṇāddharmajñānām । padaṁ viṣayaḥ । ētē akrōdhādayaḥ sarvēṣāmāśramāṇāṁ sēvyāḥ, na kēvalaṁ yōgināmēvēti dharmajñānāṁ samaya ityarthaḥ । ētē hi bhāvyamānāḥ krōdhādīnū samūlaghātaṁ ghnanti । ataśca tānyanutiṣṭhan vidhinā sārvagāmī bhavati । tānyakrōdhādīni tuṣṭyantāni । vidhinā yathāśāstram । anutiṣṭhan sārvagāmī sarvasmai hitaḥ sārvaḥ ātmā taṁ gacchati prāpnōti। 'vidhinē'ti vacanāt[#3]prāṇināṁ tu vadhō yatra tatra sākṣyanr̥taṁ vadēt ।' ityādikē viṣayē anr̥tavacanādāvapi na dōṣa iti ॥ 6 ॥  

[#1]: avarudhya iti ka, pu.  

[#2]: indriyanigrahaḥ iti ga. pu  

[#3]:

    dvitrēṣvapyādarśapustakēṣu 'prāṇināṁ tu vadhō yatra' ityēva pāṭhassamupalabhyatē । parantu ślōkārthamidaṁ yājñavalkīyam । tatra “varṇināṁ hi vō yatra" ityēva mudritapustakēṣu pāṭhassamasti । (yā0 smr̥0 2.83.) kiñca manau-ētatsamānārthakaślōka ēvamupalabhyatē—  

    śūdraviṭkṣatraviprāṇāṁ yatrartōktau bhavēdvadhaḥ ।  
    tatra vaktavyamanr̥taṁ taddhi satyādviśiṣyatē ॥ iti । (ma0 smr̥0 8. 104)   

    anayōrēkārthatvamabhyupagamyaiva vijñānēśvarēṇā'pi “yatra varṇinā śudrāviṭkṣatraviprāṇāṁ satyavacanēna vadhassambhāvyatē” iti yājñavalkīya vacanaṁ vyākhyātam । anyairapi viśvarūpāparārkādibhi 'varṇinām' ityēvaṁ pāṭhaḥ svīkr̥taḥ । atō'trāpi 'varṇinā' ityēva pāṭhassādhīyāniti yuktamutpaśyāmaḥ ॥  

iti śrīharadattaviracitāyāmāpastambadharmasatravr̥ttāvujvalāyāṁ
trayōviṁśī kaṇḍikā ॥ 23 ॥  

iti cāpastambadharmasūtravr̥ttau haradattamiśraviracitāyāmu
jjvalāyāṁ prathamapraśnē'ṣṭamaḥ paṭalaḥ ॥8॥ .
</details>

<details><summary>śaṅkarācārya-vivaraṇam</summary>

akrōdhō'harṣō'rōṣō'lōbhō'mōhō'dambhō'drōhaḥ satyavacanamanatyāśō'paiśunamanasūyā saṁvibhāgastyāga ārjavaṁ mārdavaṁ śamō damaḥ sarvabhūtairavirōdhō yōga āryamānr̥śaṁsaṁ tuṣṭiriti sarvāśramāṇāṁ samayapadāni tānyanutiṣṭhanvidhinā sārvagāmī bhavati 6

vivaraṇam । __ akrōdhō'harṣaḥ ityēvamādyā ayōgaviparītāḥ । atastē samādhilakṣaṇa svāda yōgā। savibhāgaḥ ātmanō yātrālādhanasyā'rthibhyaḥ saṁvibhajanam । syāgaḥ dr̥ṣṭādr̥ṣṭēṣṭabhōgānāṁ śaktitaḥ parityajam , tatsādhanānāṁ ca । ārjavam r̥jutā, aduṣṭākalanapūrvikā vāṅmanākāyānāṁ pravr̥tiḥ। mārdava mr̥dutvam । śamō'ntaḥkaraṇōpaśamaḥ। damō bāhyakaraṇāpēśamaḥ। idamanyad yōgalakṣaṇaṁ saṁkṣēpata ucyatē-sarvabhūtāvirōdhō yōgaḥ, virōghē hi bhūtānāṁ pīḍā, tadabhāvē'pīḍā । sa ēva sarvabhūtāpīḍālakṣaṇō yōgaḥ। āryam āryāṇāṁ bhāvaḥ akṣudratā । ānr̥śaṁsam ānr̥śaṁsyam , akrauryam । tuṣṭiḥ labdhavyasyā'lābhē'pi cētasā prasannatayā'vasthānaṁ lābha iva । sarva bhatāvirōlakṣaṇāṁhilā parivrājakasyaiva sambhavatītyāyaryādīnāṁ trayā. ṇāmanyēṣāṁ cāviruddhānāṁ sarvāśramāna prati prāptiritītiśabdasāma
d,i itiśabdasya ca prakāravacanatvādāryādīnītthaṁprakārāṇi sarvāśra mān prati gamayati sarvāśramāṇāṁ samayapadānōti । samayasthānānītyē tat । avaśyānuṣṭhēyānītyarthaḥ । tānyētāni yathōktānyanutiṣṭhan vidhinā sarvagāmī sarvagamanaśīlaḥ, śānābhivyaktikramēṇa । bhavati mucyatē ityarthaḥ ।। iti śrīgōvindabhagavatpūjyapādaśiṣyasya śrīśaṅkarabhagavatpādācāryasya kr̥tiṣu
āpastambīyadharmaśāstrādhyātmapaṭalavivaraṇam ॥
</details>
</details>

## +09

### 24 hatyādi

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

kṣatriyaṁ hatvā gavāṁ sahasraṁ vairayātanārthaṁ dadyāt 1
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

1. He who has killed a Kṣatriya shall give a thousand cows (to Brāhmaṇas) for the expiation of his sin. [#1] 

[#1]:  24. Manu XI, 128; Yājñ. III, 266. Others explain the phrase vairayātanārtham, 'for the expiation of his sin,' thus: 'He, who is p. 79 slain by anybody, becomes, in dying, an enemy of his slayer (and thinks), "O that I might slay him in another life," for the removal of this enmity!'--Haradatta. I am strongly inclined to agree with the other commentator, and to translate vairayātanārtham, 'in order to remove the enmity.' I recognise in this fine a remnant of the law permitting compositions for murder which was in force in ancient Greece and among the Teutonic nations. With the explanation adopted by Haradatta, it is impossible to find a reasonable interpretation for prāyaścittirthaḥ, Sūtra 4. Haradatta, seduced by the parallel passage of Manu, takes it to be identical with vairayātanārtham. I propose to translate our Sūtra thus: 'He who has killed a Kṣatriya shall give a thousand cows (to the relations of the murdered man) in order to remove the enmity.' According to Baudhāyana I, 10. 19. 1 (compare Zeitschr. d. D. Morg. Ges., vol. 41, pp. 672-76; Festgruss an Roth, pp. 44-52), the cows are to be given to the king.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
kṣatriyaṁ hatvā gavāṁ sahasraṁ vairayātanārthaṁ dadyāt ॥ 1 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
kṣatriyaṁ hatvā gavāṁ sahasraṁ brāhmaṇēbhyō dadyāt। kimartham ? vairayātanārthaṁ vairaṁ pāpaṁ tasya yātanaṁ niharaṇaṁ tadartham "r̥ṣabhaścātrādhikaḥ sarvatra prāyaścittārtha"(24.4)iti vakṣyati । tēna prāyaścittarūpamidaṁ dānam। prāyaścittaṁ ca pāpakṣayārtham । tatkimarthaṁ vairayātanārthamityucyatē ? kēcinmanyantē nā'bhuktaṁ kṣīyatē karma puṇyamapuṇyaṁ ca । prāyaścittaṁ tu naimittikaṁ karmāntaraṁ [#1]yathā gr̥hadāhādau kṣāmavatyādaya iti । tānnirākartumidamuktam । śrautē'pyuktaṁ-[#2]dōṣanighātārthāni bhavantī'ti । apara āha-yō yēna hanyatē sa hatō mriyamāṇastasminvairaṁ karōti-api nāmā'hamēnaṁ janmāntarē'pi vadhyāsamiti । tasya vairasya yātanārthamidamiti prāyaścittārthatvamapi vakṣyamāṇēna siddhamiti ॥ 1॥   

[#1]:

    'yasya gr̥hān dahatyagnayē kṣāmavatē purōḍāśamaṣṭākapālaṁ nirvapēt bhāgadhēyēnaivainaṁ śamayati nā'syā'paraṁ gr̥hān dahati' (tai0saṁ0 2. 2.2.) iti vihitā āhitāgnēryajamānasya gr̥hē dagdhē tādr̥śagr̥hadāhanimittakā kṣāmavadagnidēvatākēṣṭiḥ kṣāmavatīṣṭiḥ।

sā vr̥ttiḥ 16

16. That is (the way in which he must gain) his livelihood.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
sā vr̥ttiḥ॥ 16॥  

**ṭīkā**  
saptasvagārēṣu yā ca yāvatī labhyatē saiva vr̥ttiḥ aparyāptā'pi ॥16॥
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

alabdhōpavāsaḥ 17
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

17. If he does not obtain anything (at the seven houses), he must fast.

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
alabdhvōpavāsaḥ ॥ 17 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yadi saptāgārēṣu na kiñcillabhyatē tadōpavāsa ēva tasminnahani ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

gāśca rakṣēt 18

<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

18. And (whilst performing this penance) he must tend cows.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
gāśca rakṣēt ॥18॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ēvaṁ prāyaścittaṁ kurvannaharahargāśca rakṣēt ॥ 18॥
</details>

tāsāṁ niṣkramaṇapravēśanē dvitīyō grāmē'rthaḥ 19

<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

19. When they leave and enter the village, that is the second occasion (on which he may enter) the village.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
tāsāṁ niṣkramaṇapravēśanē dvitīyō grāmē'rthaḥ ॥ 19 ॥

**ṭīkā**  
tāsāṁ gavāṁ niṣkramaṇasamayē pravēśanasamayē ca dvitīyō grāmē'rthaḥ prayōjanam । bhikṣārtha prathamamuktam । nā'nyathā grāmaṁ praviśēdityuktaṁ bhavati ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

dvādaśa varṣāṇi caritvā siddhaḥ sadbhiḥ saṁprayōgaḥ 20
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

20. After having performed (this penance) for twelve years, he must perform) the ceremony known (by custom), through which he is re-admitted into the society of the good. [#7] 

[#7]:  'I.e. after having performed the penance, he shall take grass and offer it to a cow. If the cow approaches and confidingly eats, then one should know that he has performed the penance properly not otherwise.'--Haradatta. Manu XI, 195 and 196.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
dvādaśa varṣāṇi[#1] caritvā siddhaḥ sadbhissamprayōgaḥ ॥20॥

**ṭīkā**  
ēvaṁ dvādaśa varṣāṇi vratamētaccaritvā sadbhiḥ samprayōgaḥ kartavyaḥ । sadbhiḥ saha samprayujyatē yēna vidhinā sa kartavyaḥ। sa śiṣṭācārē śāstrāntarē ca siddhaḥ sa ucyatē-kr̥taprāyaścittaḥ svahastē yavasaṁ gr̥hītvā gāmāhvayēt । sā yadyāgatya śraddadhānā bhakṣayati tadā samyaganēna vrataṁ caritamiti jānīyāt , anyathā nēti ॥ 20 ॥  

[#1]:

    'vratamētaditi ādhikaṁ pustakē
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ājipathē vā kuṭiṅkr̥tvā brāhmaṇagavyōpajigīṣaṁāṇō vasēttriḥ pratirāddhō'pajitya vā muktaḥ 21
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

21. Or (after having performed the twelve years' penance), he may build a hut on the path of robbers, and live there, trying to take from them the cows of Brāhmaṇas. He is free (from his sin), when thrice he has been defeated by them, or when he has vanquished them. [#8] 

[#8]:  Manu XI, 81.--Thus Haradatta, better, 'when-thrice he has fought with them,' see the Pet. Dict. s. v. rādh.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ājipathē vā kuṭiṁ kr̥tvā brāhmaṇagavyō'pajigīṣamāṇō vasēstriḥ pratirāddhō'pajitya vā muktaḥ ॥ 21 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
saṅgrāmēṇa jētavyā dasyavō yēna pathā prāmaṁ praviśya gavādikamapahr̥tyā'pasaranti sa ājipathaḥ । tasminvā kuṭiṁ kr̥tvā vasēt । kiṁ cikīrṣan ? brāhmaṇagavyaḥ [#2] 'vā chandasī'ti pūrvasavarṇābhāvē yaṇādēśaḥ। brāhmaṇagavīrapajigīṣamāṇaḥ dasyūnapajitya pratyāhartumicchan । ēṣa vasan dasyubhirhriyamāṇaṁ gavādikamuddiśya tairyuddhaṁ kurvan triḥ pratirāddhaḥ tairapajitaḥ apajitya vā tān gavādikaṁ pratyāhr̥tya brāhmaṇēbhyō datvā muktō bhavati tasmādēnasaḥ । dvādaśavārṣikē pravr̥ttasyēdam । ēvamuttaramapi ॥ 21 ॥  

[#2]: pā0 sū0 6.1.106.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

āśvamēdhikaṁ vāvabhr̥thamavētya mucyatē 22
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

22. Or he is freed (from his sin), if (after the twelve years' penance) he bathes (with the priests) at the end of a horse-sacrifice. [#9] 

[#9]:  Manu XI, 83; Weber, Ind. Stud. X, 67.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
āśvamēdhikaṁ vā'vabhr̥thamavētya mucyatē ॥ 22 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
atha vā'śvamēdhāvabhr̥thē snātvā mucyatē ॥ 22 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

dharmārthasaṁnipātē'rthagrāhiṇa ētadēva 23
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

23. This very same (penance is ordained) for him who, when his duty and love of gain come into conflict, chooses the gain. [#10] 

[#10]:  'Or the Sūtra may have reference to unrighteous gain acquired by false testimony and the like.'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
dharmārthasannipātē'rthagrāhiṇa ētadēva ॥ 23 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
dharmasyā'gnihōtrādēḥ, arthasya ca kuḍyakaraṇādēḥ [#1] yugapadyatra sannipātaḥ tōbhayānugrahāsambhavē dharmalōpēna yō'rthaṁ gr̥hṇāti tasyā'pyētadēva prāyaścittam । athavā dharmaṁ hitvā'rthahētōḥ kauṭasākṣyādi karōti tadviṣayamētat । atra gautamaḥ—  
[#2] 'kauṭasākṣyaṁ rājagāmi paiśunaṁ gurōranr̥tābhiśaṁsanaṁ mahāpātakasamānī'ti । manurapi—  
[#3] anr̥taṁ ca samutkarṣē rājagāmi ca paiśunam ॥  
gurōścā'līkanirbandhaḥ samāni brahmahatyayā' ॥ iti ॥ 23 ॥  

[#1]:

    kuḍyakaraṇādēḥ iti nāsti ka. ca. pu.

[#2]:

    gau0 dha0 20, 9.

[#3]:

    ma0 smr̥0 11.56.  

[#4]:  

    tēna putrādibhissarakārādyaurdhvadēhikāḥ kāryā iti bhāvaḥ, iti kha.pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

guruṁ hatvā śrōtriyaṁ vā karmasamāptamētēnaiva vidhinōttamāducchvāsāccarēt 24
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

24. If he has slain a Guru or a Brāhmaṇa, who has studied the Veda and finished the ceremonies of a Soma-sacrifice, he shall live according to this very same rule until his last breath. [#11] 

[#11]:  'Guru means "the father and the rest."--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
guruṁ hatvā śrōtriyaṁ vā karmasamāsamētēnaiva vidhinōttamāducchvāsāccarēt ॥ 24 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
guruḥ pitrācāryādiḥ । śrōtriyō'dhītavēdaḥ । sa yadi karmasamāptō bhavati sōmāntāni karmāṇi samāptāni yasya sa karmasamāptaḥ । tō hatvā ētēnaivā'nantarōktēna vidhinā ōttamāducchvāsāt । uttama ucchvāsaḥprāṇaviniyōgaḥ ।
ā tasmāccarēt ॥ 24॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

nāsyāsmiṁllōkē pratyāpattirvidyatē kalmaṣaṁ tu nirhaṇyatē 25
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

25. He cannot be purified in this life. But his sin is removed (after death). [#12] 

[#12]:  'His sin is removed after death. Hence the meaning is that his sons or other (relations) may perform the funeral ceremonies and the like. But others think that the first part of the Sūtra forbids this, and that the meaning of pratvāpattiḥ (can be p. 82 purified) is "connection by being received as a son or other relation."--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
nāsyā'smiṁllōkē pratyāpattirvidyatē ॥ 25 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
aśvamēdhāvabhr̥thādiṣu sambhavatsvapi asyā'smiṁllōkē asmin jīvitē pratyāpattiḥ śuddhirnāstītyarthaḥ ॥ 25 ॥  

**sūtram**  
kalmaṣaṁ tu nirhaṇyatē ॥ 26 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
mr̥tasya kalmaṣaṁ nirhaṇyatē । [#4]tēna putrādibhiḥ saṁskārādiḥ kartavya iti bhāvaḥ । anyē tu pūrvaṁ sūtraṁ tannivr̥tyarthaṁ manyantē । pratyāpattiḥ putrādibhiḥ pitrādibhāvēna sambandha iti ॥26॥  

iti haradattaviracitāyāmāpastambasūtravr̥ttau caturviṁśī kaḍikā ॥24॥
</details>
</details>

### 25 stēyādi

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

gurutalpagāmī savr̥ṣaṇaṁ śiśnaṁ parivāsyāñjalāvādhāya dakṣiṇāṁ diśamanāvr̥ttiṁ vrajēt 1
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

1. He who has had connection with a Guru's wife shall cut off his organ together with the testicles, take them into his joined hands and walk towards the south without stopping, until he falls down dead. [#1] 

[#1]:  25. Haradatta's explanation of a 'Guru's wife' by 'mother' rests on a comparison of similar passages from other Smṛtis, where a different 'penance' is prescribed for incestuous intercourse with other near relations. Manu XI, 105; Yājñ. III, 259.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
gurutalpagāmī savr̥ṣaṇaṁ śiśna parivāsyā'ñjalāvādhāya dakṣiṇāṁ diśamanāvr̥tti vrajēt ॥ 1॥  

**ṭīkā**  
gururatra pitā, nā''cāryādiḥ। talpaśabdēna śayanavācinā bhāryā lakṣyatē । sā ca sākṣājjananī[#1] na tatsapatnī। tāṁ gatvā savr̥ṣaṇaṁ sāṇḍaṁ śiśnaṁ parivāsya kṣurādinā chitvā'ñjalāvādhāya dakṣiṇāṁ diśaṁ vrajēt । anāvr̥ttim āvr̥ttirna kriyatē yasyāṁ tāṁ diśamanāvartamānō gacchēt । atha yē[#2] dakṣiṇasyōdadhēstīrē vasanti tē'pi yāvaddēśaṁ gatvā udadhimēva pravēkṣyanti । maraṇaṁ hātra vivakṣitam । atra sarvataḥ—  

[#1]: tatsapatnī vā iti ga. pu.  

[#2]: athēti nāsti ga. pu.  

[#3]pitr̥dārān samāruhya mātr̥varjaṁ narādhamaḥ।  
bhaginīṁ māturāptāṁ vā svasāraṁ vā'nyamātr̥jām ॥  
ētā gatvā striyō mōhāta[#4] taptakr̥cchraṁ samācarēt ॥ iti ।  
nāradastu—  
'mātā mātr̥ṣvasā śvaśrūrmātulānī pitr̥ṣvasā ।  
[#5]pitr̥vyapatnī śiṣyastrī bhaginī tatsakhī snuṣā ।  
duhitā''cāryabhāryā ca sagōtrā śaraṇāgatā ।  
rāśī pravrajitā dhātrī sādhvī varṇōttamā ca yā । āsāmanyatamāṁ gatvā gurutalpaga ucyatē ।  
śiśnasyōtkr̥ntanaṁ tatra nā'nyō daṇḍō vidhīyatē ॥ iti ॥ 1 ॥  

[#3]: saṁva0 smr̥0 158, 159.  

[#4]:

    taptakr̥cchrān ṣaḍācarēt , iti. cha. pu.  

[#5]:

    pitr̥vyasakhiśiṣyastrī iti. ka. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

jvalitāṁ vā sūrmiṁ pariṣvajya samāpnuyāt 2
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

2. Or he may die embracing a heated metal image of a woman. [#2] 

[#2]:  Manu XI, 104; Yājñ. III, 259.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
jvalitāṁ vā sūrmiṁ pariṣvajya samāpnuyāt ॥ 2॥  

**ṭīkā**  
āyasī tāmramayī vā antassuṣirā strīprakr̥tiratra sūrmiḥ। tāṁ jvalitāmagnau taptām । pariṣvajya samāpnuyāt samāptiṁ gacchēt mriyēta ॥2॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

surāpō'gnisparśāṁ +++(kvatithāṁ)+++ surāṁ pibēt 3
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

3. A drinker of spirituous liquor shall drink exceedingly hot liquor so that he dies. [#3] 

[#3]:  Manu XI, 91, 92; Yājñ. III, 253.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
surāpō'gnisparśāṁ surāṁ pibēt ॥ 3 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
'gauḍī paiṣṭī ca mādhvī ca vijñēyā trividhā surā।'  
tasyāḥ pātā surāpaḥ । saḥ agnisparśāṁ [#6]agnikathitāṁ surāṁ pibēt । tayā dagdhakāyaḥ śuddhyati ॥3॥  

[#6]:

    atiśrapitā, iti. kha. ga. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

stēnaḥ prakīrṇakēśō'ē musalamādāya rājānaṁ gatvā karmācakṣīta । tēnainaṁ hanyādvadhē mōkṣaḥ 4
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

4. A thief shall go to the king with flying hair, carrying a club on his shoulder, and tell him his deed. He (the king) shall give him a blow with that (club). If the thief dies, his sin is expiated. [#4] 

[#4]:  I.e. who has stolen the gold of a Brāhmaṇa. Manu VIII, 314, 316; XI, 99-101; Yājñ. III, 257.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
stēnaḥ prakīrṇakēśōṁ'sē musalamādhāya rājānaṁ gatvā karmā''cakṣīta । tēnainaṁ hanyādhē mōkṣaḥ ॥ 4॥   

**ṭīkā**  
stanō brāhmaṇasvarṇahārī। aṁsē svē skandhē । musalamādhāya āyasaṁ khādiraṁ vā dhārayan । rājānaṁ gavā karmā''cakṣīta-ēvaṁkarmā'smi, śādhi māmiti। sa tēna musalēna ēnaṁ stēnaṁ hanyāt , yathā mr̥tō bhavati । [#1]vadhēna stēyāt mōkṣō bhavati ॥ 4॥   

[#1]:

    vadhē sati stēnasya mōkṣō muktirbhavatyēnasō nānyathā iti. ka. ca. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

anujñātē'nujñātāramēnaḥ 5
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

5. If he is forgiven (by the king), the guilt falls upon him who forgives him, [#5] 

[#5]:  Manu VIII, 317.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
anujñātē'nujñātāramēnaḥ spr̥śati ॥5॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yadi rājā dayādinā tamanujānīyāt gacchēti, tadā tamanujñātāraṁ rājānamēva tadēnaḥ spr̥śati ॥ 5॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

agniṁ vā praviśēttīkṣṇaṁ vā tapa āyacchēt 6
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

6. Or he may throw himself into the fire, or perform repeatedly severe austerities, [#6] 

[#6]:  Manu XI, 102.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
agniṁ vā praviśēta ॥6॥

**ṭīkā**  
uttaramr̥ju ॥6॥

**sūtram**  
tīkṣṇaṁ vā tapa āyacchēt ॥ 7 ॥  

tīkṣṇaṁ tapaḥ mahāparākādi । tadvā āyacchēt āvartayēt ॥7॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

bhaktāpacayēna vātmānaṁ samāpnuyāt 7
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

7. Or he may kill himself by diminishing daily his portion of food,
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
bhaktāpacayēna vā''tmānaṁ samāpnuyāt ॥8॥  

**ṭīkā**  
bhaktamannam । tasyā'pacayō hrāsaḥ। prathamē dinē yāvantō grāsāḥ tē ēkēna nyūnā dvitīyē । ēvaṁ tr̥tīyādiṣvapi ā ēkasmād grāsāt । tatrāpi yadi na samāptiḥ tatastatraiva grāsaparimāṇāpacayaḥ kartavyaḥ । ēvaṁ bhaktāpacayēnā''tmānaṁ samāpnuyāt samāpayēt ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

kr̥cchrasaṁvatsaraṁ vā carēt 8
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

8. Or he may perform Kṛcchra penances (uninterruptedly) for one year. [#7] 

[#7]:  According to Haradatta this Sūtra refers to all kinds of sins and it must be understood that the Kṛcchra penances must be heavy for great crimes, and lighter for smaller faults; see also below, I, 9, 27, 7 and 8.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
kr̥cchrasaṁvatsaraṁ vā carēt ॥ 9॥  

**ṭīkā**  
atha vā saṁvatsaramēkaṁ nairantaryēṇa kr̥cchrāṁścarēt । ēṣāmēnassu guruṣu gurūṇi, laghuṣu laghūnīti vyavasthā ॥ 9॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

athāpyudāharanti । stēyaṁ kr̥tvā surāṁ pītvā gurudāraṁ ca gatvā brahmahatyāmakr̥tvā caturthakālā mitabhōjanāḥ syurapō'bhyavēyuḥ savanānukalpam 9
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

9. Now they quote also (the following verse): [#8] 

[#8]:  Haradatta states that the verse is taken from a Purāṇa.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
athā'pyudāharanti ॥ 10 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
asminnēva viṣayē purāṇaślōkamapyudāharantītyarthaḥ ॥ 10॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

sthānāsanābhyāṁ viharanta ētē tribhirvarṣairapa pāpaṁ nundatē 10
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

10. Those who have committed a theft (of gold), drunk spirituous liquor, or had connection with a Guru's wife, but not those who have slain a Brāhmaṇa, shall eat every fourth meal-time a little food, bathe at the times of the three libations (morning, noon, and evening), passing the day standing and the night sitting. After the lapse of three years they throw off their guilt.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
stēyaṁ kr̥tvā surāṁ pītvā gurudāraṁ ca gatvā brahmahatyāmakr̥tvā ।  
caturthakālā mitabhōjinaḥ syu[#2]rapō'bhyavēyuḥ savanānukalpam ।  
sthānāsanābhyāṁ viharanta ētē tribhirvaṣairapa pāpaṁ nudantē ॥ 11 ॥   

[#2]:

    apō'bhyupēyuḥ iti, ka. cha. pu.  

**ṭīkā**  
brahmahatyāvyatiriktāni stēyādīni kr̥tvā caturthakālāścaturthōṁ bhōjanakālō yēṣām । yathā- adya divā bhuṅktē śvō naktamiti, tē tathōktāḥ। tathāpi mitabhōjinaḥ na mr̥ṣṭāśinaḥ। [#21]apō'bhyavēyuḥ bhūmigatāsvapsu snānaṁ kuryuḥ । savanānukalpaṁ, yathā savanāni prātassavanādīnyanuklr̥ptāni anusr̥tānyanuṣṭhitāni bhavanti tathā[#22] triṣavaṇamityarthaḥ । tiṣṭhēyurahani, rātrāvāsīran । ēvaṁ sthānāsanābhyāṁ viharantaḥ kālakṣēpaṁ kurvantaḥ। ētē tribhirvarṣaistatpāpamapanudantē ॥ 11 ॥  

[#21]:

    apō'bhyupēyuḥ iti. ka. cha. pu,  

[#22]:

    sōmayāgē prātarmadhyandinē sāyamiti triṣu kālēṣu prātassavana, mādhyandinaṁ savanaṁ, tr̥tīyasavanaṁ, iti savanatrayamanusyūtatayā'nuṣṭhīyatē tadvat kālatrayē'pi snānaṁ kuryurityarthaḥ ।
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

prathamaṁ varṇaṁ parihāpya prathamaṁ varṇaṁ hatvā saṁgrāmaṁ gatvāvatiṣṭhēta । tatrainaṁ hanyuḥ 11
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

11. (A man of any caste) excepting the first, who has slain a man of the first caste, shall go on a battle-field and place himself (between the two hostile armies). There they shall kill him (and thereby he becomes pure). [#9] 

[#9]:  Manu XI, 74; Yājñ. III, 248.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
prathamaṁ varṇaṁ parihāpya prathamaṁ varṇaṁ hatvā saṅgrāmaṁ gatvā'vatiṣṭhēta tatrainaṁ hanyuḥ ॥ 12 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
prathamō varṇō brāhmaṇaḥ । taṁ hatvā saṅgrāmaṁ gatvā sēnayōrmadhyē'vatiṣṭhēt । kiṁ sarvē ? nētyāha-prathamaṁ varṇaṁ parihāpya brāhmaṇavarjamitarō varṇaḥ kṣatriyādirityarthaḥ । tatra sthitamēnaṁ tē sainikā hanyuḥ, ta ēnaṁ hataṁ vidadhyuḥ । aghnanta ēnasvinaḥ syuḥ, yathā rājā stēnam । sa mr̥taśśuddhyati ॥ 12 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

api vā lōmāni tvacaṁ māṁsamiti hāvayitvāgniṁ praviśēt 12
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

12. Or such a sinner may tear from his body and make the priest offer as a burnt-offering his hair, skin, flesh, and the rest, and then throw himself into the fire. [#10] 

[#10]:  The Mantras given in the commentary, and a parallel passage of Vasiṣṭha XX, 25-26, show that this terrible penance is not altogether a mere theory of Āpastamba. Yājñ. III, 247.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
api vā lōmāni tvacaṁ māṁsamiti hāvayitvā'gniṁ praviśēt ॥ 13 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
anantarōkta ēva viṣayē prāyaścittāntaram । itiśabdō lōhitādīnāmapyupalakṣaṇārthaḥ। ātmanō lōmādīnyutkr̥tya purōhitēna hāvayitvā hōmaṁ kārayitvā paścāt svayaṁ tasminnagnau praviśēt , mr̥taḥ śuddhati । tatrā'gnimupasamādhāya juhuyāt[#3] "lōmāni mr̥tyōrjuhōmi, lōmabhirmr̥tyuṁ vāsayē svāhā । tvacaṁ mr̥tyōrjuhōmi tvacā mr̥tyuṁ vāsayē svāhā ॥ lōhitaṁ mr̥tyōrjuhōmi lōhitēna mr̥tyuṁ vāsayē svāhā । snāvāni mr̥tyōrjuhōmi snāvabhirmr̥tyuṁ vāsayē svāhā। māṁsāni mr̥tyōrjuhōmi māṁsairmr̥tyuṁ vāsayē svāhā । asthīni mr̥tyōrjuhōmi asthabhirmr̥tyuṁ vāsayē svāhā । majjānaṁ mr̥tyōrjuhōmi majjabhimr̥tyuṁ vāsayē svāhā। mēdō mr̥tyōrjuhōmi mēdasā mr̥tyuṁ vāsayē svāhā” ityētē mantrāḥ vasiṣṭhēna paṭhitāḥ ॥13॥  

[#3]: ba0 dha0 20. 26.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

vāyasapracalākabarhiṇacakravākahaṁsabhāsamaṇḍūkanakulaḍērikāśvahiṁsāyāṁ śūdra vatprāyaścittam 13
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

13. If a crow, a chameleon, a peacock, a Brāhmaṇī duck, a swan, the vulture called Bhāsa, a frog, an ichneumon, a musk-rat, or a dog has been killed, then the same penance as for a Śūdra must be performed. [#11] 

[#11]:  'According to some, the penance must be performed if all these animals together have been slain; according to others, if only one of them has been killed.'--Haradatta. Manu XI, 132, 136 Yājñ. III, 270-272.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
vāyasapracalākabarhiṇacakravākahaṁsabhāsamaṇḍūkanakulaḍērikāśvahiṁsāyāṁ śūdravatprāyaścittam ॥ 14 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
vāyasaḥ kākaḥ । pracalākaḥ kāmarūpī kr̥kalāsaḥ । barhiṇō mayūraḥ । cakravākō divā mithunacara , rātrau virahī। haṁsō mānasavāsī। bhāsō gr̥dhraviśēṣaḥ। nakulamaṇḍūkādayaḥ prasiddhāḥ । ḍērikā gandhamūṣikā । ētēṣāṁ samuditānāṁ vadhē śūdravatprāyaścittam । pratyēkaṁ vadhē tu kalpyam । kēcit pratyēkaṁ vadha ētatprāyaścittamityāhuḥ ॥14॥   

॥ ityāpastambadharmasūtravr̥ttau prathamapraśnē pañcaviṁśī kaṇḍikā ॥ 25 ॥
</details>
</details>

### 26 apatanīyāni

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

dhēnvanaḍuhōścākāraṇāt 1
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

1. (The same penance must be performed), if a milch-cow or a full-grown ox (has been slain), without a reason. [#1] 

[#1]:  26. 'A reason' for hurting a cow is, according to Haradatta, anger, or the desire to obtain meat.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
dhēnvanaḍuhōścā'kāraṇāt ॥1॥  

**ṭīkā**  
dhēnuḥ payasvinī gauḥ । anaḍvān anōvahanayōgyō balīvardaḥ । tayōḥ kāraṇamantarēṇa hiṁsāyāṁ śūdravatprāyaścittaṁ kartavyam । kāraṇaṁ kōpō māṁsēcchā vā । tābhyāṁ vinā, abuddhipūrvamityarthaḥ । buddhipurvaṁ tu[#1] 'gāśca vaiśyava'dityādi smr̥tyantarē draṣṭavyam ॥ 1 ॥  

[#1]:

    gau0 dha0 23. 18
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

dhuryavāhapravr̥ttau cētarēṣāṁ prāṇinām 2
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

2. And for other animals (which have no bones), if an ox-load of them has been killed. [#2] 

[#2]:  Manu XI, 141; Yājñ. III, 269. That 'animals without bones,' i.e. insects or mollusks, are intended in the Sūtra is an inference, drawn by Haradatta from the parallel passages of Gautama, Manu, and Yājñavalkya.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
dhuryavāhapravr̥ttau cētarēṣāṁ prāṇinām ॥ 2॥  

**ṭīkā**  
dhuraṁ vahatīti dhuryō balīvardaḥ । tēna vōḍhuṁ śaktyā dhuryavāhāḥ। tāvatsu hiṁsāyāḥ pravr̥ttau satyām । itarēṣāṁ prāṇināṁ kēvalaṁ prāṇā ēva yēṣāṁ nā'sthīni tēṣāṁ hiṁsāyāṁ śūdravatprāyaścittamiti। atra gautamaḥ[#2] asthanvatāṁ sahasraṁ hatvā anasthimatāmanuḍudbhārē cēti ॥ 2॥  

[#2]: gau0 dha0 23, 20,
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

anākrōśyamākruśyānr̥taṁ vōktvā trirātramakṣīrākṣārālavaṇabhōjanaṁ 3
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

3. He who abuses a person who (on account of his venerability) ought not to be abused, or speaks an untruth (regarding any small matter) must abstain for three days from milk, pungent condiments, and salt. [#3] 

[#3]:  'A person who ought not to be abused, i. e. a father, a teacher, and the like.'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
anākrōśyamākruśyā'nr̥taṁ vōktvā trirātramakṣīrākṣāralavaṇabhōjanam ॥ 3 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yēna yō na kathañcanā''krōśamarhati sa pitrācāryādiranākrōśyaḥ । tamākruśya anr̥taṁ vōktvā pātakōpātakavarjaṁ, trirātraṁ kṣīrādi bhōjanē varjayēt । kṣīragrahaṇēna tadvikārāṇāṁ dadhyādīnāmapi[#3] grahaṇamityāhuḥ ॥3॥  

[#3]:

    varjanamāhuḥ iti ka. pu
</details>
</details>

śūdrasya saptarātramabhōjanam 4
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

4. (If the same sins have been committed) by a Śūdra, he must fast for seven days.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**   
śudrasya saptarātramabhōjanam ॥ 4 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
śudrastvanantarōktaviṣayē saptarātramupavasēt ॥ 4॥
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

strīṇāṁ caivam 5
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

5. And the same (penances must also be performed) by women, (but not those which follow). [#4] 

[#4]:  The same penances, i. e. those prescribed I, 9, 24-I, 9, 26, 4. According to Haradatta this Sūtra is intended to teach that women shall not perform the penances which follow. Others, however, are of opinion that it is given in order to indicate that the preceding Sūtras apply to women by an atideśa, and that, according to a Smārta principle, applicable to such cases, it may be inferred, that women are to perform one-half only of the penances prescribed for men.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
strīṇāṁ caivam ॥5॥  

**ṭīkā**  
'kṣatriyaṁ hatvē'(24. 1.)tyādiṣu annavacanāntēṣu nimittēṣu yāni prāyaścittānyuktāni tāni strīṇāmapyēvamēva kartavyāni । ētat 'catvārō varṇā' iti jātyābhidhānādēva[#1] prāptaṁ sanniyamārthamucyatē—ata ūrdhvaṁ puruṣasyaiva na strīṇāmiti । apara āha— jātyābhidhānādēva siddhē atidēśārthaṁ vacanam । atidēśēṣu cā'rdhaṁ prāpyatē iti smārtō nyāyaḥ । tēna strīṇāmardhaprāptyarthaṁ vacanamiti । tathā ca bhārgavaḥ —  

aśītiryasya varṣāṇi bālō vāpyūnaṣōḍaśaḥ ।  
prāyaścittārdhamarhanti striyō vyādhita ēva ca ॥' iti ॥5॥  

[#1]:

    prāyaścittaṁ prāptam, tanniyama' iti ka. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yēṣvābhiśastyaṁ tēṣāmēkāṅgaṁ chittvāprāṇahiṁsāyām +++(tataḥ śūdrahaprāyaścittam)+++ 6
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

6. He who cuts off a limb of a person for whose murder he would become an Abhiśasta (must perform the penance prescribed for killing a Śūdra), if the life (of the person injured) has not been endangered.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yēṣvābhiśastyaṁ tēṣāmēkāṅgaṁ chitvā'prāṇihiṁsāyām ॥6॥

**ṭīkā**  
yēṣu hatēṣu 'savanagataṁ vā'bhiśasta, (24.9) ityādinā abhiśastatvamuktaṁ tēṣāmēkāṅgaṁ chitvā śūdravatprāyaścittaṁ kuryāt । aprāṇihiṁsāyāṁ yadi chēdanēna tasyāṅgasya śakti[#2]rna hanyatē ॥6॥   

[#2]:

    na bhajyatē iti gha. pu. ।
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

anāryava-paiśuna-pratiṣiddhā'cārēṣv  
abhakṣyā'bhōjyā'pēya-prāśanē  
śūdrāyāṁ ca rētaḥ siktvā 'yōnau ca  
dōṣavac ca karmābhisaṁdhipūrvaṁ kr̥tvā 'nabhisaṁdhipūrvaṁ vā  
'bliṅgābhir apa upaspr̥śēd  
vāruṇībhir vānyair vā pavitrair yathā karmābhyāsaḥ 7
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

7. He who has been guilty of conduct unworthy of an Aryan, of calumniating others, of actions contrary to the rule of conduct, of eating or drinking things forbidden, of connection with a woman of the Śūdra caste, of an unnatural crime, of performing; magic rites with intent (to harm his enemies) or (of hurting others) unintentionally, shall bathe and sprinkle himself with water, reciting the (seven) verses addressed to the Waters, or the verses addressed to Varuṇa, or (other verses chosen from the Anuvāka, called) Pavitra, in proportion to the frequency with which the crime has been committed. [#5] 

[#5]:  The Anuvāka intended is Taitt. Saṃh. II, 5, 12.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
[#3]anāryavapaiśunapratiṣiddhācārēśvabhakṣyā bhōjyāpēyaprāśanē śūdrāyāṁ ca rētassikvā'yōnau ca dōṣavacca karmābhisandhipūrvaṁ kr̥tvā'nabhisandhipūrvaṁ vā'bliṅgābhirapa upaspr̥śēdvāruṇībhirvā'nyairvā pavitramantrairyathā karmābhyāsaḥ ॥7॥  

**ṭīkā**  
āryāṇāṁ bhāva āryam । tadyasminnācārē'sti tadāryavam । matvarthīyō vapratyayaḥ। tatō'nyadanāryavam । asatyabhāṣaṇādi । paiśunaṁ paradōṣakathanaṁ rājagāmi pratiṣiddhācāraḥ 'ṣṭhīvanamaithunayōḥ karmā'suvarjayē(30.19)dityādēranuṣṭhānam । abhakṣyaṁ vr̥thākr̥sarādi । abhōjyaṁ kēśakīṭadyupahatam । apēyam anirdaśāyāḥ gōḥ kṣīrādi । ētēṣāṁ prāśanē । śūdrāyāṁ ca vēśyāprabhr̥tau rētaḥ siktvā । ayōnī ca jalādau rētaḥ sikvā । dōṣavacca karma śrautamābhicārikam । abhisandhipūrvaṁ buddhipūrvaṁ kr̥tvā। anabhisandhipūrvaṁ vā parapīḍādikaraṁ karma kr̥tvā । abliṅgābhiḥ[#4] "āpō hi ṣṭhā mayōbhuva' iti tisr̥bhi[#5] hiraṇyavarṇāśśucayaḥ pāvakā' iti catasr̥bhirapa upaspr̥śēt ।

[#3]:

    gautamīyē 26. 15. sūtraṁ draṣṭavyam ।  

[#4]:

    tai0 5. 6. 10. yō vaśśivatamō rasaḥ, tasmā araṁ gamāma vaḥ, ityagrimē r̥cau ।  

[#5]:

    tai0 saṁ0 6. 6. 1. yāsāṁ rājā varuṇaḥ, yāsāṁ dēvā divi, śivēna mā cakṣuṣā, ityagrimaṁ r̥ktrayam ।  

tūṣṇīṁ prathamaṁ snātvā paścādētairmantrairmārjanaṁ kuryāt । vāruṇībhirvā [#21] imaṁ mē varuṇa, 'tattvā yāmi, 'tvannō agnē' ityētābhiranyairvā pavitraiḥ [#22]pavamānassuvarjana' ityatēnānuvākēna [#23] śuddhavatībhiḥ [#24] taratsamandīyēna ca । yathā karmābhyāsaḥ kr̥taḥ [#25] tāvatkr̥tvō'pa upaspr̥śēt । rahasyaprāyaścittamētadityāhuḥ ॥7॥  

[#21]: tai0 saṁ0 4. 2. 11.  

[#22]: tai0 brā0 1.4.4  

[#23]: r̥0 saṁ0 8. 95. 6.  

[#24]: r̥0 saṁ0 8.95,7  

[#25]: kr̥taḥ tathōpaspr̥śēt0 iti. ka. pu.
</details>
</details>

gardabhēnāvakīrṇī nirr̥tiṁ pākayajñēna yajēta 8
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

8. A (student) who has broken the vow of chastity, shall offer to Nirṛti an ass, according to the manner of the Pākayajña-rites. [#6] 

[#6]:  Taitt. Ār. II, 18, and Weber, Ind. Stud. X, 102; Manu XI, 199 seq.; and Yājñ. III, 280. Regarding the Pākayajña-rites, see Āśv. Gṛ. Sū. I, 1, 2, and Max Müller's History of Ancient Sanskrit Literature, p. 203.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
gardabhēnā'vakīrṇī nirr̥tiṁ pākayajñēna yajēta ॥ 8 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yō brahmacārī striyamupēyāt sō'vakīrṇī gardabhēna nirr̥tiṁ yajēta pākayajñēna sthālīpākavidhānēna । atra manuḥ—  

[#6] 'avikīrṇā tu kāṇēna gardabhēna catuṣpathē।  
pākayajñavidhānēna, yajēta nirr̥tiṁ niśi ॥' iti ।  
hārītastu—  
"strīṣvavakīrṇī nirr̥tyai catuṣpathē gardabhaṁ paśumālabhēta pākayajñadharmēṇa। bhūmau paśupurōḍāśaśrapaṇamapsvavadānaiḥ pracāryā''jyaṁ juhōti 'kāmāvakīrṇō'smyavakīrṇō'smi kāmakāmāya svāhā । kāmābhidrugdhōsmyabhidrugdhō'smi kāmakāmāya svāhā' iti ॥ 8॥  

[#6]: ma0 smr̥0 11. 118.

</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

tasya śūdraḥ prāśnīyāt 9
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

9. A Śūdra shall eat (the remainder) of that (offering).

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
tasya śudraḥ prāśnīyāt ॥ 9 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
tasya gardabhasya sarpiṣmaddhavirucchiṣṭaṁ śudraḥ prāśnīyāt [#7] tēna sarpiṣmatā brāhmaṇa'mityasyā'pavādaḥ ॥9॥  

[#7]: āpa0 gr̥0 7. 15.
</details>
</details>
