mithyā'dhīta-prāyaścittam 10
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

10. (Now follows) the penance for him who transgresses the rules of studentship.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
mithyādhītaprāyaścittam ॥ 10 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
niyamātikramēṇā'dhītaṁ mithyādhītam । taddōṣanirharaṇāya prāyaścittaṁ vakṣyatē ॥10॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

saṁvatsaram ācārya-hitē vartamānō  
vācaṁ yacchēt  
svādhyāya ēvōtsr̥jamānō vācam  
ācārya ācārya-dārē bhikṣācaryē ca 11
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

11. He shall for a year serve his teacher silently, emitting speech only during the daily study (of the Veda, in announcing necessary business to) his teacher or his teacher's wife, and whilst collecting alms.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
samvatsaramācāryahitē vartamānō vācaṁ yacchētsvādhyāya ēvōtsr̥jamānō vācamācārya ācāryadārē vā bhikṣācaryē ca ॥11॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ācāryahitē vartamānō vācaṁyamaḥ syāt । [#8]svādhyāyādiṣvēṣu vācamutsr̥jamānaḥ । ācāryē taṁ prati kāryanivēdanē । ēvamācāryadārē । bhikṣācaryaṁ bhikṣācaraṇam। tatra ca 'bhavati bhikṣāṁ dēhī'ti । asmādēva jñāyatē-asamāvr̥ttaviṣayamētaditi ॥ 11 ॥

[#8]:

    vāgutsargassvādhyāya ēva iti. kha. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ēvamanyēṣv api dōṣavatsv apatanīyēṣūttarāṇi yāni vakṣyāmaḥ 12
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

12. The following penances) which we are going to proclaim, may be performed for the same sin, and [#7]  also for other sinful acts, which do not cause loss of caste.

[#7]:  Regarding the Patanīya-crimes which cause loss of caste, see above, I, 7, 21, 7 seq.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ēvamanyēṣvapi dōṣavatsvapatanīyēṣūttarāṇi yāni vakṣyāmaḥ ॥ 12 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yathā mithyādhītasyēdaṁ prāyaścittamēvamuttarāṇi yāni prāyaścittāni vakṣyāmaḥ tānyanyēṣvapi । apiśabdānmithyādhītē'pi । dōṣavatsvapatanīyēṣu patanīyavyatiriktēṣu karmasu yēṣvāhatya prāyaścittaṁ nōktaṁ tadviṣayāṇi draṣṭavyāni ॥ 12॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

kāma-manyubhyāṁ vā juhuyāt -  
kāmō'kārṣīn manyur akārṣīd iti japēd vā 13
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

13. He may either offer oblations to Kāma and Manyu (with the following two Mantras), 'Kāma (passion) has done it; Manyu (anger) has done it.' Or he may mutter (these Mantras). [#8] 

[#8]:  Weber, Ind. Stud. X, 102. According to the greatness of the crime the number of the burnt-oblations must be increased and the prayers be repeated.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
kāmamanyubhyāṁ vā juhuyātkāmō'kārṣīnmanyurakārṣīditi ॥13 ॥

**ṭīkā**  
svāhākārāntābhyāṁ hōmaḥ । ājyaṁ dravyam ॥ 13 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

parvaṇi vā tilabhakṣa upōṣya vā śvōbhūta udakam upaspr̥śya sāvitrīṁ prāṇāyāmaśaḥ sahasra-kr̥tva āvartayēd aprāṇāyāmaśō vā 14
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

14. Or, after having eaten sesamum or fasted on the days of the full and new moon he may, on the following day bathe, and stopping his breath, repeat the Gāyatrī one thousand times, or he may do so without stopping his breath.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
japēdvā ॥ 14 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
asmin pakṣē na svāhākāraḥ। kēcittu 'kāmāya svāhā' 'manyavē svāhē'ti hōmamicchanti । japapakṣē tu sūtrōpadiṣṭau mantrāviti । dōṣābhyāsānurūpaṁ japahōmayōrāvr̥ttiḥ ॥14॥  

**sūtram**  
parvaṇi vā tilabhakṣa upōṣya vā śvōbhūta udakamupaspr̥śya sāvitrīṁ prāṇāyāmaśassahasrakr̥tva āvartayēdaprāṇāyāmaśō vā ॥15॥   

**ṭīkā**  
parvaṇi paurṇamāsyāmamāvāsyāyāṁ vā । tilānēva bhakṣayati nānyadōdanādikamiti tilabhakṣaḥ । śvōbhūtē udakamupaspr̥śya snātvā sāvitrīṁ prāṇāyāmaśaḥ prāṇāyāmēna ēkasminprāṇāyāmē yāvatkr̥tva āvartayituṁ śakyaṁ tāvatkr̥tva āvartayēt । ēvamā sahasrapūrtēḥ prāṇāyāmāvr̥ttiḥ । aprāṇāyāmaśō vā [#1]japakālē prāṇānāyacchēt , tuṣṇīṁ japēdvēti ॥ 15 ॥  

[#1]: japakāla ityādi nāsti kha. ca. pu.  

॥ ityāpastambadharmasūtravr̥ttau prathamapraśnē ṣaḍviṁśī kaṇḍikā ॥26॥
</details>
</details>

### 27 apatanīyāni

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

śrāvaṇyāṁ paurṇamāsyāṁ tila-bhakṣa upōṣya vā  
śvōbhūtē mahānadam udakam upaspr̥śya  
sāvitryā samit-sahasram ādadhyāj japēd vā 1
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

1. After having eaten sesamum or having fasted on the full moon day of the month Srāvaṇa July-August), he may on the following day bathe in the water of a great river and offer (a burnt-oblation of) one thousand pieces of sacred fuel, whilst. reciting the Gāyatrī, or he may mutter (the Gāyatrī) as many times. [#1] 

[#1]:  27. 'The oblations of sacred fuel (samidh) are not to be accompanied by the exclamation Svāhā'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
śrāvaṇyāṁ vā paurṇamāsyāṁ tilabhakṣa upōṣya vā śvō bhūtē [#1]māhānadamudakamupaspr̥śya sāvitryā samitsahasramādadhyājjapēdvā ॥1॥  

**ṭīkā**  
giriprabhavā samudragāminī nadī mahānadī tatra bhavaṁ māhānadam । samitsahasraṁ yājñikasya vr̥kṣasya । 'ādadhyādi'ti vacanānna hōmadharmaḥ svāhākāraḥ[#2] 'juhōticōdanā svāhākārapradāna,' ityuktatvāt । japēd vā ॥1॥  

[#1]: mahānada iti cha. pu.  

[#2]:

    (āpa0 pa0 3.4.) "juhōticōdanā svāhākārapradāna ityuktatvāt । japēdvā" iti nāsti. ka. cha. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

iṣṭi-yajña-kratūn vā pavitrārthān āharēt 2
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

2. Or he may perform Iṣṭis and Soma-sacrifices for the sake of purifying himself (from his sins), [#2] 

[#2]:  Iṣṭis are the simplest forms of the Śrauta-sacrifices, i.e. of those for which three fires are necessary.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
iṣṭiyajñakratūnvā pavitrārthānāharēt ॥ 2 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
pavitrārthāḥ śuddhyarthāḥ [#3]mr̥gārādyā iṣṭayaḥ । [#4]yajñakratavaḥ sōmayāgā agniṣṭōmādayaḥ । tānyētāni ṣaṭ prāyaścittāni ēnassu guruṣu gurūṇi, laghuṣu laghūni ॥ 2॥  

[#3]:

    agnayē'hōmucē'ṣṭākapālaḥ (tai0 saṁ0 7. 5. 22.) iti vihitēṣṭirmr̥gōriṣṭidarśa haviṣkā ।  

[#4]:

    yajñāḥ kratavaḥ । iti. ka.cha.pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

abhōjyaṁ bhuktvā naiṣpurīṣyam +++(kadēti cēt -)+++3
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

3. After having eaten forbidden food, he must fast, until his entrails are empty. [#3] 

[#3]:  For some particular kinds of forbidden food the same penance is prescribed, Manu XI, 153-154.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
abhōjyaṁ bhuktvā naiṣpurīṣyam ॥3॥  

**ṭīkā**  
abhōjyasya mārjārādimāṁsasya bhakṣaṇē niṣpurīṣabhāvaḥ kartavyaḥ । yāvadudaraṁ niṣpurīṣaṁ bhavati tāvadupavastavyam ॥ 3॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

tat-sapta-rātrēṇāvāpyatē 4
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

4. That is (generally) attained after seven days.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
tatsaptarātrēṇā'vāpyatē ॥ 4 ॥   

**prastāvaḥ**  
tatkiyatā kālēnā'vāpyatē ? tadāha—

**ṭīkā**  
tat naiṣpurīṣyam । saptarātrēṇā'vāpyatē saptarātramupavastavyamityarthaḥ । saptarātramupavasadityēva siddhē naiṣpurīṣyavacanādyēṣāṁ trirātrēṇaiva tadavāpyatē tēṣāṁ tāvataiva śuddhiḥ। tathā ca gautamaḥ-[#5] 'abhōjyabhōjanē
niṣpurīṣabhāvaḥ trirātrāvaramabhōjanaṁ saptarātraṁ vē'ti ॥ 4 ॥

</details>
</details>

hēmanta-śiśirayōr vōbhayōḥ saṁdhyōr udakam upaspr̥śēt 5
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

5. Or he may during winter and during the dewy season (November-March) bathe in cold water both morning and evening.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
hēmantaśiśirayōrvōbhayōssandhyōrvōdakamupaspr̥śēt ॥ 5 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ubhayōḥ sandhyayōḥ sāyaṁ prātaśca । udakamupaspr̥śēt bhūmigatāsvapsu snāyāt । uddhr̥tābhirvā śītābhiḥ ॥ 5 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

kr̥cchra-dvādaśa-rātraṁ vā carēt 6
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

6. Or he may perform a Kṛcchra penance, which lasts twelve days.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
kr̥cchvādaśarātraṁ vā carēt ॥ 6 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
dvādaśarātrasādhyō vrataviśēṣaḥ kr̥cchradvādaśarātraḥ ॥ 6 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

tryaham anaktāśy  
adivāśī tatas tryahaṁ  
try-aham ayācita-vratas  
tryahaṁ nāśnāti kiṁcanēti  
kr̥cchra-dvādaśa-rātrasya vidhiḥ 7
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

7. The rule for the Kṛcchra penance of twelve days (is the following): For three days he must not eat in the evening, and then for three days not in the morning; for three days he must live on food which has been given unasked, and three days he must not eat anything. [#4] 

[#4]:  The same penance is described, under the name Prājāpatya kṛcchra, the Kṛcchra invented by Prajāpati, Manu XI, 212, and Yājñ. III, 320.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
tryahamanaktāśyadivāśī tatastryaham, tryahamayācitavratastryahaṁ nāśnāti kiñcanēti kr̥cchradvādaśarātrasya vidhiḥ ॥ 7 ॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
tasya vidhimāha[#1]—  

**ṭīkā**  
āditastriṣvahassu naktaṁ nāśnīyāt । divaiva bhuñjīta । tatastryahamadivāśī rātrāvēva bhuñjīta । na divā । tatastryahamayācitamēva bhuñjīta। yācñāpratiṣadhō'yama । tēna svadravyasyāpratiṣēdhaḥ । tathā ca gautamaḥ [#2] 'athā'paraṁ tryahaṁ na kaṁcana yācē'diti । tatatryahaṁ nāśnāti kiñcana phalādikamapīti । ēvaṁ kr̥cchradvādaśarātrasya vidhiḥ । tatra smr̥tyantaravaśāddhaviṣyamannaṁ, brahmacaryaṁ, strīśūdrādibhirasambhāṣaṇaṁ ca draṣṭavyam ॥ 7 ॥  

[#1]: manau. 11. 211 ślōkō draṣṭavyaḥ ।  

[#2]: gau0 dha0 26. 4.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ētam ēvābhyasēt saṁvatsaraṁ - sa kr̥cchrasaṁvatsaraḥ 8
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

8. If he repeats this for a year, that is called a Kṛcchra penance, which lasts for a year.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ētamēvā'bhyasyētsaṁvatsaraṁ sa kr̥cchrasaṁvatsaraḥ ॥8॥

**ṭīkā**  
ētamēva vidhiṁ saṁvatsaraṁ nirantaramabhyasyēt । sa ēṣa kr̥cchrasaṁvatsarō vēditavyaḥ । yaḥ pūrvōktaḥ 'kacchrasaṁvatsaraṁ vā carē'( 25.9 )diti ॥8॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

athā'param ।  
bahūny apy apatanīyāni kr̥tvā  
tribhir anaśnat-pārāyaṇaiḥ kr̥ta-prāyaścittō bhavati 9
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

9. Now follows another penance. He who has committed even a great many sins which do not cause him to fall, becomes free from guilt, if, fasting, he recites the entire Śākhā of his Veda three times consecutively. [#5] 

[#5]:  Manu XI, 259.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
athā'paraṁ bahūnyapyapatanīyāni kr̥tvā tribhiranaśnan pārāyaṇaiḥ kr̥taprāyaścittō bhavati ॥ 9 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
athā'paraṁ prāyaścittamucyatē । anaśnataiva nirantaraṁ trīṇi pārāyaṇāni kartavyāni । ādita ārabhyā''samāptērvēdasyā'dhyayanaṁ pārāyaṇam । bahūnyapi ।
apiśabdātkiṁ punarēkaṁ dvē vā ॥9॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

anāryāṁ śayanē bibhrēd,  
dadad vr̥ddhiṁ+++(=interest)+++ +++(svadravyasya)+++, kaṣāya-paḥ+++(=surāvyatiriktaṁ madyaṁ piban)+++ ।  
abrāhmaṇa iva +++(sarvān)+++ vanditvā,  
tr̥ṇēṣv āsīta pr̥ṣṭha-tap 10
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

10. He who cohabits with a non-Aryan woman, he who lends money at interest, he who drinks (other) spirituous liquors (than Surā), he who praises everybody in a manner unworthy of a Brāhmaṇa, shall sit on grass, allowing his back to be scorched (by the sun).
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
anāryāṁ śayanē vibhraddadadvr̥ddhiṁ kaṣāyapaḥ ।  
abrāhmaṇa iva vanditvā tr̥ṇēṣvāsīta pr̥ṣṭhatap ॥10॥  

**ṭīkā**  
anāryāṁ śūdrā tāṁ śayanē bibhrat upagacchan ।  
dadad vr̥ddhiṁ vr̥ddhyarthaṁ dravyaṁ dadat । vr̥ddhyājīva ityarthaḥ ।  
surāvyatiriktaṁ madyaṁ kaṣāyaḥ । [#3] tasya pātā kaṣāyapaḥ ।  
yaścā'brāhmaṇa iva sarvān vandī bhūtvā stauti sa sarvō'pi tr̥ṇēṣūdayādārabhyā''sīt । yāvadasyā''dityaḥ pr̥ṣṭhaṁ paścādbhāgaṁ tapati । ādityē tapati tadānuguṇyācaraṇāt svayamēva pr̥ṣṭhatavityucyatē । abhyāsē abhyāsō yāvatā śuddhiṁ manyatē ॥ 10॥  

[#3]:

    'tat pibatīti kaṣāyapaḥ' iti ga, pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yad ēkarātrēṇa karōti pāpaṁ  
kr̥ṣṇaṁ+++(→śūdraṁ)+++ varṇaṁ brāhmaṇaḥ sēvamānaḥ ।  
caturtha-kāla udakābhyavāyī +++(snānakartā)+++  
tribhir varṣais tad apahanti pāpam 11
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

11. A Brāhmaṇa removes the sin which he committed by serving one day and night (a man of) the black race, if he bathes for three years, eating at every fourth meal-time. [#6] 

[#6]:  The expression kṛṣṇa varṇa, 'the black race,' is truly Vedic. In the Ṛj-veda it usually denotes the aboriginal races, and sometimes the demons. Others explain the Sūtra thus: p. 88 A Brāhmaṇa removes the sin, which he committed by cohabiting for one night with a female of the Śūdra caste, &c.--Haradatta. The latter explanation has been adopted by Kullūka on Manu XI. 179.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yadēkarātrēṇa karōti pāpaṁ kr̥ṣṇaṁ varṇaṁ brāhmaṇassēdhamānaḥ caturthakāla [#1]udakābhyavāyī tribhirvarṣaistadapahanti pāpam ॥ 11॥  

**ṭīkā**  
kr̥ṣṇō varṇaḥ śūdraḥ। tamājñākarō bhūtvā vr̥ttyarthaṁ sēvamānaḥ । śiṣṭaṁ spaṣṭaṁ gataṁ ca । apara āha- śūdrāṁ maithunē sēvamāna iti । asminpakṣē r̥tāvupagamanē apatyōtpattāvidaṁ draṣṭavyam । manuḥ—  
[#2]vr̥ṣalīphēnapītasya niśvāsōpahatasya ca ।   
tasyāṁ caiva prasūtasya niṣkr̥tirna vidhīyatē ॥ iti ॥11॥

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

yathā kathā ca paraparigrahamabhimanyatē stēnō ha bhavatīti kautsaharītau tathā kāṇvapuṣkarasādī ॥1॥  

**ṭīkā**  
[#1]yathā kathā ca āpadyanāpadi vā bhūyāṁsamalpaṁ vā, paraparigrahaṁ parasvamabhimanyatē-mamēdamastviti buddhau kurutē[#2] sarvathā stēna ēva bhavatīti kautsādayō manyantē ॥1॥  

[#1]:

    'kathā' iti chāndasaṁ rūpaṁ kathamityarthaḥ । dr̥ṣṭaṁ ca "tamabruvan kathā hāsthāḥ"(tai0saṁ0 2.6.3.) "kathā mā nirabhāgiti" (tai0saṁ0 3.1.9) ityādau ।

   buddhau kr̥tvā''datta ityartha , ityadhika ka. cha. pu.

<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

3. (E.g.) seeds ripening in the pod, food for a draught-ox; (if these are taken), the owners (ought) not (to) forbid it. [#1]

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
śamyōṣā yugyaghāsō na svāminaḥ pratiṣēdhayanti ॥ 3 ॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
tānēvōdāharati —  

**ṭīkā**  
**śamī** bījakōśī tasyām **uṣyantē** dahyantē kālavaśēna pacyantē iti **śamyōṣāḥ** -  
kōśīdhānyāni mudga-māṣa-caṇakādīni ।

yugaṁ vahatīti **yugyaḥ** śakaṭavāhī balīvardaḥ, tasya **ghāsō** bhakṣastr̥ṇādiḥ **yugyaghāsaḥ** ।

ētē ādīyamānāḥ svāminō na pratiṣēdhayanti - svāmibhiḥ pratiṣēdhaṁ na kārayanti ।

ētēṣv ādīyamānēṣu svāminō na pratiṣēdhum arhantīty arthaḥ । svayaṁgrahaṇē'pi na stēya-dōṣa iti yāvat । atra smr̥tyantarē viśēṣaḥ —  

> 'caṇakavrīhigōdhūma-  
> yavānāṁ mudgamāṣayōḥ ।  
> aniṣiddhair grahītavyō  
> muṣṭir ēkā'dhvani sthitaiḥ ॥'  

manustu—  
[#3] dvijō'dhvagaḥ kṣīṇavr̥ttirdvāvikṣū dvē ca mūlakē ।  
ādadānaḥ parakṣētrānna daṇḍaṁ dātumarhati ॥ 3 ॥  

[#3]: ma0 smr̥0 8. 341.
</details>

    āpa0 śrau0 8. 5. 41, karambhapātranirmāṇē saṁkhyāvidhirayam ।

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**

**ṭīkā**  
[#2] yastu antarēṇaiva nimittaṁ kaumārān dārān parityajati sa dāravyatikramī । kharasya, gardabhasyā'jinaṁ bahirlōma paridhāya vasitvā dāravyatikramiṇē bhikṣāṁ dattēti saptāgārāṇi bhikṣāṁ carēt । [#3]kaumāradāraparityāginē bhikṣāṁ dattē'ti vāsiṣṭhē । [#4]sā vr̥ttiḥ ṣaṇmāsān । tataḥ siddhiḥ ॥ 19 ॥

    dharmaprajādikamantarēṇa kaumārān dārān' iti ka. kha. pu.  

[#3]:

    va.dha, kaumāradāravyatikramiṇē. iti. kha. pu. kaumāradāraparityāginē iti, ka. pu.  

[#4]:

</details>

striyāstu bhartr̥vyatikramē kr̥cchradvādaśarātrābhyāsastāvantaṁ kālam 20

striyāstu bhartuvyatikramē kr̥cchradvādaśarātrābhyāsastāvantaṁ kālam ॥ 20 ॥

bhartuvyatikrama iti chāndasō rēphalōpaḥ । vyatikramaḥ parityāgaḥ । yā tu strī bhartāraṁ parityajatyantarēṇa nimittaṁ, tasyāstāvanta kālaṁ ṣaṇmāsān kr̥cchradvādaśarātrābhyāsaḥ prāyaścittam ॥ 20 ॥
</details>
</details>

atha bhrūṇahā śvājinaṁ kharājinaṁ vā bahirlōma paridhāya puruṣaśiraḥ pratīpānārthamādāya 21

ityāpastambadharmasūtravr̥ttau prathamapraśnē'ṣṭāviṁśī kaṇḍikā ॥28॥

### 29 patita-dharmaḥ

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

khaṭvāṅgaṁ daṇḍārthē karmanāmadhēyaṁ prabruvāṇaścaṅkramyēta kō bhrūṇaghnē bhikṣāmiti । grāmē prāṇavr̥ttiṁ pratilabhya śūnyāgāraṁ vr̥kṣamūlaṁ vābhyupāśrayēnna hi ma āryaiḥ saṁprayōgō vidyatē 1-1

ētēnaiva vidhinōttamāducchvāsāccarēt । nāsyāsmiṁl lōkē pratyāpattirvidyatē । kalmaṣaṁ tu nirhaṇyatē 1-2  
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

1. And he shall take the foot of a bed instead of a staff and, proclaiming the name of his deed, he shall go about (saying), 'Who (gives) alms to the murderer of a Bhrūṇa?' Obtaining thus his livelihood in the village, he shall dwell in an empty house or under a tree, (knowing that) he is not allowed to have intercourse with Aryans. According to this rule he shall act until his last breath. He cannot be purified in this world. But (after death) his sin is taken away.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
khaṭāṅgaṁ daṇḍārthē karmanāmadhēyaṁ prabruvāṇaścaṅkramyēta kō bhrūṇaghnē bhikṣāmiti । grāmē prāṇavr̥ttiṁ pratilabhya śūnyāgāraṁ vr̥kṣamūlaṁ vā'bhyupāśrayē'nna hima āryaiḥ saha samprayōgō vidyatē । ētēnaiva vidhinōttamāducchvāsāccarēt । nā'syāsmiṁllōkē pratyāpattirvidyatē । kalmaṣaṁ tu nirhaṇyatē॥ 1 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ṣaḍaṅgasya vēdasyā'dhyētā, tadarthavit, pragōgaśāstrasya savyākhyasyārthavit karmaṇāmanuṣṭhātā'nuṣṭhāpayitā ca brāhmaṇō bhrūṇaḥ । tathā ca baudhāyanaḥ— [#1]'vēdānāṁ kiñcidadhītya brāhmaṇaḥ । ēkā śākhāmadhītya śrōtriyaḥ । aṅgādhyāyyanūcānaḥ । kalpādhyāyyr̥ṣikalpaḥ। sūtrapravacanāpyāyī bhrūṇaḥ' iti । taṁ yō hatavān sa bhrūṇahā । sa śunaḥ kharasya vā'jinaṁ vahirlōmaparidhāya puruṣasya yasya kasyacinmr̥tasya śiraḥ, pratīpānārtham । pratirdhātvānuvādaḥ [#2] 'upasargasya ghañyamanuṣyē bahula'miti bāhulakō dīrghaḥ । pānamēva pratīpānam । pānagrahaṇamupalakṣaṇam । bhōjanamapi tatraiva । khaṭāṅgaṁ daṇḍārthē, khaṭvāyā aṅgaṁ khaṭvāṅgamīṣādi taṇddaṇḍakr̥tyē ādāya । “bhraṇahā'smītyēvaṁ karmanibandhanamātmanō nāmadhēyaṁ prabruvāṇaścakramyēta itastataścarēt । kāpālikatantraprasiddhasya khaṭvāṅgasya vā grahaṇam । bhikṣācaraṇakālē ca kō bhrūṇaghnē bhikṣā dadātīti carēt । caritvā prāmē prāṇavr̥ttiṁ prāṇayātrāmātraṁ pratilabhya śūnyāgāraṁ vr̥kṣamūlaṁ vā nivāsārthamabhyupāśrayēt- 'na hi ma āryaiḥ saha samprayōgō vidyata' ityēvaṁ manyamānaḥ । kiyantaṁ kālamēvaṁ caritavyamityata āha— ētēnaivētyādi । gatam ।

[#1]: baudhā0 gr̥0 1. 11.  

[#2]: pā0 sū0 6. 3  

'śrōtriyaṁ vā karmasamāpta(24.24.) mityatra yaḥ śrōtriyaḥ [#21]granthadhārī arthajñaśca na bhavati anuṣṭhāpayitā ca na bhavati tasya prahaṇam ॥2॥  

**sūtram**  
yaḥ pramattō hanti prāptaṁ dōṣaphalam ॥ 2॥  

**ṭīkā**  
'kṣatriyaṁ hatvē'tyēvamādikē'nukrāntē'pi viṣayē yaḥ pramattō hanti pramādē nā'buddhipūrvaṁ hanti tasyā'pi dōṣaphalaṁ prāptamēva । na tu pramādakr̥tamiti dōṣābhāvaḥ ॥2॥

[#21]: śrutidhārī iti ka0 pu0
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yaḥ pramattō hanti, prāptaṁ dōṣaphalam 2
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

2. He even who slays unintentionally, reaps nevertheless the result of his sin.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yaḥ pramattō hanti prāptaṁ dōṣaphalam ॥ 2॥  

**ṭīkā**  
'kṣatriyaṁ hatvē'tyēvamādikē'nukrāntē'pi viṣayē yaḥ pramattō hanti pramādē nā'buddhipūrvaṁ hanti tasyā'pi dōṣaphalaṁ prāptamēva । na tu pramādakr̥tamiti dōṣābhāvaḥ ॥2॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

saha saṁkalpēna bhūyaḥ 3
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

3. (His guilt is) greater, (if he slays) intentionally.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
saha saṅkalpēna bhūyaḥ ॥ 3 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
saṅkalpēna saha vadhē kr̥tē bhūyaḥ prabhūtataraṁ bhavati । tēna pramādakr̥tē laghuprāyaścittam , buddhipūrvaṁ tu gurviti । yatpunaḥ pūrvamuktaṁ 'dōṣavacca karmābhisandhipūrvaṁ kr̥tvā'nabhisandhipūrvaṁ vē(26.7)'ti tatra tēṣu prāyaścittēṣu viśēṣābhāvādidamuktam ॥ 3 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ēvamanyēṣvapi dōṣavatsu karmasu 4
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

4. The same (principle applies) also to other sinful actions,
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ēvamanyēṣvapi dōṣavatsu karmasu ॥ 4 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
anyēṣvapi hananavyatiriktēṣu dōṣavatsu karmamu ēvamēva draṣṭavyam-abuddhipūrvaṁ kr̥tē'lpō dōṣaḥ , buddhipūrvē mahāniti ॥ 4॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

tathā puṇyakriyāsu 5
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

5. And also to good works. [#1] 

[#1]:  29. Haradatta gives, as an example, the case where a warrior saves the property of a traveller from thieves. If the traveller turns out to be a Brāhmaṇa, and the warrior did not know his caste before rescuing his property, his merit will be less than if he had rescued knowingly the property of a Brāhmaṇa.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
tathā puṇyakriyāsu ॥ 5 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
puṇyakriyāsvapyēṣa ēva nyāyaḥ— abuddhipūrvē'lpaṁ phalam, buddhipūrvē mahaditi। tadyathā— brāhmaṇassvānyapahr̥tya cōrēṣu dhāvatsu yadr̥cchayā kaścicchūra āgatastān hanyāt, svayamēva vā śūraṁ dr̥ṣṭvā cōrā apahr̥tāni dravyāṇyutsr̥jya palāyēran tadā śūrasyā'lpaṁ puṇyaphalam । yadā tu buddhipūrvaṁ svayamēva cōrēbhyaḥ pratyāhr̥tya svāni svāmibhyō dadāti tadā mahaditi । ēvaṁ svabhāryābuddhyā paradāragamanē'lpam, anyatra mahaditi ॥5॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

parīkṣārthō'pi brāhmaṇa āyudhaṁ nādadīta 6
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

6. A Brāhmaṇa shall not take a weapon into his hand, though he be only desirous of examining it.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
parīkṣārthō'pi brāhmaṇa āyudhaṁ nā''dadīta ॥ 6॥  

**ṭīkā**  
guṇadōṣajñānaṁ parīkṣā । tayā arthaḥ prayōjanaṁ yasya saḥ । ēvaṁbhūtō'pi brāhmaṇa āyudhaṁ na gr̥hṇīyāt kiṁ punarhiṁsārtha ityapiśabdārthaḥ ॥ 7 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

yō hiṁsārthamabhikrāntaṁ hanti manyurēva manyuṁ spr̥śati na tasmindōṣa iti purāṇē 7
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

7. In a Purāṇa (it has been declared), that he who slays an assailant does not sin, for (in that case) wrath meets wrath.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yō hiṁsārthamabhikāntaṁ hanti manyurēva manyuṁ spr̥śati na tasmin dōṣa iti purāṇē ॥ 7 ॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
asya pratiprasavaḥ—  

**ṭīkā**  
yastu hiṁsārthaṁ māraṇārthamabhikrāntamabhipatitaṁ hanti na tasmin dōṣō vidyata iti purāṇē śrutam । dōṣābhāvē hētuḥ-yasmānmanyurēva manyuṁ spr̥śati na punaḥ puruṣaḥ puruṣam । atra vasiṣṭhabaudhāyanau—  

[#1]svādhyāyinaṁ kulē jātaṁ yō hanyādātatāyinam ।  
na tēna bhrūṇahā sa syānmanyustaṁ manyumr̥cchati ॥ iti ॥  
manustu—  

[#2]śastraṁ dvijātibhirgrāhyaṁ dharmō yatrōparuddhyatē ।
dvijātīnāṁ ca varṇānāṁ viplavē kālakāritē ॥  
ātmanaśca paritrāṇē dakṣiṇānāṁ ca saṅgarē ।  
strīviprābhyavapattau ca ghnan dharmēṇa na duṣyati ॥ iti ॥  

gautamaḥ- [#3]'prāṇasaṁśayē brāhmaṇō'pi śastramādadītē'ti ॥  

vasiṣṭhaḥ—
[#4]agnidō garadaścaiva śastrapāṇirdhanāpahaḥ ।  
kṣētradāraharaścaiva ṣaḍētē hyātatāyinaḥ ॥  
ātatāyinamāyāntamapi vēdāntapāragam ।  
jighāṁsantaṁ jighāṁsīyānna tēna bhrūṇahā bhavēt ॥' iti ॥7॥

athābhiśastāḥ samavasāya  
patita-putrēṣu carēyur dhārmyam iti

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
athā'bhiśastāḥ samavasāya carēyurdhārmyamiti sāṁśityētarētarayājakā itarētarādhyāpakā mithō vivāhamānāḥ ॥8॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
patitairakr̥taprāyaścittairutpāditānāṁ putrāṇāmapi pātityamastīti pratipādayituṁ pūrvapakṣamāha —  

**ṭīkā**  
athaśabdō'rthāntaraprastāvaṁ sūcayati । abhiśastāḥ patitāḥ । samavasāya carēyuḥ । avasānaṁ gr̥ham । samityēkībhāvē । grāmādbahirēkasmin pradēśē gr̥hāṇi kr̥tvā carēyuḥ । dhārmyaṁ dharmyē vakṣyamāṇaṁ vr̥ttamiti । sāṁśitya saṁśitāṁ tīkṣṇāṁ buddhiṁ kr̥tvā । niścityētyarthaḥ । itarētaraṁ yājayantaḥ । itarētaramadhyāpayantaḥ parasparaṁ vivāhasambandhaṁ ca kurvantaścarēyuḥ vartēranniti ॥8 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

putrānsaṁniṣpādya brūyur -  
"vipravrajatatāsmad -  
ēvaṁ hy asmatsv āryāḥ saṁpratyapatsyatē"ti 9

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

9. If they have begot sons, let them. say to them: 'Go out from amongst us, for thus the Āryas, (throwing the guilt) upon us, will receive you (amongst their number).' [#2] 

[#2]:  It is impossible to agree with Haradatta's explanation of the words to be addressed by Abhiśastas to their children. No Vedic license can excuse the use of the second person plural instead of the third. I propose the following: 'Go out from among us; for thus (leaving the guilt) to us, you will be received (as) Āryas.' it is, however, not improbable that our text is disfigured by several very old corruptions, compare Baudhāyana II, 1, 2, 18.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**

**ṭīkā**  
atha tē putrān sanniṣpādya brūyuḥ hē putrāḥ asmat asmattaḥ। vipravrajata vividhaṁ prakarṣēṇa ca snēhamutsr̥jyā''ryasamīpaṁ gacchata ।  
ēvaṁ hyasmāsu asmāsv āryāḥ śiṣṭāḥ sampratyapatsyata । [#1]  
'āśaṁsāyāṁ bhūtavaccēti' bhaviṣyati luṅ । sakārātparō yakārō'papāṭhaśchāndasō vā ।  
sampratipattiṁ kariṣyanti । āryāṇāmapyētadabhiprētaṁ bhaviṣyati । yasmādasmābhirēva patanīyaṁ karmā'nuṣṭhitaṁ na bhavadbhiḥ । na ca patitēnōtpāditasya pātityam, anyatvāt ॥9॥

[#3]:  'In like manner a man who has lost his rights, (can) beget a son, who possesses the rights (of his caste). For the wife is also a cause (of the birth of the son), and she is guiltless.'--Haradatta.

kuta ityāha—

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>

14. For if one makes impure milk curdle (by mixing it with whey and water) in a milk-vessel and stirs it, no sacrificial rite can be performed with (the curds produced from) that. Just so no intercourse can be allowed with the impure seed which comes (from an Abhiśasta).
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yō hi dadhidhānyāmaprayattaṁ paya ātañcya manthati na tēna dharmakr̥tyaṁ kriyēta ēvamaśuci śuklaṁ yannivartatē na tēna saha samprayōgō vidyatē ॥ 14 ॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
tataḥ kim ?

**ṭīkā**  
yō hi puruṣaḥ dadhidhānyāṁ sthālyām, aprayataṁ śvāādyupahatam , paya ātañcya takrādyātañcanēna saṁskr̥tya manthati na tēna tadutpannēna ghr̥tādinā dharmakr̥tyaṁ yāgādikaṁ kriyatē। ēvaṁ patitasambandhēnā'śuci śuklaṁ striyāṁ niṣitaṁ śōṇitēnākaṁ yannivartatē yēna rūpēṇa niṣpadyatē na tēna saha samprayōgō vidyatē śiṣṭānām । atra cā'śuci śukla'mityēta'dathāpi na sēndriya patatī'tyasya dūṣaṇam । na hi vācanikē'rthē yuktaya kramantē । tathā ca samānāyāmapyutpattau putra ēva patati na duhitā । yathā''ha vasiṣṭhaḥ—  

[#1] 'patitōtpannaḥ patitō bhavatyanyatra striyāḥ । sā hi paragāminī tāmarikthāmupēyāt' । iti ॥ 14 ॥  

[#1]: va. dha. 3.
</details>
</details>

abhīcārānuvyāhārāvaśucikarāvapatanīyau 15

**sūtram**  
abhīcārā[#2]nuvyāhārāvaśucikarāvapatanīyau ॥ 15 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
abhicāraḥ ēvā'bhīcāra । [#3] 'upasargasya dhañī'ti dīrghaḥ । abhīcāraḥ śyēnādiḥ । anuvyāhāraḥ śāpaḥ । tau brāhmaṇaviṣayē'pi kriyamāṇāvaśuciḥ karāvēva, na tu patanīyau ॥ 15 ॥

[#3]: pā0 sū0 6.3 112.

patanīyāviti hārītaḥ 16
</details>

<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

16. Hārita declares that they cause loss of caste.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
patanīyāviti hārītaḥ ॥ 16 ॥   

**ṭīkā**  
hārītastu tāvapi patanīyāviti manyatē ॥ 16 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

patanīyavr̥ttistvaśucikarāṇāṁ dvādaśa māsāndvādaśārdhamāsāndvādaśa dvādaśāhāndvādaśa saptāhāndvādaśa tryahāndvādaśāhaṁ saptāhaṁ tryahamēkāham 17
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

17. But crimes causing impurity must be expiated, (when no particular penance is prescribed,) by performing the penance enjoined for crimes causing loss of caste during twelve months, or twelve half months, or twelve twelve-nights, or twelve se’nnights, or twelve times three days, or twelve days, or seven days, or three days, or one day.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
patanīyavr̥ttistvaśucikarāṇāṁ dvādaśa māsān dvādaśā'rdhamāsān dvādaśa dvādaśāhān dvādaśa saptāhān dvādaśa tryahān dvādaśa dvahān dvādaśāhaṁ saptāhaṁ tryahaṁ dvyahamēkāham ॥ 17 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
aśucikarāṇāmapi karmaṇāṁ yēṣāmāhatya prāyaścittaṁ nōktaṁ tēṣāmapi patanīyēṣu karmasu yā vr̥ttiḥ prāyaścittaṁ saiva prāyaścittiḥ। kiyantaṁ kālam ? dvādaśa māsādyēkāhāntam ॥ 17 ॥
</details>
</details>

ityaśucikaranirvēṣō yathā karmābhyāsaḥ 18
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

18. Thus acts causing impurity must be expiated according to the manner in which the (sinful) act has been committed (whether intentionally or unintentionally).
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ityaśucikaranirvēṣō yathā karmābhyāsaḥ ॥ 18 ॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
kimaviśēṣēṇa sarvēṣvēvā'śucikarēṣvayaṁ kālavikalpaḥ ? nētyāha—  

**ṭīkā**  
ityēṣō'śucikaranirvēṣō yathā karmābhyāsastathā vēditavyaḥ । buddhipūrvē sānubandhē'bhyāsē ca bhūyāṁsaṁ kālam, viparītē viparyaya iti ॥18॥   

॥ ityāpastambasūtravr̥ttau prathamapraśnē ēkōnatriṁśī kaṇḍikā ॥ 29 ॥  

iti cā''pastambadharmasūtravr̥ttau haradattamiśraviracitāyāmujvalāyāṁ prathamapraśnē daśamaḥ paṭalaḥ ॥ 10 ॥
</details>
</details>

  

iti daśamaḥ paṭalaḥ

## +11

### 30 snātakaḥ

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

vidyayā snātītyēkē 1
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

1. Some declare, that a student shall bathe after (having acquired) the knowledge of the Veda, (however long or short the time of his studentship may have been). [#1] 

[#1]:  30. The bath is taken at the end of the studentship, and forms part of the Samāvartana-ceremony. From this rite a student who has completed his course of study derives the name Snātaka, 'one who has bathed.' See also Weber, Ind. Stud. X, 125.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
vidyayā snātītyēkē 1

**prastāvaḥ**  
'na samāvr̥ttā vapēran' ( 8. 7. ) snātastu kāla' (10.7.) ityādiṣu prasaktasya snānasya kālamāha —  

**ṭīkā**  
vēdavidyā vidyā । tayā sampannaḥ snānaṁ kuryādityēkē manyantē । manurityāha—  
[#1]vēdānadhītya vēdau vā vēdaṁ vā'pi yathākramam ।  
aviplutabrahmacaryō gr̥hasthāśramamāvasēt ॥ iti ॥ 1॥  

[#1]: ma0 smr̥0
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

tathā vratēnāṣṭācatvāriṁśatparīmāṇēna 2
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

2. (He may) also (bathe) after having kept the student's vow for forty-eight, (thirty-six or twenty-four) years, (though he may not have mastered the Veda).
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
tathā vratēnā'ṣṭācatvāriṁśatparīmāṇēna ॥2॥  

**ṭīkā**  
parimāṇamēva parīmāṇam । chāndasō dīrghaḥ । aṣṭācatvāriṁśadgrahaṇaṁ [#2] 'pādūnam, ardhēnē'(2.13,14)tyādipūrvōktasyāpyupalakṣaṇam । aṣṭācatvāriṁśadādiparimāṇēna vratēna [#3]vā sampannaḥ snāyāt asampannō'pi vidyayā ॥2॥  

[#2]:

   pādūnam , ardhēna, tribhirvā' ityētēṣāṁ pūrvōktānāmupalakṣaṇam । iti. ka. pu.  

[#3]:

   'atha brahmacaryavidhiḥ' ityārabhya prapañcitēna samidādhānabhikṣācaraṇagandhādivarjanādirūpēṇa । asti ca tēṣu vrataśabdaḥ 'yathā vratēṣu samarthaḥ syādyāni vakṣyāmaḥ" iti । iha tu samudāyābhiprāyamēkavacanam । tēna vā vratēna sampannassnāyāt । asampannō'pi vidyayā । 'catvāri vēdavratānī'tyēṣāṁ tu grahaṇamatra nā''ṅkanīyam । yathōktaṁ viśvarūpē । ityadhikaḥ pāṭhō ga. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

vidyāvratēna cētyēkē 3
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

Some declare, that the student (shall bathe) after (having acquired) the knowledge of the Veda and after (the expiration of) his vow.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
vidyā vratēna cētyēkē ॥3॥  

**ṭīkā**  
vidyēti tr̥tīyaikavacanasyākārasya[#4] 'supāṁ suluk' ityādinā luk । vidyayā vratēna cōbhābhyāṁ sampannaḥ snāyādityēkē manyatē । ēvaṁ ca [#5]'vēdamadhītya snāsya'nityatra vēdamadhītyētyupalakṣaṇam । atra yājñavalkyaḥ —  

[#6]vēdaṁ vratāni vā pāraṁ nītvā hyubhayamēva vā ।  
aviplutabrahmacaryō lakṣaṇyā striyamudvahēt ॥ iti ।  

[#4]: pā0 sū0 7 1. 29  

[#5]: āpa0 gr̥0 12. 1.  

[#6]: yājña0 smr̥0 1. 52.  

* atra vrataśabdēnā'gnīndhanabhaikṣācaraṇādayō brahmacāridharmā ucyatē। tēṣu hi kālaparimāṇasya śrutatvātū pāraṁ nītvēti yujyatē । dr̥śyatē ca tēṣu vrataśabdaḥ। 'yathā vratēṣu samarthassyādyāni vakṣyāma iti। na tu sāvitryādīni vēdavratānyucyantē । tēṣāṁ tattatpradēśādhyayanaśēṣatayā tadabhāvē'bhāvādvēdaṁ vratāni vēti vikalpānupapattēḥ । ataḥ kālaviśēṣāvacchinnāni vratāni vēdamubhayaṁ vā pāraṁ nītvētyarthaḥ * ॥ 3 ॥  

* *.ētaccinhāntargatō bhāgō'dhikapāṭhatayā parigaṇitaḥ kha. pustakē । ga. pustakē nāsti pāṭhaḥ । anyatra tu yathāyathamasti ।
</details>
</details>

sandhyōśca bahirgrāmādāsanaṁ vāgyataśca ॥ 8 ॥

paścimāṁ tu samāsīta

iti

divā ca śirasaḥ prāvaraṇaṁ varjayēn - mūtra-purīṣayōḥ karma parihāpya ॥ 14॥  

**ṭīkā**  
cakāraḥ pūrvāpēkṣayā samuccayārthaḥ । divā śirasaḥ prāvaraṇaṁ paṭādinā na kuryāt । kimaviśēṣēṇa ? nētyāha- mūtrapurīṣayōḥ karma kriyāṁ parihāpya varjayitvā ॥ 14 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

śiras tu prāvr̥tya mūtra-purīṣē kuryād - bhūmyāṁ kiṁcid +++(tr̥ṇādi)+++ antardhāya 15
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

15. But when voiding excrements, he shall envelop his head and place some (grass or the like) on the ground. [#4] 

[#4]:  Manu IV, 49.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
śirastu prāvr̥tya mūtrapurīṣē kuryāt bhūmyāṁ kiñcidantardhāya ॥ 15 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
divā rātrau ca mūtrapurīṣē kurvan śiraḥ prāvr̥ttya kuryāt । bhūmyāṁ kiñcidantardhāya tr̥ṇādikam, na sākṣāt bhūmyāmēva । iha kāmacārē prāptē 'divā ca śirasaḥ prāvaraṇaṁ varjayē'dityuktam । tasya paryudāsaḥ kr̥taḥ-'mūtrapurīṣayōḥ karma parihāpyē'ti । tatra mūtrapurīṣakālē sa ēva kāmacāraḥ sthitaḥ। ata ārabhyatē-śirastu prāvr̥tyēti । ēvaṁ tarhīdamēvā'stu । na pūrvaḥ paryudāsaḥ। sō'pyavaśyaṁ kartavyaḥ । anyathā 'śirastu prāvr̥tyē'tyasya rātrau caritārthatvāt divā pratiṣēdha ēva syāt । gautamasta rātrau sadaiva prāvaraṇamāha[#1] 'na prāvr̥ttya śirō'hani paryaṭēt, prāvr̥tya rātrī, mutrōccārē cē'ti ॥ 15 ॥

[#1]: gau0 dha0 9. 35, 36, 37
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

chāyāyām mūtrapurīṣayōḥ karma varjayēt 16
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

16. He shall not void excrements in the shade (of a tree, where travellers rest).
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
chāyāyāṁ mūtrapurīṣayōḥ karma varjayēt ॥ 16 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
'na cōpajīvyacchāyāsvi'ti smr̥tyantarē darśanāt yasyāṁ pathikādayō viśrāmyanti sā gr̥hyatē । tēna chatrachāyādērapratiṣēdhaḥ mēghacchāyāyā apyapratiṣēdhaḥ, avarjanīyatvāt ॥ 16 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

svāṁ tu chāyām ava-mēhēt 17
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

17. But he may discharge urine on his own shadow.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
svāṁ tu chāyāmavamēhēt ॥ 17॥  

**ṭīkā**  
chāndasastugabhāvaḥ । dvitīyāśrutēḥ pratiśabdādhyāhāraḥ । avamēhanaṁ mūtrakarma । anupajīvyatvānnāyaṁ pūrvasya pratiṣēdhasya viṣaya iti pratiprasavō'yaṁ na bhavati । tēna sati sambhavē svāmēva chāyāṁ pratyavamēḍhavyam ॥17॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

na sōpānah mūtra-purīṣē kuryāt, kr̥ṣṭē, pathy, apsu ca 18
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

18. He shall not void excrements with his shoes on, nor on a ploughed field, nor on a path, nor in water. [#5] 

[#5]:  Manu IV, 45, 46; Yājñ. I, 137.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
[#2] na sōpānanmūtrapurīṣē kuryāt ॥ 18 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
+++(agrimē sūtrē draṣṭavyam)+++  

[#2]:  

    ētadādi 'karma varjayē'dityantamēkasūtratayā parigaṇitaṁ kha. pustakē । sūtradvādaśakatayā chēdaḥ kr̥taḥ ka. pu0  

**sūtram**  
kr̥ṣṭē ॥ 19 ॥  

**sūtram**  
pathi ॥20॥  

**sūtram**  
apsu ca ॥21॥  

**ṭīkā**  
spaṣṭāni catvāri ॥ 18-21 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

tathā ṣṭhēvana-maithunayōḥ karmāpsu varjayēt 19
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

19. He shall also avoid to spit into, or to have connection with a woman in water. [#6] 

[#6]:  Manu IV, 56.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
tathā[#3]ṣṭhēvanamaithunayōḥ karmā'psu varjayēt ॥22॥  

**ṭīkā**  
ṣṭhēvanamāsyaślēṣmādīnāmutsargaḥ ॥ 22 ॥

[#3]: ṣṭīvana iti. kha pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

agnim ādityam apō brāhmaṇaṁ gā dēvatāś cābhimukhō mūtra-purīṣayōḥ karma varjayēt 20
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

20. He shall not void excrements facing the fire, the sun, water, a Brāhmaṇa, cows, or (images of) the gods. [#7] 

[#7]:  Manu IV, 48, 52; Yājñ. I, 134.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
agnimādityamapō brāhmaṇaṁ gā  dēvatāścā'bhimukhō mūtrapurīṣayōḥ karma varjayēt ॥ 23 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
dēvatāḥ dēvatā pratimāḥ ॥23॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

aśmānaṁ, lōṣṭham,  
ārdrān ōṣadhi-vanaspatīn+++(←puṣpair vinā phalanti)+++ ūrdhvān +++(→vātādibhir abhagnān)+++ ācchidya,  
mūtra-purīṣayōḥ śundhanē varjayēt 21
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

21. He shall avoid to clean his body from excrements with a stone, a clod of earth, or with (boughs of) herbs or trees which he has broken off, whilst they were on the tree and full of sap.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
aśmānaṁ lōṣṭamānōṣadhivanaspatīnūrdhvānācchidya mūtrapurīṣayōḥ śundhanē varjayēt ॥ 24 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
phala-pākāvasānā **ōṣadhayaḥ** ।  
yē puṣpair vinā phalanti tē **vanaspatayaḥ** ।  
**ārdrān** iti vacanāt śuṣkēṣu na dōṣaḥ ।  
**ūrdhvān** iti vacanād vātādi-nimittēna bhagnēṣu na dōṣaḥ। 'ētairaśmādibhimūtrapurīṣayōśśōdhanaṁ na kuryāt ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

agnim, apō, brāhmaṇaṁ, gā, dēvatā, dvāraṁ, pratīvātaṁ ca  
śakti-viṣayē nābhiprasārayīta +++(pādau)+++22
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

22. If possible, he shall not stretch out his feet towards a fire, water, a Brāhmaṇa, a cow, (iniages of) the gods, a door, or against the wind. [#8] 

[#8]:  The prohibition to stretch the feet towards a fire occurs also Manu IV, 53; Yājñ. I, 137.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
agnimādityamapō brāhmaṇaṁ gā dēvatādvāraṁ prati pādaṁ ca śaktiviṣayē nā'bhiprasārayīta ॥ 25॥  

**ṭīkā**  
śaktau satyāṁ agnyādīnprati pādau na prasārayēt ॥ 25 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

athāpy udāharanti +++('grē vakṣyamāṇam)+++ 23
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

23. Now they quote also (the following verse):
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
athā'pyudāharanti ॥ 26 ॥  
**ṭīkā**    

॥ ityāpastambadharmasūtra prathamapraśnē triṁśī kaṇḍikā ॥ 30॥
</details>
</details>

### 31 snātakaḥ

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

> prāṅ-mukhō 'nnāni bhuñjīta   
> uccarēd dakṣiṇā-mukhaḥ ।  
> udaṅ-mukhō mūtraṁ kuryāt  
> pratyak-pādāvanējanam 

iti 1
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

1. He shall eat facing the east, void fæces facing, the south, discharge urine facing the north, and wash his feet turned towards the west.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
prāṅmukhō'nnāni bhuñjīttōccarēddakṣiṇāmukhaḥ ।  
udaṅmukhō mūtraṁ kuryātpratyakpādāvanējanamiti ॥1॥   

**ṭīkā**  
uccāraḥ purīṣakarma । pādāvanējanaṁ pādaprakṣālanam । bhōjanādiṣu catasrō niyamyantē । manustu—  
[#1] 'āyuṣyaṁ prāṅmukhō bhuktē yaśasyaṁ dakṣiṇāmukhaḥ ।  
śriyaṁ pratyaṅmukhō bhuṅkta[#2] r̥taṁ bhuṅktē udaṅmukhaḥ' ॥ iti।   
yājñalkvaśca —  
[#3] 'divā sandhyāsu karṇasthabrahmasūtra udaṅmukhaḥ।  
kuryānmūtrapurīṣē tu rātrī cēddakṣiṇāmukhaḥ ॥' iti ॥ 1॥  

[#1]: ma0 smr̥0 2. 52.  

[#2]: r̥taṁ satyaṁ, tatphalamicchan ।  

[#3]: yā0 smr̥0 1. 16.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

ārāc cāvasathān mūtrapurīṣē kuryād, dakṣiṇāṁ diśaṁ dakṣiṇāparāṁ vā 2
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

2. He shall void excrements far from his house, having gone towards the south or south-west. [#1] 

[#1]:  31. Manu IV, 151; Yājñ. I, 16.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
ārāccā''vasathānmūtrapurīṣē kuryāddakṣiṇāṁ diśaṁ dakṣiṇāparāṁ vā ॥ 2॥  

**ṭīkā**  
āvasathō gr̥ham । tasya dūratō mūtrapurīṣē kuryāt, dakṣiṇāṁ diśam । dvitīyānirdēśādabhiniṣkramyēti gamyatē । dakṣiṇāparā nair̥tī ॥2॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

astam itē ca  
bahir grāmād,  
ārād āvasathād vā mūtrapurīṣayōḥ karma varjayēt 3
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

3. But after sunset he must not void excrements outside the village or far from his house.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
astamitē ca bahirgrāmādārādāvasathānmūmūtrapurīṣayōḥ karma varjayēt ॥ 3 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
astamita ādityē bahirgrāmānmūtrapurīṣē na kuryāt । tathā antargrāmē'pi gr̥hasya dūratō na kuryāt । dr̥ṣṭārthō'yaṁ pratiṣēdhaścōravyāghrādiśaṅkayā । nirbhayē dēśē nā'sti dōṣaḥ ॥ 3 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

dēvatābhidhānaṁ cāprayataḥ 4
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

4. And as long as he is impure he (shall avoid) to pronounce the names of the gods.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
dēvatābhidhānaṁ cā'prayataḥ॥ 4 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
dēvatānāmanyādīnāmabhidhānaṁ cā'prayatasman varjayēt । [#1]apidhānamityapi pāṭhē ēṣa ēvārthaḥ ॥ 4॥  

[#1]:

    apidhānamityapāṭhaḥ । ēṣa ēvārtha iti kha. ga. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

paruṣaṁ +++(vacanaṁ)+++ cōbhayōr dēvatānāṁ rājñaś ca +++(varjayēt)+++ 5
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

5. And he shall not speak evil of the gods or of the king. [#2] 

[#2]:  Manu IV, 163.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
paruṣaṁ cōbhayōrdēvatānāṁ rājñaśca ॥5॥  

**ṭīkā**  
dēvatānāṁ rājñaścētyubhayōḥ । rāśyapēkṣayā dvivacanam । paruṣa nindāṁ varjayēt ॥5॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

brāhmaṇasya gōr iti padōpasparśanaṁ varjayēt 6
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

6. He shall not touch with his foot a Brāhmaṇa, a cow, nor any other (venerable beings).
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
brāhmaṇasya gōriti padōpasparśanaṁ varjayēt ॥ 6॥  

**ṭīkā**  
brāhmaṇaṁ gāṁ ca pādēna nōpaspr̥śēt । itiśabdaḥ prakārē । tēna vidyāvayōvr̥ddhānāmabrāhmaṇānāmapi varjanam ॥ ॥6॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

hastēna cākāraṇāt 7
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

7. (Nor shall he touch them) with his hand, except for particular reasons.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
hastēna cā'kāraṇāt ॥ 7॥  

**ṭīkā**  
kāraṇamabhyaṅgakaṇḍūyanādi । tēna vinā hastēnā'pyupasparśanaṁ varjayēt pūrvōktānām ॥ 7॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

gōr, dakṣiṇānāṁ, kumāryāś ca parīvādān varjayēt 8
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

8. He shall not mention the blemishes of a cow, of sacrificial presents, or of a girl. [#3] 

[#3]:  'In the section on transcendental knowledge (I, 8, 23, 5), "speaking evil" has been forbidden, in connection with the means of salvation. And below (Sūtra 25) the (author) will declare that the sins which destroy the creatures are to be avoided. But this precept (is given in order to indicate that) in the case of cows and the rest an extra penance must be performed.'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
gōrdakṣiṇānāṁ kumāryāśca parīvādānvarjayēt ॥ 8 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
gōradakṣiṇāyā api dakṣiṇānāmagavāmapi hiraṇyādīnāṁ kumāryāḥ kanyāyāśca dōṣān satō'pi na kathayēt । adhyātmaprakaraṇē yōgāṅgatayā parīvādaḥ pratiṣiddhaḥ । anantaraṁ ca vakṣyati[#2] 'krōdhādīṁśca bhūtadāhīyān varjayēditi । idaṁ tu vacanaṁ gavādiṣu prāyaścittātirēkārtham ॥ 8 ॥  

[#2]: āpa0dha0 31.23.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

+++(sasyadhānyādikaṁ bhakṣayantīṁ←)+++ spr̥hatīṁ ca gāṁ nācakṣīta +++(tatsvāminē)+++ 9
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

9. And he shall not announce it (to the owner) if a cow does damage (by eating corn or grass in a field).
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
spr̥hatīṁ ca gāṁ nā''cakṣīta ॥ 9 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
spr̥hatīṁ sasyadhānyādikaṁ bhakṣayantīṁ gāṁ svāminē na brūyāt ॥ 9 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

saṁsr̥ṣṭāṁ +++(gāṁ)+++ ca vatsēnānimittē +++(nācakṣīta tatsvāminē)+++10
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

10. (Nor shall he call attention to it) if a cow is together with her calf, except for a particular reason.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
saṁsr̥ṣṭāṁ ca vatsēnā'nimittē ॥10॥

**ṭīkā**  
yā ca gaurvatsēna saṁsr̥jatē tāmapi na brūyādanimittē-iyaṁ tē gaurvatsēna pīyata iti । 'animittē' iti vacanāt[#1] 'yasya haviṣē vatsā apākr̥tā dhayēyuri'tyādikē nimittē sati vakturnāsti dōṣaḥ ॥ 10॥  

[#1]: āpa0 śrau0 9. 1. 23.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

nādhēnum adhēnur iti brūyāt - "dhēnubhavyē"ty ēva brūyāt  11
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

11. And of a cow which is not a milch-cow he shall not say, 'She is not a milch-cow.' He must say, 'This is a cow which will become a milch-cow.'
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
nā'dhēnumadhēnuriti brūyāt । dhēnubhavyētyēva brayāt ॥ 11 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yā ca gauradhēnuḥ payasvinī bhavati tāmapyadhēnuriti na brūyāt ॥19॥   

kiṁ tarhi dhēnubhavyētyēva brūyāta- bhaviṣyantī dhēnurdhēnubhavyā । 'dhēnōrbhavyāyāṁ (mum vaktavya) iti mum na bhavati । cvyagtatvēnā'vyayatvāt । vaktavyatvē
ca sati śabdaniyamō'yam । na punaradhēnudarśana ēvaṁ vaktavyam ॥12॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

na bhadram "bhadram" iti brūyāt । +++(tat-sthānē)+++ "puṇyaṁ praśāstam" ityēva brūyāt 12
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

12. He shall not call 'lucky' that which is lucky. He shall call it 'a mercy, a blessing.' [#4] 

[#4]:  Manu IV, 139.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
[#2] na bhadraṁ bhadramiti brūyāt ॥ 13 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yat bhadraṁ tat bhadramiti na brūyāt ॥ 13 ॥  

[#2]: ma0 smr̥0 4. 139.  

**sūtram**  
puṇyaṁ praśāstamityēva brūyāt ॥14॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
kiṁ tu?

**ṭīkā**  
puṇyaṁ praśāstamityanayōranyatarēṇa śabdēna brūyāt । praśāstaṁ praśastam । chāndasō dīrghaḥ ॥ 14॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

vatsa-tantīṁ ca nōpari gacchēt 13
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

13. He shall not step over a rope to which a calf (or cow) is tied. [#5] 

[#5]:  Manu IV, 38.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
[#3] vatsatantī ca nōpari gacchēt ॥ 15 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
vatsānāṁ bandharajjurvatsatantī । tasyā upari na gacchēt tāṁ na laṅghayēt । vatsagrahaṇaṁ gōjātērupalakṣaṇam ॥ 15॥  

[#3]: ma0 smr̥0 4. 38.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

prēṅkhāv+++(=ḍōlāstambhau)+++ antarēṇa ca nātīyāt 14
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

14. He shall not pass between the posts from which a swing is suspended. [#6] 

[#6]:  'Or according to others, " He shall not pass between pillars supporting an arch."'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
prēṅkhāvantarēṇa ca nā'tīyāt ॥ 16॥  

**ṭīkā**  
**prēṅkhau** ḍōlāstambhau । tōraṇastambhāvityanyē । tāv **antarēṇa** nā'tīyāt- tayōrmadhyē na gacchēt ॥ 16 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

na "+asau mē sapatna" brūyāt । yadyasau mē sapatna iti brūyād, dviṣantaṁ bhrātr̥vyaṁ janayēt 15
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

15. (In company) he shall not say, 'This person is my enemy.' If he says, 'This person is my enemy,' he will raise for himself an enemy, who will show his hatred.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
nā'sau mē sapatna iti brūyāt yadyasau mēṁ sapatna iti brūyāt dviṣantaṁ bhrātr̥vyaṁ janayēt ॥ 17 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
asau dēvadattō mē sapatna iti na brūyāt sadasi । kiṁ kāraṇam ? yadyasau mē sapatna iti brūyāt, dviṣantaṁ, kriyāśabdō'yam, vidviṣāṇaṁ bhrātr̥vyaṁ sapatnaṁ janayēt 'vyan sapatnē' iti bhrātr̥śabdē vyan pratyayaḥ । ēvaṁ yuktē sa manyēta-nā'kasmādayaṁ brūtē nūnamasya mayi dvēṣō vartata iti । tataśca tatpratīkārārthaṁ yatamānassapatna ēva jāyatē iti ॥ 17 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

nēndra-dhanur iti parasmai prabrūyāt 16
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

16. If he sees a rainbow, he must not say to others, 'Here is Indra's bow.' [#7] 

[#7]:  Manu IV, 59.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
nēndradhanuriti parasmai prabrūyāt ॥ 18 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
indradhanurākāśē paśyan parasmai tēna śabdēna na brūyāt । yadyavaśyaṁ vaktavyaṁ maṇidhanuriti brūyāt । gautamīyē [#1] darśanāt ॥ 18 ॥  

[#1]: gau0 dha0 9. 22.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

na patataḥ +++(=pakṣiṇaḥ/ asteroids)+++ saṁcakṣītaḥ+++(=gaṇayēt)+++ 17
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

17. He shall not count (a flock of) birds. [#8] 

[#8]:  Others explain (the Sūtra thus): He shall not announce it to others, if he sees (the souls of) good men falling from heaven on account of the expenditure of their merit, (i.e.) he shall not call attention to shooting-stars.'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
na patataḥ sañcakṣīta ॥ 19 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
patataḥ pakṣiṇaḥ saṅghībhūya sthitānna sañcakṣīta na gaṇayēt— iyanta ēta iti । apara āha— 'puṇyakṣayēṇa svargātpatataḥ sukr̥tinaḥ parasmai na sañcakṣīta-jyōtīṁṣi patantīti na kathayēt ॥ 19 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

udyantam astaṁ yantaṁ cādityaṁ darśanē varjayēt 18
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

18. He shall avoid to look at the sun when he rises or sets. [#9] 

[#9]:  Manu IV, 37. 19. Manu IV, 153.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
udyantamastaṁ yantaṁ cā''dityaṁ darśanē varjayēt ॥20॥  

**ṭīkā**  
udayasamayē astamayasamayē vā ādityaṁ na paśyēt ।  
[#2]manustu —  

> nēkṣētōdyantam ādityaṁ  
> nā'staṁ yantaṁ kadācana ।  
> nōparaktaṁ na vāristhaṁ  
> na madhyaṁ nabhasō gatam ॥

iti ॥ 20 ॥  

[#2]: ma0 smr̥0 4. 36.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

divādityaḥ sattvāni gōpāyati,  
naktaṁ candramās,  
tasmād amāvāsyāyāṁ niśāyāṁ svādhīya+++(=sādhīya)+++ ātmanō guptim icchēt  
prāyatya-brahmacarya-kālē caryayā ca 19
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

19. During the day the sun protects the creatures, during the night the moon. Therefore let him eagerly strive to protect himself on the night of the new moon by purity, continence, and rites adapted for the season.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
divā''dityaḥ satvāni gōpāyati naktaṁ candramāḥ ।   tasmādamāvāsyāyāṁ niśāyāṁ svādhīya ātmanō guptimicchēt prāyatyabrahmacaryakālē caryayā ca ॥ 21 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
**divā** ahani । **ādityaḥ** satvāni **gōpāyati** prāṇinō rakṣati, ālōkadānēna ।  
**naktaṁ** rātrau **candramāḥ** ।  
**tasmād amāvāsyāyāṁ niśāyāṁ** rātrau  
**svādhīyaḥ** । vakāraśchāndasaḥ । antikavāḍhayōrnēdasādhau ।  
**bāḍhataraṁ** bhr̥śataraṁ ātmanō guptiṁ rakṣaṇamicchēt ।  

kēna prakārēṇa ?  
prāyatya-brahmacaryābhyāṁ kālē caryayā ca । ayaṁ tāvadarthānurūpaḥ pāṭhaḥ। adhīyamānastu pramādaśchāndasō vā । prayatasya bhāvaḥ prāyatyaṁ nityaprāyatyādadhikēna prāyatyēna snānādijēna । brahmacaryēṇa maithunatyāgēna । kālē kr̥tayā caryayā dēvārcanajapādikayā ca ॥ 21 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

saha hy ētāṁ rātriṁ sūryācandramasau vasataḥ 20
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

20. For during that night the sun and the moon dwell together.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
saha hyētāṁ rātriṁ sūryācandramasau vasataḥ ॥ 22 ॥  

**prastāvaḥ**  
kasmātpunarasyāṁ rātrau candramā na gōpāyatītyāha —  

**ṭīkā**  
ētāṁ rātrim । atyantasaṁyōgē dvitīyā । sarvāmētāṁ rātriṁ sūryācandramasau saha vasataḥ । na ca sūryēṇa saha vasataścandramasaḥ prakāśō'sti ॥ 22 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

na kusr̥tyā grāmaṁ praviśēt ।  
yadi praviśēn "namō rudrāya vāstōṣpataya" ityētām r̥caṁ japēd anyāṁ vā raudrīm 21
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

21. He shall not enter the village by a by path. If he enters it thus, he shall mutter this Ṛk-verse, 'Praise be to Rudra, the lord of the dwelling,' or some other (verse) addressed to Rudra. [#10] 

[#10]:  Manu IV, 73; Yājñ. I, 140.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
na kusr̥tyā grāmaṁ praviśēt ॥ 23 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
kusr̥tiḥ kumārgaḥ । tayā grāmaṁ na praviśēt ॥ 23॥  

**sūtram**  
yadi praviśē'nnamō rudrāya vāstōṣpattaya' ityētāmr̥caṁ japēdanyāṁ vā raudrīm ॥ 24 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yadi gatyantarābhāvāt praviśēta[#1] 'namō rudrāyē'tyādikāmr̥caṁ japēt । anyāṁ vā raudrīm[#2] 'imāṁ rudrāya tavasa'ityādikām । atra vājasanēyagr̥hyē— [#3] vanaṁ pravēkṣyannanumantrayatē 'namō rudrāya vanasadē svasti mā sampārayē'ti । panthānamārōkṣyannanumantrayatē 'namō rudrāya pathipadē svasti mā sampārayē'ti । apaḥ pravēkṣyannanumantrayatē— 'namō rudrāyā'psuṣadē svasti mā sampārayēti । tasmādyatkiñcana karma kurvan syāt sarvaṁ 'namō rudrāyē'tyēva kuryāt 'sarvō hyēṣa rudra' iti śrutēriti । bhāradvājagr̥hyē'pyasminviṣayē kiyānēva bhēdaḥ ॥24॥  

[#1]:

    brā. 3.7. 9 namō rudrāya vāstōṣpatayē । āyanē vidravaṇē । udyāyanē yatparāyaṇē । āvartanē nivartanē । yō gōpāyati tam̐ huvē ॥ iti samagrā r̥k ॥  

[#2]:

    'imā rudrāya tavasē kapardinē kṣayadvīrāya' iti rudrādhyāyagatā (tai0 saṁ04 5.10)  

[#3]: pāra0 gr̥0 3. 15. 11.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

nābrāhmaṇāyōcchiṣṭaṁ prayacchēt ।  
yadi prayacchēd - dantān skuptvā, tasminn avadhāya prayacchēt 22
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

22. He shall not (ordinarily) give the residue of his food to a person who is not a Brāhmaṇa. When he gives it (to such a one), he shall clean his teeth and give (the food) after having placed in it (the dirt from his teeth). [#11] 

[#11]:  Manu IV, 80. 'This prohibition (given in the first part of the Sūtra) refers to Śūdras who are not dependents; to dependents the following (exception applies).'--Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
nā'brāhmaṇāyōcchiṣṭaṁ prayacchēt ॥ 25 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
abrāhmaṇaḥ śudraḥ । [#4] 'na śūdrāyōcchiṣṭamanucchiṣṭaṁ vā dadyā'diti vāsiṣṭhē darśanāt । tasmā ucchiṣṭaṁ na prayacchē'dityanāśritaviṣayam ॥ 25 ॥  

[#4]: va0 dha0 18 14.  

**sūtram**  
yadi prayacchēddantān skuptvā tasminnavadhāya prayacchēt ॥26॥  

**ṭīkā**  
idamāśritaviṣayam । dantānnakhēna skupavā vilikhya tanmalaṁ tasminnucchiṣṭē'vadhāya prayacchēt । 'skuptvē'ti skubhnātēḥ ktvāpratyayē chāndasaṁ bhakārasya cartvam । skunōtērvā pakāra upajanaḥ ॥ 26 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

krōdhādīṁś ca bhūta-dāhīyān dōṣān varjayēt 23
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

23. And let him avoid the faults that destroy the creatures, such as anger and the like. [#12] 

[#12]:  See above, I, 6, 23, 4 and 5, and Manu IV, 163.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
krōdhādīṁśca bhūtadāhīyāndōṣānvarjayēt ॥ 27 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
**krōdhādayō** bhūtadāhīyā adhyātmapaṭalē(22.5) vyākhyātāḥ । tadvacanaṁ yōgiviṣayamityayōginō'pi snātakasya krōdhādinivr̥ttyarthamidaṁ vacanam । idamēva tarhyubhayārthamastu-yōgyarthamayōgyarthaṁ ca । ēvaṁ siddhē tadvacanaṁ krōdhādivarjanasya yōgāṅgatvapratipādanārtham । tēna krōdhādyanuṣṭhānē yōgasiddhirna bhavati । na punaḥ snātakavratalōpaprāyaścitamiti ॥27॥  

॥ ityāpastambadharmasūtravr̥ttau prathamapraśnē ēkatriṁśī kaṇḍikā ॥ 31 ॥
</details>
</details>

### 32 snātakaḥ

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

pravacana-yuktō varṣā-śaradaṁ maithunaṁ varjayēt 1
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

1. Let him who teaches, avoid connubial intercourse during the rainy season and in autumn. [#1] 

[#1]:  32. Weber, Ind. Stud. X, 42.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
pravacanayuktō varṣāśaradaṁ maithunaṁ varjayēt ॥ 1॥  

**ṭīkā**  
pravacanamadhyāpanam । tēna yuktō varṣāsu śaradi ca maithunaṁ varjayēt r̥tāvapi ॥1॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

mithunī-bhūya ca, na tayā saha sarvāṁ rātriṁ śayīta 2
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

2. And if he has had connection (with his wife), he shall not lie with her during the whole night [#2] 

[#2]:  Manu IV, 40.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
mithunībhūya ca na tayā saha sarvāṁ rātriṁ śayīta ॥ 2॥  

**ṭīkā**  
mithunībhūya maithunaṁ kr̥tvā tayā bhāryayā saha tāṁ rātriṁ sarvāṁ na śayīta ॥ 2 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

śayānaś cādhyāpanaṁ varjayēt 3
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

3. He shall not teach whilst he is lying on a bed.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
śayānaścā'dhyāpanaṁ varjayēt ॥ 3॥  

**ṭīkā**  
divā naktaṁ ca śayānasyā'dhyāpanapratiṣēdhaḥ। svayaṁ tu dhāraṇārthamadhīyānasya na dōṣaḥ ॥ 3 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

na ca tasyāṁ śayyāyām adhyāpayēd yasyāṁ śayīta 4
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

4. Nor shall he teach (sitting) on that couch on which he lies (at night with his wife).
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
na ca tasyāṁ śayyāyāmadhyāpayēdyasyāṁ śayīta ॥4॥  

**ṭīkā**  
yasyā śayyāyāṁ bhāryayā saha śayīta rātrau tasyāṁ śayyāyāmāsīnō'pi nā'dhyāpayēt ॥ 4॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

an-āviḥ+++(bhūta)+++-srag-anulēpaṇaḥ syāt 5
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

5. He shall not show himself adorned with a garland, or anointed with ointments. [#3] 

[#3]:  Manu IV, 72.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
anāviḥsraganulēpaṇassyāt ॥ 5 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
āvir-bhūtē prakāśitē sraganulēpanē yasya ēvaṁbhūtō na syāt । ṇatvaṁ pūrvavat ॥ 5 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

sadā niśāyāṁ dāraṁ praty alaṁkurvīta 6
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

6. At night he shall always adorn himself for his wife.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
sadā niśāyāṁ dāraṁ pratyalaṅkurvīta ॥ 6 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
'dāraṁ pratīti vacanādupagamanārthamalaṅkaraṇam । tēna bhāryā aśaktyādinā upagamanāyōgyatvē nā'yaṁ niyamaḥ ॥ 6 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

+++(nitya-snānē snātakōcitē)+++ saśirā vamajjanam apsu varjayēt 7
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

7. Let him not submerge his head together with his body (in bathing),
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
saśirā vamajjanamapsu varjayēta ॥7॥  

**ṭīkā**  
**vamajjanam** avamajjanam । 

'vaṣṭi vāgurirallōpamavāpyōrupasargayō'rity akāralōpaḥ ।  
tat **saśirā** varjayēt ।  
saha śirasā snānaṁ na kuryāt ।  

avagāhana-vidhayaḥ sarvē snātaka-vyatiriktē caritārthāḥ, naimittikāś ca ।  
snātakasya tu nitya-snānam avagāhana-rūpaṁ na bhavatīty ācāryasya pakṣaḥ ॥ 7 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

astam itē ca snānam  +++(varjayēt)+++8
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

8. And (let him avoid) to bathe after sunset.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
astamitē ca snānam ॥ 8 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
astamitē ādityē sarvaprakāraṁ snānaṁ varjayēt ॥ 8॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

pālāśam {āsanaṁ, pādukē, danta-prakṣālanam} iti ca varjayēt 9
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

9. Let him avoid to use a seat, clogs, sticks for cleaning the teeth, (and other utensils) made of Palāśa-wood.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
pālāśamāsanaṁ pādukē dantaprakṣālanamiti ca varjayēt ॥ 9 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
pālāśamāsanādi varjayēt । dantaprakṣālanaṁ dantakāṣṭham । itiśabdaḥ prakārē। tēnā'nyadapi gr̥hōpakaraṇaṁ pālāśaṁ varjayēt ॥ 6 ॥
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

> durvivaktuḥ prajāṁ paśūn āyatanaṁ hinasti ।  
> "dharmaprahrāda! na kumālanāya +++(idaṁ kukarma)+++"  
> rudan ha mr̥tyur vy-uvāca +++(r̥ṣikr̥taṁ)+++ praśnam  
> +++("kēnānavadhānēna pātitēna macchiśur mr̥ta" iti )+++

iti 24
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

24. (The foolish decision) of a person who decides wrongly destroys his ancestors and his future happiness, it harms his children, cattle, and house. 'Oh Dharmaprahrāda, (this deed belongs) not to Kumālana!' thus decided Death, weeping, the question (addressed to him by the Ṛṣi). [#6] 

[#6]:  Haradatta tells the story to which the second half of the verse alludes, in the following manner: 'A certain Ṛṣi had two pupils, called Dharmaprahrāda and Kumālana. Once they brought from the forest two great bundles of firewood and threw them negligently into their teacher's house, without looking. One of the bundles struck the teacher's little son so that he died. Then the teacher asked his two pupils, "Which of you two has killed him?" Both answered, "Not I, not I." Hereupon the teacher, being unable to (come to a decision in order to) send away, the sinner and to keep the innocent one, called Death, and asked him, "Which of the two has killed the boy?" Then Death, finding himself involved in a difficult law-question, began to weep, and p. 99 giving his decision, said, "Oh Dharmaprahrāda, not to Kumālana (the dative has the sense of the genitive), this sin is none of Kumālana's!" Instead of declaring, "Dharmaprahrāda, thou hast done this,' he said, "The other did not do it." Still from the circumstances of the case it appeared that the meaning of the answer was, "The other has done it." "This was the decision which he gave crying."'--The reading of the text rendered in the translation is, dharmaprahrāda na kumālanāya.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
mūlaṁ tūlaṁ vr̥hati durvivaktuḥ prajāṁ paśunāyatanaṁ hinasti । dharmaprahrāda na kumālanāya rudan ha mr̥tyurvyuvāca praśnam । iti ॥ 24 ॥  

**ṭīkā**  
durnirūpamarthaṁ sahasā nirṇīyaṁ yō durvivakti, anyathā varṇayati sa durvivaktā । tasya **durvivaktus** tadēva durvacanamēva mūlaṁ tūlaṁ ca vr̥hati । **mūlaṁ** pitr̥dhanam । **tūlam** āgāminī sampat । tadubhayamapi **vr̥hati** utpāṭayati । dantōṣṭayōḥ vakāraḥ। kimētāvadēva ? na, **prajāṁ** putrādikām । **paśūna** gavādikān । **āyatanaṁ** gr̥haṁ ca **hinasti** । atō durvacanasambhavāt praśnamātramēva na vibrūyāditi।  

atrētihāsaḥ —  

kasyacid r̥ṣēr dharmaprahrādaḥ kumālanaścēti dvau śiṣyāvāstām ।  
tau kadācid araṇyān mahāntau samid-bhārāv āhr̥tya śramād[#1] dr̥ṣṭipūta ēvācāryagr̥hē prākṣipatām ।  
tayōrakēnā''krānta ācāryasya śiśuḥ putrō mr̥taḥ ।  
tataḥ śiṣyāvāhūyā''cāryaḥ papraccha- "kēnāyaṁ mārita" iti ।  
tāvubhāvapi na mayēty ūcatuḥ ।  
tathā patitasya parityāgam aduṣṭasya parigrahaṁ kartum aśaknuvann r̥ṣir mutyum āhūya papraccha- "kēnāyaṁ vyāpādita" iti ।  
tatō dharmasaṅkaṭē patitō mr̥tyū rudann ēva praśnaṁ **vyuvāca** vivicya kathitavān । 

katham ? **hē dharmaprahrāda na kumālanāya** । ṣaṣṭhaparthē caturthī । kumānalasya nēdaṁ patanīyam iti । dharmaprahrāda tvayēdaṁ kr̥tam iti vaktavyē itarasya nā'stītyuktam । tathāpītarasyāstīty arthād gamyatē । iti rudan ha vyuvācēti । ha-śabda aitihyatvadyōtanārthaḥ । prahrādaśabdē hakārātparō rēphaśchāndasaḥ ॥ 24 ॥  

[#1]: dr̥ṣṭipatha ēva iti kha. pu.
</details>
</details>

# +2

## +01 gr̥hasthaḥ

### 01 gr̥hasthaḥ

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

pāṇigrahaṇādadhi gr̥hamēdhinōrvratam 1
</details>

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

1. After marriage the rites prescribed for a householder and his wife (must be performed). [#1] 

[#1]:  1. According to Haradatta, this rule is intended to refute the opinion of those who hold that the sacred household-fire may be kept, and the prescribed offerings therein may be performed, either from the time of the marriage, or after the division of the family estate. He also states that the use of the dual gṛhamedhinoḥ indicates that husband and wife must perform the rites conjointly. Manu III, 67.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
pāṇigrahaṇādadhi gr̥hamēdhinōvratam ॥1॥  

**ṭīkā**  
pūrvasmin praśna ādyayō' paṭalayōḥ prāyēṇa brahmacāriṇō dharmā uktāḥ। itarēṣvaṣṭasu sarvāśramāṇām । ēkādaśē samāvr̥ttasya । idānīṁ pāṇigrahaṇādārabhya kartavyāni karmāṇyucyantē । pāṇiryasmi[#1]nnahani gr̥hyatē tatpāṇigrahaṇam[#2] । adhiśabda ūrdhvārthē vartatē । tasmādūrdhvaṁ gr̥hamēhadhinōrgr̥hasthāśramavatōḥ yadvrataṁ niyataṁ kartavyam, jātāvēkavacanam, taducyatē । 'pāṇigrahaṇādadhī'ti vacanaṁ[#3] bhāryādiragnirdāyādirvē'ti śāstrāntarōktō vikalpō mā bhūditi । 'gr̥hamēdhinō'riti dvivacanamanyataramaraṇē mā bhūditi[#4] । vaiśvadēvaṁ tu vidhurā api kurvanti ॥ 1॥

[#1]: yasmin karmaṇi iti. ka. ḍa. pu.  

[#2]: caturthīkarmmāntō vivāhaḥ ityadhikaṁ ḍa. pu.  

[#3]: gau0 dha0 5. 7  

[#4]: anēkabhāryasya ēkasyāmapi satyāṁ bhavatyēva । anēkāśritasyā'dhikārasya vidyamānatvācchāstrāntaratvācca । ityadhikaṁ ka. pu.
</details>
</details>

<details open><summary>mūla-prastutiḥ</summary>

kālayōrbhōjanam 2
</details>

<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

2. He shall eat at the two (appointed) times, (morning and evening) [#2] 

[#2]:  Haradatta thinks that this Sūtra is intended to prevent householders from having more than two meals a day, and to keep them from gluttony. Others are of opinion that its object is to keep householders from excessive fasting, and to make them perform the Prāṇāgnihotra at either meal. At the Prāṇāgnihotra the sacrificer eats five mouthfuls invoking successively, whilst he p. 100 eats, the five vital airs. At the first mouthful he says, 'To Prāṇa svāhā;' at the second, 'To Apāna svāhā,' &c.
</details>

yaccainayōḥ priyaṁ syāt tad ētasminn ahani bhuñjīyātām 7

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

7. And on (the anniversary of) that (wedding)-day they may eat that food of which they are fond. [#4] 

[#4]:  Haradatta holds that the words 'on that day' do not refer to the days of the new and full moon, the Parvan-days, mentioned in Sūtra 4. His reasons are, first, that the permission to eat food, of which the householder may be particularly fond, has already been given in Sūtra 6, by the term tṛpiḥ, 'satisfaction'; and, secondly, that the singular 'on this day' does not agree with the plural 'on the Parvan-days.' Hence he comes to the conclusion that the words 'on that day' must refer to the wedding-day, mentioned in Sūtra 1, as well as to its anniversary. Haradatta is, probably, right in his explanation, though the reasons adduced here are very weak. A stronger reason for detaching this Sūtra from Sūtra 4 will be brought forward below, under Sūtra 11. Mahādeva, the commentator of the Hiraṇyakeśidharma, adopts the view rejected by Haradatta.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

**sūtram**  
yaccainayōḥ priyaṁ syāttadētasminnahāni bhuñjīyātām ॥7॥  

**ṭīkā**  
'ētasminnahanī'ti na vaktavyam । prakr̥tatvāt । yathā 'tr̥ptiścānnasyē'ti parvasu bhavati, ēvamidamapi bhaviṣyati। kiṁ ca 'parvasviti bahuvacanāntasya prakr̥tasya 'ētasminnahanī'tyēkavacanāntēna pratyavamarśō nā'tīva samañjasaḥ । tasmādvyavahitamapi pāṇigrahaṇamahaḥ pratyavamr̥śyatē । ētadarthamēva ca gr̥hyē [#1]ētadaharvijānīyādyadaharbhāryāmāvahata' ityuktam । ētasmin pāṇigrahaṇē'hani yadēnayōrdampatyōḥ priyaṁ tat bhuñjīyātām । na tu 'nā''tmārthamabhirūpamannaṁ pācayē'(2.7-4)diti niṣēdhasyā'ya viṣaya iti । pratisaṁvatsaraṁ caitatkartavyam । yathā caitrē māsi svātau kr̥tavivāhasyā'parasminnapi saṁvatsarē tasminmāsē svātāvēva kāryam । ēvaṁ hi tadēvā'hariti bhavati । pratimāsaṁ tu nakṣatrāgamē'pi caitrādibhēdānna tadēvēti pratipattiḥ । tasmāt pratisaṁvatsaramidaṁ vivāhanakṣatrē kartavyam । [#2]yathā rājñāmabhiṣēkanakṣatramēvaṁ hi gr̥hamēdhinōrvivāhanakṣatramiti ॥ 7 ॥  

[#1]: āpa0 gr̥0 8.7.

<details><summary><h5>sarvāṣ ṭīkāḥ</h5></summary>
<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

11. The manner in which that offering must be [#7]  performed has been declared by (the description of the Sthālīpāka) to be performed on the days of the new and full moon (the Pārvaṇa).

[#7]:  The Pārvaṇa Sthālīpāka has been described by Āpastamba p. 101 in the Gṛhya-sūtra, III, 7. Again, Haradatta returns to the question whether the words on that day (Sūtra 7) refer to the Parvan-days, or the marriage-day and its anniversaries. He now adds, in favour of the latter view, that the word Pārvaṇena, 'by the rite to be performed on Parvan-days,' by which the Sthālīpāka on Parvan-days is intended, clearly proves the impossibility to refer he preceding rules to the Parvan-days. He adds that some, nevertheless, adopt the explanation rejected by himself.
</details>

<details><summary>Bühler</summary>

15. The water-vessels in the house shall never be empty; that is the duty to be observed by the householder and his wife. [#10] 

[#10]:  Haradatta states that the object of the repetition of the words 'the householder and his wife' is to show that they themselves must fill the water-vessels, and not employ others for this purpose. He adds that, according to another commentator, the object of the repetition is to show that Sūtras 13 and 14 apply not only to householders, but also to students, and that hence students, when they offer the daily oblations of sacred fuel (above, I, 1, 4, 14 seq.), should also perform the rites taught in the preceding Sūtras.
</details>

<details><summary>haradatta-ṭīkā</summary>

nityamudadhānānyadbhirariktāni syurgr̥hamēdhinōrvratam ॥15॥

anya āha— puna'rgr̥hamēdhinō'riti vacanāt pūrvasūtraṁ brahmacāriviṣayē'pi 'sāvitryā samitsaharamādhyā' (1.26.1.)dityādau bhavati । pākē tu striyā na bhavati । 'upasamādhāsya'nniti liṅgasya vivakṣitatvāt । āryāḥ prayatā' (2.3.1.) ityādau bhavatīti ॥15॥
